events.id: Kai Tahi Quiz Night - Every Tuesday-Kai Tahi,20 Parumoana Street, Porirua, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Kai Tahi Quiz Night - Every Tuesday
events.venue: Kai Tahi,20 Parumoana Street, Porirua, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Kai Tahi Quiz Night - Every Tuesday
Join us every week at Kai Tahi in Porirua for our Tuesday Quiz Night, hosted by Tory from Gee Quiz!

Kicking off promptly at 6:30pm, our quiz is designed to be more than just questions and answers. It includes:

- Brain-teasing questions that cover a wide range of topics, ensuring everyone on the team contributes.
- An engaging and entertaining atmosphere.
- Exciting bonus games throughout the night, giving you even more chances to win awesome prizes and points!

Whether you're a trivia whiz or just looking for a fantastic evening out with your crew, our weekly quiz at Kai Tahi is the perfect mid-week pick-me-up. Gather your team and get ready for an evening of friendly competition and good times. Quiz is held outside Meltdown Burger.

Registrations recommended ~ https://www.kaitahi.co.nz/quiz-night

We can't wait to see you there!

events.id: Brazilian Zouk Dance Classes - Beginners block A-60 Dixon St, 6011,60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Brazilian Zouk Dance Classes - Beginners block A
events.venue: 60 Dixon St, 6011,60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Brazilian Zouk Dance Classes - Beginners block A
Connect with other like minded people that have a love of dance.
Brazilian Zouk was developed in Rio de Janeiro in the mid 90s, and is now becoming more and more popular

..............
This is stunning to watch and even more fun to dance! It is based on the original Lambada dance but adapted to more modern music with a slow-quick-quick beat. It can be danced to a wide variety of music including R&B, Rock and Pop.
In this block of 5 classes you will discover the fundamental techniques, movements and sequences of Brazilian Zouk to get you up and running on the dance floor.
This includes:
Week 1: Passo basico
Week 2: Lateral
Week 3: Viradinha
Week 4: Piao
Week 5: Combination
They are designed so you can start this block as a complete newbie, or you can continue on as an existing student from the last block.
There are 4 blocks of classes (A, B, C, D) in the complete Fundamentals course. Once these are done, you can progress to the Improvers classes.
Prices and payment:
- Prepaid 5 week term cost is $90 waged or $75 for unwaged/students.
- Ad hoc cost is $20 waged or $18 unwaged/students
Online payments can be made to Adam Polaczuk
Acct: 03-0531-0559348-25
Details: Your name and ZoukFunA
Location:
Classes are on the First Floor - FootNote Dance Studio, 60 Dixon Street

events.name: Escape Rooms Wellington - Summer School Holiday Deal 2025
events.venue: Escape Rooms Wellington, 118 Tory Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Escape Rooms Wellington has become one of Wellington's favourite family fun activities. We have 3 exciting escape games for you to play, Operation Beehive and The Diamond Heist and our newest game, Quest for the Magic Wand.

Our games are designed for teenagers and adults. Younger kids can play along with the rest of the family , but we don't take bookings for groups of under 12's.

We have capped the maximum price per game at $130 dollars per team for the Summer School Holidays. That means you can have up to 8 players for $130 dollars.

This offer is only available Monday to Friday, from Monday 29th December to 6th February 2026 .

Visit https://escaperoomswellington.com to check availability and make a booking.

Normal pricing applies at weekends. ie $38 per adult and $28 per child.

events.id: Future Architecture of the Network (FAN) Conference 2026-Kelburn Parade, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Future Architecture of the Network (FAN) Conference 2026
events.venue: Kelburn Parade, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Kia ora!
Electricity and electrification are seen as the significant enablers for decarbonisation of our nation. The Future Architecture of the Network (FAN) | Te Whatunga Hiko programme aspires to meet the challenges the electrical power system will face as we journey towards sustainable decarbonisation.
Our vision is to provide an infrastructure paradigm through a hybrid AC/DC transmission and distribution system that meets the needs of tomorrow’s efficient, low-carbon, reliable and resilient electrical power system.
Funded as part of the New Zealand Government’s Strategic Science Investment Fund (SSIF) on Advanced Energy Technology Platform (AETP), the research team is investigating what the future electrical power system might look like.
Hear about the team’s latest achievements as we approach the final phase of the programme.
Attendance is in person at Victoria University Wellington.
Ngā mihi nui,
Prof. Neville Watson,
Science Leader
The detailed programme will be circulated closer to the event.
 More information on the research can be found at https://www.fan.ac.nz/
If you have any questions, please contact futurearchitecturenetwork@canterbury.ac.nz

events.name: Have a Pūkaha summer

events.long_description:
Stick Your Beak into Pūkaha This Summer – Family Fun for All

Spend the summer exploring nature at Pūkaha National Wildlife Centre, with heaps of fun for the whole whānau.

What’s on:

Kids’ treasure hunts with free ice blocks

Meet the wildlife, including Prince Tūī Teka, the talking tūī who went viral, and our new kiwi

Hike the forest trails and enjoy the fresh air

Grab a bite to eat at the Kākā Café

Opening hours:
9am–5pm daily (closed Christmas Day)

Join us until 8 February 2026 as we celebrate an awesome summer at Pūkaha.

Half-price entry for locals living from Featherston to Norsewood.

We look forward to welcoming you to Pūkaha.

events.id: Meditation - Journeys Every Tuesday Evening-14A Ngapotiki Street, Paraparaumu Beach, Kapiti Coast District, Paraparaumu Beach, New Zealand 5032,14A Ngapotiki St, Paraparaumu Beach, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu-All Events In
events.name: Meditation - Journeys Every Tuesday Evening
events.venue: 14A Ngapotiki Street, Paraparaumu Beach, Kapiti Coast District, Paraparaumu Beach, New Zealand 5032,14A Ngapotiki St, Paraparaumu Beach, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Meditation - Journeys Every Tuesday Evening
Every Tuesday night we welcome you into the magic of the bell tent. The tent is lovely during the day, but as it gets dark, it takes on a magical feeling. Fairy lights and crystals lit by gently changing coloured lights. We have the fire going if it's cold, the sky curtain pulled if it's a clear night.

The evening starts with us welcoming in the Elements, the Directions and the web of life, into our sacred circle. Arniya then dances the energy in with Celestial Energy Movement, for the group. This creates a vortex of Divine power into the middle of the tent. Each person is linked into this Divine power, and receives a "top-up" of Divinity.
We then have an opportunity for each person to hold the Talking Stick and send positive energy to their life, or current experience, or to ask the Divine for help. This is completely optional. Throughout the evening, you will have opportunities to choose oracle cards to support your guidance through life.

At 8pm the Zoom people join our circle. They will get to choose an oracle card and be connected into the vortex of power in the tent. This always creates an energy of expansion within the group.
Arniya then gives a wee run down of any current energies influencing the planet, before she leads everyone on a Journey Meditation. Some weeks we to the V.U soul plane. Sometimes we travel to our inner world. Sometimes the guardians take us somewhere else entirely. Each journey is channelled to support the needs of whoever is present.
After the meditation, we say goodbye to our Zoom friends, close the energy on the circle and give thanks. After this journey is complete, we have a cup of tea - time for a chat or playing with oracle cards, enjoying each other’s company in the uplifted space.

This is normally a fairly jovial group. Sacredness is embraced fully, but not at the expense of a good giggle when it’s called for.

You can choose to join us on a casual basis or join the V.U. program and get dream time support and access to past journey recordings. The V.U is booked monthly. Payment options are below. Click here for more details

Spaces are limited, so please book in and be on time.

events.id: Michelangelo - A Different View-Tākina Wellington Convention Centre, 50 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Michelangelo - A Different View
events.venue: Tākina Wellington Convention Centre, 50 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington
events.long_description:
Last 4pm last entry

Under license from the Vatican Museums, this exhibition offers the most complete and authentic reproduction of Michelangelo’s beautiful ceiling frescoes of the Sistine Chapel to be shown outside the Vatican.

Featuring over 50 stunning pieces, including a life-sized reproduction of The Genesis, famously painted on the Sistine Chapel ceiling. But instead of craning your neck to look up, A Different View invites you to experience Michelangelo’s genius from an entirely new perspective – from above and up close.

This immersive experience, completed with guided audio, allows visitors to admire every intricate detail of Michelangelo’s work, many from just two metres away – offering a far more intimate and comfortable viewing experience than the Vatican itself, where some 20,000 people queue daily for a glimpse.

With no time constraints, visitors can allow these masterpieces to truly soak in.

As an addition to – and to complete – Michelangelo — A Different View, reproductions of 14 of these impressive frescoes await visitors inside the exhibition. Scenes from the lives of Jesus and Moses, painted by Sandro Botticelli, Pietro Perugino, Domenico Ghirlandaio and Cosimo Rosselli, provide additional historical background and allow for a deeper insight into this epoch.

Enhancing the exhibition further, VIP guided tours will be led by Dr Christopher Longhurst, a theologian and aesthete who served for 17 years as an operatore didattico at the Sistine Chapel, St Peter’s Basilica, and the Vatican Museums' Papal Art Galleries.

* Booking and credit card fees apply

events.id: Eat Your Art Out: High Tea-Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Eat Your Art Out: High Tea
events.venue: Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Eat Your Art Out brings a creative twist to high tea, inspired by the bold and brilliant works of Toi Art.

Enjoy a menu of classic treats with an artistic edge: from the Sweet William’s Dish, Golden Ratio Scone, Madeleine Moment, and the Mint to Be mousse. Each dish is a playful nod to the world of art, clever, colourful, and made to be shared.

Your high tea includes your choice of tea or coffee. Alcoholic beverages are available for purchase, and dietary options are available on request.

Every purchase helps to support Aotearoa New Zealand’s national museum.

------

Set Menu
(Includes one of each item per person)

Cheery Cherry Curator
A silky milk chocolate crémeux layered with vibrant cherry glaze and topped with a dark chocolate disc creates a perfectly balanced blend of tart and sweet

Mint to Be
Cool mint and sweet strawberry mousse gently resting on a white chocolate base, combining vibrant flavours that are meant to be together

Madeleine Moment
A citrus-infused madeleine paired with silky sambuca namelaka, vibrant green apple gel, and an elegant chocolate garnish delivers golden flavours with a playful twist

Sweet William’s Dish
Mānuka honey ganache nestled in a crisp vanilla tart shell, topped with a chocolate ‘The Dish’ by William De Morgan. A refined take on New Zealand’s liquid gold

The Golden Ratio
A perfectly proportioned cheese scone layered with sundried tomatoes, olives, and fresh basil brings Mediterranean flavours in perfect balance

The Pecking Order
Tender horopito-spiced chicken layered with creamy Tatua mayo and peppery watercress on fresh focaccia fingers, with native pepper leaf adding a bold, warming kick

Still Life with Eggplant
Tangy eggplant and native kawakawa caponata with buffalo bocconcini and fragrant basil pesto on artisanal brioche. A bold sandwich blending native botanicals and classic flavours.

events.id: Adopt a Plant: Begonia House Fundraiser-Begonia House, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Adopt a Plant: Begonia House Fundraiser
events.venue: Begonia House, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Support the Friends of Wellington Botanic Garden and grab yourself a bargain. We’ve kept the plants we need for propagation, but we have healthy plants left over that we can’t fit into our nursery. That’s where you come in – take home one of our plants and help the Friends fundraise to go beyond the basics with amazing new features like exterior landscaping and internal fixtures for the renewed Begonia House.
These plants are from the display end and thrive in indoor conditions (they are coming from a glasshouse after all). They should do just fine in your house. Have too many house plants? Wrong. You can definitely fit just one more. It’s for charity after all.
We’ll have some available for loose change and others for a minimum donation that won’t break the bank. Payment by cash or bank transfer only (no EFTPOS). All proceeds go to the Friends of Wellington Botanic Garden to put towards the Begonia House enhancements http://givealittle.co.nz/.../the-begonia-house-the....
Get prepped:
- Share the love! 3 plants max per person.
- Plants come as they are – we practice integrated pest management but you may need to give them a quarantine before joining your other plant pals at home.
- Swap your pot – there will be a station where you’ll swap your plant to a different pot. We need all our A+ pots for our future plants. We’ll be around to help.
- BYOB – bring your own bag or box for transporting your new friend home.
- Early bird gets the plant – no holds.
We’ll post an update in our Facebook event page a few days out of what plants will be for sale. Make sure you RSVP to get notified.

events.id: Jewellery-making in 8 weeks for Beginners-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Jewellery-making in 8 weeks for Beginners
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
This class is beginner level only, with each student following the class project.

Our popular weeknight classes are the best way for beginners to get into jewellery-making in a lively, warm and friendly environment.

The stone-setting process teaches you many fundamental techniques in one project!

We start with basic ring-making and stone-setting in copper or brass. Students will learn measuring, texturing, shaping, cutting and soldering.

Then we move on to making a practice ring set with a Cabochon stone (a cabochon has a flat bottom and a smooth, domed top) in a Bezel Setting.

As you work through your practice ring and setting, you can move on to working in silver and produce another ring with a cabochon stone that you really love. This way, you will learn the basics as you go on your practice ring, before taking the next step in costly silver.

This class has all materials included in the class fee!

Each student receives a carefully curated materials pack including copper or brass, sterling and fine silver for your ring-making projects, as well as two stones from our supply so you get a good stone for your level of experience.

We have loads of gorgeous stones of a range of colours, and they are all appropriate for beginner settings.

Our booking system asks for payment to be made via credit card, Afterpay or PayPal on booking. If you do not have access to these payment methods or need to pay your course fee over time, please email us to arrange this ;)

events.id: Book Group: The Idiot by Fyodor Dostoevsky-The Library, 1/53 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Book Group: The Idiot by Fyodor Dostoevsky
events.venue: The Library, 1/53 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Do you keep meaning to read more of the great classics of literature? At Wellington Classic Literature Club, we read novels that have stood the test of time, whether they were written in 1780, 1880 or even 1980. We meet on the first Tuesday of the month.

We return to Russia for our long summer read! The group's first-ever summer book was Anna Karenina, and we read Dostoevsky's The Brothers Karamazov over the 2018/19 summer. (We were also due to discuss his novel Crime and Punishment, but that was set down for April 2020 and, well, the world had other plans…)

This year, we read another of Fyodor Dostoevsky's masterworks: The Idiot, which was initially published as a serial in 1868-1869. Dostoevsky scholar Joseph Frank said The Idiot "is the most personal of all his major works, the book in which he embodies his most intimate, cherished, and sacred convictions."

The story revolves around Prince Lef Nicolaievitch Muishkin, a young man returning to Russia after spending several years in a Swiss sanatorium for epilepsy. Dostoevsky had set out to create a protagonist with "a truly beautiful soul" and to trace the fate of such an individual as he comes into contact with the brutal reality of contemporary society.

RSVP
If you use Facebook, you can RSVP to the event on our Facebook page (above) - it really helps us keep track of numbers. Otherwise, just come along...

VENUE
We meet in the ‘Games Room’, The Library bar's private area overlooking Courtenay Place. After you enter the bar, head to your right (up the step) and through a smaller space with booths to the large carpeted space beyond.

ABOUT US
Wellington Classic Literature Club has been running for more than a decade - since the start of 2013 - and we have a great bunch of regulars as well as readers who come along for particular books or simply when it suits. All welcome.

events.id: Brazilian Zouk - Improvers - Lateral and Viradinha variations-60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Brazilian Zouk - Improvers - Lateral and Viradinha variations
events.venue: 60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Come and join us for Improvers Zouk Block A (5 weeks).
We have some great new content for you this year and will be building on foundational movements.
The complete Improvers course consists of 6 different Blocks (A-F).
Each block focuses on a different aspect and technique of Brazilian Zouk and so they can be completed independently of each other.
Our recommendation is to complete all 6 Blocks before progressing onto the Brazilian Zouk Deep Dive classes.
In Improvers Block A you will get a number of Variations to the standard Lateral and Viradinha movements, as well as some exercises on Connection.
===Prices and payment:
- Prepaid 5 week Block cost is $90 waged or $75 for unwaged/students
- Ad hoc cost per class is $20 waged or $18 unwaged/students
Online payments can be made to Adam Polaczuk
Acct: 03-0531-0559348-25
Details: Your name and ZoukImpA
===Location:
Classes are in Footnote dance studio, 60 Dixon Street
===Housekeeping:
- You should have completed the 4 beginner Class blocks before joining Improvers classes
- Drop in or new students, please get in contact before the start of class to let us know you are interested so we can assess your level and organise a private class if necessary to catch you up. If you just show up on the night, you are welcome to watch the class but will not be able to join in (this is to respect the learning of our regular students as the classes are progressive)

events.name: February Pool Induction
events.venue: 139A Oriental Pde, Oriental Bay, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Our next induction session is at Freyberg Pool (Oriental Parade), starting at 6:00pm and going until approximately 8:30pm on Tuesday evening.
The session covers some theory and an introduction to freediving at the beginning, along with a safety briefing and some breathing exercises. The second half of the session will involve getting into the pool and doing some surface and underwater swims (you must be able to swim 200m non-stop with or without fins).
Inductions cost $40 which includes a month of club membership (pool entry fee is additional).

events.venue: Lone Star, 66 Tory St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Every Tuesday is Mean Quiz night!
February's entry koha goes to Wellington Women's Health Collective, a dedicated team of support workers and counsellors, offering compassionate care, counselling and regular workshops for low-income wāhine in Wellington.
The quiz STARTS at 6:30pm so make sure you've arrived by then!
The top three teams get the glory and the Taproom vouchers:
1st Place: $80 Taproom vouchers
2nd Place: $40 Taproom vouchers
3rd Place: $20 Taproom vouchers
Even if you're not at the top you can still win something! Each week the 2nd to last team gets to choose a MYSTERY BOX! Which will usually contain something good...
And the top scoring team each round spins our sparkly prize wheel.
Get your team entered by 6:20pm to be on the MEAN WHEEL and have a shot at winning a $20 voucher.
Plenty of spot prizes, candy, chocolate and our famous nips or hips (heads or tails) round.
PLUS each week you also have the chance to win the accumulator jackpot, by correctly answering three difficult questions. If no one gets all three correct, the prize jackpots to next week...

events.id: Below The Worms-BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Below The Worms
events.venue: BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington
events.long_description:
A feijoa. A Witch. A secret. And two children on a mission at midnight in search of magic. With a bloodthirsty hound on their heels, the mysteries of the garden begin to unravel before their eyes.

Below the Worms is an absurdist magic realism tale that follows the story of two families that live in homes that sit in the same house, split in half. The world is full of unexplained magic that slips into the ordinary, such as the garden of singing worms and the witch that lives next door with her blood thirsty hound. Despite its terrors and delights, the homes live in harmony until a kept secret between the families is revealed, and the world is no longer what the children once thought.
Below The Worms is filled with physical theatre, puppetry and live music.

Created by S.L.U.G (Society for Little Ugly Girls) Theatre Company, Below The Worms had it's debut season in NZ Fringe Festival 2025 for which it won the Parkin Development Award and S.L.U.G won Most Promising Emerging Company.

Presented as part of the Parkin Development Award, Below The Worms is back and more exciting than ever with new direction from Alison Bruce and more delightful writing from Te Ata Tu Patelesio and Sugar Rea-Bruce.

events.id: The Glass Menagerie-Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Glass Menagerie
events.venue: Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Acclaimed American playwright, Tennessee Williams penned emotional powerhouse hits like A STREETCAR NAMED DESIRE, BABY DOLL, CAT ON A HOT TIN ROOF and SUDDENLY LAST SUMMER but it was his tender and autobiographical ” memory ” play, THE GLASS MENAGERIE, that catapulted him from obscurity to international fame.

THE GLASS MENAGERIE follows a family trapped by dreams and delusions in 1930s St Louis. Times are tough. Amidst the turmoil of a changing world, solo mother, Amanda Wingfield, a faded Southern belle, is hellbent on finding a better future for her emotionally fragile daughter, Laura, while her restless son, Tom, is caught between his duty to his family and his desire for freedom.

Deftly blending humour and pathos and suffused with the eloquent poetic language that became Tennessee Williams’ trademark, The GLASS MENAGERIE is an achingly beautiful study of four people struggling to conform to the expectation of others.

Featuring Circa stalwart Simon Leary, as Tom and Hera Dunleavy (Blithe Spirit) as Amanda, with Jackson Burling as ‘The Gentleman Caller’ and exciting newcomer Ashley Harnett as Laura, this is a rare opportunity to experience the urgent relevance of Tennesee Williams’ haunting and uncompromising masterwork.

Reviews:
” Will lodge in your mind and soul for years to come” The Observer
” Spellbinding theatre at its very best” New York Times

By Tennessee Williams
Director Colin McColl
Design Tony Rabbit
Design Nic Smillie
Design John Gibson
Company St. Louis Blues

Sat 24 Jan – Sat 21 Feb
Preview Night Friday 23 Jan
Tues – Sat 7pm, Sun 4.00pm
Special midweek matinees 1pm Thurs 12 Feb a& 1pm Thurs 19 Feb
CIRCA ONE
$25 – $60

events.venue: 54 Hampshire Street, New Zealand 5024,54 Hampshire St, Cannons Creek, Porirua 5024, New Zealand, Porirua
events.long_description:
Plant & Learn in the WELLfed Garden (2026)
ALL WELCOME! Join us for "Plant and Learn" in the WELLfed Garden again in 2026

Join the WELLfed Garden crew each Wednesday morning to spend some time gardening and learning!

No experience or skills are necessary - our awesome team can teach you about when and how garden tasks need doing and lots of skills you can use in your own garden.

Garden tasks include composting, seed starting, seed sowing, plant health, biology first gardening (working with nature).
Sharing morning tea (delicious WELLfed snacks provided!) is also a great chance to connect with other awesome humans in our community.

Pre-schoolers are welcome during term time and during the school holidays you are welcome to bring school-aged kids. They can get stuck in and connect with Papatunuku as well, or there is space for outdoor play. Children must be supervised by their caregivers whilst onsite.

Plant and Learn session are weather and staffing dependent - we will post in the event if we won't be gardening due to rain or sickness

events.long_description:
Presented by: Handsome Tours & Laneway
Handsome Tours and Laneway Presents are proud to present Malcolm Todd!
Los Angeles-born songwriter Malcolm Todd has gone from scooping ice cream to racking up millions of streams in just a few years. After a viral breakthrough with ‘Roommates’ and his mixtape Sweet Boy (2024), Malcolm Todd doubled down with his 2025 self-titled debut album – a record that blends humour, honesty and restless ambition into a singular voice.
Featuring Omar Apollo on the standout single ‘Bleed’ the album captures Todd at his most fearless, pushing his pop instincts into bold new territory. With a devoted fanbase and a reputation for chaotic, heartfelt live shows, Malcolm Todd now makes his Australian and New Zealand debut with headline sideshows in Sydney, Melbourne and Wellington.

Michelangelo — A Different View invites you to experience the genius of the sixteenth-century artist from an entirely new perspective. You get to be above and up close.

events.id: Waiora Te Ūkaipō — The Homeland-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Waiora Te Ūkaipō — The Homeland
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The impact of colonisation and urban drift are themes in a theatrical reboot at the next Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts. ‘Waiora Te Ūkaipō — The Homeland’ was originally commissioned by the festival in 1992. Its return 34 years later at the 2026 festival is highly anticipated. It has become a landmark piece of New Zealand theatre — exploring the tension between past and future. Set in the summer of 1965, the play follows Hone, who brings his family from New Zealand’s East Cape to the South Island in search of a better life. As they gather for a beachside birthday hāngī with their Pākehā guests, buried secrets and cultural tensions rise to the surface. Far from their  tīpuna , the family must navigate questions of identity, belonging, and survival. 
Waiora Te Ūkaipō was conceived, written and directed by Hone Kouka (Ngāti Porou, Ngāti Raukawa, Ngāti Kahungunu). The multi-award-winning writer/director has penned 13 plays. Many have been staged in Aotearoa and further afield in Canada, South Africa, New Caledonia, and the UK. Waiora Te Ūkaipō is presented in partnership with the Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts, Te Ahurei Toi o Tāmaki Auckland Arts Festival, Auckland Theatre Company and Tawata Productions.

events.id: Heathers the Musical-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Heathers the Musical
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
It’s Westerberg High, where popularity is a matter of life and death. Welcome to ‘Heathers the Musical”. Based on a movie with the same name, the show is a coming-of-age story dealing with love, heartache, defying expectations, and being true to yourself. It originally premiered in Los Angeles in 2013. Since then, the musical has had record-breaking seasons across the globe. It now makes its professional New Zealand debut in 2026, and Wellington is in line to join the school assembly. Described as a high-octane, black comedy rock musical, Heathers is packed with a mix of ballads and showstoppers. The catchy tunes are written by Kevin Murphy (Desperate Housewives) and Laurence O’Keefe (Legally Blonde: The Musical). 
The 1989 film starred Winona Ryder and Christian Slater. It quickly achieved cult status among audiences. Both the movie and musical follow high school student Veronica Sawyer. Veronica is just another nobody until she’s unexpectedly taken under the wings of the beautiful and cruel Heathers. When mysterious teen rebel J.D. arrives, Veronica learns that it might kill to be a nobody, but it's murder being a somebody. 
This special production will feature a stellar Australasian cast. So grab your scrunchies, break out the Corn Nuts and wait for the bell to ring.

events.id: Circa Theatre Season 2026-Circa Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Circa Theatre Season 2026
events.venue: Circa Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Inside Circa Theatre’s waterfront venue, you’ll find two performance spaces. Both offer a smorgasbord of professional theatre throughout the year. Playwrights from international heavy hitters to brilliant Kiwi voices are represented. It also includes programming from comedies and cabarets to contemporary dance and pantomime. 
Before or after your show, visit the on-site café, brasserie and restaurant, Chouchou. It opens out onto a deck, where you can take in views across the harbour. Look up to admire the art installation above. Called ‘Velarium’, it undulates in the wind, mirroring the water in the harbour. 
Circa Theatre began its life in 1976. A breakaway group of actors and theatre practitioners decided that Aotearoa needed a new and innovative approach to theatre. Five decades later, it is still pushing boundaries, making people laugh and cry, and creating theatrical memories. 
If you don’t have your own Circa memory yet, there’s an opportunity to create one nearly every night of the week.

events.id: Practice as a Yogi - 6 week beginners course- Daily morning practice-Yoga in Daily Life Centre, 23 Jessie St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Practice as a Yogi - 6 week beginners course- Daily morning practice
events.venue: Yoga in Daily Life Centre, 23 Jessie St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
The challenging opportunity to practice every day as a yogi in the morning and experience how it can change your life. We come to know our body and ourselves better through the regular daily practice, practicing with full awareness and experiencing the effect of yoga on our body, mind and soul.
Going earlier to bed and not eat too much in the evening are the prerequisites to not give up after few days/weeks though
According to the ancient yoga scriptures, yoga needs to be practiced during the period of sunrise, when an immense amount of Prana (cosmic energy) enters our system nourishing our body, mind, intellect, and soul. Daily practice is crucial if we want to master any skill. You will notice an increased level of energy and positive change in your mood as wel as an improvement in your attention span and concentration. You will experience more inspiration, joy, and love in your daily life.

The Beginners Course teaches the “Sarva Hitta Asanas” from Level 1 - postures that are good for everyone. The Course covers all the foundations you need for an ongoing yoga practice. Loosening your body, the joints, and your mind, the exercises are designed for the complete balance and awakening of energy in body, mind and soul. Experience yoga postures, breath techniques, meditation and relaxation, along with knowledge about basic yoga philosophy and a healthy lifestyle. A wonderful course for new beginners and those looking to deepen their practical experience of yoga.
Some of the many benefits of yoga include: improvement in posture and breathing, increased strength and flexibility, a greater ability to cope with stress, and a feeling of peace and calm.

Monday - Friday 6.30 - 7.30am
Starts: 12 January 2026

Cost: 6 weeks| $171
For this course we require booking. 04-801 7012 or info@yogaindailylife.org.nz

There is no discount for this course. Possibility to join the course any time. We will practice each week a different part from the Level 1. If you could make just one or two weeks, you might like to buy a week pass for $54. Or feel free to contact us.

events.id: Malcolm Todd | Meow Nui, Wellington-17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Malcolm Todd | Meow Nui, Wellington
events.venue: 17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Handsome Tours and Laneway Presents are proud to present Malcolm Todd!
Los Angeles-born songwriter Malcolm Todd has gone from scooping ice cream to racking up millions of streams in just a few years. After a viral breakthrough with ‘Roommates’ and his mixtape Sweet Boy (2024), Malcolm Todd doubled down with his 2025 self-titled debut album – a record that blends humour, honesty and restless ambition into a singular voice.
Featuring Omar Apollo on the standout single ‘Bleed’ the album captures Todd at his most fearless, pushing his pop instincts into bold new territory. With a devoted fanbase and a reputation for chaotic, heartfelt live shows, Malcolm Todd now makes his Australian and New Zealand debut with headline sideshows in Sydney, Melbourne and Wellington.

events.id: Masterclass - Awaken Your Soul Purpose-Christchurch,73 Eastern Hutt Rd, Taita, Lower Hutt 5019, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Masterclass - Awaken Your Soul Purpose
events.venue: Christchurch,73 Eastern Hutt Rd, Taita, Lower Hutt 5019, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Masterclass - Awaken Your Soul Purpose
When we feel safe in our bodies, everything becomes clearer.
We can finally soften out of survival mode…
We hear our intuition again…
And we reconnect with the quiet, wise voice of our Soul.

So many women are trying to “find their purpose” from a dysregulated nervous system - overthinking, pushing, striving - when what their soul is really asking for is safety, presence, and space.

Because when your nervous system settles, your truth rises.

This masterclass is a gentle nervous system reset designed to help you come home to yourself and open to your Soul’s guidance.

You will be guided through:
✨ Soft, grounding movement to release tension and bring you back into your body
✨ A deeply calming meditation with soul-evoking prompts to invite clarity and insight
✨ A powerful base-chakra somatic practice to create a felt sense of safety and belonging
✨ Space to receive the subtle visions, feelings and knowings that reveal your Soul Purpose

From this place of embodied safety, your inner wisdom can finally speak.

This is not about forcing answers.

It’s about creating the conditions where they naturally arise.

This masterclass will help you connect with what is within you, quietly waiting to be heard - so you can live, choose and create in alignment with who you truly are.

As we step into the Year of the Fire Horse, this is your invitation to release what no longer serves you and move forward with clarity, passion and purposeful alignment 🐎🔥

Your attendance qualifies you for a special offer regarding the life-changing, Soul Purpose Expansion retreat in Ubud, Bali later this year.

This Masterclass is free to attend.

We do request that you indicate you are attending on this event and please click on the ticket link below to submit your contact details, to ensure you receive the link to the live event (and the recording if you can't make the live event).

Susan and I are looking forward to facilitating this masterclass for you.

Namaste

events.id: Self-Guided Tour of Stonehenge Aotearoa-Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Self-Guided Tour of Stonehenge Aotearoa
events.venue: Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton
events.long_description:
Explore Stonehenge Aotearoa at Your Own Pace

Our self-guided tour includes a map and a 12-minute audio-visual presentation to help you uncover the secrets of the henge. Afterward, head down to the stone circle and try out its unique acoustics — clap your hands and hear the echo respond, or whisper and see how far your voice carries.

A self-guided tour typically takes around 30 minutes, but many visitors stay longer simply because it’s so much fun. The bigger your group, the better the experience!

Please arrive at least 30 minutes before closing time.
Available during our opening hours: 10 AM – 4 PM.

events.id: Shared 90-Minute Guided Tour-Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Shared 90-Minute Guided Tour
events.venue: Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton
events.long_description:
Join a Shared Guided Tour and experience Stonehenge Aotearoa through the eyes of an expert. In this 90-minute journey, you’ll uncover how ancient cultures measured time, tracked the Sun and Moon, and connected the heavens with life on Earth.

Your experience begins with a captivating introduction and a 15-minute audio-visual presentation explaining how the Henge works. Then, step outside with your guide for a detailed tour of the stone circle, where astronomy, archaeology, and mythology come together in one unforgettable setting.

Perfect for visitors seeking a deeper understanding of the stars and stories that shaped human history.

events.id: Host Responsibility Training - Wellington 4th February 2026-166 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Host Responsibility Training - Wellington 4th February 2026
events.venue: 166 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Host Responsibility Training for all staff
Regular staff training is an important part of maintaining and renewing your premises' Alcohol Licence. We are bringing regular, in-person Host Responsibility training to you and your staff. We all know Hospitality venues can be fun and dynamic places to work, but serving alcohol carries a lot of responsibility.
Minimising harm and providing safer environments for the sale and supply of alcohol is a priority whether working in a restaurant, bar, hotel, club, or off-licence.
This Host Responsibility course is essential training that provides the following:
Knowledge of the law
The principles of responsible service
Practical tools for all staff working in licensed premises.
Book your team for this in-person training, which your regional manager will present.
If any of your team members can no longer attend after booking, please cancel the booking, as space is limited.

events.id: Lost Wax Casting - 6 Weeks Course-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Lost Wax Casting - 6 Weeks Course
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
A fantastic course that's full of fun and inspiration!

It starts on Wed 4 February and runs for 6 weeks till Wed 11 March, 5.30pm - 8pm.

Create interesting designs in wax, then send them off to be professionally cast in metal. Once your pieces are back, you will be taught how to cut, file and shape them into wearable pieces.

Level 1 students: Learn to work in both soft and hard jewellers' wax and send your waxes away to be cast. When they return, you will learn how to clean them up into finished jewellery and/or incorporate them into jewellery in multiple ways. We start with rings, but encourage students to think outside the box!

Level 2 students: Advance your carving skills and learn to set stones in your waxes. This can be done either by creating claws and other settings or trying the cast-in-place technique - an organic, exciting process.

Included in the class fee are all your different types of waxes, sandpaper and courier costs.

Not included are the casting and metal costs, which vary from student to student depending on what they want to make. Small castings can cost around $7 - $10, and metals are between $0.35 per gram for bronze - $4 per gram for silver. Please see details on our Regular Classes page.

Our booking system asks for payment to be made via credit card, PayPal or Afterpay on booking. If you do not have access to these payment methods or need to pay your course fee over time, please email us to arrange this ;)

events.id: Raumati / summer yoga in the māra-7 Hospital Rd, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Raumati / summer yoga in the māra
events.venue: 7 Hospital Rd, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join Shaz for Raumati/Summer Yoga in the Māra at Kaicycle Farm on the 28th Hanuere / January and 4th Pēpuere / Febryuary. Class runs 5.30-6.45pm. Koha class - pay what feels good.
Spaces are limited so please register by emailing wildhumannature1@gmail.com or messaging Shaz on Instagram @wildhuman.nature
This vinyasa flow practice focuses on linking breath with movement to help participants slow down, tune in, and settle into the body. With options to scale intensity up or down, the practice welcomes all levels. We’ll explore fluid movement, intentional breath, and moments of stillness that support nervous-system regulation and mental clarity. Come as you are. Leave feeling a little more centered, spacious, and connected.
Please bring:
Yoga mat + a towel (for under your mat for protection if needed)
Warm layers
Water bottle
Cash for koha if you're able to
If you can't pay - still come along! Or if you can pay extra for someone who can't, that's much appreciated. Either bring cash or feel free to do a bank transfer to: S AUDIBERT, 06-0705-0561596-00
Please note that we do have bee-hives on site if these pose a concern for you.
Parking outside the farm is largely reserved for Hospital staff. If you are driving we recommend parking elsewhere in Newtown and walking to the farm so please allow time for this. The undercover parking at the Newtown Woolworths works well.

events.id: Yoga in the Sanctuary-ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Yoga in the Sanctuary
events.venue: ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington
events.long_description:
Find peace and tranquility while participating in our Sanctuary Yoga sessions this summer.

Meet at the Visitor Centre and take a calming hīkoi/walk up Lake Road to Tūī Terrace in the heart of the valley. Lay out your mats and be led in a hatha yoga session that is uniquely facilitated with a te ao Māori kaupapa.

Our Wednesday evening sessions run from 5.30-7.30pm, and our morning sessions on Sundays run from 9.00-11.00am.

This experience is outdoors so make sure to dress appropriately. There will be a gentle 15 min walk up and back from the site along an accessible path. These sessions are designed to suit all levels of ability.

If you have your own yoga mat then bring it along, as while Zealandia does have a few to loan out, supplies are limited.

In the event of bad weather the session may be moved indoors but may have a short walk out in the valley before hand, or else cancelled with credit offered to customers for another session.

Terms and conditions:
Non-member ticket price includes general admission to the sanctuary on the day of the yoga session.
Poor weather conditions may result in the event being moved indoors, or else cancelled with refunds or credit offered to customers for another session.
Photos and video of these sessions may be taken for marketing purposes. If you do not want your photo taken, please advise staff on the day.

events.id: Absolute Beginners Social Dancing Introductory Class-110 Hutt Rd, Kaiwharawhara, Wellington 6035, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Absolute Beginners Social Dancing Introductory Class
events.venue: 110 Hutt Rd, Kaiwharawhara, Wellington 6035, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Ever wanted to glide around the dancefloor like Ginger Rogers and Fred Astaire? Or maybe just be the couple who get up on the floor and look like they know what they're doing? Have you thought that learning social dancing might be fun but not wanted to commit to a whole term of classes? Well here is a one-hour class to give it all a try and totally FREE!
The class will cover two simple building blocks, which form the basis of five dances: Waltz, Foxtrot, Rumba, Cha Cha, and East Coast Swing. Partners always welcome but not a requirement to enrol.
DATE: Wednesday, 4 February 2026
TIME: 6-7pm
PLACE: Level 2, 110 Hutt Rd, Kaiwharawhara, Wellington
COST: FREE!
This Introductory Class will be followed by a seven-week course to develop these building blocks and practice the five named dances. While we hope you will sign up to the course there is no obligation, whatsoever.
Come and experience the relaxed and fun atmosphere of social dancing, enjoying the music and company, and learn a new skill that will have all the people watching wishing they could dance like you!
Come give it a try!

- Week 2 Feb 11th: Tango, Samba and Lindy Hop

events.venue: Space Place at Carter Observatory, 40 Salamanca Rd, Kelburn, Wellington
events.long_description:
Perfect for anyone interested in the night sky, this two-hour live session under our immersive planetarium dome will guide you through the basics of stargazing: how and why the stars and planets move the way they do; how to find South and other useful markers in the sky; and how to locate your place in space.

Sit back and enjoy being taken on a detailed tour of the night sky with our high-definition laser projectors.

Includes:
- Intermission with refreshments
- Access to Space Place’s galleries and interactive exhibits
- 20% discount at Space Place Shop

Doors open 6:30pm | Event 7:00pm-9:00pm | Space Place | R16

events.id: Sunset Guided Tour-Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Sunset Guided Tour
events.venue: Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton
events.long_description:
Experience Stonehenge Aotearoa at its most breathtaking — as the sun dips below the Wairarapa horizon.
Our Sunset Guided Tour blends astronomy, storytelling, and the natural beauty of twilight for an evening you will never forget.

Led by one of our knowledgeable guides, this 90-minute experience explores how ancient cultures used the Sun to track time and mark the turning of the seasons. You’ll discover the scientific and cultural thinking behind the Henge’s unique Southern Hemisphere design before watching the sunset alignment from inside the stone circle.

Weather permitting, you’ll witness how the setting Sun interacts with the structure — a striking moment that links ancient knowledge with the rhythms of the natural world.

Duration and Schedule
• Allow: Approximately 90 minutes
• Start Time: Begins one hour before sunset
• Availability: Offered any day with advance booking

events.id: The Book of Will-Gryphon Theatre, 22 Ghuznee St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Book of Will
events.venue: Gryphon Theatre, 22 Ghuznee St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
The Book of Will, by playwright Lauren Gunderson, directed by Janet Noble, is a (mostly) faithful retelling of the true story of how Shakespeare's plays were almost lost to time.

This play opens several years after Shakespeare's death, as the surviving members of the King's Men realise that they are losing more and more of their company - and with them, the memory of all of the plays that made them. While Shakespeare published his sonnets during his lifetime, he never published his plays. Few playwrights did.

Shakespeare had started giving his actors only their lines, not the full play, so that it was harder for other theatre troupes to steal the work. A fire at the Globe Theatre after his death had destroyed many of the original full copies of the scripts. On top of that, unscrupulous printers had sent people to memorise as much of the popular plays as they could, then recount them so the printer could publish the play and claim copyright on it - even if the repeated version bore little resemblance to the actual play.

Two of Shakespeare's dearest friends, John Heminges and Henry Condell, set out to gather and publish all of the plays in their "true and correct" form. The result was the First Folio, without which we would have less than half of Shakespeare's plays in a corrupted version, the rest having been lost completely.

Both hilariously funny and poignant, this play is a love letter to theatre, a meditation on legacy and loss, and a celebration of the friends who ensured Shakespeare's words would survive.
events.description:
The Book of Will, by playwright Lauren Gunderson, directed by Janet Noble, is a (mostly) faithful retelling of the true story of how Shakespeare's plays were almost lost to time.
This play opens several years after Shakespeare's death, as the surviving members of the King's Men realise that they are losing more and more of their company - and with them, the memory of all of the plays that made them.
While Shakespeare published his sonnets during his lifetime, he never published his plays.
Shakespeare had started giving his actors only their lines, not the full play, so that it was harder for other theatre troupes to steal the work.
Two of Shakespeare's dearest friends, John Heminges and Henry Condell, set out to gather and publish all of the plays in their "true and correct" form.

events.id: Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds — Wild God Tour-TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds — Wild God Tour
events.venue: TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Their music has long defied classification. For over 40 years, Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds have delivered a sophisticated mix of post-punk, experimental, gospel, and blues to adoring fans. Now, in a New Zealand exclusive, Wellington gets to hear them live at TSB Arena in February. Renowned for their exhilarating and unforgettable performances, the band is regarded as one of the most thrilling to watch on stage. 
In 2024, they released their eighteenth studio album, ‘Wild God’. Now, Nick and the band are circling the globe on the ‘Wild God Tour’. They have finished the North American and European legs, and TSB Arena on Wellington’s waterfront is the next stop off. The band will perform a setlist drawn from the latest album alongside songs spanning the four decades of a storied career.
Brought to you in association with Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts. 
Tickets will go on sale to the public on Friday, 29 August at 10am.
events.description:
Their music has long defied classification.
For over 40 years, Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds have delivered a sophisticated mix of post-punk, experimental, gospel, and blues to adoring fans.
Now, in a New Zealand exclusive, Wellington gets to hear them live at TSB Arena in February.
Renowned for their exhilarating and unforgettable performances, the band is regarded as one of the most thrilling to watch on stage.
In 2024, they released their eighteenth studio album, ‘Wild God’.

events.id: Park Hotel Reading Big Band (Nicholas’s farewell gig)-The Rogue & Vagabond,18 Garrett St, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Park Hotel Reading Big Band (Nicholas’s farewell gig)
events.venue: The Rogue & Vagabond,18 Garrett St, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Park Hotel Reading Big Band (Nicholas’s farewell gig)
The Park Hotel Reading Band brings the vibrant energy of big band music to the best music venue in town! Formed as a space for musicians to explore and perform classic big band charts, the group has been meeting every second week for the past year to do exactly that — keeping the spirit of live big band music alive and thriving in Pōneke.

Join us for an evening celebrating the rich tradition of big band jazz, featuring music from legends like Thad Jones and Count Basie to modern masters such as Maria Schneider and Jacob Mann.

Come experience the power, swing, and excitement of big band music — past and present — performed by the Park Hotel Reading Band.

This is also a farewell gig for Nicholas who is moving to Europe the following week. Come have a drink and say goodbye before he leaves.

events.id: Men's Circle: Authentic Relating-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Men's Circle: Authentic Relating
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Men's Circle: Authentic Relating

In a world where men are often expected to have everything figured out, this gathering offers a space to be genuine, not perfect.

This is a free event, with an optional plant-based dinner available for $15. While there’s no obligation to stay for dinner, sharing a meal together offers a meaningful way to strengthen connections.

Andre and Sri Jiva co-host this circle with a shared passion for creating authentic, supportive spaces where men can connect deeply—offering this gathering simply because they believe in its importance.

The Men’s Circle provides a safe and nurturing environment where men can share openly, express their feelings, and encourage personal growth—free from societal pressures to be stoic or self-reliant. Through honest sharing and collective support, participants build resilience, deepen self-awareness, and strengthen their sense of identity and purpose.

Structure of the Circle

Gathering in a Circle: Participants sit in a circle to symbolize equality and unity.

A short meditation or moment of silence may be included to help everyone arrive and connect.

Talking Object: A sharing stick or object is placed in the center. Only the person holding the object may speak, ensuring uninterrupted sharing.

Open Sharing: Anyone may choose to share while holding the object. Sharing is optional, and passing is always respected.

Active Listening: While one person shares, others listen attentively without speaking, interrupting, or offering advice. The focus is on witnessing and being present.

No Judgments or Advice: Participants refrain from judging or offering unsolicited advice, creating a safe space for authentic expression.

Closing: The circle may conclude with a group reflection, a moment of gratitude, or a simple acknowledgment of the shared experience.

Circle Agreements

Supportive Environment: We are here to uplift and support one another, fostering trust and brotherhood.

Focus on the Present: Share what's alive for you now, focusing on your emotions and experiences to deepen emotional awareness.

Use "I" Statements: Speak from your personal perspective using "I" statements to promote authenticity and responsibility. Avoid generalizations like "we" or "us."

No Judgment or fixing: Refrain from judging others sharing or offering unsolicited advice, ensuring a safe and non-critical space.

Confidentiality: What is shared in the circle stays in the circle. You may discuss your own experience outside the group, but keep others' details private.

Meet Andre, your host

Andre has been immersed in men’s work since the age of 13, when he first experienced a rite of passage in Golden Bay. That formative experience sparked a lifelong connection to circle work, which he later deepened by returning as a mentor. A multi-instrumental musician, poet, and pranayama (breathwork) facilitator, Andre also brings his passion for ecstatic dance, philosophy, and authentic connection into his offerings. He is deeply inspired by the question of what it means to be human—how we can more fully experience our aliveness, our depth, and reconnecting with the beauty of life together.

Andre and Sri Jiva co-host this circle with a shared passion for creating authentic, supportive spaces where men can connect deeply—offering this gathering simply because they believe in its importance.
Sharing is optional, and passing is always respected.

No Judgment or fixing: Refrain from judging others sharing or offering unsolicited advice, ensuring a safe and non-critical space.

events.id: Sound Bath Experience: Reflection & Intention-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Sound Bath Experience: Reflection & Intention
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Sound Bath Experience: Reflection & Intention

Restore your energies with sound healing to support reflection, release, and personal transformation.

Guided by Smita and Alexandra, this sound bath blends the soothing tones of harmonium, crystal bowls, and flute to create a deeply healing environment for body and mind.

Through the vibrations of sound, you can:

*Release physical tension and mental clutter

*Calm the nervous system

*Realign your energy through live frequency healing

*Gain clarity & perspective

Take it as a chance to slow down, reflect, and emerge feeling centered, rebalanced, and renewed.

After the session, enjoy a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert included in your ticket - a mindful, wholesome way to close the evening in connection.

Meet Smita & Alexandra, your sound healers
From a young age, Smita was drawn to music as a means for reflection and self-expression. During her music studies at university, she was introduced to taonga pūoro, and this sparked a personal journey of reconnection to te ao Māori and her own whakapapa. Following university, she lived in an ashram for several years where she was introduced to the wonderful practice of bhakti yoga. She now lives with her husband in the Wellington region, where they regularly participate in kirtan (mantra music meditation) at Bhakti Lounge.

Alexandra is a sound healing practitioner devoted to nurturing healing in both mind and body. She believes that sound vibration holds the power to expand consciousness and restore harmony and balance in our lives. Her journey into sound healing began with the realization of how deeply sound vibration was affecting her psyche—making her more mindful of the music she listens to and the intention it carries. Along the way, she has drawn inspiration from artists such as Deva Premal, The Flying Mystics, Stevin McNamara, and the Bhakti Lounge Kirtan. Their music has profoundly influenced her own sound healing practice, inspiring her to explore sound as a tool for transformation, connection, and inner peace.

events.name: Quiz Night
events.venue: Blend Bar & Bistro, 7 King Street, Upper Hutt
events.description:
Come join us for the weekly ritual on a Thursday night, where you and your crew will negotiate five rounds of amazing trivia with Gee Quiz and your host Tory!
Your team's street cred, life smarts and common sense will go a long way to ensuring success on the night.
Add to the mix delicious food and an incredible vibe, it's the place to be on a Thursday night with plenty of time for laughter, banter and merrymaking!

So, grab your buddies and come on down and join us for one of Upper Hutt's best quiz nights!

events.id: Summer League in the City 2026-570 Adelaide Rd, Berhampore, Wellington 6023, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Summer League in the City 2026
events.venue: 570 Adelaide Rd, Berhampore, Wellington 6023, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Back by popular demand, Summer League in the City returns for 2026.
Similar to leagues at Harcourt Park, Summer League in the City will be an 8 week, PDGA Sanctioned league, run on Thursday nights between Jan 15th and March 5th, 2026.
League Layout:
Weeks 1-4 - Gold Layout (Long Clubhouse 10/Normal Eastern

Weeks 5-8 - Black Layout (Main tees both sides)
This year will feature three ratings-based divisions:
Gold - 900 and Above
Red - Between 850 and 899
Green - Below 850
Prizes:
This league is mainly about ratings points and bragging rights (did someone say distance multiplier?), but with enough players, we will put up a small prize for the player who shoots the highest round above their rating.
Summer in the City Entry Fee:
$15 for Greater Wellington Disc Golf members.
$30 for Non-members.
$5 for Single Round/Casual Play
*Entry Fee does not include Berhampore Greens Fee
(No better time to become a Mornington Club Member)
Please pay your Summer League in the City fee directly into the GW League Account and use "City26" & your last name as reference.
KiwiBank: 38-9016-0650973-03
Otherwise you can pay in cash on the night.
Please meet in the Adelaide Road carpark a few minutes before 6:30 for the creation of cards.

events.id: West African Dance Workshop with Fred nii Addo (Ghana/Aus)-11 Hutchison Rd, Mount Cook, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: West African Dance Workshop with Fred nii Addo (Ghana/Aus)
events.venue: 11 Hutchison Rd, Mount Cook, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Thursday 5 February, 2026
6:30pm-8pm
Te Whaea National Dance & Drama Centre
11 Hutchison Rd, Newtown
Shake, shimmy and groove to the soulful rhythms of Africa, led by the one and only Fred nii Addo from Ghana/Aus. He will get everyone rocking and you will be sure to leave with a smile on your face! Accompanied with live drumming by Simon Elwell & the drummers of Kubatana/Djembe NZ.
All are welcome, no experience necessary!
This is a very special opportunity, don't miss out!
About the teacher:
Fred Nii Addo, a virtuoso in the realms of dance, drumming, multi-instrumentalism, and award-winning musicianship, has found his artistic home in the vibrant state of Victoria, Australia. With a rich tapestry of experience woven over many years in the world of performance, he is a luminary in his field. Fred's mesmerizing flute melodies and captivating vocal prowess have left audiences worldwide enchanted. His achievements include an impressive touring repertoire, having graced stages in Sweden, Israel, Egypt, the USA, New Zealand, and numerous African nations. Fred Nii Addo is a true global ambassador of rhythm and harmony, a maestro who transcends borders with his artistry.

events.id: Adult Class - Introduction To Welding Class 2-MakeRoom HQ, 118 Miramar North Road, Miramar, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Adult Class - Introduction To Welding Class 2
events.venue: MakeRoom HQ, 118 Miramar North Road, Miramar, Wellington
events.long_description:
4 Weeks
Thu 5th February 7pm-9pm
Thu 12th February 7pm-9pm
Thu 19th February 7pm-9.30pm
Thu 26th February 7pm-9.30pm

This class is run by the owner operator of a Wellington based Engineering firm with over 20 years of Welding experience. Participants will get to learn the theory and safety aspects of welding before gaining experience MIG welding Tee Joints, Lap Joints and But Joints. Some of the joints will then be cut through to inspect and learn more about how to improve their quality and strength.

Only 6 students per class.

What people are saying about this class...

Tim Blair's intro to welding course is 10/10. Concise, considered, and targeted course material and practice for the beginner to give you confidence for self-directed learning.

_______________________________________________________________________________

Did a beginners welding course with Tim and it is absolutely worth it. Gives you good base knowledge of what a good weld is and whatba bad one is and why and gives you the confidence to give it a go. Good tips and tricks as well with proper hands on leaning. Thanks Tim and MakeRoom Wellington!

_______________________________________________________________________________

Tim Blair is an excellent tutor. Pace was perfect, content excellently presented, really approachable. Incredible patience and feedback. Really recommend for women especially wanting to learn the art of welding, Tim's a good guy!
I'll be back for advanced lessons.

events.id: Hutt City Chorale Open Night-St Marks Church Lower Hutt, 58 Woburn Road, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Hutt City Chorale Open Night
events.venue: St Marks Church Lower Hutt, 58 Woburn Road, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Join us for an entertaining evening of singing in a choir. No auditions needed. We are a community choir so all are welcome to come along and sing together.

You will be given some music to follow for the evening. We start with vocal warm-ups a small amount of stretching and some gentle movements to prepare for singing. Our talented Music Director Jonathan Berkahn directs us with our wonderful accompanist Philip O’Malley on the piano.

We stop halfway through the evening for a drink and supper which is provided.

It’s a great way to experience singing in a choir, especially if you haven’t tried it before.

We welcome all levels of singing experience. Although having some music experience can be helpful it’s not essential, as it can be learnt over time.

We offer four free practice sessions. If you miss one, just come to the next one when you can. After your four free sessions, you can decide whether you would like to join us as a member of our choir, Hutt City Chorale.

We hope you can come along and have an enjoyable evening singing with our choir.

You will be given some music to follow for the evening.
After your four free sessions, you can decide whether you would like to join us as a member of our choir, Hutt City Chorale.
We hope you can come along and have an enjoyable evening singing with our choir.

events.id: Pub Sing-The Empire, 175 Jackson St, Petone, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Pub Sing
events.venue: The Empire, 175 Jackson St, Petone, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Pub Sing - where the audience (you) turns into the choir at the pub, with a live rock band.

No sheet music, no experience needed, and absolutely no solos.

Katy reveals three songs on the night (usually a crowd-pleaser, a ballad, and a banger), and even if you don’t know them, you’ll pick them up fast with colour-coded lyrics on screen.

You learn different harmony options, sing along with the band, and blend into a room of up to 80 voices, so no one’s listening to you; they’re singing with you.

There’s banter, laughs, a bit of silliness, and a whole lot of feel-good energy. It’s not karaoke (shudder), it’s everyone singing together just for the fun of it, and it’s the perfect end-of-week lift you needed.

*Please check the booking link for updates or changes to dates*

*Tickets are $10pp, and all proceeds go directly to the band!

events.id: Summer Camp | Sam Fowles and Elly Mae-San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Summer Camp | Sam Fowles and Elly Mae
events.venue: San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us and some of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s finest artists over five nights across January and February with tickets from $10 or a season pass for $40, featuring drink specials and cocktails thanks to our sponsor Jameson.

Our penultimate night features two of Pōneke’s finest songwriters from two separate sonic worlds… their combination is sure to be a treat!

Sam Fowles makes music that moves the body, speaks to the heart, and touches the soul. Driven by groove and the desire to find meaning in the moments on this journey we call life, the musician, songwriter and producer has a signature sound that stands out and stuns. Fowles would describe his music as psychedelic soul laced with blues and funk. It resonates with deep grooves and driving rhythms created by vintage drum sounds, digital sonics, and electric guitars that build and blaze into billowing soundscapes. At its core is his unique, soulful voice and the punchy, heartfelt lyrics he wears on his sleeve.

Elly Mae crafts songs that encapsulate the bittersweet ache of growth, the quiet unraveling of time, and the soft glow of nostalgia embedded within. Her music is an amalgamation of folk, dreampop, indie, shoegaze, and anything in between. From lullabies that make you feel weightless to being wrapped in a blanket of sound, Elly Mae's folk/country melodic guitar style is accompanied by experimental, spatial bass from Arran Cargill-Brown and textured pocket drumming from Sasha Francis-Murray.

Join us and some of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s finest artists over five nights across January and February with tickets from $10 or a season pass for $40, featuring drink specials and cocktails thanks to our sponsor Jameson.
Our penultimate night features two of Pōneke’s finest songwriters from two separate sonic worlds… their combination is sure to be a treat!
Sam Fowles makes music that moves the body, speaks to the heart, and touches the soul.
Fowles would describe his music as psychedelic soul laced with blues and funk.
San Fran holds a Supervised License, meaning minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue.

events.name: The Mat Enright Blues Band
events.venue: 21 Blair Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
From small town Avalon Mississippi to big city New Orleans, songs from Mississippi John hurt, Elizabeth Cotten, John Lee Hooker and more, from Piedmont, to folk, and straight up blues, the no drum quartet will bring you some absolute gems of the genres, played by artists dedicated to authentic representations of the forms. Easy on the ears fun!
Mat Enright on guitar and vocals, Nick Granville on guitar, Neil Billington on harmonica, with Mike Duffy on bass, What! No drummer? Yep, this is a New Orleans style of blues so come and enjoy something different.
Tickets are $20 or $10 for members, and there is a 10% member discount at the bar.
See you there.

events.id: Women's Football Training-Te Whaea Artificial Turf, Hutchison Road, Newtown, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Women's Football Training
events.venue: Te Whaea Artificial Turf, Hutchison Road, Newtown, Wellington
events.long_description:
Try Football This Summer — Free Sessions for All Women*!

Ever wanted to try football but didn’t know where to start?
Or keen to get back into the game after a break?

The Women’s Football Centre is hosting free, beginner-friendly football lessons for women aged 18+ (no upper age limit!), designed to help you build skills, confidence, and community this summer.
No experience? No worries, this is for you!

You’ll learn the basics of the game — passing, dribbling, movement, teamwork — in a supportive and empowering environment created specifically for new and returning players. You'll also have a chance to socialise and meet new people! All sessions are run by women coaches and supported by an awesome volunteer crew.

Stay after the session for Extra Time, where you can try goalkeeping or get one-on-one guidance from our coaches.

Bring a bottle of water and your sports shoes or football boots, and get ready to give football a go in a fun, inclusive space.

No sign ups or registrations! Just turn up to any session and we'll see you there!

*including cis women, transfeminine and trans women

events.id: Kizomba/Semba Beginners 101 TERM-60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Kizomba/Semba Beginners 101 TERM
events.venue: 60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Embark on a journey into Angolan partner dances! This class introduces you to the enchanting world of Kizomba and its vibrant parent, Semba.
The focus of the styles will be Semba Social and Kizomba. From here you can branch into Semba Show or Kizomba/Fusion
- Basic steps and rhythms for both styles
- The fascinating historical connection between the dances
- Proper frame and partner connection techniques
- Essential moves to flow on the social dance floor
- Dance both styles at parties around the world.
- Kizomba basics and key patterns
- Practice time with rotating partners
- Add Banga (attitude) to you dance
Perfect for beginners and experienced dancers alike! No partner needed – we'll rotate to ensure everyone dances.
Wear comfy clothes and shoes that are not to grippy/sticky on the floor.
Ready to let Angola's rhythms move you?
Join us and unlock the joy of Kizomba and Semba!
Casual $20 each - $160 for 8 weeks
Crazy Savings - Limited time
Foundation Package - $120 for 8 weeks ($15 each)
Paired Pass - $80 each person for 8 weeks ($10.00 each person)
Must be 1 lead and 1 follow
BOOK
https://www.danca.co.nz/classes
PASSES & DISCOUNTS
https://www.danca.co.nz/buy-packages

events.venue: 5 Tenth Lane, Blenheim Central, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The Richter City Rebels have a sound that blends RnB, soul, hip-hop, jazz and funk with the heart and soul of New Orleans brass band music. Trumpets, trombones, saxes, sousaphone, and percussion bring the ultimate Mardi Gras party to any venue or festival. Incorporating stylish original melodies and shouts, funked-up pop tunes and bouncing hip-hop, the Rebels’ sound embodies the musical melting pot of Louisiana.
Energy, entertainment, and musicianship of the highest quality: the Richter City Rebels guarantee a rousing New Orleans experience.

events.id: The Park Hotel Reading Band-The Rogue & Vagabond-Rogue & Vagabond
events.name: The Park Hotel Reading Band
events.venue: The Rogue & Vagabond
events.long_description:
The Park Hotel Reading Band brings the vibrant energy of big band jazz to life! Formed as a space for musicians to explore and perform new big band charts, the group has been meeting every week for the past year to do exactly that — keeping the spirit of live big band music alive and thriving in Pōneke.

Join us for an evening celebrating the rich tradition of big band jazz, featuring music from legends like Thad Jones and Count Basie to modern masters such as Maria Schneider and Jacob Mann.

Come experience the power, swing, and excitement of big band music — past and present — performed by the Park Hotel Reading Band.

Music from 9pm, FREE ENTRY

events.venue: Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
FULL TIME SENDERS & JUICED UP PRESENT

WINDOW KID — LIVE AT MEOW

Waitangi Weekend Thursday · February 5

This Waitangi Weekend Thursday, WINDOW KID brings his unmistakable UK bass energy to Meow for a high-pressure night of fast mixing, heavy sound system culture, and elite mic control.

An award-winning UK MC, Window Kid has earned wide recognition for his technical delivery, timing, and ability to elevate a dancefloor. His sound is rooted in drum & bass, jungle, bassline, grime, and UK garage, with sets that move fluidly across tempos while staying locked to the energy of the room.

Expect rolling low-end, sharp transitions, and a set that feels driven, dynamic, and fully engaged with the crowd from start to finish.

SUPPORT LINEUP

A stacked local lineup bringing the heat all night featuring:
RONI V B2B SNB DON
BVRBWYRE
OFFGRID
YOUNG GHOST
GEO WREN
FRONTA B2B KAMEANO

WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW

Meow, Wellington
Thursday, February 5 — Waitangi Weekend
Tickets available on Flicket

Delicious BBQ Lunch: Enjoy a mouth-watering BBQ lunch combined with a combination of liquid refreshments.

Book your spot today! $50 without bus or $60 with bus

events.id: Te Tiriti and Me– He Māori by Īhaka Martyn in Tawa-Tawa Community Centre,5 Cambridge St, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Te Tiriti and Me– He Māori by Īhaka Martyn in Tawa
events.venue: Tawa Community Centre,5 Cambridge St, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Te Tiriti and Me– He Māori by Īhaka Martyn in Tawa
Te Tiriti and Me – He Māori? by Īhaka Martyn

Nau mai, haere mai! Join us to celebrate Te Rā o Waitangi 2026, with a free travelling Theatre Roadshow, He Māori by Īhaka Martyn.

Alongside our Te Rā o Waitangi event, we are bringing Te Tiriti and Me back to Wellingtonians again. Last year saw a travelling forum series, and this year we welcome the free Theatre Roadshow 'He Māori?' by Īhaka Martyn, which is touring three locations on Waitangi Day:

📍Tawa Community Centre, 10am – 11.30am: https://events.humanitix.com/tawa-te-tiriti-and-me-2026-taki-rua-and-wcc-present-he-maori

📍Khandallah Community Centre, 1.30pm – 3pm: https://events.humanitix.com/khandallah-te-tiriti-and-me-2026-taki-rua-and-wcc-present-he-maori

📍The Hannah Playhouse, 4pm – 5.30pm: https://events.humanitix.com/the-hannah-te-tiriti-and-me-2026-taki-rua-and-wcc-present-he-maori

About He Māori:
Is 1/16th enough? Īhaka Martyn will have you laughing and crying as he weaves elements of stand-up comedy, waiata, and physical performance to explore the confusion, comedy and celebration of reclaiming his Māoritanga from a Pākehā upbringing. A 60 minute journey from total confusion to partial understanding. He aha? He Māori? Is he? Maybe - it depends.

He Māori? by Īhaka Martyn is presented in partnership with Taki Rua Productions and is suitable for all ages. There will be a Q&A session after each performance.

events.name: Waitangi Day - Parent & Child Tournament
events.venue: 55 Delhi Crescent, New Zealand 6035,55 Delhi Cres, Khandallah, Wellington 6035, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Waitangi Day - Parent & Child Tournament
🎾 Ready for some Waitangi Day fun?

Our much-loved Parent–Child Tournament is back on Friday 6 February, and we’d love to see you on court! This is one of the happiest days of the year at KTSC — a relaxed, family-friendly tournament where it’s all about teamwork, laughs, and making memories. And when we say “parent–child,” we mean it broadly… parents, grandparents, aunties, uncles, older siblings, caregivers — all welcome! 💙

✨ Entry is just $15 per pair
✨ Please bring a plate to share for our communal morning tea/lunch
✨ All ages and abilities welcome

Grab your favourite little (or big!) person, dust off the racquets, and get your entry in.
