events.id: Waitangi Day 2026 - Open Day-70 Wrights Hill Road, New Zealand 6012,66 Wrights Hill Rd, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Waitangi Day 2026 - Open Day
events.venue: 70 Wrights Hill Road, New Zealand 6012,66 Wrights Hill Rd, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Waitangi Day 2026 - Open Day
FOR IMMEDIATE USE – JAN / FEB 2026
WAITANGI DAY– OPEN DAY
FRIDAY 6TH FEB, 10AM- 4PM

Wellington’s historic Wrights Hill Fortress in Karori will be open for public inspection again on Waitangi Day, Friday, February 6th. The World War Two coastal battery first opened to the public in 1989 and will be accessible between 10am and 4pm.

On Waitangi Day people are invited to self-guide themselves through the tunnels and gun emplacements. The walk usually takes about one hour. Bring a torch with you for some fun! Strong footwear and no jandals!

Visitors will be able to explore the 620 metres of underground tunnels with a free map and history pamphlet. They will see shell stores, plotting rooms and the huge gun pit where Gun umber 1 used to stand, as well as a replica of the 10-metre-long gun barrel. Also on show will be historic photos, and an assortment of military memorabilia. A DVD of how a 9.2-inch gun operates will be showing as well. The World War Two Fortress is the only one of its type in New Zealand available to the public on four Open Days a year.

Wrights Hill Fortress was built from 1942 to protect Wellington from Japanese bombardment. In the early 1960’s, the guns were cut up for scrap and sold, ironically, to the Japanese.

Admission is $20 for a family of two adults and three children under 12, or $10 per adult and $5 per child. (CASH ONLY please-NO EFTPOS). Access is via Karori Road, Campbell Street, and Wrights Hill Road. All proceeds go to the continuing restoration of the Fortress. There is limited car parking at the summit of the Hill.

Visitors to the Fortress in Wrights Hill Reserve can also enjoy bush walks, picnic sites and panoramic views from the top of the hill.

There will also be a BBQ sausage sizzle and soft drinks on sale. No booking required.

E ngā whānau, hapū, iwi me ngā hāpori, nau mai, tauti mai ki Taumanuka!

Ngā Hapū o Ōtaki, in partnership with Kāpiti Coast District Council, warmly invite you to commemorate Waitangi Day with us.

events.id: Te Rā o Waitangi--Wellington NZ
events.name: Te Rā o Waitangi
events.long_description:
Te Rā o Waitangi is a free, whānau -friendly event to commemorate the signing of Te Tiriti o Waitangi and Aotearoa New Zealand’s national day. Kicking off at midday in Waitangi Park, you'll find the main stage programme packed with local talent. Enjoy live music, dance, and cultural performances. Dotted around Waitangi Park, you’ll also find a selection of delicious kai , stalls, a Kids’ Zone, a treaty education space, and much more. 
Te Rā o Waitangi 2026 acknowledges tūrangawaewae and whakapapa for all — where is the place you lay down your roots? Where is your family from? In 2026, Waitangi Day celebrates the things that we all share and the things that make us different.

events.long_description:
FREE ENTRY: Waitangi Day in Porirua
FREE ENTRY:

We are glad to partner with mana whenua Ngāti Toa once again to deliver a fun-filled Waitangi Day event in Porirua, one of the largest Waitangi Day events to take place in New Zealand on our national day.

❤️ Waka tours are on once more!
🎤 Live music at Te Rauparaha Park
🥗 Food trucks will line Norrie Streets
😜 Fun for tamariki and rangatahi

Parking 🚙
Parking will be available on surrounding streets such as Wi Neera Drive or you can leave your car at the railway station and take the short walk to Te Rauparaha Park.

Cash 💳
It’s best to bring cash on the day as not all vendors will have eftpos available, although there are nearby ATMs on Lyttelton Avenue if you wish to top up.

The event will be alcohol-free, smoke/vape-free and there will be no dogs allowed.

events.venue: Waitangi Park,24A Herd St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Te Rā o Waitangi 2026
Nau mai, haere mai! Join us to celebrate Te Rā o Waitangi 2026, Wellington City Council’s free annual Waitangi Day event ❤️🖤

Te Rā o Waitangi 2026 acknowledges tūrangawaewae and whakapapa for all!

Bring your friends and whānau to Waitangi Park from 12 noon to 6pm on Friday 6 February for live music, kai, activities celebrating Māori culture, and the spirit of Te Tiriti o Waitangi.

He aha kei te haere? What to expect:

✨ Live performances showcasing tangata whenua and tangata tiriti talent

✨ Multicultural food stalls and a fundraiser hāngi from midday (get in quick!)

✨ Arts, crafts, and family-friendly activities, including taonga tākaro Māori

✨Pacific Media Networks 531pi audience stage activations

✨ Stunning stage artwork created at the 2024 event by artists Keri-Mei Zagrobelna and Tina Rae Carter

✨ A Treaty Education Tent to learn, reflect, and connect

Gather your whānau and join us to honour our past, celebrate our present, and dream of our future together.

Alongside our Te Rā o Waitangi event, we’re excited to bring the free theatre roadshow ‘He Māori?’ by Īhaka Martyn and Taki Rua Productions, this Waitangi Day. Catch a performance at one of three locations:
🕙 10am–11.30am: Tawa Community Centre
🕜 1.30pm–3pm: Khandallah Community Centre
🕓 4pm–5.30pm: The Hannah Playhouse

All shows are free, but bookings are required.

For more information, the Te Rā o Waitangi Day programme and booking information: https://wellington.govt.nz/news-and-events/events-and-festivals/waitangi-day

Our Te Rā o Waitangi event is made possible by many, and we acknowledge our Tākai Here partners: Te Rūnanga O Toa Rangatira, Taranaki Whānui ki Te Upoko o te Ika and Te Rūnanganui o Te Āti Awa ki te Upoko o Te Ika a Māui.

events.id: Te Tiriti and Me – He Māori? by Īhaka Martyn at The Hannah-Hannah Playhouse,12 Cambridge Ter, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In

events.venue: Hannah Playhouse,12 Cambridge Ter, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Te Tiriti and Me – He Māori? by Īhaka Martyn at The Hannah
Te Tiriti and Me – He Māori by Īhaka Martyn

Nau mai, haere mai! Join us to celebrate Te Rā o Waitangi 2026, with a free travelling Theatre Roadshow, He Māori? by Īhaka Martyn.

Alongside our Te Rā o Waitangi event, we are bringing Te Tiriti and Me back to Wellingtonians again. Last year saw a travelling forum series, and this year we welcome the free Theatre Roadshow 'He Māori?' by Īhaka Martyn, which is touring three locations on Waitangi Day:

📍Tawa Community Centre, 10am – 11.30am: https://events.humanitix.com/tawa-te-tiriti-and-me-2026-taki-rua-and-wcc-present-he-maori

📍Khandallah Community Centre, 1.30pm – 3pm: https://events.humanitix.com/khandallah-te-tiriti-and-me-2026-taki-rua-and-wcc-present-he-maori

📍The Hannah Playhouse, 4pm – 5.30pm: https://events.humanitix.com/the-hannah-te-tiriti-and-me-2026-taki-rua-and-wcc-present-he-maori

About He Māori:
Is 1/16th enough? Īhaka Martyn will have you laughing and crying as he weaves elements of stand-up comedy, waiata, and physical performance to explore the confusion, comedy and celebration of reclaiming his Māoritanga from a Pākehā upbringing. A 60 minute journey from total confusion to partial understanding. He aha? He Māori? Is he? Maybe - it depends.

He Māori? by Īhaka Martyn is presented in partnership with Taki Rua Productions and is suitable for all ages. There will be a Q&A session after each performance.

events.id: Te Rā o Waitangi - Waitangi Day at the National Library-National Library of New Zealand, 70 Molesworth Street, Thorndon, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Te Rā o Waitangi - Waitangi Day at the National Library
events.venue: National Library of New Zealand, 70 Molesworth Street, Thorndon, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us this Te Rā o Waitangi and learn about the hītori (histories) of the 1840 Te Tiriti o Waitangi.

Can you tell which Te Tiriti sheets are made from animal skin? Can you find Hōne Heke’s signature? Did rangatira (chiefs) in Te-Whanganui-a-Tara sign Te Tiriti?

There will be fun activities for tamariki (children), rangatahi (youth), and pakeke (adults) throughout the day.

Join a reorua (bilingual) tour to learn more about Te Tiriti, brush up your whakahua te reo Māori (pronunciation), sing waiata, or add your own tohu (mark) to the collective tiriti canvas. Watch film footage compiled by Ngā Taonga Sound & Vision or test your Te Tiriti knowledge with a quiz.

From 9am to 4pm we will have taonga that relate to the signing of Te Tiriti o Waitangi on display in the Alexander Turnbull Library.

HOME Café will be open until 2pm, and City Gallery Wellington will be open until 4pm.

events.venue: 34 Poplar Ave, Raumati South, Paraparaumu 5032
events.long_description:
Paraparaumu, New Zealand-Raumati Social Club with Celia Farran and Melissa Cox
Join the Mystic Muses, award-winning singer/songwriters Melissa Cox (NZ/USA) and Celia Farran (USA) for an unforgettable show featuring Celtic music of the past, present, and future - Enya, Sinead O'Connor, The Cranberries, Loreena McKennitt, traditional tunes, lore & legends, sea shanties, and haunting original songs by Melissa and Celia.

-- Meet the Muses --

MELISSA COX: Multi-instrumentalist and award-winning songwriter Melissa Cox conjures a one-woman storm of Celtic tradition, tribal beats, and celestial synths to create an ethereal, danceable Elvish EDM dream. Using her looping pedal, she layers tin whistle, electric mandolin, piano, synths, drum beats, and her haunting voice to create performances reminiscent of Enigma, Enya, and Loreena McKennitt. A seasoned touring artist and classically trained vocalist, she pushes Celtic and World music into the 21st century with raw energy and fearless, honest lyrics. http://www.melcoxmusic.com

CELIA FARRAN: “A cross between an Earthy Enya, Joan Baez, and Tina Fey.” She dishes up the most delicious concoction of the silly and sacred, delighting audiences across the globe. With rusty red locks and twinkling eyes, she casts a spell of enchantment upon her listeners, bringing deep and resonating experiences to audiences across the globe. With powerful, heart-felt vocals and wacky comedic improvisations, the audience never knows what will happen with Celia on stage. http://www.celiafarran.com

events.id: Lavender Magic Flower Farm PYO-Lavender Magic, 61 Blakes Road, Mt Holdsworth, Carterton, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Lavender Magic Flower Farm PYO
events.venue: Lavender Magic, 61 Blakes Road, Mt Holdsworth, Carterton, Carterton
events.long_description:
Your weekend escape starts at Lavender Magic surrounded by the calming scent of Lavender. As the evening cools, wander through rows of fragrant blooms and gather fresh flowers — the perfect gift for friends and family.

Nestled in a charming country garden, Lavender Magic offers breathtaking views of the Tararua Ranges, creating a stunning backdrop for relaxation and discovery. Whether you’re picking flowers, strolling among the lavender, or simply soaking in the peaceful atmosphere, this is the place to unwind and reconnect with nature.

Come see the magic. Lavender Magic — where tranquility blossoms and the stars are brighter.

Lavender Magic is a Lavender farm and a Cut Flower Farm. It has about 5000 lavender plants and grows a range of cut flowers. In season you will find pockets roses, lilies, sunflowers, zinnias and dahlias. You can pick lavender and cut flowers!

Since 2007 Lavender Magic has won many awards for the quality of their lavender oil, which can be purchased on site along with balms, creams and sprays in the small farm shop.

We will provide you with everything you need. Cutting nips, rubber band and bucket. We will let you know which flowers are in season and available to cut.

Our Place Cafe will be operating when available so you can pair the best coffee with your visit. Keep an eye on our socials for updates.

Plan your visit: Lavender Magic is a great place to take time out, relax and recover.
Wear - Good footwear to explore the lavender field and surrounding gardens.
Wear - Sunglasses and slip, slop, slap on if a sunny day as we get full sun.
Bring - BYO food and drink is allowed. Or grab a coffee and something to eat from OUR PLACE CAFE who set up when available.
Bring - A rug if you want to sit in the lavender, but not on the ground. Some seating may be available on quiet days.
Bring - A journal or magazine, to ensure you take time out to reflect and relax
Bring - A friend and whanau to share your experience
Bring - A Team of friends, a pack of cards or games and just hang out for awhile
Bring - Your pet, if you are a responsible owner and promise you will pick up its mess and will not let it annoy others.
Bring - A camera to capture some of the magic and create memories.
A toilet is on site.

Bookings are not essential and you can pay at the gate.

Lavender Magic is a scenic drive, about 75 minutes from Upper Hutt and Palmerston North.

Cut flower bouquets are available or can be ordered in advance to surprise someone special.

If you want something a little more private, we do hire out our property for photography and special events, contact Pauline on lavendermagic@outlook.com

How to get there:
Drive past the pizza place to get to Lavender Magic - Pizza at the Water Mill Bakery is open (Friday Only 5pm-9pm). Other things to do in the Mt Holdsworth area - Fernado Oscar Calligo may have Choripan the Argentinian Food Cart open (Check socials for dets) Paul Melser Pottery (Weekends Only), Jackie Pearson's Fine Art Gallery (Check for details), Rivenrock Mountain Biking Park (Check for details) and DOC walks (24/7) as Holdsworth is the main entrance to the eastern side of the Tararua Forest Park.

Mt Holdsworth, Carterton, Wairarapa is a great place to visit.

Our Place Cafe will be operating when available so you can pair the best coffee with your visit.
Bring - A journal or magazine, to ensure you take time out to reflect and relax Bring - A friend and whanau to share your experience Bring - A Team of friends, a pack of cards or games and just hang out for awhile Bring - Your pet, if you are a responsible owner and promise you will pick up its mess and will not let it annoy others.

events.id: Waitangi Day 2026 - Open Day-66 Wrights Hill Rd, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Waitangi Day 2026 - Open Day
events.venue: 66 Wrights Hill Rd, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
FOR IMMEDIATE USE – JAN / FEB 2026
WAITANGI DAY– OPEN DAY
FRIDAY 6TH FEB, 10AM- 4PM
Wellington’s historic Wrights Hill Fortress in Karori will be open for public inspection again on Waitangi Day, Friday, February 6th. The World War Two coastal battery first opened to the public in 1989 and will be accessible between 10am and 4pm.
On Waitangi Day people are invited to self-guide themselves through the tunnels and gun emplacements. The walk usually takes about one hour. Bring a torch with you for some fun! Strong footwear and no jandals!
Visitors will be able to explore the 620 metres of underground tunnels with a free map and history pamphlet. They will see shell stores, plotting rooms and the huge gun pit where Gun umber 1 used to stand, as well as a replica of the 10-metre-long gun barrel. Also on show will be historic photos, and an assortment of military memorabilia. A DVD of how a 9.2-inch gun operates will be showing as well. The World War Two Fortress is the only one of its type in New Zealand available to the public on four Open Days a year.
Wrights Hill Fortress was built from 1942 to protect Wellington from Japanese bombardment. In the early 1960’s, the guns were cut up for scrap and sold, ironically, to the Japanese.
Admission is $20 for a family of two adults and three children under 12, or $10 per adult and $5 per child. (CASH ONLY please-NO EFTPOS). Access is via Karori Road, Campbell Street, and Wrights Hill Road. All proceeds go to the continuing restoration of the Fortress. There is limited car parking at the summit of the Hill.
Visitors to the Fortress in Wrights Hill Reserve can also enjoy bush walks, picnic sites and panoramic views from the top of the hill.
There will also be a BBQ sausage sizzle and soft drinks on sale. No booking required.

They will see shell stores, plotting rooms and the huge gun pit where Gun umber 1 used to stand, as well as a replica of the 10-metre-long gun barrel.
Also on show will be historic photos, and an assortment of military memorabilia.
The World War Two Fortress is the only one of its type in New Zealand available to the public on four Open Days a year.
Visitors to the Fortress in Wrights Hill Reserve can also enjoy bush walks, picnic sites and panoramic views from the top of the hill.

events.id: Te Rā o Waitangi-Waitangi Park, 107 Cable St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Te Rā o Waitangi
events.venue: Waitangi Park, 107 Cable St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Te Rā o Waitangi is a free, whānau-friendly event to commemorate the signing of Te Tiriti o Waitangi (The Treaty of Waitangi) and Aotearoa New Zealand’s national day. It's about coming together to celebrate our country and to acknowledge our treaty obligations and partnerships.

Join us for a main stage programme packed with local talent from both tangata whenua and tangata te tiriti performers. Enjoy live music, dance, cultural performances, stalls, a Kids’ Zone, a treaty education space, kai, and more.

Alongside our Te Rā o Waitangi event, we are bringing Te Tiriti and Me back to Wellingtonians. Last year saw a travelling forum series, and this year we welcome the free Theatre Roadshow 'He Māori?' by Īhaka Martyn, which is touring three locations on Waitangi Day:

10am – 11.30am: Tawa Community Centre
1.30pm – 3pm: Khandallah Community Centre
4pm – 5.30pm: The Hannah Playhouse

Book on the Council web page from January.

events.long_description:
Te Tiriti and Me 
Wellingtonians talk about what Whakapapa and The Treaty of Waitangi means to them. 
What is it? 
After the successful delivery of Te Tiriti and Me on Waitangi Day this year, we are bringing the roadshow back! In 2026, we’re changing things up to a touring theatre show which has been designed to be presented in schools and community spaces: 
Taki Rua Productions and Īhaka Martyn present: He Māori? 
Īhaka Martyn will have you laughing and crying as he weaves elements of stand-up comedy, waiata and physical performance to explore the confusion, comedy and celebration of reclaiming his Māoritanga from a Pākehā upbringing. It is a journey from total confusion to partial understanding. 
He aha? He Māori? Is he? Maybe - it depends 
He Māori is a 60 minute performance with a short Q+A session afterwards. Suitable for all ages. 
All sessions are free, but require bookings due to venue capacities.
When is it? 
Thursday 6 February 2025 – Waitangi Day. You are warmly invited to join us for a free presentation of He Māori? Followed by a short Q+A. 
Te Tiriti and Me is part of WCC’s Te Rā o Waitangi celebrations.  Full community centre timetable below: 
10.00 - 11.30am  
SESSION #1 - Tawa Community Centre  
  1.30 - 3.00pm  
SESSION #2 - Khandallah Community Centre  
  4.00 - 5.30pm  
SESSION #3 – The Hannah Playhouse

events.id: DESSERT FIRST - petit dessert degustation-Le Ciel Bakery, 100 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: DESSERT FIRST - petit dessert degustation
events.venue: Le Ciel Bakery, 100 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
DESSERT FIRST
A Valentine’s Petit Dessert Degustation

A refined five-course dessert experience exploring balance, texture, and emotion — designed to be indulged and savoured.

The Tease

Strawberry · rose · lychee · almond tuile taco
A crisp almond tuile shell filled with strawberry and rose crémeux, layered with fresh lychee. Light, fragrant, and delicately structured.

The Crush

Chocolate lava cake · molten centre · vanilla cream
A warm petite chocolate lava cake with a flowing dark chocolate centre, balanced with soft vanilla cream.

The Slow Burn

Chai-spiced custard tart · brûléed sugar
A refined tart with silky chai-infused custard and a thin crack of caramelised sugar.

The Chaos

Raspberry · mandarin · white chocolate mille-feuille
Crisp pastry layers with white chocolate cream, sharp raspberry, and bright mandarin — structured, vibrant, and playful.

The Afterglow

Petite madeleine · honey butter · milk chocolate
A warm madeleine served with whipped honey butter and smooth milk chocolate. Soft, comforting, and nostalgic.

Optional Pairings
3-course dessert wine pairing — $28
3-course tea pairing — $15

events.id: Andrew London Duo-Whirinaki Whare Taonga, 836 Fergusson Drive, Upper Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Andrew London Duo
events.venue: Whirinaki Whare Taonga, 836 Fergusson Drive, Upper Hutt
events.long_description:
Andrew London’s quirky songs will make you laugh out loud as you recognise yourself and everyone around you, and all the prejudices, obsessions and weird little habits we put out on display, every day, in this funny little country.

There are songs about politics, social status, shopping habits, teenagers, coffee, neighbours and small town protocol. And insights into the unpredictable and tenuous lives of travelling musicians, based on having played a thousand gigs from the woolsheds of Central Otago to the boardrooms of Queen Street.

Andrew’s songs have contributed to popular trio Hot Club Sandwich, country band The Cattlestops, and numerous collaborations at jazz, blues, folk, country and arts festivals from Queenstown to Auckland, Melbourne to Norfolk Island and Sydney to Saudi Arabia. The enforced isolation of the Covid lockdown saw him and his partner/bass player, Kirsten, rearrange his entire repertoire for duo, the results viewable on eight YouTube episodes called ‘Live at The Londons’.

His current show ‘Songs I Wrote When I Was Cross’ sees the duo tighter than ever, the songs more concise, with the accent on occasionally acerbic satire, self-deprecating humour and astonishing wordcraft. Andrew’s partner, Kirsten, provides bass guitar, vocals and counselling.

‘I’ve never seen anyone sing so many words, so fast, without swallowing his own tongue. These guys are Flight of the Conchords for Rest Homes’ said a Radio NZ caretaker.

Come and have a laugh at yourself.

Koha Entry

events.id: Valentine’s Special Macaron Class-Le Ciel Bakery, 100 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Valentine’s Special Macaron Class
events.venue: Le Ciel Bakery, 100 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Valentine’s Special Macaron Class

Love is in the air… and in the oven.
This Valentine’s season, step into the dreamy world of French patisserie with our Valentine’s Special Macaron Class — designed for lovers, besties, singles who love dessert, and anyone who believes sugar is a love language.
In this hands-on class, our pastry chefs will guide you through the art of making perfectly smooth, heart-shaped Valentine’s macarons from scratch. You’ll learn all the secrets — from macaronage and piping to baking, filling, and decorating — so you leave confident, inspired, and slightly obsessed.

What’s included

Step-by-step macaron making with our chefs

Valentine-themed flavours & decorations

All ingredients, tools, and packaging provided

Take-home macarons (if you don’t eat them first)

A cosy, romantic Le Ciel experience


Class Dates
January: 16th, 17th, 23rd & 24th
February: 6th, 7th, 21st & 22nd

Perfect as a date night, Galentine’s plan, or a thoughtful Valentine’s gift.
Spots are limited, and these sessions will fill quickly — because nothing says “I love you” quite like handmade macarons.

Book now and make this Valentine’s extra sweet.

Live at the Undercurrent, Top dogs... A new quartet... featuring radical interpretations of Wellington- Theo Thompson plays guitar, leader of the Mantle Septet. events.venue: The Rogue & Vagabond
events.long_description:
Brazza is Brazilian goodness on the dance floor at our favourite Wellington venue.

Join us at Rouge and Vagabundo to incinerate the darkness and boogie the night away.

A fusion of Brazilian Funk, famous classic tunes and original music that is sure to raise up the cold winter vibes.

Check out Abe the Babe in the kitchen, Blyn Blan Bliet and (Santo) Nicolau on wind, Frechie Fe on guitar, Pedro on bass, Fab directing traffic and Marcel keeping the pace up.

But let’s be honest, the beer is also stellar! We love Rogue!

Music from 9:30

FREE ENTRY

events.long_description:
Brazza is Brazilian goodness on the dance floor at our favourite Wellington venue.

Join us at Rouge and Vagabundo to incinerate the darkness and boogie the night away.

A fusion of Brazilian Funk, famous classic tunes and original music that is sure to raise up the cold winter vibes.

Check out Abe the Babe in the kitchen, Blyn Blan Bliet and (Santo) Nicolau on wind, Frechie Fe on guitar, Pedro on bass, Fab directing traffic and Marcel keeping the pace up.

Music from 9:30

FREE ENTRY

events.long_description:
75th Middlesex County Wavell Wakefield Cup NZ National Club 7s Tournament
75th Middlesex County Wavell Wakefield Cup
NZ National Club 7s Tournament
Ngāti Toa Domain
7th February 2026

🎉 FRIDAY 6 FEBRUARY – OFFICIAL TOURNAMENT OPENING
We welcome Sir Gordon Tietjens to Ngāti Toa Domain for a Q&A Evening, accompanied by Tamati Ellison

⭐ Sir Gordon Tietjens – Career Highlights
Widely regarded as one of the greatest rugby coaches of all time:

• Member of the 1st NZ Hong Kong 7s Team (1983)
• NZ Sevens Head Coach (1994–2016)
• 12× IRB Sevens World Series Champion
• 2× Rugby World Cup Sevens Champion
• 4× Commonwealth Games Gold Medallist
• NPC Coach of the Year (2000)
• NZRU Coach of the Year (2010)
• IRB Hall of Fame Member
• Knight Companion of the NZ Order of Merit

⭐ Tamati Ellison – Career Highlights
Current All Blacks Assistant Coach

• All Black #1099 (Debut 2009 vs Italy)
• 45 appearances for Wellington Lions
• Ranfurly Shield Winner (2008)
• 100+ Super Rugby appearances
(Blues, Hurricanes, Highlanders, Rebels)
• NZ Sevens – Commonwealth Gold Medallist (2006)
• NZ Māori All Blacks
• Junior All Blacks

ℹ️ More details on the Friday evening to follow
_____________________________________________________________________
🏉 SATURDAY 7 FEBRUARY – TOURNAMENT DAY
One-Day Sevens Tournament
⏰ First Game: 9:00am
🎥 Livestream Coverage: Details coming soon

🍔 FOOD, DRINKS & ENTERTAINMENT
• Food Trucks onsite from 9:00am
• Clubrooms Bar open from 12:00pm

🎭 FANCY DRESS COMPETITION (R18) sponsored by the Supply Room
Get creative and dress to impress!
Prizes:
🏆 Best Group (min. 6 people): $500 meal & drink voucher courtesy of the Supply Room
🏆 Best Individual: $100 meal & drink voucher courtesy of the Supply Room

🚗 PARKING & ACCESS
• Limited parking available onsite
• Traffic management will be in place
• Please follow signage and instructions

📌 More tournament, draw, and livestream details to follow

👉 Hit Going or Interested and invite your mates!

events.venue: Te Matapihi - Bulls Community and Events Centre,20 Criterion St, Bulls 4818, New Zealand, Palmerston North
events.long_description:
BULLS | Meditation, Breath & Sound Healing Workshops - Foundations
⏰ Session:
🌿 ReConnected Foundations Workshop (10:00am - 2:00pm): Meditation, breathwork, and sound healing.
.
.
𝗛𝗮𝘃𝗲 𝗹𝗶𝗳𝗲'𝘀 𝘂𝗻𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗻𝘀 𝘁𝗮𝗸𝗲𝗻 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗼𝗳𝗳 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗻𝗱𝗲𝗱 𝗽𝗮𝘁𝗵?
𝗔𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗳𝗲𝗲𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗹𝗼𝘀𝘁 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘂𝗻𝘀𝘂𝗿𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝘄𝗵𝗼 𝘁𝗼 𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗻 𝘁𝗼 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗵𝗲𝗹𝗽?

Life throws us surprises - big or small. You're not alone. We've been there too.
That's why we created this one-day experience - a chance for us all to reconnect with the paths that matter most to us!

Get ready for an inspiring experience with like-minded friends as we lead you toward discovering new clarity about yourself and your direction moving forward.

Don't wait any longer; start taking control now by saying yes to this extraordinary opportunity!

We’re bringing a one-day immersion of profound inner work to BULLS.

On Saturday, February 7th, at Te Matapihi Town Hall, 4 Criterion Street, Bulls 4818, New Zealand, we invite you to experience a powerful session designed to awaken, clear, and elevate your energy. Choose to embrace a deeper, more transformative journey. ❤️

This is a Foundations Workshop, a session designed to clear mental fog, restore balance, and ignite your inner spark through breathwork, meditation, and sound healing. 🧘‍♀️

All our previous events have sold out, so be sure to secure your spot early.

Love and gratitude,
Matt & Guy

events.name: Hoe Down
events.venue: Tangimoana Road, Ohakea,530 Tangimoana Rd, Ohakea 4479, New Zealand, Palmerston North
events.long_description:
Hoe Down
Two massive days of historic cars at Harrisville!
While you are in town for the Teams Champs make sure you head out to NZ's best privately owned track!
Watch the historic cars and bikes hit the dirt and do some laps!
ALL Vintage open wheel - Saloon cars, sprint cars, Stock cars, TQs, Midgets, Modifieds, side cars and solo bikes.
Saturday and Sunday racing starts from 11:000am and finishes about 3:00pm. Prize giving to follow on Sunday.
Harrisville Speedway merchandise will be for sale, food trucks, coffee and cold drinks on site.
Spectators are welcome, entry is a gold coin per person.
To enter your car PM Harrisville Speedway with your name, class, car number and cell phone number.
$100 per car to enter for both days, extra drivers $30.00 per day.
Camping available $10 per person per night. You must register at the Saloon prior to setting up or you may be asked to move.
NO DOGS

Johnsonville Divine Connections Expo
Experience the uplifting atmosphere of the Holistic Wellbeing & Spiritual Expo while connecting with our talented collective of lightworkers

Psychic Readings l Divination l Energy Healing l Hands-on Healing l Spiritual + Wellbeing Supplies l Crafts l Giftware

We are delighted to present the

Johnsonville Divine Connections Expo!
Holistic Wellbeing & Spiritual Expo
Johnsonville Community Hall
3 Frankmoore Ave
Johnsonville
7th February 2026
10:00am – 4:00pm


Divine Connections is a holistic wellbeing and spiritualism event that offers psychic readings, spiritual + wellbeing supplies, handcrafted creations, giftware and various energetic and hands-on healing modalities.

Our events are about community, connection and wellness. They facilitate a space for like-minded lightworkers to connect with the public and offer their amazing gifts. Hauora is addressed on all four dimensions through our stallholders' many offerings; the physical, the mental, the spiritual and of course family. We are a family friendly event, so you can take this opportunity to connect with yourself or your loved ones on this plane as well as the next!

So come along, support a good cause and bask in the awesome atmosphere and aroha created by our collective of talented lightworkers!


Entry: Koha (digital donation available via Eventbrite)
Please bring cash, sorry No EFTPOS onsite.
Each stallholder has there own methods of payment and prices


We love welcoming new faces to our stallholder community, not only does it raise the vibration of the collective, it means that no two expos are ever the same. We also love to support our regular stallholders and their upcoming ventures. If anyone is interested in participating as a stallholder please message Divine Connections Expo on Facebook.

SEE YOU THERE!


Visit us at: Facebook.com/DivineConnectionsExpo


Keep an eye out for us in an area near you!

events.id: UNLEASH THE VOICES OF YOUR SUN AND MOON-Paraparaumu Memorial Hall-All Events In
events.name: UNLEASH THE VOICES OF YOUR SUN AND MOON
events.venue: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall
events.long_description:
UNLEASH THE VOICES OF YOUR SUN AND MOON
Book Soon for this special day workshop and explore and unleash the power of your Voice and Astrological Archetypes!!

We are blessed that Alignment Coach and Healer, Clare Babbage is visiting the Wellington Region from Napier, and collaborating with Voice Empowerment Coach and Healer, Bryony Rogers from Heartsong Healing, in this exciting, unique offering.

This workshop is a specially designed, transformative full day experience of Embodied Astrological Archetypes and Conscious Sound and Voice Practices.

BOOK HERE - https://buy.stripe.com/aEU3g1gMecNj2SkbJI

On the date of the full moon, the energies of the sun and the moon stand face to face — illuminating both our outer expression and our inner world.

In astrology, the sun represents our fullest expression, our vitality, and the way we are here to shine. The moon reveals our emotional landscape, our inner rhythms, and often the fears that arise when we dare to live that full expression. Together, they form a powerful dialogue between structure and flow, logic and emotion, masculine and feminine.

In this workshop, Clare will guide you into an embodied exploration of your own sun and moon, inviting you to feel these two archetypes within your body and notice where they support, resist, or balance each other.

Bryony will lead you into vocal practices that bring these energies into sound and voice — giving expression to what is often left unspoken. Through voice, you’ll release what holds you back and discover new harmony between your inner and outer selves.

This full moon is the perfect moment to unleash the voices of your sun and moon — and to step more fully into clarity, balance, and authentic expression.

The timing of this workshop gives you a unique opportunity to tune into these planets and benefit from their placement in the collective astrology.

The workshop will begin with the opportunity to explore powerful, enjoyable, accessible Voice Practices which open, align and strengthen your expression - and create physiological changes in your energy field.

We will then directly, bodily experience the energies of each of the Celestial Bodies through Embodied Astrology, guided by Clare.

We will integrate these energies, through further Voice Practices, including improvisation, healing chants and songs.

These two modalities will be carefully interwoven in an enjoyable, rich day's workshop that will benefit all participants.

There will be guided space in the workshop to integrate the energetic shifts and discoveries of both the Voice Practices and the Astrology.

This special workshop takes place on Saturday February 7th, 10am-4.30pm - we hope you can join us

At the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, Paraparaumu.

INVESTMENT:

Your investment for this day is $233. Shared lunch.
Some concessions are available - please contact us by email .

Payment by card here - https://buy.stripe.com/aEU3g1gMecNj2SkbJI

Please contact us with any questions at all.

events.id: Danny Bhoy-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Danny Bhoy
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Danny Bhoy, New Zealand’s favourite Scottish comedian, is returning to The Opera House with his new show ‘Dear World’. His easy-going and intimate style of comedy brings banter and anecdotes that are sure to make you cackle. In ‘Dear World,’ Danny brings a thespian flair to the stage. “This is the sequel to my 2015 show ‘Dear Epson…’ My favourite ever show. It’s a hybrid of stand-up and theatre, but really that just means I get to sit down for bits of it.” 
Danny has been honing his craft and touring the world for over 25 years. Having built an impressive following in Australia, Canada and New Zealand, he knows his audience well and never shies away from playfully picking them apart. Described by The Montreal Gazette as “One of the most sparkling wits in the world,” and by The Age as having “unsurpassed storytelling”. This one-night-only show is sure to be one to remember.

events.name: Field Trip Presents — Giant Picnic
events.venue: Frank Kitts Park, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The antidote to idle weekends is here. Field Trip presents a giant DJ-led picnic in Frank Kitts Park, complete with pop-up bars, food trucks and aesthetic picnic styling. Dress in your summer best, and get ready to mingle.   
Kicking things off with a live jazz band, then sliding into an epic lineup of DJs, the music will be spinning all the way through to sunset. Get your eye in for the lawn games with a summer cocktail, then cool down with a scoop of ice cream. This stylish party offers plenty of space to sprawl, sip, snack and dance. Tickets are limited.

events.id: Wellington Pasifika Festival--Wellington NZ
events.name: Wellington Pasifika Festival
events.long_description:
Experience the sights, sounds, and flavours of the Pacific. With over 15,000 people attending each year, the Wellington Pasifika Festival is a standout event for the regional and national calendar. This free, family-friendly festival celebrates the unique Pacific communities here in Wellington. There will be a special opening ceremony at midday, followed by live music and performances. Dotted around Waitangi Park, you’ll find stalls, a Kids’ Zone, stone carving, workshops, and plenty of delicious food. 
The younger ones can pick up a festival passport from the Kids’ Zone and collect stamps to win special prizes. Enjoy a festival experience based on the card game ‘Lalaga’, designed by Torisse Lalau, which uses Pasifika wisdom (talanoa) to foster empathy and connection through sharing stories. 
The theme for 2026 is ‘Arrival’ — a celebration of and a welcome to the Pasifika communities who have made New Zealand their home. Grab your friends and whanau and come along to soak up the island vibes and cultural celebrations.

events.id: Wellington Pasifika Festival 2026 🌺-Waitangi Park,24A Herd St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Wellington Pasifika Festival 2026 🌺
events.venue: Waitangi Park,24A Herd St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Wellington Pasifika Festival 2026 🌺
Experience the sights, sounds, and flavours of the Pacific at Wellington Pasifika Festival 2026 🌸🌴🥥

Come along to this free, whānau-friendly festival and join us to celebrate our unique Pacific communities. From art and language to performances and food, the Pasifika Festival is all about acknowledging the richness of our Pacific brothers and sisters.

📅Saturday 7 February 2026, at Waitangi Park, Wellington
⌚12pm-6pm for the main event. Come from 1:30am for the opening ceremony.
📍Waitangi Park, Wellington Waterfront

The 2026 event theme is ‘Arrival’, which will be represented through explorations of migration stories and is a celebration of and a welcome to the Pasifika communities who have made New Zealand their home. You can also view the carving has been taking shape since the 2024 festival and talk to artist Leo Semau about the artwork.

Plus... The popular Pasifika Cuisine Cook-Off competition is back for another year, with food stalls submitting their best dish for judging by a celebrity panel.

The festival will open with a blessing followed by stage performances from various Pacific Island groups. There will be food stalls, craft, and sponsor stalls, a Kids’ Zone, and Pacific Media Network 531pi FM and Āti Awa Toa radio activations.

You can also take part in a festival wide activation based on the card game ‘Lalaga’, designed by Torisse Lalau, which uses Pasifika wisdom (talanoa) to foster empathy and connection through sharing stories.

We’d like to thank the Pasifika Patrol who will be helping out on the day. Gather your friends and family for a fun day out–be transported to the Pacific Islands for the day! ❣️

To see the full programme, head to 👉 https://wellington.govt.nz/news-and-events/events-and-festivals/pasifika-festival

events.long_description:
Celebrating the Lunar New Year and Waitangi Day
🏮🌿 SAVE THE DATE:A Celebration of Unity & New Beginnings! 🐎✨
Upper Hutt, get ready for a spectacular afternoon of culture, rhythm, and community! The Upper Hutt Multicultural Council (UHMCC) invites you to join us as we celebrate the Lunar New Year and Waitangi Day in one festive event.

This year, we are bringing the energy of the Year of the Fire Horse to the heart of the city! 🐎🔥

What’s happening? ✅ Breathtaking Cultural Performances ✅ A celebration of our shared journey under Te Tiriti o Waitangi ✅ Community connection in the beautiful Whirinaki Whare Taonga ✅ Fun for the whole whānau!

The Details:
📅 WHEN: Saturday, 7 February 2026
🕑 TIME: 2:00 PM – 4:00 PM
📍 WHERE: Whirinaki Whare Taonga, Upper Hutt
🎟 ENTRY: Gold Coin or Canned Food Donation
Supporting Orongamai Food Bank

Whether you’re here to honor the foundations of Aotearoa or to welcome the luck of the Lunar New Year, there is a place for everyone in this celebration. Let’s come together to make 2026 a year of strength and unity.

👇 Tag a friend you want to bring along and help us spread the word!

#UpperHutt #UpperHuttMulticulturalCouncil#WaitangiDay #LunarNewYear#WhirinakiWhareTaonga#UpperHuttEvents

events.id: Porirua Parkrun-Bothamley Park, Champion Street, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: Porirua Parkrun
events.venue: Bothamley Park, Champion Street, Porirua - Mana
events.long_description:
What is Porirua parkrun? It is a free 5km walk or run event - It’s not about coming first or winning. You can go at your own pace and just enjoy being with other people. It is inclusive and the perfect way to start your weekend in the outdoors chatting to people.

The start occurs just upstream of the Bothamley Park carpark. This car park is off Champion street, opposite the intersection with Windley Street. Head to end of carpark where the concrete ends and there is a gate. For location see https://goo.gl/maps/wEohfp9bRu82.

The course is following the old coach road (circa 1870's) established for the early farms in the area. Today this historic track is located within a park, away from cars and now used by walkers, runners and cyclists.

The track is generally 3 metres wide with a gentle gradient and a compacted gravel surface beside the Kenepuru Stream through a picturesque wooded wild valley. (Note there is a pinch point for a short section after the 2km marker where participants need to go single file each direction for approx 30 metres)

The valley runs east-west with mature trees which means this has to be one of the most sheltered places, out of the wind to exercise in Wellington.

What does it cost to join in? Nothing - it's free! but please register before your first run or walk, so you can get your timing results. You only need to register with parkrun once, to participate at any of the parkrun events around the world. Don't forget to bring a copy of your barcode. If you forget it, you won't get a time.

How fast do I have to be? Walking is fine as long as you can finish the 5km. Please come along and join in whatever your pace!

One dog per adult is welcome, as long as it is on a short hand held lead.

Children welcome but those 10 years and under need to be kept within arms reach of a supervising adult.

Note there is no toilets in the park, so go before you go.

We're friendly! Every week we grab a post park run/walk coffee/tea at Get Fixed within Kai Tahi at 20 Parumoana Street, to mix exercise with socialising.

There are volunteering opportunities even week. So those doing Duke of Edinburgh or similar challenges can get volunteer credits. Ensure you contact us well in advance at "porirua@parkrun.co.nz"

events.id: Martinborough Fair-Martinborough Square, Martinborough Square, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Martinborough Fair
events.venue: Martinborough Square, Martinborough Square, Martinborough
events.long_description:
The much-loved Martinborough Fair is back in 2026 on Saturday 7 February and Saturday 7 March. This year’s Fairs promise to be bigger and better than ever! Nearly five hundred stalls and tents displaying an eclectic mix of handmade goods, produce, food and more will be sprawled under the trees in the picturesque Martinborough Square and surrounding streets. Whether you are looking for one-of-a-kind gifts, home décor, fashion or art, there is something for everyone at the Martinborough Fair.

Martinborough Fair highlights include:

- A large number of stalls offering jewellery and clothing, pottery, woodwork, metalwork, candles, plants, dried flowers, pet accessories and so much more.

- Fresh produce including fruits, vegetables, herbs, honey, and other foodie delights.
- Food stalls and local vendors offering delicious food, snacks, and beverages to satisfy every craving.

- Live entertainment from local musicians.

- Family-friendly fun activities including big bubbles and face painting.

Mark your calendars and bring your friends and family for a fun day out or make going to the Fair part of a weekend stay. For the latest Martinborough Fair updates and sneak peeks, follow us on social media.
The Martinborough Fair is owned by South Wairarapa Rotary and all proceeds from the fairs are distributed to charities and organisations especially those in South Wairarapa.

events.id: PADI Open Water Diver Course-New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: PADI Open Water Diver Course
events.venue: New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana
events.long_description:
PADI is by far the largest and most popular Scuba diver certifying system in the world and for good reason. Courses are fun, safe, relevant, and packed with excitement! No matter what country you are in, your PADI qualification will be recognised.

The practical part of your Open Water Scuba Diver course takes just four days! During the first weekend, we make it very easy and convenient for you with our on-site dive pool (the only one in the Wellington Region). Our pool is where you learn to dive, so we can go at your pace, no matter how long it takes. During the first weekend, you learn and practice all the necessary dive skills. Once completed, you will be ready for the sea dives.

Once you are a certified diver, you will receive an eCard on your PADI App showing your qualification – and any PADI Dive Centre will be able to confirm your certification on-line. You will also be qualified to attend the PADI Advanced Open Water Diver course, and our regular Dive Days.

We want to make your diving safe and enjoyable. Welcome to the exciting world of Scuba diving!

If you have any questions please call, email or stop by our Dive Store.

Kind regards,
Tony Howell
PADI Course Director
Tel: 04 233-8238 Email: nzsa@scubadiving.co.nz Web: www.scubadiving.co.nz
9 Marina View, Mana, Porirua 5026


PADI Open Water Diver course at a glance:
•Digital theory: Open Water Diver eLearning Course (allow 8-14 hours)
•Practical: One weekend pool training, one weekend with four sea dives
•Options: One-on-one or unscheduled dates – additional costs apply.
•Start Time: Please be at NZ Sea Adventures by 8.30am daily.

Location:
We are located at 9 Marina View, Mana, Porirua; just north of the Paremata bridge on SH1. Look for the big yellow building. Check our website for location.

Prerequisites:
•Be at least 10 years old (special conditions apply for 10 and 11-year-olds)
•Be able to swim 300m (no time limit) and swim/float for 10 minutes.
•Be medically fit to dive. Check the Diver Medical Participant Questionnaire. If you answer YES to any of the questions or have any doubts, a visit to your doctor is required.
•Elearning must be completed before your pool training can begin.
•Complete the RDP Tables Quiz and Exam if you don’t have a dive computer.

What to Bring:
•Completed Diver Medical Participant Questionnaire.
•If Under 18 years – bring a Parent or Legal Guardian to sign your forms.
•A pen, swimming costume, towel and a snack for the breaks.
•Any personal dive equipment you wish to use.
•The $450.00 balance of your course fee.

Cost:
•Scheduled Open Water Diver Course Fee: total is $750.00; deposit is $300.00.
•Includes: PADI eLearning Course, Dive Gear Rental, Pool Sessions, and Sea Dives. Rental wetsuits are available in stock sizes only. Other sizes are available for purchase. Made-to-measure options can be ordered and purchased
•10% off all in-store purchases during your course. Does not include packages.
•$20 off your course fee for every person you get to sign on with you.

When:
Our PADI Open Water Diver Courses are scheduled year-round. See our online calendar for scheduled course dates or ask in store. Booking early guarantees your place and price.
Looking for different dates or smaller classes? Ask about our one-off course options. Let us know what you need and we will do our best to help (conditions may apply).

Booking your course:
•Course bookings can be made in-store, via email, online or over the phone
•The deposit of $300.00 secures your place on a course and purchases your eLearning course.
•Deposits are transferable to another person but are not refundable.
•Elearning courses, once redeemed, cannot be transferred.
•Before we can send you the eLearning link, we require your full name, date of birth, a valid personal email address and phone number.
•Your course balance is to be paid before we can begin your pool training.

events.id: Crop Up Greytown-Truckstop Greytown, 102 Main St, Greytown-Event Finder
events.name: Crop Up Greytown
events.venue: Truckstop Greytown, 102 Main St, Greytown
events.long_description:
Fresh local produce, seafood, flowers, eggs, meat and plants from Greytown and the South Wairarapa. From 9am Saturday mornings at Truckstop Greytown, 102 Main St.

Crop Up is Greytown's very own ultra-fresh, ultra-sustainable and ultra-tasty Saturday morning pop-up place to get your fresh food. It's all about crops, coffee and community.

Crop Up brings a blend of small farm suppliers, growers and local backyarders, offering their produce. As well as locally grown fruit and vegetables, there’s coffee, breakfast from The Baker, plus special guest pop-ups offering fresh-caught fish and other tempting products.

Our picnic tables are ready, and umbrellas are up for you and your friends to relax under. Catch up at Crop Up. It’s that kind of friendly place.

Crop Up is zero-waste and plastic-free. Crop Up is at Truckstop Greytown, 102 Main St.

events.long_description:
At the Solway Showgrounds, every Saturday, sample our artisan produce, meet the makers and support small Wairarapa businesses.

Picnic tables are set beneath the giant Redwood tree at the historic Solway Showgrounds. The park-like setting is just the place to enjoy a coffee and something to eat while listening to our live music. Shop at the Wairarapa Farmers' Market and take home fresh produce and hand-made artisan products, grown and made in the Wairarapa.

Visiting the Wairarapa Farmers' Market makes for a great outing.

events.id: Community Open Day - Pēpuere / February-7 Hospital Rd, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Community Open Day - Pēpuere / February
events.venue: 7 Hospital Rd, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Respecting Papatūānuku is a way in which we can all do our bit under Te Tiriti o Waitangi, so join us this Waitangi weekend to get your hands in the māra and learn about our methods to leave this whenua better than we found it.
Have you been looking for a chance to visit Kaicycle Urban Farm? Come along our Community Open Day regularly in spring, summer, and autumn! Each open day includes a working bee, shared lunch, koha workshop, and compost sales. Come along for as much or as little of the day as you would like!
9:30am - 12.30pm COMMUNITY WORKING BEE - Registrations required
Many hands make light work - come and get your hands in the māra - with a bunch of us we'll be able to get a good chunk of mahi done, plus you'll take some skills home for your own māra! Register at www.kaicycle.org.nz/volunteer
12:30PM - 1:30pm, KAI BREAK
Bring a picnic lunch and join us for koha coffee, tea, and cake.
1:00pm -1:30pm FARM TOUR
If you haven't been to our urban farm before, this is a great opportunity to find out what we're all about and how our farm and community composting works.
1:00pm - 2.30pm KOHA WORKSHOP: KAICYCLE'S HUA PARAKORE JOURNEY- This Waitangi weekend, get some information about Kaicycle's Hua Parakore journey! Hua Parakore is a Māori led organic growing verification system, open to home gardeners and commercial growers! Kaicycle has been on the Hua Parakore waka for 3 years, learning about growing and composting on this Māori whenua in a way that respects Papatūānuku and tino rangatiratanga. Come along to this workshop whether or not you're interested in joining the Hua Parakore waka; explore the pillars of Hua Parakore, built around te ao Māori; hear about Kaicycle's experiences; and get tips for running your own māra and composting in a whenua respectful way.
Registrations required - email community@kaicycle.org.nz to sign up.
****
Any pātai? Email community@kaicycle.org.nz
events.description:
Respecting Papatūānuku is a way in which we can all do our bit under Te Tiriti o Waitangi, so join us this Waitangi weekend to get your hands in the māra and learn about our methods to leave this whenua better than we found it.
Each open day includes a working bee, shared lunch, koha workshop, and compost sales.
1:00pm -1:30pm FARM TOUR If you haven't been to our urban farm before, this is a great opportunity to find out what we're all about and how our farm and community composting works.
Come along to this workshop whether or not you're interested in joining the Hua Parakore waka; explore the pillars of Hua Parakore, built around te ao Māori; hear about Kaicycle's experiences; and get tips for running your own māra and composting in a whenua respectful way.
Registrations required - email community@kaicycle.org.nz to sign up.

events.id: Colourful Enamel Jewellery Day-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Colourful Enamel Jewellery Day
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Learn to create beautiful enamels with Lisa Sinclair!

This exciting full-day workshop uses the Enamel technique to focus on beautiful enamels on copper and silver. It is a wonderful way to add colour to your work!

Create a simple yet beautifully textured pendant or earrings in metal, and learn how to add a pop of colour to your piece!

Beginners to metalwork can use pre-formed shapes, so they can focus on creating bright funky patterns. Those with some metalwork experience can take on a more advanced textured piece.

This is an ideal class to take if you love creating with colour!

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but an enrolled parent or caregiver must accompany any person under the age of 16.

All basic materials provided and extra materials, sterling silver chains etc can be purchased.

For health and safety reasons students must wear sturdy closed-toe shoes.

events.id: Fazed on a Pony - 'swan' Tour - Te Whanganui-a-Tara w/ Welcomer & Tessa de Lyon-167 Riddiford St, Newtown, Wellington 6021-All Events In
events.name: Fazed on a Pony - 'swan' Tour - Te Whanganui-a-Tara w/ Welcomer & Tessa de Lyon
events.venue: 167 Riddiford St, Newtown, Wellington 6021
events.long_description:
Fazed on a Pony - 'swan' Tour - Te Whanganui-a-Tara w/ Welcomer & Tessa de Lyon
Fazed on a Pony is embarking on a nationwide tour to celebrate the release of their new album swan, out January 23 2026 on Melted Ice Cream and Meritorio Records.

Joining FOAP on the night will be Welcomer and Tessa de Lyon.

Tickets at: https://www.undertheradar.co.nz/gig/100103/Fazed-On-A-Pony---Swan---Album-Release-w/-Welcomer-and-Tessa-De-Lyon.utr
_

Fazed on a Pony is the recording project of Tāmaki-based songwriter Peter McCall. Featuring elements of indie rock, alt-country and emo, McCall’s songs address the uncertainties of life with warmth, wit, and emotional immediacy.

swan follows FOAP’s 2022 debut album, it’ll all work out, which featured “nuggets of genius lyricism” (RNZ). This new body of work will see McCall, with bandmates Rassani Tolovaa (Office Dog), Hamish Morgan (Marlin’s Dreaming, School Fair), and Shaun Malloch (Mim Jensen), expand from the Pavement-esque tuneful indie rock of previous releases to include pedal steel, fiddle, drum machines, and synthesisers. While there is a diversity of style, the album is rooted in the hallmarks of McCall’s music: uplifting and catchy guitar lines that serve the song, paired with arrangements that feel both comfortable and surprising. Where the lyrics tell a sad story, the music betrays that it might just be okay in the end.

Fazed on a Pony - 'swan' Tour - Te Whanganui-a-Tara w/ Welcomer & Tessa de Lyon Fazed on a Pony is embarking on a nationwide tour to celebrate the release of their new album swan, out January 23 2026 on Melted Ice Cream and Meritorio Records.
Featuring elements of indie rock, alt-country and emo, McCall’s songs address the uncertainties of life with warmth, wit, and emotional immediacy.
swan follows FOAP’s 2022 debut album, it’ll all work out, which featured “nuggets of genius lyricism” (RNZ).
This new body of work will see McCall, with bandmates Rassani Tolovaa (Office Dog), Hamish Morgan (Marlin’s Dreaming, School Fair), and Shaun Malloch (Mim Jensen), expand from the Pavement-esque tuneful indie rock of previous releases to include pedal steel, fiddle, drum machines, and synthesisers.

Psychic Readings l Divination l Energy Healing l Hands-on Healing l Spiritual + Wellbeing Supplies l Crafts l Giftware

We are delighted to present the

Johnsonville Divine Connections Expo!
Holistic Wellbeing & Spiritual Expo

Divine Connections is a holistic wellbeing and spiritualism event that offers psychic readings, spiritual + wellbeing supplies, handcrafted creations, giftware and various energetic and hands-on healing modalities.

Our events are about community, connection and wellness. They facilitate a space for like-minded lightworkers to connect with the public and offer their amazing gifts. Hauora is addressed on all four dimensions through our stallholders' many offerings; the physical, the mental, the spiritual and of course, family. We are a family-friendly event, so you can take this opportunity to connect with yourself or your loved ones on this plane as well as the next!

So come along, support a good cause and bask in the awesome atmosphere and aroha created by our collective of talented lightworkers!

events.id: Nevers (France/Australia) / Jean-Philippe Gross (solo) / Oghum-Pyramid Club,272 Taranaki Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Nevers (France/Australia) / Jean-Philippe Gross (solo) / Oghum
events.venue: Pyramid Club,272 Taranaki Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Nevers (France/Australia) / Jean-Philippe Gross (solo) / Oghum
Nevers
Featuring Clare Cooper (Australia) on guhzeng and Jean-Philippe Gross (France) on electro-acoustic devices, Nevers sometimes sounds like a fire in an electronic flea market, other times like the amplification of an insect funeral march. The duo finds common ground between Clare Cooper’s Chinese guhzeng and Jean-Philippe Gross’ lo-fi microphones, electroacoustic devices and localized speaker system.



Strasbourg’s Jean-Philippe Gross will also perform a solo set, of electronic music using a dedicated feedback system.
https://jeanphilippegross.com/

Clare Cooper is a musician and Design Lecturer from Sydney. Her work in creative community projects includes collaborative composition, speculative design, and critical listening. She co-founded the NOW now (2001), Splinter Orchestra (Sydney 2000), Splitter Orchester (Berlin 2009), and Frontyard Projects (2016).

Jean-Philippe Gross (Strasbourg – France) is a composer and improviser, performing with a dedicated feedback system often utilising multiple small speakers positioned around the performance space. In the studio, he continues his research with a “Serge modular system”. He has composed music for dance and performance, as well as for contemporary ensembles such as Ensemble Dedalus.

Nevers is presented with the support of Rise / La Muse en Circuit - Musica.

---

Oghum is the interstellar duo of Nell Thomas (Orchestra of Spheres, Cookie Brooklyn and the Crumbs) and Jonny Marks (All Seeing Hand, Mean Bones), performing on Synthi AKS, theremin and other assorted items. Oghum blends electronic sounds from times past with an array of acoustic and found sounds, using nuanced improvisation to create detailed and tangible sonic environments, invoking memory and transporting the listener through narrow gaps into wide open otherworldly spaces.

$20 presale tickets via UTR

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

Strasbourg’s Jean-Philippe Gross will also perform a solo set, of electronic music using a dedicated feedback system.

Her work in creative community projects includes collaborative composition, speculative design, and critical listening.
She co-founded the NOW now (2001), Splinter Orchestra (Sydney 2000), Splitter Orchester (Berlin 2009), and Frontyard Projects (2016).

events.id: THE WAY OF TEA-110A Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: THE WAY OF TEA
events.venue: 110A Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The Way of Tea is a traditional Japanese art—a ritual that embodies the mindful practice of harmony and tranquility in everyday life. Our Herbal Tea Ritual is our interpretation of the Way of Tea, infused with the therapeutic benefits of herbal medicine, bringing traditional knowledge into the modern world. You will be expertly guided by our knowledgeable herbalists in the art of mindful herbal tea blending.
You will discover the therapeutic qualities and unique tastes of nine medicinal herbs, focusing on their calming, grounding, uplifting, healing, balancing, and energising properties. From these, you will select your favourites to blend into your own unique tisane—a medicinal infusion.
Throughout the workshop, you will take time to reflect on the tastes, sensations, and effects of each herb as you infuse and taste your new herbal blend. You will leave with a tranquil mind, 50g of your custom tisane, a stainless steel infuser, and the embodied experience of this mindful ritual to invoke each time you brew your blend.
To complement your tea tasting, enjoy a selection of handcrafted bites from the Oatery.
When 11am, Saturday 7th February, duration 1 Hours.

events.id: This happened to US. It is Not Who We Are-8 Broomhedge St, Mount Cook, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: This happened to US. It is Not Who We Are
events.venue: 8 Broomhedge St, Mount Cook, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Do you sometimes feel the weight of patterns that are not yours?
Do you notice how past hurts - yours or inherited from family - quietly shape the way you parent, teach, or care for others?
This transformative retreat is a gentle, guided journey for adults who care for children and wish to release the silent inheritance of intergenerational trauma.
Through personal reflection, mindful movement, storytelling, and embodied practices, you will:
Recognise how trauma echoes through generations and impacts your relationships
Learn to separate your own emotional patterns from the needs of the children you care for
Cultivate presence, compassion, and attunement in both home and educational environments
Receive practical tools to move from carrying old stories to transforming them into understanding and peace
This day is for parents, ECE teachers, and anyone supporting children - anyone ready to bring awareness, love, and clarity to their relationships.
Evening Offering: A short, practical session on nervous system regulation for parents and teachers, helping you stay grounded and attuned even in challenging moments.
Spaces are limited to ensure a safe, reflective environment.
Book your place now: donna@therelationshipfacilitator.com
Healing does not erase the past - it brings it home. Step into a day of reflection, release, and connection.

Every month brings new ways to experience Toi Art.
Join us for free talks, performances, and hands-on activities that connect you with the artworks and exhibitions.
This month: Sit and Sketch – settle in front of your favourite artworks with paper and pencil, and see where your hand and imagination take you.
Materials are provided and no booking is required for this drop-in activity.

events.id: Wellington Pasifika Festival 2026-24A Herd St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Wellington Pasifika Festival 2026
events.venue: 24A Herd St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Experience the sights, sounds, and flavours of the Pacific at Wellington Pasifika Festival 2026
Come along to this free, whānau-friendly festival and join us to celebrate our unique Pacific communities. From art and language to performances and food, the Pasifika Festival is all about acknowledging the richness of our Pacific brothers and sisters.
Saturday 7 February 2026, at Waitangi Park, Wellington
12pm-6pm for the main event. Come from 1:30am for the opening ceremony.
Waitangi Park, Wellington Waterfront
The 2026 event theme is ‘Arrival’, which will be represented through explorations of migration stories and is a celebration of and a welcome to the Pasifika communities who have made New Zealand their home. You can also view the carving has been taking shape since the 2024 festival and talk to artist Leo Semau about the artwork.
Plus... The popular Pasifika Cuisine Cook-Off competition is back for another year, with food stalls submitting their best dish for judging by a celebrity panel.
The festival will open with a blessing followed by stage performances from various Pacific Island groups. There will be food stalls, craft, and sponsor stalls, a Kids’ Zone, and Pacific Media Network 531pi FM and Āti Awa Toa radio activations.
You can also take part in a festival wide activation based on the card game ‘Lalaga’, designed by Torisse Lalau, which uses Pasifika wisdom (talanoa) to foster empathy and connection through sharing stories.
We’d like to thank the Pasifika Patrol who will be helping out on the day. Gather your friends and family for a fun day out–be transported to the Pacific Islands for the day!

events.id: Ata Rangi Summer Sessions - Waitangi Weekend-Ata Rangi Winery, 14 Puruatanga Rd, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Ata Rangi Summer Sessions - Waitangi Weekend
events.venue: Ata Rangi Winery, 14 Puruatanga Rd, Martinborough
events.long_description:
Celebrate Waitangi weekend with a little soul-jazz, boogaloo with old-school charm, in the stunning grounds of Ata Rangi Vineyard in Martinborough.

Beloved in the Wairarapa, Rose & Smith return with a menu built for hungry summer afternoons. Offerings of Paella — Chicken, Chorizo & Prawn or Smashed Burgers — Smashed Cheese Burger & Fries or the Double Trouble Burger & Fries, whatever palate pleaser you choose, it will be a perfect pairing for a glass of Ata Rangi rosé, Pinot Gris, or your favourite summer pour.

What to expect: A relaxed and welcoming afternoon of:
• Ata Rangi wines served across the day
• Shade, sunshine, and plenty of space to unwind
• Soulful live music with room to dance
• Comfort food with local flavour
• An atmosphere that feels looked after and unhurried

Ticket includes entry, live music and a glass of Ata Rangi bubbles on arrival. Pay on consumption for all other food and beverages. It is perfectly timed for the long weekend, held on the same day as the renowned Martinborough Fair. Make a weekend of it.

This is part of a series of four Ata Rangi Summer Sessions, taking place on 17 Jan, 24 Jan, 7 Feb and 21 Feb. See the full series at www.atarangi.com/ata-rangi-events

events.name: Wellington Pasifika Festival
events.venue: Waitangi Park, 107 Cable St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Experience the sights, sounds, and flavours of the Pacific. This free whānau-friendly festival celebrates our unique Pacific communities. From art and language to performance and food – the Pasifika Festival is all about acknowledging the richness of our Pacific cultures.

Bring your friends and whānau, and enjoy a line-up of Pacific community performances, a stage activation by Pacific Media Network 531pi FM, food, stalls, and workshops.

In our Kids’ Zone, pick up your festival passport and collect stamps to win special prizes.

Enjoy a festival experience based on the card game ‘Lalaga’, designed by Torisse Lalau, which uses Pasifika wisdom (talanoa) to foster empathy and connection through sharing stories.

Come and see the final Pasifika stone carving that is being unveiled at the event. The carving has been taking shape since the 2024 festival. Talk to artist Leo Semau about the artwork.

We look forward to seeing you there!

events.id: Community Working Bee | Paekawakawa Reserve-46B Derwent St, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Community Working Bee | Paekawakawa Reserve
events.venue: 46B Derwent St, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Paekawakawa Reserve is community-owned and driven, and we we love helping hands!
Our spring & summer working bees are about weeding, tree releasing, and chatting with lovely people. No experience needed, cup of tea provided.
Volunteers meet just before 1pm at the Derwent St entrance, or if coming later just follow the voices into the valley.
More than 20 years ago, Island Bay locals fundraised to buy the the Reserve, and it's been run on volunteer love ever since. Come and be a part of it!
Bring:
Water
Good shoes
Gardening gloves
Any questions, feel free to message us on Facebook.

events.id: Respecting Papatūānuku as Tangata Tiriti - Waitangi weekend workshop-Kaicycle Urban Farm and Composting, 5 Hospital Road, Newtown, Wellington 6021, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Respecting Papatūānuku as Tangata Tiriti - Waitangi weekend workshop
events.venue: Kaicycle Urban Farm and Composting, 5 Hospital Road, Newtown, Wellington 6021, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join Kaicycle Urban Farm for this Waitangi Weekend koha workshop on how to respect Papatūānuku, as Tangata Tiriti / treaty partners, through learning about Kaicycle's Hua Parakore journey.

Hua Parakore is a Māori led organic growing verification system, open to home gardeners and commercial growers! Kaicycle has been on the Hua Parakore waka for 3 years, learning about growing and composting on this Māori whenua in a way that respects Papatūānuku and tino rangatiratanga.

Come along to this workshop whether or not you're interested in joining the Hua Parakore waka; explore the pillars of Hua Parakore, built around te ao Māori; hear about Kaicycle's experiences; and get tips for running your own māra and composting in a whenua respectful way.

Read more about Hua Parakore here: www.tewakakaiora.co.nz/whatishuaparakore

This is part of our Pēpuere / February Community Open Day: www.facebook.com/events/1246402707334114

REGISTRATIONS ESSENTIAL - Register for this koha workshop by emailing community@kaicycle.org.nz

events.name: Beating the Odds - Guided Walk
events.venue: Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join the Friends of the Botanic Garden on this easy 60 to 75-minute downhill walk, looking at plants that have opted out of the competition for the best sites, with fertile soil, warmth, and adequate rainfall, and have evolved and adapted to the less hospitable situations.

Meet at the Cable Car Lookout, Upland Road, Kelburn.
Cost: $10 - book now
Free for Friends

This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden. They run throughout the year with a different topic every time.
Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

events.name: Beating the Odds - Guided Walk
events.venue: Begonia House, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
In this one-hour downhill walk we will enjoy one of the legacies of Wellington’s past summers, namely the often-ignored ‘smorgasbord’ of woody fruit structures. A close-up look at these structures will reveal a wide variety of mechanisms for fruit formation, protection, and dispersal.
Meet at the Cable Car Entrance Lookout, Upland Road, Kelburn.
Cost: $10 or Free for Friends – bookings required (you’ll get the option to choose your ticket type after clicking ‘Buy Tickets’)
This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden. They run throughout the year with a different topic every time.
Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

events.id: Discover Te Muna - Explore the Wines-Craggy Range Te Muna Vineyard, 275 Te Muna Rd, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Discover Te Muna - Explore the Wines
events.venue: Craggy Range Te Muna Vineyard, 275 Te Muna Rd, Martinborough
events.long_description:
Te Muna means secret place in Maori. We want to let you into the secret of the Te Muna Valley wines.

Te Muna valley, just east of Martinborough, is not the easiest place to grow grapes. The winds and the temperatures test us.  But the micro climate and the unique soil structure help us produce exceptional wines with a distinctive style.

Join us for a small group, interactive tasting led by wine writer and educator Joelle Thomson, as we explore a curated selection of Te Muna wines from a variety of producers. Craggy Range, Escarpment, Big Sky, Blue Earth Estate and more.

You will be picked up from the Square in Martinborough and driven to the stunning Craggy Range Te Muna Estate vineyard where Joelle will guide you through a tasting of twelve of Te Muna wines. The experience concludes with a relaxed opportunity to revisit some of your favourites from the tasting while meeting several of the producers, before being transported back to the Square.

events.id: Vietnamese Art Exhibition: Những Miền Đất Nhớ | Lands We Remember-287 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Vietnamese Art Exhibition: Những Miền Đất Nhớ | Lands We Remember
events.venue: 287 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Những Miền Đất Nhớ (Lands We Remember) is a Vietnamese contemporary art exhibition by respected artist Đặng Mậu Tựu, proudly presented as part of Viet Hub NZ’s Lunar New Year (Tết) Festival 2026.
This exhibition shares the journey of an artist from another country and culture who immersed himself in life in Aotearoa New Zealand. Through approximately 30 original artworks, he reflects on how two worlds - Vietnam and Aotearoa - meet, overlap, and quietly converse. The works explore cultural memory, identity, belonging, and the emotional experience of living between homelands.
Created during the artist’s stay in New Zealand, these paintings offer an intimate, lived perspective - capturing moments of connection, unfamiliarity, and shared humanity through a deeply Vietnamese artistic lens. This exhibition is both a cultural bridge and a personal story told through art.
This is Viet Hub NZ’s first Vietnamese community art exhibition, created with care, whānau values, and a strong commitment to accessibility and cross-cultural understanding. Whether you love art, culture, storytelling, or simply discovering new perspectives, Những Miền Đất Nhớ invites you to pause, reflect, and connect.
events.description:
Những Miền Đất Nhớ (Lands We Remember) is a Vietnamese contemporary art exhibition by respected artist Đặng Mậu Tựu, proudly presented as part of Viet Hub NZ’s Lunar New Year (Tết) Festival 2026.
This exhibition shares the journey of an artist from another country and culture who immersed himself in life in Aotearoa New Zealand.
Through approximately 30 original artworks, he reflects on how two worlds - Vietnam and Aotearoa - meet, overlap, and quietly converse.
The works explore cultural memory, identity, belonging, and the emotional experience of living between homelands.

events.id: Queensgate Night Market-Queensgate Shopping Centre, 45 Knights Rd, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Queensgate Night Market
events.venue: Queensgate Shopping Centre, 45 Knights Rd, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
What started as a humble food market in a suburban Auckland carpark has grown into one of New Zealand’s most popular evening destinations. The Auckland Night Markets bring together street food, community, and live entertainment - and from the 27th September 2025, Queensgate Night Market will be joining the family!
Our market offers a vibrant atmosphere, showcasing an ever-evolving mix of global cuisines, handmade goods, and live entertainment - from buskers to magicians and cultural performers. It’s this unique blend of flavour, fun, and family-friendly energy that’s helped us become a staple in the weekday and weekend plans of thousands of Kiwis.
