events.id: Anyone Can Draw - Observational-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Anyone Can Draw - Observational
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
Learn to create a realistic drawing from what you see. This introductory class teaches the technical skills of observational drawing using a variety of media, including pen and ink, charcoal, pencil and pastel.

Students will learn a range of formal skills through exercises in the following:

- Quality of line
- Accurate observation of shape
- Gesture drawing
- Use of negative and positive shapes
- Using tone well
- Direct observation of spaces such as interiors, buildings or landscapes

With expert guidance from Denise you will learn a broad range of skills that can serve as a basis for advancing into classes in painting and assist and finding your own means of expression.

Basic materials provided.

You must be at least 16 years of age to attend this course.

Eight week course on either:
- Tuesdays, 10 Feb - 31 March, 6:30pm-8:30pm.
- Wednesdays, 11 Feb - 1 April, 10am-1pm.

events.id: Intro into 2D Animation-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Intro into 2D Animation
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
This is an adult beginners course in 2D animation where you'll learn the time-honoured principles of hand-drawn animation and how to apply them to your own animation project. You may work on a project incorporating your own ideas, or if you'd rather, an assigned a project from your tutor.

In each lesson there will be examples and demonstrations of the animation principles with follow up exercises to put your new skills into practice. You'll work on your project both during class and at home, applying the animation principles to your individualised project.

You can choose to draw your animation on paper then scan/capture into your device, or choose to draw your animation digitally, directly into an animation programme. whichever you choose instructions in class will be provided to give you the skills needed for this step.

You can use any device, ipad or laptop you already own (except a mobile – it's really not big enough to do good animation on). The school does not provide any digital equipment. Ross will also advise you on a variety of animation apps/programmes available online to use, ranging in price from free to not very much.

Eight week course: Tuesdays, 10 Feb - 31 March, 6:30-8:30
Materials included
Suitable for ages 14+

events.name: 10 February 2026 Whisky Tasting
events.venue: 16 Dundas Street, Seatoun, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Whisky Tasting: 10 February 2026
Hosted by Matt Mueller

Let's get 2026 off to a great start by answering the question: "What affordable, 12 year-old whisky should I have in my whisky cabinet at home?" - a classic conundrum at an affordable price.  Having a look at a few classics, some new challengers, and a mystery bottle is going to be our way of welcoming in the New Year with our first whisky tasting of 2026.
Bunnahabhain and Glendronach are the stalwarts that always rise to the top of these type of lineups, but they will have challengers from Glenturret, Tamdhu and Tomatin!  Plus a mystery will be in the lineup to cause some havoc and challenge our expectations...
(I haven't forgotten the peat lovers - In March or April, we will do a peaty, smokey version of this tasting, finding what's the best in a lineup of Whiskies from Islay!)
Get your tickets now for the February 10th Whisky Tasting at the Seatoun Bowling Club: $60 per person.  The tasting will begin at 7:30pm; please arrive a bit earlier to grab a beer and a table (e-mail Matt if you'd like a table reserved for your party: matt@muellerworld.com)
*** Please note you need to be a member or a guest of a member to attend. Details on how to pay subs is below***
Membership subscriptions
Subs details: $50 for social membership, $100 for family social, $120 for playing membership. Pay direct into the club bank account:
Account Name: Seatoun Bowling Club Inc  
Bank: Westpac Kilbirnie  
Bank Account #: 030521- 0101368 - 00 
Please include your name in one of the boxes on the bank payment form.

events.id: The Best of Bill Bryson Live on Stage-The Opera House, 111 - 113 Manners Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Best of Bill Bryson Live on Stage
events.venue: The Opera House, 111 - 113 Manners Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join Bill Bryson as he shares the major advances of science uncovered in his complete rewrite of the biggest-selling popular science book of the 21st century explaining the Earth, the universe, and everything in-between - A Short History of Nearly Everything 2.0 - plus Bill’s hilarious travel, forays into the Body and Bill being Bill.

Planetology, astronomy, particle physics, the Big Bang, quantum mechanics, evolution and the show is just getting started. A Short History of Nearly Everything 2.0 is the result of Bill’s quest to understand everything that has happened from the Big Bang to the rise of civilisation – how we got from being nothing at all to what we are today. Bill will share the stories of the lives and times of the scientists behind the research and discoveries, highlighting their sometimes eccentric behaviours.

In this theatrical light hearted and fun live performance, Bill makes complex subjects fascinating and accessible to everyone with an interest in the world around them.

An evening with Bill would not be complete without delving into his travel experiences and the human body itself.

events.id: A Place To Bury Strangers NZ Tour-Meow,9 Edward Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: A Place To Bury Strangers NZ Tour
events.venue: Meow,9 Edward Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
A Place To Bury Strangers NZ Tour
UTR and Meow Touring presents:

A Place To Bury Strangers return to Aotearoa with their explosive new album Synthesizer — a record built on chaos, colour, and pure DIY spirit. Synthesizer isn’t just the title of their seventh album; it’s also a custom-built instrument created specifically for it. “It’s pretty messed up, chaotic… but it feels really human,” says frontman Oliver Ackermann. The album celebrates spontaneity, collaboration, and the kind of raw noise that can only come from a band locked in together.

Written in the band’s Queens studio after a refreshed lineup — Ackermann with John and Sandra Fedowitz — Synthesizer cracks open and reimagines the signature APTBS sound in vivid new ways. It’s romantic, raw, unsteady, and built for the stage, where the band’s legendary walls of sound hit with full force.

With Support from: Grecco Romank

events.id: Christoph Gallio / Phil Durrant-Pyramid Club,272 Taranaki Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Christoph Gallio / Phil Durrant
events.venue: Pyramid Club,272 Taranaki Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Christoph Gallio / Phil Durrant
Phil Durrant (electric mandolin and electronics) and Christoph Gallio (saxophones) are veterans of the international free improvisation scene. Their individual and collaborative projects have helped shape the development of improvised music. They first worked together over 40 years ago, but it wasn’t until 2022 that they started performing as a duo. It is rare that improvisors of their calibre make it out to NZ, so we’re very happy to host them at Pyramid Club for a duo concert plus collaborative sets with local musicians.

Phil Durrant (London, UK) is a multi-instrumentalist improviser, composer and sound artist. As a violinist he was one of the key exponents of the ‘group voice approach’ style of improvised music, performing as a member of the Butcher/Russell/Durrant trio, News From The Shed and the Chris Burn Ensemble. In the late 90s, his influential trio with Radu Malfatti and Thomas Lehn represented a shift to a more reductionist approach. As a synthesiser player, Durrant performs with Bertrand Denzler and Burkhard Beins in Trio Sowari. He is also a member of the international electronic ensemble MIMEO with Keith Rowe, Kaffe Matthews, Thomas Lehn and Rafael Toral. He has performed all over Europe and Canada and released CDs and records on Acta and Emanem Records.

Swiss saxophonist and composer Christoph Gallio studied classical saxophone with Iwan Roth at the Basel Music Conservator and then with Steve Lacy in Paris. He has collaborated with many of the world’s leading voices in improvisation including Irene Schweizer, Urs Blöchlinger, Mani Neumeier, Peter Kowald, Fred Frith, Haco, Tetsu Saitoh, Phil Minton, Pablo Diaz, Marcelo von Schultz, Olie Brice, Andrew Lisle, Cath Roberts, Irene Aebi, William Parker, Rashied Ali, Matthew Ostrowski, Gerry Hemingway, Sven-Åke Johansson, Olaf Rupp, Jan Roder, Oli Steidle, Andrea Neumann, Ernst Thoma, Julian Sartorius, Nicolas Stocker, Paula Shocron, Sergio Merce, Alistair Zaldua, Phil Durrant, Roger Turner, Dominic Lash, Mark Sanders and many more. Gallio has been running his own label PERCASO since 1986.

www.gallio.ch

Durrant and Gallio will perform a duo set, and then be joined by local improvising musicians Tom Callwood (bass), Jake Baxendale (sax) and Daniel Beban (guitar/tapes).

Their tour is sponsored by Swiss Arts Council, Aargauer Kuratorium, City of Baden, SIS (Schweizerische Interpreten Stiftung) and Fondation SUISA.


$20 presale tickets via UTR
$35 donation tickets
$15 unwaged door sales

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

It is rare that improvisors of their calibre make it out to NZ, so we’re very happy to host them at Pyramid Club for a duo concert plus collaborative sets with local musicians.
As a violinist he was one of the key exponents of the ‘group voice approach’ style of improvised music, performing as a member of the Butcher/Russell/Durrant trio, News From The Shed and the Chris Burn Ensemble.

events.id: Expressive Watercolour-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Expressive Watercolour
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
Watercolour is special because of the fluid properties that produce spontaneous and unique results. The inability to anticipate exactly what the paint will do makes watercolour an exciting medium to work with.

In this course we will learn to set the conditions for surprising and beautiful accidents to occur on the page. By incorporating these looser abstract elements into representational paintings we can convey heightened emotions in our work.

Throughout the term we will cover the following:

- The wet into wet technique to achieve one of a kind paint interactions.
- Learn about transparent colour mixing to create luminosity in your paintings.
- Use marbling to find organic shapes and patterns.
- Study the relationship between line and colour and the different ways they can be combined to find a personal style.
- Experiment with composition through collage.

Each class we will look at examples of historic and contemporary painting, and discuss how to selectively incorporate references into your work. Over the term you will build up a visual style and body of work.

Whether you’re new to watercolour or looking to expand your range, this course offers an opportunity to explore the expressive potential of watercolour.

Basic materials included. Students must be at least 16 years of age to attend this course.

Eight week courses running on:
- Wednesdays, 11 Feb - 1 April, 10-12pm
- Thursdays, 12 Feb - 2 April, 6-8pm

events.name: TechWomen and AWS - Career Mindset Workshop: Own Your Energy
events.venue: Multiple locations and online
events.long_description:
Kick off 2026 with a transformative mindset experience that will enable you to set and execute the right intentions for your career throughout 2026 and beyond.
The TechWomen and AWS teams invite you to begin the year with a special mindset workshop designed for women in tech, hosted by Candice Murray, a leading NZ based career mindset coach. In this interactive session, you'll choose a positive emotional state you want to strengthen - whether it's calm, confidence, self-belief, or focus - and learn practical, evidence-based techniques to access it whenever you need it most.
As the session is best experienced in person, we've arranged remote hubs around the country with Candice presenting live from Auckland. Discover how to harness your emotional power and elevate your professional performance through simple, science-backed tools that will equip you with lasting skills to thrive in your career.
Spaces are limited, so register early to secure your spot at this highly anticipated event.
Event Details:
Date: Wednesday, 11 February 2026
Time: 3:00pm - 5:30pm
Locations:
Auckland: AWS, Commercial Bay Level 13/15 Customs Street West, Auckland Central
Wellington: AWS, 21/157 Lambton Quay, Wellington Central
Hamilton: Tuatahi First Fibre, 11 Ken Browne Drive, Te Rapa, Hamilton
Queenstown: Queenstown Resort College
Christchurch: TBC

events.id: The World of Ikebana - Tension and the Beauty of Space-100 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: The World of Ikebana - Tension and the Beauty of Space
events.venue: 100 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Have you ever heard of Ikebana, the Japanese art of flower arrangement? This event invites you to explore the history, philosophy, and aesthetics of Ikebana, followed by a hands-on workshop where you can experience the art firsthand.
With a history spanning over 1,400 years, Ikebana is far more than decorative floral design. It is a refined art form that expresses space, balance, seasonality, and life itself. Today, Ikebana is internationally recognised and practiced by enthusiasts around the world.
Through careful techniques such as proper water preparation and pruning, flowers can be enjoyed for weeks, subtly changing their appearance over time.
By engaging with flowers, space, and silence, participants are encouraged to sense the changing seasons and reflect on the essence of life.
Part I: Lecture & Demonstration, Q&A
Part II: Workshop

events.long_description:
Do you want to meet fellow sapphics but you don't feel super comfortable in environments that are loud and pressure you to drink alcohol and flirt? Sapphic Chill Hangouts are monthly events that prioritise low-pressure talks and being your beautiful unmasked self. events.id: Life Drawing Central-St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Life Drawing Central
events.venue: St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington
events.long_description:
UPDATE. We have just finished our sessions for
2025. We intend to start again on 11 February 2026.

Queries - text 021 02510112.

We are usually on the top floor in the room at the end of the foyer. There is an electronic noticeboard showing the location of groups.

Weekly untutored life drawing from a model. Please note you will need to bring your own art materials.

Meet up with others who have an interest in art. We meet each Wednesday evening in a room on the top floor of the St Andrews on the Terrace conference centre.

The conference centre rooms are rented by a range of organisations - we are not affiliated to the church. Our group has been meeting for many, many years - it started at Turnbull House. Some people attend regularly, while others come occasionally as their schedule permits. There is no need to book in advance.

Our group is untutored; please bring your own art materials.
The starting time is 5.30 pm, but if you are delayed, don't worry if you are a few minutes late. We are a small, informal group. Afterwards, some of us usually go to the Old Bailey on Lambton Quay for drinks and dinner. See some of our work on Facebook: St Andrews Wellington Life Drawing Group. We also now have an Instagram page @wgtn_life_art

events.name: The Open Painting Studio

events.long_description:
Explore your own ideas and image with guidance of an experienced tutor. The tutor and the student will discuss and find a way of how best to achieve their concept through the use of materials, composition, colour, texture.

This is a dynamic class where, apart from the tutor’s guidance, the input from the students is encouraged and valued in the weekly critique of the work created. This course offers the opportunity to work your skills in drawing, composition, description of volume, mixing of colours, technique and most important, personal expression.

This course is appropriate for all levels and suitable for ages 16+.

Materials are not supplied. Students must bring their own materials and brushes ( i.e. paint oil or acrylic, paper, canvases, brushes).

8 week course on either:
- Wednesdays, 11 Feb - 1 April, 5:30-8pm
- Thursdays, 12 Feb - 2 April, 10-1pm

events.id: Book Launch | Bill Manhire and Jenny Bornholdt-61 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Book Launch | Bill Manhire and Jenny Bornholdt
events.venue: 61 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
We are starting the publishing year with a major double book launch! Join us to launch two stunning new poetry collections by Bill Manhire and Jenny Bornholdt.
Wednesday 11 February, 6pm
Unity Books Wellington
All welcome!
Bill Manhire's Lyrical Ballads and Jenny Bornholdt's What to Wear arrive together from two of New Zealand's most celebrated poets, both former poet laureates. The books will be launched by Robyn Marsack, a Wellington-born editor, translator and literary advocate, and former Director of the Scottish Poetry Library.

Lyrical Ballads by Bill Manhire is a dazzling new collection from New Zealand's inaugral poet laureate.
Bill Manhire observes the collisions between wonder and reality, childhood vulnerability and ageing, and hilarity and heartbreak.
Lyrical Ballads is a many-peopled book: the baffled inhabitants of Every Street and Intermediate Street are here, while Dracula, T.S. Eliot and Bobby Outram from Outram have walk-on parts. The collection is anchored by two long sequences that embrace awkwardness, mystery and absurdity: 'The Tobacco Tin' and 'Tell You What'.

What to Wear is a beautiful new collection by Jenny Bornholdt, one of Aotearoa's most-loved poets and a former poet laureate.
The poems in What to Wear observe that life means doing ordinary and marvellous things – like going to Bunnings, falling asleep on the train, losing and finding poems, losing and dreaming of our mothers, loving, dying, and deciding what to wear.
Bornholdt's poems turn to the universal subjects of mortality, memory, ageing and grief, but always with lightness, humanity and wry humour.

The cover of Lyrical Ballads is by Todd Atticus
The cover photograph for What to Wear is by Deborah Smith
The cover design for What to Wear is by Dexter Murray

events.id: Anyone Can Draw - Structural-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Anyone Can Draw - Structural
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
In this course, you will examine structural drawing with a careful, helpful approach, focusing on simple perspective drawing and the value of geometric shapes and solids. Both these structural approaches contribute greatly to the success of your drawing.

Geometric shapes can simplify a subject, unify a drawing and make compositions dynamic. Geometric solids will help render any subject in three dimensions and transition to perspective.

A good working knowledge of the concepts of perspective will help you draw any subject with correct dimensionality. It can also help in your realistic drawing, painting and invented subjects and environments. These concepts are also used in most two-dimensional art because it enables us to realise great spatial effects, making it an invaluable tool to add to your skill set.

In this course, you will learn the following:

- Focus on geometric shapes and solids and how they contribute to both realist and abstract drawing
- Form an appreciation of geometry and shapes that can help with constructing a drawing
- The important tools, methods and concepts of one-point, two-point and three-point perspectives
- Universal boxing, drawing ellipses
- Hints in locating helpful lines and axes to draw real subjects
- Introductory methods of working that blend perspective knowledge with real drawing situations

All basic materials supplied.

You must be at least 16 years of age to attend this course.

An eight-week course running on either:
- Wednesdays, 11 Feb - 1 April, 6:30-8:30
- Fridays, 13 Feb - 10 April, 10am-1pm

events.id: Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Picasso Kiss-Hotel Bristol, 131 - 133 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Picasso Kiss
events.venue: Hotel Bristol, 131 - 133 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

events.id: A Place To Bury Strangers-Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: A Place To Bury Strangers
events.venue: Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
UTR and Meow Touring presents:

A Place To Bury Strangers return to Aotearoa with their explosive new album Synthesizer — a record built on chaos, colour, and pure DIY spirit. Synthesizer isn’t just the title of their seventh album; it’s also a custom-built instrument created specifically for it. “It’s pretty messed up, chaotic… but it feels really human,” says frontman Oliver Ackermann. The album celebrates spontaneity, collaboration, and the kind of raw noise that can only come from a band locked in together.

Written in the band’s Queens studio after a refreshed lineup — Ackermann with John and Sandra Fedowitz — Synthesizer cracks open and reimagines the signature APTBS sound in vivid new ways. It’s romantic, raw, unsteady, and built for the stage, where the band’s legendary walls of sound hit with full force.

With Support from: Grecco Romank

events.id: Christoph Gallio / Phil Durrant-272 Taranaki Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Christoph Gallio / Phil Durrant
events.venue: 272 Taranaki Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Phil Durrant (electric mandolin and electronics) and Christoph Gallio (saxophones) are veterans of the international free improvisation scene. Their individual and collaborative projects have helped shape the development of improvised music. They first worked together over 40 years ago, but it wasn’t until 2022 that they started performing as a duo. It is rare that improvisors of their calibre make it out to NZ, so we’re very happy to host them at Pyramid Club for a duo concert plus collaborative sets with local musicians.
Phil Durrant (London, UK) is a multi-instrumentalist improviser, composer and sound artist. As a violinist he was one of the key exponents of the ‘group voice approach’ style of improvised music, performing as a member of the Butcher/Russell/Durrant trio, News From The Shed and the Chris Burn Ensemble. In the late 90s, his influential trio with Radu Malfatti and Thomas Lehn represented a shift to a more reductionist approach. As a synthesiser player, Durrant performs with Bertrand Denzler and Burkhard Beins in Trio Sowari. He is also a member of the international electronic ensemble MIMEO with Keith Rowe, Kaffe Matthews, Thomas Lehn and Rafael Toral. He has performed all over Europe and Canada and released CDs and records on Acta and Emanem Records.
Swiss saxophonist and composer Christoph Gallio studied classical saxophone with Iwan Roth at the Basel Music Conservator and then with Steve Lacy in Paris. He has collaborated with many of the world’s leading voices in improvisation including Irene Schweizer, Urs Blöchlinger, Mani Neumeier, Peter Kowald, Fred Frith, Haco, Tetsu Saitoh, Phil Minton, Pablo Diaz, Marcelo von Schultz, Olie Brice, Andrew Lisle, Cath Roberts, Irene Aebi, William Parker, Rashied Ali, Matthew Ostrowski, Gerry Hemingway, Sven-Åke Johansson, Olaf Rupp, Jan Roder, Oli Steidle, Andrea Neumann, Ernst Thoma, Julian Sartorius, Nicolas Stocker, Paula Shocron, Sergio Merce, Alistair Zaldua, Phil Durrant, Roger Turner, Dominic Lash, Mark Sanders and many more. Gallio has been running his own label PERCASO since 1986.
www.gallio.ch
Durrant and Gallio will perform a duo set, and then be joined by local improvising musicians Tom Callwood (bass), Jake Baxendale (sax) and Daniel Beban (guitar/tapes).
Their tour is sponsored by Swiss Arts Council, Aargauer Kuratorium, City of Baden, SIS (Schweizerische Interpreten Stiftung) and Fondation SUISA.

$20 presale tickets via UTR
$35 donation tickets
$15 unwaged door sales
Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

events.name: Gregory Alan Isakov
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
American indie-folk artist Gregory Alan Isakov is a Grammy-nominated singer and songwriter. He’s bringing his intimate and lyric-driven show to Wellington in February. Audiences will be given a special opportunity to experience stripped-down acoustic arrangements. He’ll delve into favourites from six of his full-length studio albums, including his most recent ‘Appaloosa Bones’. 
This 2023 album was praised with an Associated Press reviewer saying, “His new songs are relentlessly majestic, a kind of musical morphine”. Gregory has amassed a devoted community of fans who have helped him garner over 1 billion streams on listening platforms to date.

events.name: Breakfast with the Mayor
events.venue: BNZ Partners Centre Wellington,1 Whitmore Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Breakfast with the Mayor
Breakfast with the Mayor Hon. Andrew Little

About this Event

Wellington is gearing up for a milestone year.

With new leadership in place and major projects like Te Ngākau Civic Square, the Wellington Town Hall, and Te Matapihi Central Library reopening soon, the Capital is entering a period of renewal and momentum, with Mayor Hon Andrew Little at the helm.

To kick off the new year, join the Wellington Chamber of Commerce and host BNZ for an exclusive Mayor’s breakfast to hear directly from the Mayor about his priorities, and the opportunities ahead for the capital.

2026 marks a pivotal reset for Wellington’s economic outlook. This breakfast provides a rare opportunity for leaders, policy makers, and Wellingtonians alike to gain insight on the factors shaping our city’s future.

Agenda:
7:15am- Standing breakfast, networking
7:45am- Address
8:10am- Q&A
8:30am- Event concludes

events.id: Cultivating a Positive Workplace Culture for High-Performance Teams-Wellington Chamber Of Commerce,NTT Tower Level 13, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Cultivating a Positive Workplace Culture for High-Performance Teams
events.venue: Wellington Chamber Of Commerce,NTT Tower Level 13, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Cultivating a Positive Workplace Culture for High-Performance Teams
Learn to build a positive, high-performing workplace culture through trust, inclusivity, and collaboration.

About this Event

This course is designed for leaders, managers, and organisational change agents who want to foster a positive workplace culture that drives high performance, collaboration, and employee wellbeing. Participants will explore the essential principles of creating an environment that nurtures trust, accountability, inclusivity, and engagement. Through practical strategies, case studies, and interactive discussions, participants will learn how to develop a culture that motivates teams to excel, encourages open communication, and supports professional growth.


Key Topics Include:
• Building a culture of trust and psychological safety
• Fostering open communication and feedback loops
• Aligning values and purpose with organisational goals
• Promoting inclusivity, diversity, and belonging
• Recognising and celebrating achievements
• Encouraging work-life balance and wellbeing
• Developing strategies for conflict resolution and collaboration

By the end of the course, participants will have the tools and insights needed to create a workplace environment that not only supports but accelerates the success of high-performing teams, driving both individual and collective achievement.


Key audience:
This course is designed for leaders, managers, and anyone responsible for shaping the culture within their teams and organisations.


Learning outcomes:
Implement strategies to cultivate trust, psychological safety, and high performance within their teams.
Lead teams that foster open communication, collaboration, and inclusivity.
Align team goals with organisational values and objectives, ensuring a shared sense of purpose.
Develop effective strategies for conflict resolution and team cohesion.
Create a workplace culture that encourages growth, well-being, and work-life balance.

If you would like to register with Business Central directly and receive an invoice for payment, please contact our training team via .


Course details:
Duration: Full day, in person.
Time: 9am – 4pm


Course includes
Workbook, arrival tea or coffee, morning tea, lunch, afternoon tea.
To view our Terms and Conditions click here.

events.id: Women's Amateur Asia-Pacific Championship-Royal Wellington Golf Club, 28 Golf Rd, Heretaunga, Upper Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Women's Amateur Asia-Pacific Championship
events.venue: Royal Wellington Golf Club, 28 Golf Rd, Heretaunga, Upper Hutt
events.long_description:
Royal Wellington Golf Club will host the eighth edition of the Women's Amateur Asia-Pacific Golf Championship and is inviting the public to come witness the golf stars of tomorrow and enjoy hospitality and entertainment in our Royal Village.

This championship brings together the Asia- Pacific region's elite amateur women golfers who will complete for starts in three major championships. The goal of the championship is to build a long-term pathway for women's golf across the Asia Pacific region.

Free to spectators, this event is ideal for families and sports enthusiasts of all ages. There will be opportunities for people to get to know more about the game of golf. If you've wanted to give golf a go, you will want to check out the hugely popular "She Loves Golf programme" (developed by New Zealand Golf).

Please consider using public transport. If you catch the train, Heretaunga Railway Station is about a 5-minute walk to the Club. The number 110 bus from Petone to Emerald Hill (both ways) stops near Golf Road. If you're driving, parking is available in the Heretaunga area. Please note that there is no parking available at the Club.

Save the date (February 12 to 15) and we’ll see you there!

events.id: Contemporary Realism-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Contemporary Realism
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
Whether you work from objects, the figure, or secondary sources, this is an opportunity to explore working more loosely, using oils or acrylics.

Justine will guide you through drawing and painting exercises to help loosen you up, and will discuss art historical techniques that may be relevant to your individual artistic style and context.

This course will increase your ability to represent perceived objects in a dynamic, painterly way. You will be guided through drawing and painting exercises to help you achieve accuracy of form, working loosely with oils and acrylics to create fresh contemporary paintings. The emphasis is on working with your chosen source material to create a `next level’ painting. This course is for those who have explored some of the basics of painting such as mixing colours, blending etc, but want to find a process that best expresses your unique approach and ideas. Skills learnt in class can be applied across all genres.

Materials are not included in this course.
Materials: Please bring your preferred range of oils, brushes and supports (paper, canvas, or board). A good basic set of oil paints would include cad and lemon yellow, ultramarine and cerulean blue, and cad red and alizarin crimson. Also, black and white. Inverlochy will supply Liquin and Gamsol solvent. No other solvents are allowed in this class. Please also bring a photocopied reference image in both black and white and colour.

Lunch break - 30 minutes. Bring a water bottle and packed lunch to enjoy in the historic Inverlochy house or explore the local cafes in Te Aro.

events.id: Early Childhood Centre Emergency Planning Workshop - Wellington-Johnsonville Community Centre Hall, 3 Frankmoore Ave, Johnsonville, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Early Childhood Centre Emergency Planning Workshop - Wellington
events.venue: Johnsonville Community Centre Hall, 3 Frankmoore Ave, Johnsonville, Wellington
events.long_description:
Would you and your staff be confident in an emergency? Do you have a plan, and more importantly have you practiced it recently?

We are holding a free workshop for Early Childhood Education Centres in Wellington to come together to discuss your emergency plans.

This workshop is an opportunity for ECEs to share challenges and solutions and get advice from our Emergency Management Advisors.

It aims to help ECEs plan for significant events such as earthquake, tsunami, armed intruders and to share ideas and network around emergency planning.

This is an opportunity for Centre Managers, Directors, Health & Safety Representatives or Leads to:

- Share solutions, practical advice and learnings from recent events.
- Discuss your current plans with emergency management professionals.
- Learn more about our local hazards and important planning information including lessons learnt from the Christchurch Earthquake, Christchurch Mosque Attack and Cyclone Gabrielle.

Hope to see you there as we build safer and more resilient ECEs and communities together.

Places are limited to a maximum of 25 people attending each session. This workshop is endorsed by the Ministry of Education.

For more information, please email info@wremo.nz

We aim to make our community events inclusive to all people. If you are attending the event and have specific accessibility requirements, you can send us an email at info@wremo.nz with the event name and we will get in touch to see how we can meet your needs as best we can.

events.id: Art History-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Art History
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
Art History is a study of visual arts across time and cultures. It involves analysing artworks to understand visual language in its social, historical, political context, values and human expressions. It helps us to develop critical thinking to interpret how visual culture impacts the society and identity.

The focus this term will be as follows:

The first month will cover briefly the Prehistoric, Ancient, Greco- Roman art followed by the Renaissance period, looking at the works of the great masters like Donatello, Ghiberti, Leonardo da Vinci, Michelangelo, Raphael, Albrecht Dürer, Jan van Eyck and Hieronymus Bosch.

In the second month we look at Baroque, Rococo, Romanticism briefly, and then study Modern movements like Impressionism, Surrealism, Expressionism & Cubism, looking at artists like Monet, Degas, Manet, Cezanne, Seurat, Van Gogh to name a few. We also hold discussions on Dali, Matisse, Kandinsky, Mondrian, Rothko, Pollock and end with Picasso, among others.

Recommended materials - writing utensil and notebook

events.id: Printmaking - Monoprinting ant lino-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Printmaking - Monoprinting ant lino
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
Explore the printmaking technique of monoprinting and lino. Learning these techniques will allow you to create interesting and compelling images.

During this four -week course you will have in depth instruction on monoprinting and lino cutting techniques. You will learn to plan, prepare, cut, ink and print a composition.

Your imagery will be informed by your own subject matter. You are encouraged to bring sketches and or photographs for inspiration to create with.

Basic materials are included. Suitable for beginners and experienced students. Recommended for ages 16+.

Four week course running on:
- Thursday mornings, 12 Feb - 5 March, 10-1pm
- Thursdays evenings, 12 Feb - 5 March, 6-8:30pm

WELLINGTON - The Arborist Rooftop Bar
Monthly Topic: Self Love as a Business Strategy
Hosted by:
February’s networking topic is Self-Love as a Business Strategy. This session explores how self-love shows up practically in business; through boundaries, confidence, visibility, and decision-making. We’ll reflect on how honouring yourself creates clarity, sustainability, and long-term success, and why self-love is one of the most powerful strategies you can have.
Want to get your ticket for FREE?

now and become part of a wonderful community of women in business who are ready to build their dream life and business.

Whether you're just starting out with new business ideas or have years of experience under your belt, all are welcome! Empower Her provides a safe space where you can share your business with others, connect with like-minded women in business, and prioritise collaboration over competition.

events.name: Wellington Government House Garden tour
events.venue: Government House Visitor Centre, Hospital Road Entrance, Newtown Wellington, Wellington
events.long_description:
Explore Government House gardens with the BARK garden team (90 minute tour)

Government House was opened in Newtown in 1910, and its extensive gardens have been in continuous development since then. As part of the Spring Festival, the Government House garden team is offering guided walks through our gardens. Tours will go ahead regardless of weather. Tours will not enter the main house.

Bookings are essential for the free tour. Places are limited: https://gg.govt.nz/government-house/government-house-wellington/government-house-tours/upcoming

Some parts of our grounds are not mobility friendly. Please contact the Visitor Centre direct if you have any questions regarding accessibility.

Groups wanting to organise a garden tour or house tour can email our Visitor Centre team direct: bookings@govthouse.govt.nz

If you have any questions or need more information, please email us at bookings@govthouse.govt.nz, or call us at 04-382-0837. You will receive a reminder email 24 hours before your tour.

events.long_description:
Join our community at our first 2026 event - Feb 2026 in-person meetup in Wellington CBD. Many thanks to our 2026 Platinum sponsor Creative HQ for hosting us.
Date: Thursday, 12 Feb 2026
Venue: Creative HQ, 7 Dixon Street, Wellington, NZ
Time: 4.30 pm - 7.00 pm
Event website
Programme
4:30 pm – 5:00 pm
Arrival & networking
5:00 pm – 6:00 pm
Welcome notes – Stuart Whitehead
Talk 1 – Chloe Gunn
Talk 2 – Mrinal Mukherjee
Speaker Q&A and closing notes – Stuart Whitehead
6:00 pm – 7:00 pm
Community mingling & networking
Talks & Speakers
Unlocking Your Brain’s Edge with AI - Chloe Gunn, CX Designer @ Kiwibank
Chloe Gunn explores how AI can amplify your thinking, help you learn faster and make complex ideas easier to handle. She shares practical, neuroscience-backed tools to reduce cognitive load, cut rumination and face tough conversations. A fast, energising talk for anyone using AI day to day.
Engineering management: Not quite what they told you - Mrinal Mukherjee, Engineering Leader @ Bank of New Zealand
Step beyond myths about engineering management. Mrinal's talk shares the messy realities of leading teams, balancing delivery, people, and chaos. Packed with stories, humour, and practical lessons, it helps new managers prepare, gives experienced leaders reassurance, and offers all attendees tips to navigate the tricky parts of leadership.
Event entry
This is a free event for our tech community. Everyone is welcome. Please RSVP to grab your free ticket, as we have limited numbers.
Please make sure you have your QR code in your ticket email handy as we will digitally check-in on arrival at the venue.
If you can't attend, then please email us at info@nztechrally.nz to cancel your ticket, so folks on the waitlist can attend.
For any enquiries, please email info@nztechrally.nz.

events.long_description:
明けましておめでとうございます！
Come along and flex your Japanese language skills at JKaiWa
JETAA Wellington’s monthly Japanese conversation evening. JKaiWa welcomes language learners and native speakers to come and enjoy casual conversation in Japanese with like-minded people!
This month JKaiWa will be held on Thursday 12th February from 5:30pm - 7:00pm, at the usual place, the Japan Information and Cultural Centre, Level 18, Majestic Centre, 100 Willis Street Wellington CBD.
For health and safety reasons we have been asked to limit the number of attendees to a total of 30 people. We still absolutely encourage anyone interested in attending to sign up, as we often do not reach this 30 people limit, however signing up is now mandatory, so please follow the link below if you wish to attend:
https://forms.gle/ga2MMVqYxcAi9q7Y9
If all 30 places are taken you will receive an email letting you know of your spot on the waiting list. Likewise, if you have signed up and can no longer attend, you can email jkaiwawlg@gmail.com and let us know.
This is a free event open to anyone with Japanese conversational ability from beginner to advanced and native speakers, so feel free to share this event with all your Japanese-speaking friends!
We hope to see you there!
よろしくおねがいします!

events.id: Cinemal - Book Launch and Screening-27 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Cinemal - Book Launch and Screening
events.venue: 27 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us for the launch of Tessa Laird’s new book, *Cinemal: The Becoming-Animal of Experimental Film*, and experience a special screening of five artist films from Aotearoa and Australia, introduced by Tessa herself.
Thursday 12 March, 6pm
CIRCUIT, Level 2, 27 Dixon St, Wellington
Free entry | Books $35
Published by University of Minnesota Press, Cinemal is part of a growing focus on nonhuman animals in film. Cinemal ventures to the “furry underbelly” of global experimental film practice, focusing on films from New Zealand, Australia, and South America. Laird examines how animals are depicted in film and analyzes the various animal qualities of cinema, like scratching and sniffing, vibrant colors, and voices (barking, howling, or echolocation).
The screening features works by Nova Paul, Arthur & Corinne Cantrill with Ivor Cantrill, Sriwhana Spong, Tina Stefanou, and Peter Waples-Crowe with Glynn Urquhart.
Free entry, seats limited.
#Cinemal #ExperimentalFilm #BookLaunch #ArtistFilm #AotearoaArts #WellingtonEvents #MovingImage #CIRCUITAMI

events.id: From Freeze to Flow: Somatic Tools to Move Through Emotional Paralysis-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: From Freeze to Flow: Somatic Tools to Move Through Emotional Paralysis
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
From Freeze to Flow: Somatic Tools to Move Through Emotional Paralysis

This will be a gentle Somatic Breathwork workshop designed to help you regulate your nervous system, decompress emotionally, and find embodied clarity. Using nose-dominant breathing techniques, optional mouth exhales, and gentle somatic movements, this session will support you in releasing tension and building to a potential cathartic experience.

Who this is for
This workshop is perfect for:
•⁠ ⁠Those feeling stressed or overwhelmed
•⁠ ⁠Individuals experiencing wired-and-tired fatigue
•⁠ ⁠Anyone struggling with overthinking or racing thoughts
•⁠ ⁠People facing sleep disruptions or insomnia
•⁠ ⁠Those with a heaviness in the chest
•⁠ ⁠Creatives facing blocks in inspiration
•⁠ ⁠Caring parents in need of self-care
•⁠ ⁠Welcome to beginners!

What to expect
•⁠ ⁠Arrival ritual and consent check
•⁠ ⁠Breath demo to guide your experience
•⁠ ⁠Progressive breath arcs using Elebreath 5-Arc
•⁠ ⁠Conservative tracks available throughout
•⁠ ⁠Micro-shakes and unwinding to release tension
•⁠ ⁠Optional arm swings and body sways
•⁠ ⁠Integration rest to reflect on your journey
•⁠ ⁠Journaling to capture insights
•⁠ ⁠Live sound with bowls and curated music

Benefits you may notice
•⁠ ⁠A deeper sense of calm
•⁠ ⁠Softer jaw and shoulders
•⁠ ⁠A steadier baseline of emotional regulation
•⁠ ⁠A clearer mind
•⁠ ⁠Improved sleep quality
•⁠ ⁠A lifted mood
•⁠ ⁠Greater emotional range without feeling overwhelmed

Yoga mats are provided but you are most welcome to bring:
•⁠ ⁠Additional yoga mat
•⁠ ⁠Warm layers and socks
•⁠ ⁠Water bottle
•⁠ ⁠Small towel
•⁠ ⁠Optional eye mask or light scarf
•⁠ ⁠Journal and pen
•⁠ ⁠If you tend to feel cold, consider bringing a blanket

Pre-class prep
•⁠ ⁠Eat a light meal 2 hours before class.
•⁠ ⁠Hydrate well throughout the day.
•⁠ ⁠Avoid alcohol and recreational substances for 24 hours.
•⁠ ⁠Limit caffeine intake 4 hours prior.
•⁠ ⁠Arrive 10 minutes early for intake.
•⁠ ⁠If you have health conditions, check with your provider.
•⁠ ⁠Feel free to share any concerns with Lynn before the session at {{hi@lynofuro.co.nz}}.

Contraindications and safety
Breathwork can alter your breath rate and surface emotions. It may not be suitable for those who are pregnant, have serious cardiovascular issues, uncontrolled blood pressure, or a history of seizures. This practice is not medical care. We offer a conservative track with nasal-only breathing and smaller ranges of motion, along with breaks as needed.

Aftercare
Post-workshop, we encourage you to drink water, eat nourishing food, engage in simple movements or a short walk, and journal any insights. Emotional waves can continue for 24 to 48 hours, so reach out if you need support.

Facilitator
Lynn Tiang is an Integrative Somatic Coach specializing in breathwork and Reiki, focusing on corporate burnout, chronic pain, and stress. Her approach is nurturing and gentle, ensuring a supportive environment for all participants.

From Freeze to Flow: Somatic Tools to Move Through Emotional Paralysis This will be a gentle Somatic Breathwork workshop designed to help you regulate your nervous system, decompress emotionally, and find embodied clarity.
Using nose-dominant breathing techniques, optional mouth exhales, and gentle somatic movements, this session will support you in releasing tension and building to a potential cathartic experience.

events.id: Rethinking Career: Find the Work You’re Meant For-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Rethinking Career: Find the Work You’re Meant For
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Rethinking Career: Find the Work You’re Meant For

For many people, work feels heavy.
Something to get through. Something that drains more than it gives.

You might feel bored, frustrated, stuck, or quietly miserable — but also unsure what to do about it. Changing jobs can feel overwhelming. Will it actually make things better? Will it be worth the risk? Will I still feel financially safe?

This evening is not about rushing into big decisions.
It’s about understanding yourself first.

Drawing on the Career Dharma framework, this event offers a different way of looking at work - one based on human nature, psychology, and timeless wisdom. It starts from a simple but often overlooked idea: we are not all nourished by the same things.

In Career Dharma, enrichment is understood as wealth - not only financial, but emotional, creative, intellectual, relational, and spiritual. Each of us is sustained by different kinds of wealth. These are known as our prosperity types.

When our work provides the kinds of prosperity our body and mind actually need, work feels lighter, more meaningful, and more sustainable. When it doesn’t, even a “good” or stable job can slowly drain us.

Through guided reflection and practical exercises, you’ll begin to uncover:

What genuinely makes you feel fulfilled and energized at work

The types of prosperity that matter most to you

Why certain work environments exhaust you - and others don’t

How greater self-understanding can help you adjust your current role or make wiser choices about future work

This session isn’t about job titles or quick fixes. It’s about awareness - and how knowing what truly nourishes you can change the way you relate to work, without needing to have all the answers yet.

Please note this is one of two careers workshops this month. While they complement each other, each session is designed to be meaningful on its own.

A plant-based dinner and dessert are included in your ticket.
Both hosts are available to support those who wish to continue exploring their career path.

Meet your hosts, Sri Jiva & Chanchala
Since childhood, Sri Jiva has been fascinated by meaning, purpose, and authentic life fulfilment. This, among other things, led him to join a monastery at the age of 19. After years of monastic training, he chose to marry and pursue a career. He felt called to use his monastic experience to help others understand themselves, and to find wisdom, meaning, and purpose in their own lives. Inspired by this calling, he went to university to study counselling. Now, Sri Jiva and his wife live near Wellington, where he works with a small team of counsellors, supporting clients individually and in groups.

Chanchala studied psychology and education and brings a coaching-based approach to career exploration. She supports people to uncover work they love by helping them understand what truly nourishes their nature and psychology. Chanchala’s work is grounded in curiosity, self-trust, and creating careers that feel sustainable and life-giving.

events.id: Life Drawing Art Classes-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Life Drawing Art Classes
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
The figure is an attractive and fascinating subject. In our tutored life drawing class, we provide a supportive relaxed environment where you can learn figure drawing and practice from a variety of great models. Enjoy an evening of figure drawing with instruction and effective ideas to develop.

Each week we will examine tested drawing exercises that are great for practicing drawing the figure and valuable to help you problem solve. These exercises are effective and build your observational drawing. They build sensitivity to real shape, to gesture, form and the structure of figures. Our focus is to create figures that are convincing and have life.

Figure drawing is also valuable for extending an artist’s practice at any level. If you are beginning with figure work we will provide instruction, demonstrations and feed back to build your skill level.

Basic materials provided. Life model fees included in your tuition.

Eight week course running on Thursdays, 12 Feb - 2 April, 6:30-8:30pm.

Your team's street cred, life smarts and common sense will go a long way to ensuring success on the night.

events.id: The Pearl Fishers-Day's Bay Opera Canna House, 24 Moana Road, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: The Pearl Fishers
events.venue: Day's Bay Opera Canna House, 24 Moana Road, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Come and enjoy Bizet's famous opera The Pearl Fishers with New Zealand star opera singers, Madison Nonoa, Zachary McCulloch and Kieran Rayner. Staged in Days Bay with a real orchestra and a backdrop of beech forest, experience this exotic masterpiece in the most exotic of settings. Pack a picnic and spread out in this lovely old Days Bay garden, and then take your seat on the lawn and take in the opera in a truly intimate and unique way.

Howard Moody is our guest conductor from the UK, well known for his opera conducting, opera creating and for being a musical polymath. He will conduct our fabulous soloists and the excellent Days Bay Opera Chorus and Orchestra.

Producer Rhona Fraser will fully stage the opera on the terraces of Canna House using the entrances from the bush, from the garden and up from the beach.

If you haven't been to an opera in Days Bay before, this is your chance.

events.id: Pearls & Pints - Adults Social Club (Ages 18+)-Abandoned Taproom Petone, 38 Fitzherbert St, Petone, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Pearls & Pints - Adults Social Club (Ages 18+)
events.venue: Abandoned Taproom Petone, 38 Fitzherbert St, Petone, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Meet new people, make new jewellery, and enjoy your first drink on the house! Pearls & Pints is a faction of our Village Beads Social Collective, which aims to connect people of similar interests as you bond over creating some new pearl jewellery and enjoy some pints (or other beverages!). Come solo and meet new people, or bring some friends along for a fun night at Abandoned Brewery! No beading skills required, our team will help out with all the technical skills at the end.

Create either two freshwater pearl bracelets or one freshwater pearl necklace in this session. We’ll bring a huge selection of different freshwater pearl beads with us, and Abandoned have a huge selection of craft beers, wines, and other delicious drinks to choose between! Snacks available for purchase too.

Bookings and payments required in advance for people aged 18+. Valid ID required upon entry.

Workshop is held at Abandoned Taproom Petone - 38 Fitzherbert Street.

Hosted by two of Welly's most fearlessly experimental comedians (Mo Munn and Aaron James Douglas), Silly Billies is serving up a wild night of alternative comedy jam packed with laughs and crowdwork!

Expect the unexpected. Stay for the unhinged. And get ready for a comedy night unlike any other. Silly Billies is comedy uncaged.

events.id: Summer Camp Closing Party! | Dillon Jo, Miles Calder & Keira Batten Co-San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Summer Camp Closing Party! | Dillon Jo, Miles Calder & Keira Batten Co
events.venue: San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us and some of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s finest artists over five nights across January and February with tickets from $10 or a season pass for $40, featuring drink specials and cocktails thanks to our sponsor Jameson.

Here it is… our final night! Featuring not one, not two, but THREE of Pōneke’s premier acts to close our 2026 series out.

Dillon Jo is the genre defying project of Wellington Based artists Betty Smith and Georgie Levien. Dillon Jo built paths between the elements of dream pop, shoegaze, folk, alt rock, and indie pop to create their genre defying sound. Having recently recruited Kahu Sanson-Burnett and Ruadh Munro, Dillon Jo has transformed their live sets into an unbridled big-sound shoegaze experience.

Miles Calder released his solo debut album Autopilot Life in 2021, a self-reflective delve into waking up from an unexamined life, dressed in a psychedelic folk-rock palette that evoked late-era Beatles as much as contemporaries like Kevin Morby and Father John Misty. The album won over new fans and critics alike & led to a nomination for a prestigious Aotearoa Music Award (Te Kaipuoro Taketake Toa | Best Folk Artist 2022).

Keira Batten Coogan writes raw and messy music for alien listeners. Joined onstage by some familiar Pōneke talent, his earnest earworms pack more punch than ever. Themes of queerness, growing pains, love, and nostalgia shine through his lyricism and captivates audiences.

events.id: Tipping Points in the Cryosphere-Rutherford House,33 Bunny Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Tipping Points in the Cryosphere
events.venue: Rutherford House,33 Bunny Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Tipping Points in the Cryosphere
Public panel discussion featuring world leaders in cryospheric sciences as part of the international 'Climate in the Crysophere' conference

About this Event

The accelerating loss of the cryosphere, which holds 70% of the world’s freshwater in all its forms – sea ice, lake ice, mountain glaciers, the polar ice sheets and their ice shelves, snow and permafrost - is one of the clearest planet-wide consequences of global warming so far.
The loss of even parts of these key components of the cryosphere would result in severe impacts for coastal communities, infrastructure and ecosystems through permanent inundation of the lowest-lying areas and by increasing the frequency of flooding, and requires an extensive and long-term commitment to adaptation to limit these impacts. By the end of the century one billion people living in coastal areas could be impacted (IPCC 2023).
There is ample evidence for abrupt change in the past, especially for the glaciers and ice sheets. Moreover, changes in land-ice are, for the most part, are irreversible on human-to-glacial timescales. In fact, both the Greenland and Antarctic ice sheets show strong hysteresis behaviour, meaning that once certain parts of the ice sheets are gone, it would take much colder temperatures to regain the ice.
What characterises tipping dynamics in the cryosphere most, however, are the nested timescales, and possibility of tipping cascades between elements, ranging from mere hours-decades in the sea-ice, up to millennia for the ice sheets with consequences on a range of spatial scales: as global warming accelerates, there is an increasing discrepancy between the rapid forcing, and the comparably long response times in the cryosphere. This clash in timescales gives rise to a massive gap between the observed and committed impacts, in particular when it comes to sea-level rise. While typical projections focus on sea-level changes within this century, recent evidence suggests that the bulk of sea-level rise - even while triggered within this century - will unfold over hundreds, if not thousands of years.

events.id: Wellington Speed Dating For Ages 26-44 by Cheeky Events New Zealand-The Arborist Rooftop Bar,166 Willis Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Wellington Speed Dating For Ages 26-44 by Cheeky Events New Zealand
events.venue: The Arborist Rooftop Bar,166 Willis Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wellington Speed Dating For Ages 26-44 by Cheeky Events New Zealand
Get ready for a night of fun and connection at Wellington's hottest speed dating event!

About this Event

Let’s ditch the apps together and embrace real connections. Say goodbye to the dating apps and hello to your very own Cheeky Love Story! 💖
🍸 What’s included: Your first drink is on us—let’s toast to great company!
👇How It Works:
Before the event:Make sure to download the Cheeky Events App (free on Google Play & the App Store) to set up your profile and upload a photo.
P.S. Don’t worry—it’s not a dating app! We’ve skipped the chat feature because we’re all about real, in-person connections.
During the event:
Check in to grab your name tag and free drink token. 🍻
Arrive on time to enjoy 15 minutes of casual pre-mingling.
Ladies stay seated while men rotate every 5 minutes—don’t forget to rate your matches in the app! 👍👎
Take a quick 15-minute break before the next round.
After the rotations, feel free to stick around for some extra socializing!
After the event: Stay for extra mingling and check the app for your cheeky matches 12 hours later! 📱💖
For more details, check out our blog: What to expect
Who knows? You might just find your next spark! ✨ Our IRL singles events (single mixers and speed dating events) are happening across Australia, New Zealand, London, and NYC! 🌏

About Cheeky Events
We host fun, inclusive singles events across Australia, New Zealand, London, and NYC! Whether you’re in your 20s, over 40, looking for love, or just looking to meet new people, our events are designed to bring people together. events.id: Make friends & BlaBla Language Exchange Wellington - Once a month - Recurrent event-8 Courtenay Pl, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Make friends & BlaBla Language Exchange Wellington - Once a month - Recurrent event
events.venue: 8 Courtenay Pl, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Welcome to BlaBla & Make Friends Events!
A fun, friendly place to meet new people, make friends from around the world, practice languages, and just enjoy good vibes

................
What to Expect
Forget the boring setup — this is a free-flow mingle event!
No fixed tables, just conversations.
English and the local language are the main ones.
Want to practice another language? Ask one of our organizers or find someone who does!
Need help finding a partner? Try our matchmaking service:
http://blablalanguageexchange.com/.../speak-connect...
................
A Few Simple Rules
To keep things fun and respectful for everyone:
Register on our website before you come.
Please order at least one drink when you arrive (venue rule).
No outside food or drinks.
Be kind to the staff and help keep the place clean.
Respect others — good vibes only!
Breaking the rules can lead to a ban without warning.
................
Photos & Safety
Photos/videos are often taken to capture the fun! If you’d rather not appear, just let our photographer know.
Keep your belongings safe — we can’t be responsible for lost items.
................
Want to Get Involved?
Skip the fees and become part of the BlaBla Crew!
Event Organizer: Help us bring BlaBla to more cities → https://www.blablalanguageexchange.com/event-organizers
Photographer/Videographer: Capture the moments and share your talent → https://www.blablalanguageexchange.com/photographer
................
A Quick Note
We reuse the same Facebook event links, so we update event dates about 20 minutes after the start time.
The dates and participant numbers you see on Facebook might not be accurate — please ignore them.
................
More Info
For news, updates, and global events: www.blablacommunity.com
................
BlaBla is active in 150+ cities worldwide — come join the fun and make international friends!

events.id: RADAR ANGEL - APOTHEOSIS LP PRE-RELEASE PARTY-Valhalla, Wellington-Valhalla
events.name: RADAR ANGEL - APOTHEOSIS LP PRE-RELEASE PARTY
events.venue: Valhalla, Wellington
events.long_description:
After toiling long and deep in the psychic forges of the astral plane, Radar Angel are poised to deliver their debut full-length album APOTHEOSIS, here performed for your aural satisfaction in its ambrosian entirety.
Radar Angel are a four-piece synthfoolery ensemble who blend industrial grit with lush nostalgic sounds from the dawn of the digital age, all with a lavish theatricality and pop sensibility that is guaranteed to get your limbs thrashing.
Joining them are The Blue Summer, a five-piece surrounding themselves with wisps of funk, post punk, alternative rock, and pop. Like a wave crashing upon the rocks, chaotic and multi-faceted, only to pull back exposing the calm of the depths below. Gracefully twisting and changing shape from ballads to bangers.
Tickets: $10 + booking fee through UTR
$15 on door

events.id: Richter City Rebels-The Rogue and Vagabond, 18 Garrett St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Richter City Rebels
events.venue: The Rogue and Vagabond, 18 Garrett St, Wellington
events.long_description:
It’s time to move, the Rebels are back! Wellington’s own Richter City Rebels are bringing the brass heat back to blow the roof off the Rogue! Channelling the spirit of New Orleans straight into the heart of Te Aro for a night of booty-shaking brass, big grooves, and bold energy. We’re in for a special one this time as we’ll be farewelling our glorious drummer, Shaun!

Known for their infectious blend of New Orleans funk, soul, and second-line swagger, the Rebels are here to party!
Bring your mates, grab a brew, and get ready to dance — it’s going to be loud, loose, and full of funk.

Music from 9:00
Tickets $15 online from Humanitix or $20 on the door

https://events.humanitix.com/richter-city-rebels-wellington
Students $10 on the door with ID

events.long_description:
65th Anniversary Celebration
UHRLC 65th Anniversary – 2026 🐅

Join us as we celebrate 65 years of Tigers pride, community and rugby league 🧡🖤

13–15 February 2026 | Upper Hutt

⸻

Friday 13 February – Golf Day ⛳️
7th Annual Golf Tournament
Te Marua Golf Club
Ambrose format
$240 per team of four
$500 to sponsor a hole
Prizes proudly sponsored by Mainfreight

Friday Night – Games Night 🎯
Darts, Ping Pong and Billiards
At the Tigers Den

Followed by a combined meal, prize giving and a sports memorabilia auction 🔨

⸻

Saturday 14 February – Brewtown 🍔🍺
Lunch and drinks at Brewtown
DJ and live band
Q&A with our ex-Kiwis 🎤

⸻

Sunday 15 February – Club Day 🏉
AGM (committee introductions, chair’s report and strategic plan)
Past to Present game
BBQ, hāngi and whānau time

⸻

If you’re interested in volunteering, sponsoring or donating, please PM us.

“The best motivation always comes from within.”
— Michael Johnson

events.id: Jet tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: Jet tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Presented by: Live Nation
Originally hailing from Dingley in Melbourne, Jet quickly conquered the world after forming in 2001, selling more than 6.5 million albums globally and securing almost 10 x Platinum certification in Australia and Platinum in the USA and UK for their 2003 debut album “Get Born”. The album produced a string of classic singles in “Are You Gonna Be My Girl”, “Rollover DJ”, and “Look What You've Done” and netted the band 6 x 2004 ARIA awards. Both “Are You Gonna Be My Girl” and “Cold Hard Bitch” peaked at number 1 on the US Modern Rock singles charts and propelled the band to the top of festival bills and charts around the world.

Jet’s follow up album “Shine On” followed in 2006 and was rammed full of another collection of melodic rockers including, “Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is”, “Bring It On Back” and “Rip It Up”, and achieved platinum status in Australia on the back of stand-out headline shows around the world, and an unforgettable Big Day Out run in 2007.

In 2023, JET celebrated the 20th anniversary of Get Born by returning to the stage after a five-year hiatus, performing the album in full and reminding the world why their songs still pack the same punch two decades on. Reflecting on that era, Nic Cester said, “Get Born was a rare and unique moment of total planetary alignment where we somehow managed to capture lightning in a bottle.”

Their enduring legacy was officially recognised in November 2023, when they were inducted into the ARIA Hall of Fame.

This February see Jet live – raw, loud, and full of the spirit that made them international rock legends.

events.id: Authentic Dating Wellington-31 Hobson Cres, Thorndon, Wellington 6011-All Events In
events.name: Authentic Dating Wellington
events.venue: 31 Hobson Cres, Thorndon, Wellington 6011
events.long_description:
Authentic Dating Wellington
“Thank you so much for creating a space in which such well-aligned people could come together. I can't think of the last time I met so many wonderful, open-minded people in one go like that. It was a real pleasure” - John


Tired of endless scrolling?


Over the superficiality of app culture?


Ready to connect with real people and talk about what truly matters?


Here’s your chance take a break from the apps and connect more openly and authentically with those both like-minded and different. After a long break, it's returning to Wellington this February for Valentine's weekend!


You’ll have several encounters throughout the night. Each will be carefully guided, inviting you to be yourself, to communicate openly, and and explore multiples layers and flavours of connection. Come spark a new summer flame! 🔥


Authentic Dating welcomes all men, women & non-binary people aged 18+, both monogamous & non-monogamous. We will aim to pair you with a gender different from your own.


Is this event for me?

If you are seeking....

✨ Deep & meaningful conversations without small talky chit-chat

✨ Exciting new connections, both romantic & platonic

✨ An opportunity to explore & challenge your assumptions

✨ A substance-free environment

✨ Playful & sincere communication activities

✨ Skills you can apply to your dating life beyond the event

✨ A space to simply be yourself

....then this event is for you!


What will actually happen? 🥰

You will be invited to explore four unique interactions, some of which are randomised and some of which you can choose. Each will involve a new set of instructions to help you communicate about topics that really matter to you.

Each interaction will last 10-15 minutes. At the end of each interaction, you will have the opportunity to share a contact detail on a piece of paper in a way that is both cute and discrete ~ please bring your own pen!

Consent is important: you always have the agency to choose how deep you go. You will never be forced to share information that you don't want to.


Why are tickets sold by gender? 👫

To ensure that the gender balance is as even as possible, it is important to keep track of how many men/women/non-binary people are signing up. If a particular gender is over-represented in the run-up to the event, we do our best to ensure that under-represented gender(s) also sign up.

While we aim to achieve an even balance of genders (and ages), this is not always possible. However, what is guaranteed are skills that you can apply to any connection. Simply come with an open mind and ready to connect.


The facilitator 💁‍♂️

Laurie King

I'm Laurie (he/him), a queer British-Kiwi who’s current home-base is Berlin. My passion is creating spaces that cultivate healthy, thriving human-to-human relationships, helping people take off their masks, feel their sensations and celebrate their aliveness on Earth. Since 2019, I have organised and facilitated hundreds of Authentic Relating, Dating and Embodiment workshops in Oceania and Europe.

My training includes The Embody Lab, Authentic Revolution, Body Electric, Connection Institute and World Peace Yoga School. I have facilitated at internationally acclaimed festivals such as Stretch and Ignite, and organisations such as ART International and Authentic Bay Area.

My workshops have sparked thousands of nourishing connections, turning many strangers into life-long friends. I look forward to holding space for you!

I also offer online Holistic Coaching sessions, inspired by Authentic Relating, Positive Intelligence and Somatic Experiencing techniques.


For more information, check out itoiauthenticrelating.com.


For my Instagram, check out @itoiauthentic.


i to i Authentic Dating has already been a big hit in Wellington, as well as Auckland, Christchurch, Berlin, Amsterdam, Melbourne, Sydney, Vienna, Copenhagen, London, Bristol, Edinburgh, Glasgow, Montreal.


Here’s what others have said:


"This has been the most positive experience I've had in meeting genuine souls with the intention of finding love/romance for over 6 years" - Luca


"Laurie led us through a series of games and exercises that allowed us to open up and create very real bonds with others and with our own selves. Many emotions were felt in the safest, most welcoming environment" - Jason


“What a wonderful workshop you ran last night. I walked away with a sense of renewed self worth and also questioned why I don’t articulate comfortably what I want. It’s the perfect antidote to app culture.” - Imogen


“Laurie created a beautiful, safe space in no time, making it an ideal environment to be present and engage meaningfully with the activities. Even though all participants were strangers to me, I felt a deep sense of belonging developing over the evening.” - Tim


“Thank you so much for creating a space in which such well-aligned people could come together. I can't think of the last time I met so many wonderful, open-minded people in one go like that. It was a real pleasure” - John


"I love Laurie’s energy, wisdom, execution and light touch. I felt super safe to open up and connect while he was holding the space" - Tess


"Authentic Dating re-opened an old window for me in a new way. Heaps of fun too! And I did meet a very special person. Highly recommend for anyone curious and keen to connect with depth & joy" - Samantha


Practicalities:

Cost:

$35 for Low income

$45 for Regular income

$55 for High income

*

Location: Wellington Meditation Centre, 31 Hobson Crescent, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand.

When: Friday 13th February, 7.30 - 10pm. Please be on time as you may not be let in if not.

Dress code: Whatever you're comfortable in. The venue is shoes off and (mainly) seating on the floor.

Intoxicants: This is an alcohol and drug free event. There will however be plenty of tea available.

Refund policy: No refunds available. If you cannot make it you may transfer your ticket to a friend or use it as credit for a future i to i event.


* Why are tickets sold by income? 💰

In order to make the event as accessible as possible, there are three ticket types available, depending on the level of income you feel you have. It is up to you to decide how much you would like to contribute to the event.

If you would really like to attend but do not have the funds for the lowest ticket option, please get in touch and we can figure something out!

Limited spaces available through Humanitix. Book early to secure your place!

events.name: D'Things N Such
events.venue: 1 Taranaki Street, New Zealand 6011,1A Taranaki St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
D'Things N Such
“D’ Things N Such” is Wellington’s freshest, wildest and most unhinged theatrical experience since someone slapped corned beef and Nutella on toast. This absurd, high-energy, non-linear show is a chaotic collision of physical theatre, nonsense comedy and emotional whiplash. Five fearless FOB clowns with a broken compass lead audiences through a never-ending game of theatrical tag, where intense moments are created and then gleefully abandoned.

Born from a desire to rewire how we experience theatre, DTNS blends live theatre with the rhythm of TikToks and reels, bringing the energy of your screen to the streets and stages of Pōneke.

This is a disaster on purpose. Get lost with us and maybe leave with abs.

events.id: Monthly Babywearing meet up-Johnsonville Community Centre, 3 Frankmoore Ave, Johnsonville, Wellington 6037, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Monthly Babywearing meet up
events.venue: Johnsonville Community Centre, 3 Frankmoore Ave, Johnsonville, Wellington 6037, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join Babywearing Wellington for our monthly babywearing meet-up, open to parents, caregivers, and whānau at any stage of their babywearing journey
We are a group of experienced babywearers and qualified babywearing consultants, offering hands-on support in a relaxed, welcoming environment.
At each meet-up you can:
Try on a wide range of baby carriers from our lending library
Get help with fit and adjustments for any carriers you already own
Learn about different styles of carriers and what might suit you and your baby best
Hire a carrier to take home and try for a full month before deciding whether to buy
You can browse our full carrier library online here:
https://babywearingwellington.myturn.com/library
Hiring information:
To hire from our library, you’ll need to become a member:
$20 one-off membership fee
$10 per carrier for a month-long hire
Our meet-ups are baby and parent-friendly, and you’re welcome to come along just to learn, chat, or get a fit check — there’s no obligation to hire.
We look forward to seeing you in Room 4 (through the main doors then to your left).

events.long_description:
Making decisions about your future is exciting and may be a little overwhelming. But don’t worry, we’re here to help.
At Whitecliffe, we understand what it’s like to wonder, “What’s next?” That’s exactly why we’ve created our Campus Visit Day to give you a chance to explore what studying with us is really like, without any pressure.
Campus Visit Day is a welcoming way to experience Whitecliffe in person. You’ll have the space to explore, chat with our team, and understand what your study journey could look like — all in a calm, supportive environment.
You’ll be able to:
• Walk through our creative and technology spaces
• Have genuine conversations with lecturers
• See student projects up close
• Ask questions and understand your pathway
• Speak with one of our friendly Future Student Advisors

events.long_description:
Dirty Old Songs - NZ Fringe Festival
Compelled to prove the past wasn't so prudish, Ms. Weeds will take you on a sonic ride with some of the dirtiest songs from blues history. Uniquely qualified for this task, burlesquer come blues musician, she will perform songs for your pleasure while telling you the stories behind them.

In 2024, she co-produced her first ever Fringe show, Burlesque and Blues, the Devil's Own, which was nominated for the NZ Fringe Festival awards for Momentous Movement. Dirty Old Songs will be Ms. Weeds' first ever solo show!

There will be two shows, on the 13 and 14 of February, so grab your honey for a valentine's treat! Tickets available through the fringe festival website.
