events.id: Dilby (Berlin) presented by Mi Casa Su Casa-Meow,17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Dilby (Berlin) presented by Mi Casa Su Casa
events.venue: Meow,17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Dilby (Berlin) presented by Mi Casa Su Casa
We are excited to present an absolute favourite - Dilby returns after a decade in Berlin. Join us for a special evening of world-class house and techno on the dancefloor. His last three Wellington gigs were superb and Sold Out in advance.

Secure your ticket here: https://meow.flicket.co.nz/events/46777ce5-bdc8-468a-a2bc-8ba86f4d4800

Dilby is taking the world by storm with his unique take on underground music. Crafted from a classic house and techno palette but presented with a fresh modern twist. His sound is rich, warm and musical, but aimed squarely at the dance floor. His is a mainstay at the top of the charts where he’s consistently amongst the highest selling artists in House, thanks in part to his No.1 smash hit ‘Remember Me’. In 2022 Beatport named Dilby one of the top trending artists.

Dilby’s passion and talent for electronic music is evident in the creative and innovative sound coming from his studio. A sound that sees him featured on some of the scene’s most iconic and respected labels and as an in-demand remixer, having worked his magic for artists including Mihai Popoviciu, Oliver Schories, Collective Machine, Tom & Collins amongst others. A firm favourite amongst tastemaker DJ’s his music is regularly championed by top-tier artists from Hot Since 82 to Diplo, Hernan Catteneo to Carl Cox, Guy-J to Nicole Madouber.

After making the move to Berlin in 2012 he quickly rose through the ranks to become a regular favourite in the mecca’s top clubs and festivals. In recent years Dilby’s global recognition has seen him develop a global schedule, touring across Europe, Russia, South and Central America and Australasia.

Labels: Saved, 8bit, Crosstown Rebels/Rebellion, Bondage Music, Deeperfect, Toolroom, Glasgow Underground, Bar25 Music, Terms & Conditions, Poker Flat Records.

Tickets $25 + booking fee: https://meow.flicket.co.nz/events/46777ce5-bdc8-468a-a2bc-8ba86f4d4800

Venue: Meow, 9 Edward Street, Wellington

Support from: Vernon x Bastian + More TBA

Vernon x Bastian: These two scallywags have the Welly wind in their sails and a groove in their hearts. They're the duo behind the capital's much loved club night, Mi Casa Su Casa, now rockin' for over 15 years. They've also had the pleasure of playing some of NZ's most legendary shindigs like Shipwrecked, Off The Radar, Kiwiburn, CubaDupa, Taniwha's Den, The Forest and Rhythm & Vines. With the people on the dancefloor their inspiration, they'll share a bounty of underground house to lift you up and bring you on a journey.

events.id: WIDance Open and Youth Classes Term 1 2026-Te Whaea, 11 Hutchison Rd, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: WIDance Open and Youth Classes Term 1 2026
events.venue: Te Whaea, 11 Hutchison Rd, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Come dance with us!
Join the WIDance team as we slide, bounce, wiggle, roll, and dance our way into Term 1, 2026!
Whether you’re a seasoned dancer or just starting out, our classes are designed to be accessible, engaging, and fun for everyone.
Our classes offer a safe and inclusive space to find joy, laughter, and creative expression through contemporary dance, improvisation, dance-based games, and composition. Through movement, we build body and space awareness, confidence, and connection.
Wellington Youth Class:
Looking for a fun, creative, and confidence-boosting activity for your young person? Our six-week Youth Dance program is designed for young people aged 7–16 (flexible) to learn, play, and grow through the art of movement.
Over the term, dancers will:
Build foundations in contemporary dance
Develop body awareness and coordination
Engage in social, team-building games and improvisation
Explore creativity with props and playful movement tasks
We celebrate individuality — each student is encouraged to move in their own way, discover new skills, and enjoy the magic of expressing themselves through dance. Whether a beginner or experienced, every dancer is welcome!
Wellington Open Class:
Our open class has been running for 15 years and is a vibrant, welcoming space where dancers of all experience levels come together to move, create, and express themselves. Each session blends technique, improvisation, and choreography, giving you room to explore your own rhythm and creativity.
This year, our technique work now includes exercises from UK based Stopgap Dance Company’s IRIS syllabus — an inclusive, dynamic approach that supports strength, awareness, and artistry for everybody.
"IRIS is an inclusive dance syllabus that gives teachers a framework to develop the disabled dancers of tomorrow. It is a consolidation of Stopgap’s experience of training professional disabled dancers, and it contains tried and tested methods that the company has been developing since 1995.
IRIS is divided into four levels: Include, Respond, Integrate and Specialise, each having its own set exercises, guidelines and assessments. IRIS will give disabled youth and adults the same level of structure, balance and rigour of dance education as their non-disabled peers and provide the opportunity to accumulate skills and experiences necessary for the professional industry".
Term 1 runs for 6 weeks, on the following dates:
Saturdays: 14th February to 28th March ( no class march 7th)
Youth Class: 10 - 11am,
Cost: $55 for the term or casual $10 per class
Open Class: 11 - 1pm
Cost: $120 waged. $85 unwaged. casual $20 per class
New option: Technique class only, 11am to 12pm, $60.
To book:
Email: sumara@widance.nz
Phone: 021 0501565
This project is proudly supported by Wellington City Council.
Who are we?
WIDance is one of Wellington's leading dance providers for disabled and non disabled dancers, striving to provide equal opportunities for all to dance. Established in 2010, we run open classes, workshops, and performance events throughout the Wellington region.
Our mission is to provide equal opportunities to dance experiences for diverse communities, advocating for access and empowerment.
#danceforall #accessforall #communitydance #disabilitydance

events.id: Ōtari Raranga Weavers - Raranga for my Valentine-Tāne Whakapiripiri - Ōtari Visitors Centre, 150 Wilton Road, Wilton, Wellington, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Ōtari Raranga Weavers - Raranga for my Valentine
events.venue: Tāne Whakapiripiri - Ōtari Visitors Centre, 150 Wilton Road, Wilton, Wellington, Wellington
events.long_description:
Otari Raranga Weavers – Te Rā o te Aroha
Weaving Gifts from the Heart – A Valentine’s Day Celebration

With the support of Wellington City Council, Wellington Gardens, and the Ōtari team, Otari Raranga Weavers warmly invite you to Te Rā o te Aroha – Weaving Gifts from the Heart.

Set against the beauty of Ōtari Wilton’s Bush, we gather to share mātauranga Māori through traditional weaving and healing practices, guided by the rhythms of nature and the taonga of our ngahere. Our kaupapa is rooted in connection—honouring aroha, nurturing creativity, and bringing our local community together in a spirit of learning and togetherness. For this special Valentine’s wānanga, you will create putiputi (flower) bouquets to gift to your nearest and dearest. We will provide whakakano (dyed) harakeke to add colour, vibrancy, and personal expression to your weaving.

Two classes available:
• 11:00 am – 2:00 pm
• 2:30 pm – 5:30 pm
(Places are limited and high interest is expected for our first sessions of the year)


No experience required – all levels are welcome

Please arrive on time for karakia (opening blessing)

Raranga for sale - A range of woven taonga will be available to purchase. Cash or bank transfer accepted.

Drop-in welcome:
Feel free to pop in anytime during the day to see what we’re up to, connect with our weavers, and purchase heartfelt gifts.

Kai & Manaakitanga - Rongoā (Māori healing) tea and light refreshments will be provided. We’ll also have snacks on the table, and you’re welcome to bring a plate or baking to share.

Whānau friendly - Children under 14 must be accompanied by an adult with a ticket.

Stay connected - Follow us on Facebook & Instagram: Otari Raranga Weavers

www.otariraranga.co.nz

Tūngia te ururua kia tupu whakaritorito te tupu o te harakeke.
Set the overgrown bush alight and the new flax shoots will spring up.

events.name: Basejump Comedy & LFC | Improv Essentials: Unified Chaos!
events.venue: Toi Pōneke Arts Centre,69 Abel Smith Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Basejump Comedy & LFC | Improv Essentials: Unified Chaos!
Learn improv in a ridiculous group course

About this Event

Welcome to the most structured mess you'll ever love. In this 8-week, beginner-friendly course, we'll dive into the essential building blocks of improv—then flip them, twist them, and turn them into glorious chaos.
You'll learn how to play as a group, build ideas together, and spark wild scenes from the tiniest suggestions. It's all about teamwork, bold choices, and finding the funny in the unexpected.
Expect maximum stage time, supportive vibes, and a whole lot of laughter. Whether you're trying something new, eyeing the world of character work, sketch comedy, or something totally experimental, this course is your gateway.
Unleash your weird. Support your team. Start the riot.


Details
Start Date: 14th February
Teacher: Ralph Hilaga
Where: Toi Poneke Arts Center
Classes run for 8 sessions, Saturdays 12 - 3 pm
Inquiries:
Class Show: TBD


Policy
Registration is Non-Refundable & Non-Transferable.
Your enrollment HOLDS A SPACE in a class that we are no longer able to offer someone else. Please review dates and be sure about your schedule before registering.




DATES
February
Sat 14th
Sat 21st
Sat 28th
March
Sat 7th
Sat 14th
Sat 21st
Sat 28th
April
Sat 11th
Class Show
TBD



Ralph is an improviser, stand up, and sketch comedian based in Wellington. Formerly a dramatic actor, he transitioned into comedy in 2019 and has since trained at The iO Theater in Chicago, The Improv Conspiracy in Melbourne, and Basejump Comedy in Wellington. He was a Wellington finalist at the Raw Comedy Quest 2025 competition, and is a founding member of the comedy group Catfish Trifecta (Nominee for Best Regular Show and Best innovation at the Wellies 2025), and is one half of the chaotic comedy duo “Mo and Ralph” with Mo Munn.

Expect maximum stage time, supportive vibes, and a whole lot of laughter.

events.id: Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary Open Day 25/26-Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary, Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary Open Day 25/26
events.venue: Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary, Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary, Ōtaki
events.long_description:
Join us for a Tour of the Sanctuary

Open days include a tour of the sanctuary to meet the animals, learn about them, their stories and how we look after them, followed by a vegan afternoon tea. Money raised from ticket sales help us with the ongoing care of our animals. We will also happily accept donations of fruit, veggies, or hay for the animals.

Please note open days are weather dependent and in the event of rain we will normally rearrange to the following saturday.

Please arrive between 12:30 and 1pm- bring strong closed-toe footwear, sunblock, and clothing for all weather. No animal food products are allowed on the sanctuary grounds as we are a human vegan space. Sadly, dogs are not welcome as we have a lot of vulnerable animals on site. Depending on the weather, your clothing and footwear might get muddy, so please wear clothing that isn’t too precious.

If you have questions about accessibility please these questions email us before you arrive. Unfortunately, the sanctuary is not wheelchair accessible.

Make a day of it!- we are 5 mins away from some lovely river spots on the Ōtaki river and 20 mins from Ōtaki town and beach.

Cost: $10 or Free for Friends – bookings required (you’ll get the option to choose your ticket type after clicking ‘Buy Tickets’) This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden.
They run throughout the year with a different topic every time.
Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

events.id: Taste & Create - A Painting with Sugar Valentine Affair-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Taste & Create - A Painting with Sugar Valentine Affair
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
Taste and Create a palette of passion at the historic Inverlochy house. Join us in indulging in hand-crafted pastries by the renowned Maxine Schecter of Sugar Flour while working with Inverlochy's skilled tutors to create a piece of art in your choice of medium (drawing, printmaking, pastel painting, ceramics). Pastries are paired with refined tea and non-alcoholic bubbles.

The exact pastries are going to be a surprise (we'll drop hints along the way in the lead up to the event)! So pastries pictured are not what you'll get. The pastries will be incredibly seasonal and fruit focused (if anyone has any fruit allergies they’re unsure of you can can contact Maxine directly before booking). Maxine can also offer gluten free and gelatine free options for the dietaries too.

About the team:

Maxine Schecter is a French trained pastry chef who has worked in restaurants and patisseries in Wellington (Logan Brown), Paris (Gâteaux Thoumieux), London (The Fat Duck and Sketch) and is the author of Patisserie Made Simple: The Art of Petits Gateau.

Inverlochy Art School offers a broad range of high quality art classes and workshops, taught by a community of enthusiastic and talented practicing artists all year round. We believe in art for art's sake and allow students to find freedom in creative exploration.

events.name: Basejump Comedy & LFC | Creating Solo Characters!
events.venue: Toi Pōneke Arts Centre,69 Abel Smith Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Basejump Comedy & LFC | Creating Solo Characters!
WRITING AND PERFORMING SOLO COMEDY

About this Event


One of our favourite classes, Creating Solo Characters! is a course that gets you designing unique characters for the stage, all while building your comedy skills through writing, performing, and receiving individually tailored feedback.
In this class you'll learn different strategies to develop characters, as well as how to cut through the noise and get the most comedy from them. It all culminates in a solo character showcase of students best work!
Great as an addition for sketch writers or people looking to get into sketch; stand-ups or improvisers looking to try a new skill; artists building a Fringe show; or writers looking to work on their character performance. This course has it and it's all for YOU - you write the character, you perform the character!
(Class size is limited, so book early)
Note: Students will be expected to write and prepare characters outside of class each week.

Details
Start Date: 14th February
Where: Toi Poneke Arts Center
Classes run for 8 sessions, Sat 3:30 - 6:30 pm
Inquiries:
Requirements: No requirements, but familiarity of sketch comedy or some form of improv is recommended. Contact us if unsure.

Policy
Registration is Non-Refundable & Non-Transferable.
Your enrollment HOLDS A SPACE in a class that we are no longer able to offer someone else. Please review dates and be sure about your schedule before registering.




DATES

events.id: Valentine's Night at Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo-Wellington Zoo, 200 Daniell St, Newtown, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Valentine's Night at Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo
events.venue: Wellington Zoo, 200 Daniell St, Newtown, Wellington
events.long_description:
Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo is the place to be this Valentine’s Day! Get your date, your mate, your pals or your gals ready for a wild night out.

We’re staying open until 8.30pm for an adults-only night of cheeky fun – live music, an outdoor bar, delicious food, and love-themed animal talks that spill all the secrets of the animal kingdom.

Grab your favourite human(s), and treat yourselves to a wild, romantic night out!

Adults only. R18. Wild vibes only.

Buy tickets now >>> https://www.wellingtonzoo.com/visit/plan-your-day/things-to-do/valentines-night-2

*Event information*

- Adults only: Strictly R18
- Date: Saturday 14 February
- Time: 5pm–8.30pm (last entry 7.45pm)
- Location: Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo, 200 Daniell Street, Newtown, Wellington
- Note: The Zoo is not BYO licensed. ID and bag checks on arrival

*Prices*

- $24 online entry (save by booking ahead!)
- $26 standard entry on the night
- $109 package for two: 2x Zoo Entry + pre-booked picnic basket with food (no alcohol)
- For Zoo Crew members: $69 for just the pre-booked picnic basket (entry is included as part of your Zoo Crew membership)

*Add-ons*

- $10 for Wild Explorer ($8 for Zoo Crew)
- $29 per person for Giraffe Feed
- $79 per couple for Creatures of Attraction Tour
- Close Encounters – details coming soon!

*Music & Entertainment*

Enjoy the evening with live music from one of Wellington’s most colourful and fun bands Crash Bandihoot!
- Two 45-minute sets of New Orleans-style brass tunes
- Times: 6pm & 7pm
- Location: He Tuku Aroha Meet the Locals

Plus, Wild Explorer VR will be open throughout the evening! Choose from The Great Migration, Dolphins of the Reef, or everyone’s favourite: Dinosaur Evolution! Tickets are $10 ($8 for Zoo Crew) and can be purchased on the night. There are limited slots, so make sure you get in quick!

Love-themed animal talks will be scheduled throughout the evening too!

*Food & Drinks*

Pre-book to enjoy a delicious picnic basket for two from REX Tremendous Events Catering.
- The picnic basket includes cold sliced meats, and sausage rolls for carnivores OR roast vegetables for herbivores; roasted nuts, cheeses, homemade corn chips with a selection of dips and salsa, home-made focaccia, pasta salad and a duo of sweet tartlets
- Dietary options available (no swap-outs): Gluten Free or Vegetarian
- Picnic basket bookings close Wednesday 11th February at 5pm
- Pick up your basket at the Zoo Entrance between 5pm-7pm
- Return your basket to the Zoo Entrance or to He Tuku Aroha Meet the Locals Barn, baskets are not to be taken off the Zoo premises

Treat yourselves to tasty food and drinks all evening long – pay as you go! On the night we will have:
- BBQ and hot food available at He Tuku Aroha Meet the Locals Barn (vegan options included)
- Outdoor bar open at He Tuku Aroha Meet the Locals Barn (cash & EFTPOS)
- Banana Bar open for cold drinks, hot chips & ice creams
- Note: The Zoo is not BYO licensed. ID and bag checks on arrival

events.id: Valentine's Day 5 Course Dinner | 14 FEB 2026-Le Cordon Bleu New Zealand,Level 2, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Valentine's Day 5 Course Dinner | 14 FEB 2026
events.venue: Le Cordon Bleu New Zealand,Level 2, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Valentine's Day 5 Course Dinner | 14 FEB 2026
Delight in a romantic evening of heavenly creations.

IMPORTANT NOTE: Tables arranged per order

About this Event


This 5-Course dinner expertly prepared by our Superior Cuisine students is not to be missed.

Join us for a romantic evening in the heart of Wellington, enjoy a complimentary glass of bubbles on entry and savour your loved one's company as our chefs and students prepare a delectable 5 course menu.


Ticket Information
IMPORTANT NOTE: Tables are arranged per order. If you purchase tickets separately you need to e-mail to advise which other ticket holders you wish to be seated with.
Date: Friday 14th February
Price: $125 per person
Booking Times: 5:30pm | 6:00pm | 6:30pm | 7:00pm
Matched Wine Option: If you would like to add matched wines to your dining experience you can do so on the day by paying an additional charge. Alternatively, we have a selection of wines to purchase by the glass or bottle as well as beers and soft drinks. We are a fully licensed restaurant and do not offer BYO.
Dietary Requirements: Our menu is set and we are unable to make any menu alterations or cater to any specific dietary requirements (including religious diets) or food allergies. We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause.
The Menu: will not be released before the event. Please be aware that the menu will include fish, meat and shellfish components.
Tickets are allocated for specific seating times, please ensure you arrive promptly at the time indicated on your ticket.
The estimated time to enjoy the full Le Cordon Bleu 5 course dining experience is 2 hours. We invite you to sit back, relax and enjoy our students' creations.




What is Brasserie Le Cordon Bleu?
Brasserie Le Cordon Bleu is our training restaurant where our students get practical experience in a real restaurant environment - all under the expert guidance of their chef lecturers. In the kitchen, we have students from our Diplôme de Cuisine programme. In the dining room we have our Bachelor of Culinary Arts and Business students serving you and putting their theory skills into practice.

Brasserie & High Tea Refund Policy
• No refunds are provided unless the event is cancelled by Le Cordon Bleu NZ.
• Customers can arrange for someone else to take their place.

events.id: As You Like It - Summer Shakespeare-Aro Park, Aro Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: As You Like It - Summer Shakespeare
events.venue: Aro Park, Aro Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
The forest is calling! This summer, a new company of players, The Midsummer Botanicals, invite audiences to step beneath the trees and into the wild, wondrous world of As You Like It - a sun-soaked celebration of laughter and community blooming in one of Wellington’s gorgeous parks for the first week of the Wellington Fringe Festival.

In 1983, A Midsummer Night’s Dream lit up the Victoria University Quad and sparked a beloved tradition of outdoor Shakespeare in Wellington - a festival of artistry, friendship, and open-air delight that ran for over forty years. After its sudden end in 2023, a vital chapter of our city’s cultural story seemed to close. But this February, the Botanicals are bringing it gloriously back to life.

Helmed by director Eli Hancock (he/they) and produced by Shakespeare’s North Productions, As You Like It promises a riotous return to form; where the music is live, the language sparkles, and the forest is very much alive.

“As You Like It is Shakespeare at his most joyous,” says Hancock. “It’s about finding yourself in unexpected places - through love, disguise, friendship, and the wilderness. After years of loss and uncertainty in the arts, this feels like a healing; a reminder of why we make theatre in the first place.”

Set in a vibrant reimagining of Shakespeare’s Forest of Arden, this production draws on courtyard and marketplace traditions of performance, transforming Wellington’s Aro Valley Park into a living, breathing garden of music, colour, and character. Audiences are invited to arrive early, explore the space, and meet the motley cast of lovers and fools before the story even begins. Expect song, sun, silliness, and the scent of summer roses.

events.id: HED PE | Still ‘Broke’ New Zealand Tour | with Nonpoint-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: HED PE | Still ‘Broke’ New Zealand Tour | with Nonpoint
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
Celebrating the 25th anniversary of their landmark album Broke, the band will deliver a full-throttle set packed with fan favourites like Bartender, Killing Time, and Feel Good;  which featured none other than Serj Tankian (System of a Down) and Morgan Lander (Kittie) on the album.
Critics hailed Broke as a “magnum opus of rap, funk, hip hop, and metal” (UnEarthed), while Sputnikmusic praised its “excellent”RATM meets hip-hop genre fusion and raw emotional punch. Whilst RateYourMusic users described the album as “hedonistic, energetic, vulgar, rhythmic, urban, and heavy,” capturing the raw essence of its sound and attitude. With over 450,000 copies sold worldwide, Broke remains a defining moment in the nu-metal era and this tour is your chance to relive it live.
Expect pounding riffs, funk-infused grooves, and the unmistakable flow of frontman Jahred Gomes, whose stage presence turns every show into a riotous celebration of rebellion and rhythm. From their self-titled debut in 1997 to their latest release New and Improved, (HED) P.E. continues to evolve while staying true to their anti-establishment roots.
With an incredible career spanning nearly three decades, Nonpoint has long been a force to be reckoned with in the nu-metal/rap-rock genre. Known for legendary live performances and explosive tracks such as Bullet with a Name, What a Day, Ruthless, and more, the band has consistently captivated audiences with infectious riffs, compelling lyrics, and an uncompromising raw energy. Their discography and stagecraft have made them staples at rock radio and fixtures on festival lineups, earning them a dedicated international following.
This is not nostalgia, it’s a full-blown sonic nu-metal assault. Don’t miss (HED) P.E. and NONPOINT as they rip through New Zealand with setlists that traverse decades, defy genres, and unleash pure, unfiltered chaos!

events.id: Hayden Chisholm and Unwind-St Peters Village Hall, Cnr Beach Rd and Ames St, Paekākāriki-Event Finder
events.name: Hayden Chisholm and Unwind
events.venue: St Peters Village Hall, Cnr Beach Rd and Ames St, Paekākāriki
events.long_description:
Hayden Chisholm's saxophone playing is a miracle - and in St. Peter's Hall he sounds just beautiful. Performing music that knows a lot about jazz as well as folk and chamber music traditions, his group Unwind play melodic, contrapuntal music with a beautiful group sound and a great deal of space. Hayden – originally from Taranaki but resident in Europe for more than 30 years – leads Unwind with local musicians Paul Dyne (bass) and Norman Meehan (piano).
Door sales: $30.00

events.id: Deacon Blue-The Opera House, 111 - 113 Manners Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Deacon Blue
events.venue: The Opera House, 111 - 113 Manners Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Today, Scottish pop-rock icons Deacon Blue are thrilled to announce their return to Aotearoa in February 2026, marking their first shows down under since 2023. The tour will celebrate the band’s 40th anniversary and the release of their latest studio album, The Great Western Road.

Deacon Blue will be stopping at the James Hay Theatre to play in Ōtautahi, Christchurch for the first time ever on Thursday February 12, before heading to Pōneke, Wellington’s Opera House on Saturday February 14, followed by Sunday February 15 at the Bruce Mason Centre in Tāmaki Makaurau, Auckland.

New Zealand fans can expect a specially curated setlist, including all the hits you know and love, blending arena-sized classic anthems, tracks off their latest album, mixed with intimate surprises. With a reputation for crafting unforgettable live moments, Deacon Blue’s 2026 tour promises to be a celebration of fan connection, nostalgia, and musical brilliance.

events.id: ISSEY JEAN - 'DAISY FEVER' WELLINGTON ALBUM RELEASE SHOW-93 Mornington Rd, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: ISSEY JEAN - 'DAISY FEVER' WELLINGTON ALBUM RELEASE SHOW
events.venue: 93 Mornington Rd, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Issey Jean is a Berlin-based singer/songwriter from Pōneke, returning home for the release of her debut album Daisy Fever - a heartfelt, homegrown project that pulses with intensity, compassion and emotional depth, interwoven with some hearty bangers... Daisy Fever was recorded in Issey's home studio in Island Bay, with Issey and Mikey Bennett on guitars, and Issey’s brother and father as rhythm section.
Come along for a great Saturday night at Vogelmorn Upstairs venue to see Issey launch the album with her exciting NZ band, which again features Mikey and Issey on guitars, and the fabulous pairing of Olivia Campion on drums and Audrey May on bass. The support act will be alternative art rockers, “Salt”. Tickets available on Under The Radar.

events.id: Nicola Mitchell with Jo Moir & Mikey Muggeridge: Valentine's Day Gig-Hilltop, 17 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Nicola Mitchell with Jo Moir & Mikey Muggeridge: Valentine's Day Gig
events.venue: Hilltop, 17 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington
events.long_description:
Gate opens 7pm Music Starts 7.30pm

“For the smitten, slightly bitter & the happily single"
Nicola’s warm, magnetic songwriting “swells and tugs at the heartstrings, stirring more than a tear or two“. Rooted in family and storytelling, Nicola Mitchell (Waikato-Tainui, Ngāti Maniapoto) blends folky bluegrass with a touch of te reo Māori.
2025 Country Music Honour winner, Nicola is one half of the Tūī and APRA Best Country Song-nominated duo The Mitchell Twins and regularly tours Aotearoa and Australia alongside her award-winning sister, Jenny Mitchell.
This Valentine’s Day, Nicola brings a special show to Hilltop for “the smitten, the slightly bitter, and the happyily single”. She’s joined by Wellington favourites Michael Muggeridge (Butter Wouldn’t Melt and T-Bone) on mandolin, and Jo Moir (Hobnail) on the violin. An acoustic set designed to move through the many different stories of Valentines Day.
Inspired by artists like Tami Neilson, Marlon Williams, and the Topp Twins, Nicola has shared stages with John Craigie (US), The Warratahs, and Kasey Chambers, following a standout set at the Wellington Folk Festival in 2024.
Come along to catch a show drowning in harmonies with the full spectrum of love this Valentine’s Day.
Come along and enjoy this great gig in our special space, up close and personal.
These are private house concerts, not for profit, supporting our dedicated musicians. Visit www.hilltophouseconcerts.co.nz to reserve a seat. Suggested donation $30. Email confirmation will include address and details.
Teas, Coffee and Snacks provided. You're welcome to bring anything you'd like to eat or drink.
Parking available in the Coupon zones of Upland Rd & Glasgow St free after 6pm weekdays, and free all through the weekends. The Wilson Carpark at the top of the Cable Car charges 24/7.

events.id: Sue Thorby & Mr Moondog-The Raumati Social Club, 34 Poplar Ave, Raumati South, Raumati-Event Finder
events.name: Sue Thorby & Mr Moondog
events.venue: The Raumati Social Club, 34 Poplar Ave, Raumati South, Raumati
events.long_description:
Moondog Blues & Sue Thorby take to the lower North Island in mid-February 2026 with an unforgettable show of heartfelt blues & gypsy soul. Both seasoned and powerful musicians and performers, you are in for a once-in-a-lifetime experience of two of New Zealand’s finest roots musicians.

Moondog, either found based out of Northland, NZ or as the gypsy bluesman touring Australia, channels a gritty, raw style — using metal-bodied guitars (homemade biscuit tins ‘AlleyTyns’), harmonica, a gritty and sometimes dark freight train voice, thumb slappin’ bass, foot-stomping rhythm — to deliver a unique blend of traditional blues, rock n roll, voodoo-infused “Bluz A Billy,” and Mojo-Juju vibes.

Sue Thorby, one of Aotearoa’s finest, brings her exceptional self-titled album and unforgettable live performance, rich with heart and superb musicianship back out on the road. Defying genres fused with blues, rock, celtic, gypsy soul and jazz, driving guitar rhythmns and powerful vocals, Sue weaves unapologetically honest stories of love, humanity, anguish & hope, grit and beauty.

events.id: Valentine’s Night at the Movies: Wuthering Heights-205 Ohiro Rd, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Valentine’s Night at the Movies: Wuthering Heights
events.venue: 205 Ohiro Rd, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Spend Valentine’s Day at Penthouse Cinema with a special screening of Wuthering Heights - a timeless story of passion, longing, and love that refuses to fade.
We’re delighted to be teaming up with the lovely local team at Marsden Books.
On the night, Marsden Books will have copies of Wuthering Heights on display at the cinema - perfect for browsing, gifting, or finally picking up a classic you’ve always meant to read. We’ll also have copies available for purchase at Penthouse in the lead-up to the event and on the night itself.
It’s a celebration of great cinema and great literature, bringing book and film together for a romantic, slightly wild Valentine’s evening - just as Emily Brontë intended.
To make the evening extra special, your ticket includes:
• A glass of bubbles or juice on arrival
• Special Valentine’s cocktails available from the bar
• Limited-edition Valentine’s ice creams
• Spot prizes on the night
Whether it’s a date night, a Galentine’s outing, or a solo treat, this is a Valentine’s experience designed to be shared, savoured, and remembered.
Limited tickets available.

events.id: Dance Therapy hosts COUSIN (AU)-167 Riddiford Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Dance Therapy hosts COUSIN (AU)
events.venue: 167 Riddiford Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
For its eighth session, Dance Therapy is hosting Australian electronic-wizard, Cousin, with locals Ludus and Terra Verner. Expect an undulating night of deep, percussive, tripped-out sonics.
Diving from starlit heights to ocean depths, Cousin’s echoes step through tempos and styles while summoning surreal sonic landscapes centered in spacious atmospherics, subterranean bass pressure and rhythmic hypnotisms.
Powered by the hi-fi Torque rig, you will be able to reach into the music, every note and drum hit shooting into the far corners of your mind, taking hold of you.
Come and connect, release and discover something more, at Dance Therapy.

events.id: Dilby (Berlin) presented by Mi Casa Su Casa-17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Dilby (Berlin) presented by Mi Casa Su Casa
events.venue: 17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
We are excited to present an absolute favourite - Dilby returns after a decade in Berlin. Join us for a special evening of world-class house and techno on the dancefloor. His last three Wellington gigs were superb and Sold Out in advance.
Secure your ticket here: https://meow.flicket.co.nz/.../46777ce5-bdc8-468a-a2bc...
Dilby is taking the world by storm with his unique take on underground music. Crafted from a classic house and techno palette but presented with a fresh modern twist. His sound is rich, warm and musical, but aimed squarely at the dance floor. His is a mainstay at the top of the charts where he’s consistently amongst the highest selling artists in House, thanks in part to his No.1 smash hit ‘Remember Me’. In 2022 Beatport named Dilby one of the top trending artists.
Dilby’s passion and talent for electronic music is evident in the creative and innovative sound coming from his studio. A sound that sees him featured on some of the scene’s most iconic and respected labels and as an in-demand remixer, having worked his magic for artists including Mihai Popoviciu, Oliver Schories, Collective Machine, Tom & Collins amongst others. A firm favourite amongst tastemaker DJ’s his music is regularly championed by top-tier artists from Hot Since 82 to Diplo, Hernan Catteneo to Carl Cox, Guy-J to Nicole Madouber.
After making the move to Berlin in 2012 he quickly rose through the ranks to become a regular favourite in the mecca’s top clubs and festivals. In recent years Dilby’s global recognition has seen him develop a global schedule, touring across Europe, Russia, South and Central America and Australasia.
Labels: Saved, 8bit, Crosstown Rebels/Rebellion, Bondage Music, Deeperfect, Toolroom, Glasgow Underground, Bar25 Music, Terms & Conditions, Poker Flat Records.
Tickets $25 + booking fee: https://meow.flicket.co.nz/.../46777ce5-bdc8-468a-a2bc...
Venue: Meow, 9 Edward Street, Wellington
Support from: Vernon x Bastian + More TBA
events.description:
Join us for a special evening of world-class house and techno on the dancefloor.

events.id: MX-5 Rally-Manor Park,Lower Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: MX-5 Rally
events.venue: Manor Park,Lower Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
MX-5 Rally
MX-5 Rally - Sunday 15th Feb

Please note that this is a rally, and not a race. So, you need to follow provided instructions, and answer questions along the way correctly to win a prize. There is no prize for being the fastest. This rally has been organized for the Kapiti chapter of the MX-5 Club of NZ, but any other MX-5 drivers are welcome. Details below:

We will be meeting at the same place as last time - the Park 'n' Ride carpark at Manor Park, Lower Hutt, at 9am. Don't worry - we'll be doing completely different roads this time!

There is no breakfast at the start, but if people are interested, we could informally meet at Town & Country in Stokes Valley for breakfast beforehand,then all drive to the Park 'n' Ride together in convoy.

You will need to bring a pen or pencil, and something to press on, such as a clipboard, or a hardcover book. You will also need something you can take evidence photos with - a cellphone or digital camera will be fine.

I also highly, highly recommend that you bring a co-driver, as it will make things infinitely easier for you. Call Russell on 021 0269 3224 if you have trouble finding a co-driver, as I can assist with that!

Like last time, there will be prizes for 1st, 2nd & 3rd, but the prizes are based on who gets the most answers correct, and NOT on who is fastest to complete the course.

Lunch will be at the end point, so bring some $$$ with you.

Snacks will again be provided along the way. This event is free for members of The Kapiti Chapter of the MX-5 Club of NZ, or $2 per car for non-members of that club. This will cover the cost of the provided snacks, plus the photocopying. Thanks.

Further instructions on the day, but if you attended the last rally I organised, then you'll know what to expect. You'll need about 1/2 a tank of gas.

Please RSVP to Russell by texting 021 0269 3224 by Friday 13 Feb, so I can ensure that there are enough printed instructions for everyone.

events.id: Wainuiomata Water Walk - February-Wainuiomata Recreation Area,10 Whitcher Grove, Lower Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Wainuiomata Water Walk - February
events.venue: Wainuiomata Recreation Area,10 Whitcher Grove, Lower Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wainuiomata Water Walk - February
Explore ancient forests and waterways on a guided walk in Wainuiomata Regional Park

Join us for a special guided walk through beautiful native forest in Wainuiomata Regional Park, exploring areas not usually open to the public. Led by our knowledgeable park ranger, you’ll learn about the Wainuiomata water collection area and how this pristine water makes its way to Wellington’s taps.

This is one of our most popular summer events, and places are limited to just 30 participants. If you’ve attended before, please consider letting someone else experience this unique opportunity.

The walk will follow the Orongorongo Pipeline Tunnel and visit the historic Morton Dam—one of New Zealand’s largest concrete dams and a remarkable example of early engineering innovation.

Event Details:

Group size: Limited to 30 participants

Registration: Max two per person

Fitness level: Moderate; not suitable for children under 14

What to bring: Lunch, snacks, water bottle, and suitable footwear and clothing—you’re likely to get wet feet!

To book: Due to the overwhelming popularity of these limited capacity events, we allocate bookings via a ballot system. A ballot will open for registrations via the link below at 10am on Tuesday 27 January and close at 10am on Thursday 29 January. Names will then be drawn at random all applicants notified of the outcome by 4pm on Friday 30 January.

Bookings open from 27 Jan:


Your adventure starts in regional parks.

Greater Wellington has been hosting recreational events like this for 25 years, helping people connect with nature, get active outdoors, and enjoy peaceful escapes close to home.

Wainuiomata Regional Park is not only a place of beauty—it’s a hub for conservation. Greater Wellington works here to protect freshwater, restore native habitats, preserve historic sites, and build resilience to climate change. Our partners and volunteers play a vital role in making this park a special place for everyone.
events.description:
Wainuiomata Water Walk - February Explore ancient forests and waterways on a guided walk in Wainuiomata Regional Park Join us for a special guided walk through beautiful native forest in Wainuiomata Regional Park, exploring areas not usually open to the public.
If you’ve attended before, please consider letting someone else experience this unique opportunity.
The walk will follow the Orongorongo Pipeline Tunnel and visit the historic Morton Dam—one of New Zealand’s largest concrete dams and a remarkable example of early engineering innovation.
To book: Due to the overwhelming popularity of these limited capacity events, we allocate bookings via a ballot system.
A ballot will open for registrations via the link below at 10am on Tuesday 27 January and close at 10am on Thursday 29 January.

events.name: Wainuiomata River Community Open Day
events.venue: Poole Crescent Reserve,20 Poole Cres, Wainuiomata, Lower Hutt 5014, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Wainuiomata River Community Open Day
Get to know your local awa at this drop in day with Mountains to Sea Wellington’s Wai Connection team!

Take part in water quality and species identification activities from the Wainuiomata River, learn about ways you can take part in conservation mahi going on in Wainuiomata.

We’ll be running water quality monitoring (including SHMAK test demonstrations) and identifying fish and macro invertebrates living in the awa!

Our catchment co-ordinators will be onsite to chat about other ways you can get involved in conservation in your area too.

This event is for the whole whānau, drop in anytime between 10am-2pm

Register via Humanitix for updates https://events.humanitix.com/wainuiomata-open-day

events.id: Self Healing Crystal Meditation Journeys-14A Ngapotiki Street, Paraparaumu Beach, Kapiti Coast District, Paraparaumu Beach, New Zealand 5032,14A Ngapotiki St, Paraparaumu Beach, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu-All Events In
events.name: Self Healing Crystal Meditation Journeys
events.venue: 14A Ngapotiki Street, Paraparaumu Beach, Kapiti Coast District, Paraparaumu Beach, New Zealand 5032,14A Ngapotiki St, Paraparaumu Beach, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Self Healing Crystal Meditation Journeys
Are you ready to let “It” all go?
You are invited to take a journey deep into the energy of the Divine. Lying on the ground, with the heartbeat of Mother Earth beneath you, we take a meditation journey, deeper within our Soul energy. Slowly returning back to our true Soul self. Letting go of all connection to stress and the identity that the ego clings to.

Investing in the imagery that all of our cells hold the energy of our past. The trauma and struggles often block the gifts and wisdom from flowing through us. The wisdom and gifts are where the breath of the Divine can give life to our soul's purpose. When we surrender our hold on the trauma, struggles, pain and hardships of our past, we make room for the Divine to flow in.

In these journeys, we surrender all of the building blocks of our identity.

This then creates space for the new gifts to be connected into our soul magic. Allowing the energy of the creator to rebuild our Souls to hold the strongest vibration of our infinite possibilities.

We will be gridding ourselves in the crystals from the tent, before the journey. After the journey, you will have some quiet time to write, draw or just reflect.
These journeys are deep and divine. Please come in comfortable clothing and ready to be changed for the better.

events.long_description:
Te Ara Tupua Taster E-Bike Rides
Set to open in Autumn this year, Te Ara Tupua is a shared path connecting Lower Hutt and Wellington.

Free Ride is really proud to be working in partnership with HCC and NZTA to support the new cycleways coming to the Hutt. We'll have 4 e-bike rides in Jan and Feb for you to try our e bikes or bring your own. These rides will go from Free Ride HQ in Naenae to the beginning of Te Ara Tupua, to help you get on the pathway once it opens mid year.

Tickets are free, but a booking is required. Join us for two Free Rides and you may be eligible to join our E-Bike Library which allows you to borrow bikes E-bikes from us for four weeks.

*Murder at Checkmate Manor Auditions*
*AUDITION NOTICE *

The four hapless ladies of the Farndale Drama Guild (and their long-suffering stage manager) are putting on their overly-ambitious murder mystery play that would have Agatha Christie turning in her grave. Set at the remote country house, Checkmate Manor, a dastardly murderer is lurking about, killing people. The dirty rotter is trying to discover the contents of the late Sir Reginald Bishop’s will to have the inheritance altered in their favour. And what better way to ensure they are the sole beneficiary than to bump of all of Bishop’s relatives on the very night they’re all gathered for the reading of the will.
Opening night descends into chaos as scenery falls, costumes get mixed up, and the plot unravels, forcing the cast to improvise wildly.
What the Farndale ladies lack in talent, they certainly make up for with fierce enthusiasm, an unfounded sense of ability and a surprisingly good souffle recipe.

We are seeking 5 actors to bring our play to life!
Character Descriptions:

Mrs. Phoebe Reece: (50 +) The "bossy" leading figure and president of the group who attempts to direct and hold the chaotic production together. Has an underlying rivalry with Thelma which she tries (unsuccessfully) to mask. Must be able to do a French accent.
Plays Clarissa Rook, (Lady Bishop’s sister), Regine (the French maid), Patricia Bishop (Lady Bishop’s niece), Leticia Bishop (her sister), Mr Goodbody (a solicitor)

Thelma: (50+) Mrs. Reece's rival, a dressmaker who is keen to show off her costume skills. Has a simmering dislike for Mrs Reece and is repelled by Gordan’s advances. Ability to do a strong Yorkshire accent.
Plays Daphne Bishop (Lady Bishop’s daughter), Rose Bishop (her spinster Aunt)

Felicity: A younger cast member. Plays two male parts. Not as stilted and awkward as Audrey or Gordon. Uses male voices
Plays Pawn (the butler), Colonel King (Lady Bishop’s brother-in-law)


Audrey: A dithering, clumsy character who struggles with lines and delivery. Ability to do a strong Yorkshire accent.
Plays Lady Doreen Bishop (a widow), Violet Bishop (her spinster aunt), Mrs King (the colonel’s wife), Joan bishop (Lady Bishop’s cousin)

Gordon: Roped in to play the inept inspector at the last minute and is clearly out of his comfort zone. A dry physicality needed and staccato utterances of lines (due to his inability to act)
Plays Inspector O’Reilly


(Note; ages are just a guide. For this play, looking older is preferable. Parts are not suitable for young teenagers)


This is a play-within-a-play.
Characters often ‘break the 4th wall’ and ‘break character’. All characters interact with the audience to some extent. These characters are heavily nuanced – with the need for surreptitious, annoyed glances, double takes, etc. Have fun reading and getting into your character’s head.

Any questions or queries contact our Director Heidi Atkins via email or phone.
027 733 4059

events.id: Queer and trans drawing club Feb-Hutt Art Centre,9 Myrtle St, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Queer and trans drawing club Feb
events.venue: Hutt Art Centre,9 Myrtle St, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Queer and trans drawing club Feb
Queer trans drawing Club is on!

These sessions are 3 hours, so that we have time to relax, and have a good break to chat and eat snacks. We will have a model for each session, and I'll be there from 1pm setting up. Feel free to get there early and get yourself a good spot and set up.

We're in the painting studio at Hutt Art Society, 9/11 Myrtle St, Lower Hutt.

These sessions are different to Queer trans drawing class in that I won't be teaching the whole class. I wanna draw together! So I will be drawing too. I'll start us off with some great warm ups, and then we'll have timed poses, where you can use the techniques I've shared, or your own ones, to keep drawing. We will take breaks where we walk around and look at each other's drawings - always a great way to get new inspiration for techniques!

There are easels, tables, chairs and the horse things you can straddle and put a drawing board on. It's super warm, and private - all windows have blinds.

The session is $35 if you’re a waged person $20 unwaged / low waged – please pay in advance to reserve your spot and so I can get organised – nau mai haere mai, let me know if you wanna come!

Some materials provided, but to keep costs down I’m not providing all the materials so please do bring your own as well. All materials welcome, it's up to you! I recommend bringing different kinds of paper too - shopping bags, newspaper, cardboard... different papers create interesting drawings.

events.id: MX-5 Rally-Lower Hutt-Facebook
events.name: MX-5 Rally
events.venue: Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
MX-5 Rally - Sunday 15th Feb
Please note that this is a rally, and not a race. So, you need to follow provided instructions, and answer questions along the way correctly to win a prize. There is no prize for being the fastest. This rally has been organized for the Kapiti chapter of the MX-5 Club of NZ, but any other MX-5 drivers are welcome. Details below:
We will be meeting at the same place as last time - the Park 'n' Ride carpark at Manor Park, Lower Hutt, at 9am. Don't worry - we'll be doing completely different roads this time!
There is no breakfast at the start, but if people are interested, we could informally meet at Town & Country in Stokes Valley for breakfast beforehand,then all drive to the Park 'n' Ride together in convoy.
You will need to bring a pen or pencil, and something to press on, such as a clipboard, or a hardcover book. You will also need something you can take evidence photos with - a cellphone or digital camera will be fine.
I also highly, highly recommend that you bring a co-driver, as it will make things infinitely easier for you. Call Russell on 021 0269 3224 if you have trouble finding a co-driver, as I can assist with that!
Like last time, there will be prizes for 1st, 2nd & 3rd, but the prizes are based on who gets the most answers correct, and NOT on who is fastest to complete the course.
Lunch will be at the end point, so bring some $$$ with you.
Snacks will again be provided along the way. This event is free for members of The Kapiti Chapter of the MX-5 Club of NZ, or $2 per car for non-members of that club. This will cover the cost of the provided snacks, plus the photocopying. Thanks.
Further instructions on the day, but if you attended the last rally I organised, then you'll know what to expect. You'll need about 1/2 a tank of gas.
Please RSVP to Russell by texting 021 0269 3224 by Friday 13 Feb, so I can ensure that there are enough printed instructions for everyone.

events.id: Wainuiomata Water Walk - February-10 Whitcher Grove, Wainuiomata-Facebook
events.name: Wainuiomata Water Walk - February
events.venue: 10 Whitcher Grove, Wainuiomata
events.long_description:
Explore ancient forests and waterways on a guided walk in Wainuiomata Regional Park
Join us for a special guided walk through beautiful native forest in Wainuiomata Regional Park, exploring areas not usually open to the public. Led by our knowledgeable park ranger, you’ll learn about the Wainuiomata water collection area and how this pristine water makes its way to Wellington’s taps.
This is one of our most popular summer events, and places are limited to just 30 participants. If you’ve attended before, please consider letting someone else experience this unique opportunity.
The walk will follow the Orongorongo Pipeline Tunnel and visit the historic Morton Dam—one of New Zealand’s largest concrete dams and a remarkable example of early engineering innovation.
Event Details:
Group size: Limited to 30 participants
Registration: Max two per person
Fitness level: Moderate; not suitable for children under 14
What to bring: Lunch, snacks, water bottle, and suitable footwear and clothing—you’re likely to get wet feet!
To book: Due to the overwhelming popularity of these limited capacity events, we allocate bookings via a ballot system. A ballot will open for registrations via the link below at 10am on Tuesday 27 January and close at 10am on Thursday 29 January. Names will then be drawn at random all applicants notified of the outcome by 4pm on Friday 30 January.
Bookings open from 27 Jan: https://forms.office.com/r/PbBWvK2Vtz

Your adventure starts in regional parks.
Greater Wellington has been hosting recreational events like this for 25 years, helping people connect with nature, get active outdoors, and enjoy peaceful escapes close to home.
Wainuiomata Regional Park is not only a place of beauty—it’s a hub for conservation. Greater Wellington works here to protect freshwater, restore native habitats, preserve historic sites, and build resilience to climate change. Our partners and volunteers play a vital role in making this park a special place for everyone.

events.venue: Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki
events.long_description:
Join us for this fabulous block of classes in glass jewellery-making! It starts on Sunday 15 February and runs for 4 weeks till Sun 8 March.

This course is a great way for beginners and those with some experience to get into working with glass to produce beautiful beads that can be used in a myriad of ways.

Students will learn correct tool use and gain a solid understanding of the lampwork process. They will also learn some ways of incorporating their beads into wearable jewellery.

Course cost includes set materials, such as glass and stainless-steel findings. Silver, findings and extra glass are available to purchase in the studio.

People under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

events.id: Jewellery-making in 4 weeks, Beginners - Sundays-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Jewellery-making in 4 weeks, Beginners - Sundays
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Our classes are the best way for beginners to get into jewellery-making in a lively, warm and friendly environment. This Sunday course provides a solid foundation in jewellery fabrication.

Beginners will practice the basic techniques in copper or brass and then move on to working in silver. An excellent first project for beginners in this class is to create a simple textured ring band - but once you have the basics down, it is fun to create earrings, pendants or other simple items. Students will learn to cut, heat, form and texture metal, and to solder using a jeweller's torch and silver solder, and finally to polish your work up to a beautiful finish: these classes are super satisfying!

This course fee does NOT include materials. Beginners should expect to spend at least $60 on materials for their ring-making project. All metals and stones, as well as quality findings and chains, are available for purchase each week in the studio.

This block is great for teens and kids over 12 or so. NOTE: Anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

events.id: Kintsugi Workshop-Ventana Art Space, 7 Kitchener Street, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Kintsugi Workshop
events.venue: Ventana Art Space, 7 Kitchener Street, Martinborough
events.long_description:
Discover the beauty in brokenness through the timeless Japanese art of Kintsugi- the practice of mending ceramics with gold, transforming cracks into shimmering lines of strength and history. Rather than disguising flaws, Kintsugi celebrates them, honouring the story that each repaired piece carries.

In this hands-on workshop, we’ll explore a modern adaptation of this centuries-old practice using gold dust and epoxy glue. You’ll learn the process step-by-step, practice the meditative process of repairing ceramic pieces (yes, there’s a moment of satisfying, gentle smashing!), and finish with your own golden-repaired piece to take home.

Kintsugi teaches us to embrace imperfection as part of life’s story- that cracks can become something to cherish, not hide.

Your ceramic pieces will be provided on the day. Feel free to bring along treasured items to be mended, and I will advise if they are suitable for a beginner's class. Or get in touch before booking to discuss.

Date & Time:
Sunday 15th Feb
10am – 1pm

Saturday 11th Apri
10am – 1pm

Price:
$120pp

Location:
Martinborough
Ventana Art Space
7 Kitchener St, Martinborough

This workshop is taught with deep appreciation for the Japanese origins of Kintsugi, honouring its philosophy of transformation and care while offering a contemporary way to experience its spirit through making.

events.id: Portrait Sculpting-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Portrait Sculpting
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
Learn how to make a sculpture from life using the sight size technique. The artworks will be made with clay, which will be bisque fired on site to create one of a kind portraits. Students will begin with a bust, focusing on the proportions of the face, hear, neck and shoulders.

In this course you will -

- Learn how to imbue a sense of the models personality into your sculpture
- Learn different approaches to rendering the surface
- Explore traditional working methods
- Discover your own personal style in the art of sculpture

Course fee includes model, tutor, clay, necessary tools & equipment and bisque firing. There is also the option to glaze and fire your piece for an additional fee - to be discussed in class.

Four week art course running on Sundays, 15 Feb - 8 March, 10am-1pm.

events.id: Rewa Rewa Station Craft Day-Rewa Rewa Station, 166 Rewa Rewa Road, Tinui, Masterton-Event Finder
events.name: Rewa Rewa Station Craft Day
events.venue: Rewa Rewa Station, 166 Rewa Rewa Road, Tinui, Masterton
events.long_description:
Our on-farm Craft Open Days are aimed primarily at knitters, spinners, crocheters and other fibre crafters.

Nestled in the small rural community of Tinui is Rewa Rewa Station. Operating as a hill country Sheep & Beef breeding farm with a strong focus on NZ Wool & Fibre. Romney, Corriedale cross Romney, Polwarth & Gotland sheep provide the fleeces to create fibre products for crafters, which are sold via the Rewa Rewa Station website, and at Fibre Markets. Our Studio Shop is also open during Craft Days or by appointment outside of these days.

Our Craft Days allow you to work on your own project, seek advice, learn a new fibre skill or maybe just spend time with fellow fibre crafters while potentially ticking off a project or two in the process.

Please bring your knitting, crocheting, spinning, hand sewing, or any project you are working on and enjoy a drive in the country!

Coffee, tea and snacks provided, but bring your lunch and stay awhile.

Everyone is welcome, the more the merrier!

Note: Craft Days are primarily held on the 3rd Saturday of every mont,h but occasionally we do have to juggle the dates.

events.id: Drawing Basics With Botanica-Treehouse Visitor Centre, Wellington Botanic Garden , 101 Glenmore Street, Kelburn, Wellington , Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Drawing Basics With Botanica
events.venue: Treehouse Visitor Centre, Wellington Botanic Garden , 101 Glenmore Street, Kelburn, Wellington , Wellington
events.long_description:
Anyone can learn to draw. It’s not a magical talent that only a few are born with. It’s a gift you can learn. Join Wellington artist and illustrator Helen Casey and learn the tips and tricks needed to master the basics of drawing, with a botanical theme. Focusing on certain time-tested exercises and practices that train the hand and eye to work together, you will learn to see things ‘as they are’ in order to draw realistically.

Located in the Treehouse seminar room, the Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā.

Please note: The workshop is numbers dependent and will only go ahead with a minimum of 6 attendees. You will be notified and receive a full refund if this is the case.
Sponsored by Gordon Harris

events.id: Introduction to Taiko Drumming-Seido Karate, 32 Brooklyn Rd, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Introduction to Taiko Drumming
events.venue: Seido Karate, 32 Brooklyn Rd, Wellington
events.long_description:
Experience the power, rhythm, and energy of traditional Japanese drumming!

Taiko is a high-energy blend of powerful bass tones, synchronized group rhythms, and dynamic, full-body choreography. Often called "the heartbeat of Japan," Taiko is as much a workout as it is an art form.

Whether you're looking to try something new, get your heart racing, or connect with a centuries-old tradition, this one-off workshop is the perfect place to start.

In this one-off introduction to taiko drumming we will cover:
- Basic drumming techniques and simple rhythm practice
- Learn a simple piece of Taiko rhythm and play as a group

Workshop Details:
Cost: $15 (Includes a $10 discount for our upcoming 8-week beginners course starting 1 March 2026)
What to bring: Wear comfortable gym/movement clothes and bring a water bottle.
How to join: Spots are limited. Please register via our website to secure your place.

Taikoza is Wellington’s longest-running Taiko group. Founded in Hiroshima in the mid-1980s and calling Wellington home since 1991, we are dedicated to keeping the ancient spirit of the drum alive.
You may have seen our high-energy performances at Cuba Dupa, The Japan Festival, or at Blossom Valley. Most of our rhythms come directly from Hiroshima’s Taiko Hozonkai, preserving beats that have echoed through Japan for hundreds of years.
Ready to find your rhythm? Follow us on Facebook and Instagram for updates, or visit our website to book your spot today.

More info on Taikoza is available on the website.

In this one-off introduction to taiko drumming we will cover: - Basic drumming techniques and simple rhythm practice - Learn a simple piece of Taiko rhythm and play as a group Workshop Details: Cost: $15 (Includes a $10 discount for our upcoming 8-week beginners course starting 1 March 2026) What to bring: Wear comfortable gym/movement clothes and bring a water bottle.
How to join: Spots are limited.
Please register via our website to secure your place.
Taikoza is Wellington’s longest-running Taiko group.

events.id: Natural Textured Pendants/Earrings - Taster-65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Natural Textured Pendants/Earrings - Taster
events.venue: 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
This quick, creative taster class is perfect for a fun outing with friends, a thoughtful gift-making session, or a treat just for you.
In just three hours, you’ll learn to craft a stunning pair of textured metal earrings from scratch. You’ll be guided step-by-step through heating and texturing the metal, then cutting and shaping it with traditional jewellery tools.
By the end, you’ll have a beautiful pair of earrings to wear proudly or gift to someone you care about!
You will practice on smaller texture samples to work out what texture and what metal you want to go with, and then move on to creating your earrings in warm copper or yellow brass.
Your class materials pack includes everything you need for the class to make a super cool pair of shiny gorgeous earrings with a pair of sterling hooks or stainless steel hoops (gold plated or plain).
Using Copper and Brass as our main material allows us to have more creative fun and create larger earrings with less expense.
We do have a lovely range of sterling silver sheets that you can purchase as extra if you are committed to working in silver!
We use quality pre-made sterling silver and stainless steel earring hooks and hoops for these taster classes so that you can focus on making the main part of the earrings and know that your findings will be just perfect.
Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but an enrolled parent or caregiver must accompany anyone under the age of 16.
Workshop fee is $135, Early Bird $122 - ends 25 January.

events.name: Ecstatic Dance Wellington - Valentines Bass & Bliss
events.venue: 13 Vennell Street, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
🌟✨ Ecstatic Dance Wellington ✨🌟
💋 Bass & Bliss: Valentine’s Ecstatic Dance Special 💋
This Valentine’s, drop into your body and let the bass move you. A night of sultry rhythms, deep connection, and ecstatic release. Expect juicy beats, heart-opening vibes, and a dance floor that celebrates love in all its forms — solo, partnered, and everything in between. Come get blissfully bassy and let the music do the talking. 💃🔥
💫 What is Ecstatic Dance?
A freeform, drug- and alcohol-free dance experience where you move however your body wants. The music flows like a wave — starting slow, rising to ecstatic peaks, then softening into stillness. It’s therapeutic, uplifting, and a powerful way to connect with yourself and community.
Please note, that this Ecstatic Dance is not verbally guided, we let the music guide you 😊. Dance freely how your body moves you.
🎶 This Dance Floor
This Valentine’s Day, DJ Codaraan is bringing the heat — a heart-thumping journey of sexy basslines, deep drops, and blissed-out beats to awaken your inner fire.
Let the music seduce you into movement as Codaraan weaves a soundscape made for connection, passion, and playful surrender. Expect pulsing rhythms that invite you to grind, groove, and melt into the moment — a dance floor celebration of love in all its forms. ❤️‍🔥
🎶 The Sound System
Here at Ecstatic Dance Wellington, we believe in using a phat sound system with lots of bass for our dances. We will be bringing an ultra vibey and super bassy experience for you!
🗓 Event Details
📍 Vogelmorn Hall, 13 Vennell Street, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021
🕖 2:45pm – Arrive
🕖 3:00 – Opening Circle
🕢 3:15pm – Ecstatic Dance
🕘 4:45pm – Closing Circle
🕘 5:00pm – Chai & Chocolate (for those wanting to socialise)
🎟 Tickets
$25 online
$30 cash on the door
**If you would like to come but are unwaged or struggling, please send us a message directly, we'd love to help.
☀️ Extra Info
- Doors will open at 2.45pm for you to socialise in the lobby, we'll start promptly at 3pm.
❤️ What to Bring
Water bottle
Loose, comfy clothes
Warm layers for afterwards
A pillow and Blanket if you wish
A friend!
🌟 Guidelines
Drug & alcohol free event
Silence on the dance floor
Without phones/cameras on the dance floor
Respect the space & each other 😊
🎧 Tune into Kimba’s ED sets:
Mixcloud: https://www.mixcloud.com/kimbajade/
✨ Come dance with us at Ecstatic Dance Wellington — a journey of music, movement & magic. ✨

events.id: Burgin, Kerr and Norman at Greytown Upclose & Personal-Studio 73, 73 Main Street, Greytown-Event Finder
events.name: Burgin, Kerr and Norman at Greytown Upclose & Personal
events.venue: Studio 73, 73 Main Street, Greytown
events.long_description:
What a way to kick off the New Year: Burgin, Kerr & Norman! Paddy Burgin (The Wooden Box Band, The Zimmermans), Andrew Kerr (ex. Jacky Tar) and Alan Norman (The Warratahs, The Rag Poets) have been gathering crowds around the greater Wellington area for the past 18 months. A swampy melting pot of predominantly original country, folk, americana and blues, they combine a mutual love of story-telling and rhythmic grooves with narratives about the human experience.

“…..one of the year’s best albums in Americana/folk….a thoughtful, passionate, and musically rich collection that holds up under repeated listens….” Anne Hollister
Doors open 3.30pm join us for a great Sunday afternoon.
Tea/coffee sausage rolls, scones. etc for a gold coin. Bookings essential with Janette on 0210 236 1951 or buy your ticket below

events.id: Let's Sing! A Cappella Singing Intro Course with Faultline Chorus-72 Cuba Street, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Let's Sing! A Cappella Singing Intro Course with Faultline Chorus
events.venue: 72 Cuba Street, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Love to sing? 2026 is your time to shine! 
A Cappella Singing Intro Course with Faultline Chorus
Sing in the new year and rediscover your voice in a friendly, fun and supportive environment. Learn and perform a song in 4-part a cappella harmony, and develop your vocal skills.
Wednesday evenings starting 28 January, in Petone. Registration $50 per person.
Intro Course Dates
Wednesday 28 January 7.00 - 9.30pm
Wednesday 4 February 7.00 - 9.00pm
Wednesday 11 February 7.00 - 9.00pm
Sunday 15 February 2.00pm rehearsal followed by 4.00pm Friends & Whānau performance (venue to be advised)
Who are Faultline Chorus?
Faultline Chorus is a women’s singing group that has way too much fun singing four-part unaccompanied barbershop harmony. This incredibly rewarding yet challenging artform grabs you from the first moment you enter a rehearsal room or see a chorus perform.
Let's Sing!

events.id: Sue Thorby & Mr Moondog-The Undercurrent, 118 Tory Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Sue Thorby & Mr Moondog
events.venue: The Undercurrent, 118 Tory Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Moondog Blues & Sue Thorby take to the lower North Island in mid-February 2026 with an unforgettable show of heartfelt blues & gypsy soul. Both seasoned and powerful musicians and performers, you are in for a once-in-a-lifetime experience of two of New Zealand’s finest roots musicians.

Moondog, either found based out of Northland, NZ or as the gypsy bluesman touring Australia, channels a gritty, raw style — using metal-bodied guitars (homemade biscuit tins ‘AlleyTyns’), harmonica, a gritty and sometimes dark freight train voice, thumb slappin’ bass, foot-stomping rhythm — to deliver a unique blend of traditional blues, rock n roll, voodoo-infused “Bluz A Billy,” and Mojo-Juju vibes.

Sue Thorby, one of Aotearoa’s finest, brings her exceptional self-titled album and unforgettable live performance, rich with heart and superb musicianship back out on the road. Defying genres fused with blues, rock, celtic, gypsy soul and jazz, driving guitar rhythmns and powerful vocals, Sue weaves unapologetically honest stories of love, humanity, anguish & hope, grit and beauty.
events.description:

Sue Thorby, one of Aotearoa’s finest, brings her exceptional self-titled album and unforgettable live performance, rich with heart and superb musicianship back out on the road.
Defying genres fused with blues, rock, celtic, gypsy soul and jazz, driving guitar rhythmns and powerful vocals, Sue weaves unapologetically honest stories of love, humanity, anguish & hope, grit and beauty.

events.id: Sunday Jazz - New Zealand Swing Quartet-The Rogue & Vagabond-Rogue & Vagabond
events.name: Sunday Jazz - New Zealand Swing Quartet
events.venue: The Rogue & Vagabond
events.long_description:
The Rogue's regular Sunday afternoon jazz. Funky, jazzy, soulful jazz. Beer, hangs, and jazz, on a Sunday, perfect!

After numerous sold-out shows, the New Zealand Swing Quartet are delighted to return to The Rogue and Vagabond.

The New Zealand Swing Quartet specialize in traditional New Orleans jazz, and invite you to dive into a portrait of the soulful, vibrant, joyous music made famous by legends like Louis Armstrong, Sidney Bechet, Jelly Roll Morton.

Featuring:
Oscar Lavën (Clarinet / Sax)
Mat Enright (Trumpet / Vocals)
Adrian Jensen (Swing Guitar)
Daniel Yeabsley (Double Bass)
plus award-winning drummer Jacob Randall, on his unique 100-year old Trad drum set.

Free entry, Koha encouraged. 5pm downbeat.

events.name: Wellington Branch Meeting
events.venue: 16 Dundas Street, Seatoun, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Kia ora Wellington Branch Members!
You’re warmly invited to attend the upcoming Screen Guild Wellington Branch Meeting, taking place in person on:
Sunday 15 February
5.00pm
Seatoun Bowling Club, 16 Dundas Street, Seatoun, Wellington 6022
Branch Meetings are an important opportunity for Wellington members to come together, hear updates, raise local issues, contribute to Guild discussions, and help shape priorities moving forward.
Non-members are welcome to attend and participate in discussions; however, voting is limited to Screen Guild members only.
This meeting will include:
Branch updates and discussion
Member-led agenda items
Consideration of any accepted member motions
Agenda point submissions are NOW open, please see the Wellington Branch Meeting email for information on Member submissions and how to submit. (contact: coordinator@screenguild.co.nz if you have not received this email)
Come and join us, catch up with industry friends & colleagues and enjoy some nibbles and a drink on us.
We look forward to seeing you all there!
If you're not able to attend this meeting please submit your apology HERE
Ngā mihi,
The Screen Guild - Wellington Branch Committee

events.long_description:
Support Faultline Chorus with a Classic on the Big Screen!
Looking for a perfect Sunday evening out that’s a little dramatic, a little romantic, and all for a great cause? Join Faultline Chorus for a special Movie Fundraiser Night featuring the timeless literary classic Wuthering Heights.

📍 LightHouse Cinema, Petone

events.id: Hayden Chisholm and Unwind with guest Rob Thorne-Futuna Chapel, Futuna Close, Friend Street, Karori, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Hayden Chisholm and Unwind with guest Rob Thorne
events.venue: Futuna Chapel, Futuna Close, Friend Street, Karori, Wellington
events.long_description:
Hayden Chisholm's saxophone playing is a miracle - and in Futuna Chapel he sounds just gorgeous. Performing music that knows a lot about jazz as well as folk and chamber music traditions, his group Unwind play melodic, contrapuntal music with a beautiful group sound and a great deal of space. Hayden – originally from Taranaki but resident in Europe for more than 30 years – leads Unwind with local musicians Paul Dyne (bass) and Norman Meehan (piano).
For their Futuna Chapel concert, they are joined by taonga pūoro expert Rob Thorne. Hayden and Rob will be a treat in the stunning acoustics of the chapel. Don't miss this one.
Door sales: $30.00

events.id: AUSTRALIA'S THUNDER FROM DOWN UNDER - FEBRUARY 16, 2026 - SOUTHWARD CAR MUSEUM THEATRE, NZ-Southward Car Museum,250 Otaihanga Rd, Otaihanga, Paraparaumu 5036, New Zealand, Paraparaumu-All Events In
events.name: AUSTRALIA'S THUNDER FROM DOWN UNDER - FEBRUARY 16, 2026 - SOUTHWARD CAR MUSEUM THEATRE, NZ
events.venue: Southward Car Museum,250 Otaihanga Rd, Otaihanga, Paraparaumu 5036, New Zealand, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
AUSTRALIA'S THUNDER FROM DOWN UNDER - FEBRUARY 16, 2026 - SOUTHWARD CAR MUSEUM THEATRE, NZ
Australia’s Thunder from Down Under returns for their Temptation Tour 2026 to NEW ZEALAND presented by Forrest Jones Entertainment.

Get ready to experience an exhilarating and electrifying extravaganza as Thunder from Down Under, the world-renowned Australian male revue, announces its highly anticipated return in 2026 with their TEMPTATION TOUR. The sizzling hot international sensation is set to set the stage on fire with their captivating performances and infectious energy, promising an unforgettable night of entertainment for fans across the country.

Known for their charismatic personalities, chiseled physiques, and mesmerizing dance routines, Thunder from Down Under has been leaving audiences in awe for years. Their unmatched Australian charm and talent have earned them a dedicated global following, making them one of the most sought-after live shows in the entertainment industry.

Overview
This course delivers the complete site owner story from start to finish in an engaging and practical way to ensure you have the confidence to plan and create new sites or manage your existing sites, whether you're using SharePoint Online through Microsoft 365, or SharePoint 2019 on-premises. events.long_description:
Beehive to Business with Hon. Louise Upston
Beehive to Business Event: Unlocking the Potential of New Zealand’s Workforce with Hon. Minister Upston

About this Event

As New Zealand’s workforce evolves—shaped by technology, automation, and changing skills needs—it’s more important than ever to fully utilise the talent available to us.

Join us for a special Beehive to Business event with Hon. Louise Upston, Minister for the Community and Voluntary Sector, Minister for Disability Issues, Minister for Social Development and Employment, Minister for Tourism and Hospitality, Minister for Child Poverty Reduction, and Deputy Leader of the House, who will discuss how businesses can better support disabled and neurodiverse New Zealanders, and why this is critical to unlocking the full potential of the workforce.

This event is a unique opportunity for business leaders and policymakers to explore how inclusive employment can strengthen organisations and build a more capable, diverse workforce—and it’s not one to be missed.

Agenda:
7:15am- Standing breakfast, networking
7:45am- Address
8:10am- Q&A
8:30am- Event concludes

Part of the ongoing Beehive to Business series, this event is proudly made possible through our partnership with Wellington-based consulting firm Allen + Clarke.
