events.id: Once Upon a Time in Homowood @ NZ Fringe 2026-BATS Theatre,1 Kent Terrace, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Once Upon a Time in Homowood @ NZ Fringe 2026
events.venue: BATS Theatre,1 Kent Terrace, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Once Upon a Time in Homowood @ NZ Fringe 2026
Hollywood, but make it gay(er)

17 - 21 February 2026
BATS Theatre
Tickets at Fringe.co.nz
https://tickets.fringe.co.nz/event/446:8195/

The sacred texts have been discovered.

Did you know that some of Hollywood’s most iconic movies were gay gay gay?

Our intrepid researchers have discovered the original scripts of Titanic (with lesbians), Sunset Boulevard (with a trans woman) and The Social Network (with kissing) before the Hollywood suits forced the straight agenda on them.

For the first time in history, these seminal texts of queer culture have been discovered and read aloud in front of a bunch of gays.

Expect true love, divas, sexual tension and many euphemisms.

Discovered and edited by playwrights Cassandra Tse, Jamie Cain and Matthew Loveranes.

Starring Zachary Klein, Rachel McLean, Lincoln Swinerd, Ruby Carter, Mike Bryant, Cassandra Tse, Jamie Cain and Matthew Loveranes.

Once Upon a Time in Homowood is a celebration of the LGBTTQIA+ community in a way that is silly, playful and unabashed in its queerness.

Cinema and theatre are vital for queer people to see themselves represented both in explicitly queer texts as well as queer-coded works. Once Upon a Time in Homowood makes the coded canon, a fan fic of what if Jack from Titanic was a soft butch? What if Norma Desmond transitioned and Hollywood ditched her? What if Mark Zuckerberg and Eduardo Saverin kissed?

These silly 'what ifs' underlie an important kaupapa of claiming work that feels like ours because so little of art is.

Once Upon a Time in Homowood @ NZ Fringe 2026 Hollywood, but make it gay(er) 17 - 21 February 2026 BATS Theatre Tickets at Fringe.co.nz https://tickets.fringe.co.nz/event/446:8195/ The sacred texts have been discovered.
Our intrepid researchers have discovered the original scripts of Titanic (with lesbians), Sunset Boulevard (with a trans woman) and The Social Network (with kissing) before the Hollywood suits forced the straight agenda on them.
For the first time in history, these seminal texts of queer culture have been discovered and read aloud in front of a bunch of gays.
Expect true love, divas, sexual tension and many euphemisms.

events.long_description:
Pop Art and Wine Night in Wellington - POP the Kettle On
In this lively night out, we will entice your inner artist by experimenting with paint in the style of Pop Art. Made popular in the 50s & 60s by artists such as Andy Warhol and Roy Lichtenstein, Pop Art brings popular culture into the realm of art. This painted graphic style adds bold glamour to everyday consumer icons and objects, and really makes them pop!

Paint Pop Art with Paintvine, and create a vivid painting that evokes a printmaking aesthetic.

So smooth out those brushes, buy a glass of your favourite tipple, and paint the night away!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available to purchase.

Food: Want to enjoy some delicious food? Food will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a social creative class set in New Zealand’s favourite local bars. Our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the painting materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes), all you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). All our events are in licensed venues, so you can purchase drinks to sip as you create! At the end of the night, you will have a vibrant Pop Art painting that you can hang in your home.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to **👉** https://paintvine.co.nz/

events.id: STEAMS School BLENHEIM Term 1 2026-Mayfield, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: STEAMS School BLENHEIM Term 1 2026
events.venue: Mayfield, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand
events.long_description:
STEAMS is an integrated approach to learning topics of Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, Maths, and Society that fosters critical thinking, problem solving, communication and collaboration. Its aim is to teach real world skills through engaging methods whilst allowing individuals to be creative. This involves immersing tamariki into projects and activities that develop innovation and champion curiosity. STEAMS is not ‘play based learning’ but focused learning through an integrated hands-on approach allowing children to take risks and explore their own curiosity in a subject without time barriers.
At the Ministry of Inspiration we offer STEAMS learning each term for Year 1-8 students. Once a week students will attend a class at Waterlea Racecourse, Blenheim on TUESDAY or THURSDAY. STEAMS Jr (ages 7-9) start at 9am and finish at 2:45pm on TUESDAY. Little STEAMerS operates from 9-12 on THURSDAY. STEAMS Sr (ages 10-13) operates on THURSDAY from 9am to 245 pm. 
Inquiry, collaboration, and an emphasis on process-based learning are at the heart of the STEAM approach. Each term the classes will have a focus which drives the learning and our amazing teachers create opportunities to help each student develop their understanding, improve their skills and gain knowledge in a range of topics.
Students who participate in STEAM learning:
· think outside the box
· feel safe to express innovative and creative ideas
· feel comfortable doing hands-on learning
· take ownership over their learning
· work collaboratively with others
· understand the ways that science, maths, the arts, and technology work together
· become increasingly curious about the world around them and feel empowered to change it for the better.
When does it meet, and where?
The school is held during school terms.
STEAMS Jr (ages 7-9) TUESDAY, 9-245.
STEAMS Sr (ages 10-13) THURSDAY, 9-245
Little STEAMerS (ages 5-6) THURSDAY 12-3.
Location:  Waterlea Racecourse, enter off of Linton St.
How much does it cost?
The students come for a paid three-week trial-as a new student you pay for that through Humanitix.
If both family and teacher feel there is a good fit for the child in the class, they continue for the rest of the term. You are then invoiced for the full term less the amount paid for the Trial.
Payment is by term, with a cost of $73 incl. GST We have a limited number of scholarships available that are awarded on a term by term basis for those with financial need for 25% off. 
Little STEAMerS is $30 incl. GST.
Will my child’s school mind that they miss a day per week?
You will need to inform the child’s school that he or she will be at STEAMS School one day per week. To date we have not encountered any issues around accommodating a child’s participation in STEAMS School, and many of the region’s schools are very supportive of the programme. Once enrolled, you are encouraged to inform the teacher and office staff that your child should be marked present for the day they attend STEAMS School, as they will be attending an academic school as opposed to being absent due to illness or other reasons.

events.id: night ferals: a comedy in dreamland || NZ Fringe 2026-BATS Theatre,1 Kent Terrace, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: night ferals: a comedy in dreamland || NZ Fringe 2026
events.venue: BATS Theatre,1 Kent Terrace, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
night ferals: a comedy in dreamland || NZ Fringe 2026
WARNING: DREAMLAND WAITS FOR YOU.

Fall into the liminal levels of your mind with the “help” of your wide-eyed dream guide mog.

It feels familiar but it’s not.

Night ferals: a comedy in dreamland is a 50-minute surrealist sketch, clown and improv show that blends elements of weirdcore, experimental visceral comedy, and just good old fashion absurdity.

Expect otherworldly characters, uncanny environments and nonsensical situations that make you question a whole lotta things but mainly... What is the point? (there isn’t one)

Be careful, this dream watches you back.
If you like Adult Swim, Aunty Donna, Portlandia, Tim Robinson, Sarah Squirm, Stath Lets Flats, insane deep web reel pulls and Cat in the Hat (2003), you’ll love this show.

Mog (Megan Connolly) is an award-winning comedian, performer and writer based in Poneke. Typically the ‘Minge’ in comedy duo ‘Ginge & Minge’, this is Mog’s debut solo hour. This work combines their love for surrealist humour, multiple disciplines and unearthly vibes.

Directed by award-winning performer Daniel Nodder (Only Bones).

“CHAOS GOBLIN”
THEATREVIEW

“CHARISMA UNMATCHED”
WELLYOTT

events.venue: Hannah Playhouse,12 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Fijian Flying Circus - Wellington Fringe Festival
Bold, breathtaking and human, Fijian Flying Circus is a world-first fusion of Fijian storytelling and contemporary circus.

Follow Loma, a curious young girl who stumbles into a mystical world where veli (forest spirits), giants, and elemental forces live in harmony with Fiji’s lush flora and fauna. When a cheeky veli steals one of her enchanted shoes, Loma embarks on a thrilling journey to retrieve it, guided by her mischievous sidekick Tui.

A vibrant mix of jaw-dropping stunts, cheeky humour, and deep Fijian warmth, expect to laugh, gasp, and maybe even tear up as these incredible humans remind us that we’re all part of one big, flying family.

events.id: Book Launch | Leather & Chains by Kate Camp-9 Edward Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Book Launch | Leather & Chains by Kate Camp
events.venue: 9 Edward Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us for the launch of Kate Camp's extraordinary new book, Leather & Chains – a fearless dive into her 1986 diary!
Tuesday 17 February, 6pm
Meow bar, 9 Edward Street, Te Aro, Wellington
All welcome!
The book will be launched by Tracy Farr, co-curator of the Bad Diaries Salon, with words from Ashleigh Young and readings from The Diary by Kate. Books will be for sale with thanks to Unity Books.
'I never kept a diary, except for one year of my life. The year I turned fourteen. The year my parents divorced. The year I had sex for the first time. The year I learned to use the microfiche.'
In this unique follow-up to her memoir You Probably Think This Song Is About You, Kate Camp turns her poet's eye on her 1986 diary. Reading The Diary in its entirety for the first time, she revels in 80s touchstones like Revlon Custom Eyes and Ghostbusters on VHS. But amid the daily details, like smoking menthols in Suzy's Coffee Lounge and wearing Jazzercise tights in a phone box, are moments of drama, even tragedy – being black-out drunk in a spa pool, or watching her father move out of the family home. At the centre of it all is Cameron, his black hair falling over his eyes, intoning in his fake Scottish accent, 'Treat me rough, baby.'
These entries – over 100 reproduced in full – are a time capsule of a very different era. The Kate Camp of today responds to the blithe accounts of sex, drugs and risk-taking with horror and admiration. How real are our memories? Can we ever know ourselves? And why is every entry signed off Leather & Chains?
'Kate Camp reads the words of grownupchild Kate of 1986 – achingly funny, arch and louche, often shocking, always clever. And all of it threaded through with such pain and sadness and unsettling darkness, such yearning to be loved.' —Tracy Farr, author of Wonderland
'IF YOU EVER GET TO SEE KATE CAMP READ FROM HER 14YO DIARY DO IT FUCKING DO IT.' —Melody Thomas, host of The Good Sex Project
Kate Camp is the author of the memoir You Probably Think This Song Is About You (2022) and eight acclaimed collections of poems, including The Mirror of Simple Annihilated Souls (winner of the NZ Post Book Award for Poetry in 2011), How to Be Happy Though Human: New and Selected Poems (2020), and Makeshift Seasons (2025).
Cover: Todd Atticus

events.id: Once Upon a Time in Homowood-BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Once Upon a Time in Homowood
events.venue: BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington
events.long_description:
The sacred texts have been discovered. Did you know that some of Hollywood's most iconic movies were gay gay gay? Our intrepid researchers have discovered the original scripts of Titanic (with lesbians), Sunset Boulevard (with a trans woman) and The Social Network (with kissing) before the Hollywood suits forced the straight agenda on them. For the first time in history, these seminal texts of queer culture have been discovered and read aloud in front of a bunch of gays. Expect true love, divas, sexual tension and many euphemisms. Discovered and edited by playwrights Cassandra Tse, Jamie Cain and Matthew Loveranes. Presented by With Our Powers Combined.
Starring Zachary Klein, Rachel McLean, Lincoln Swinerd, Ruby Carter, Mike Bryant, Cassandra Tse, Jamie Cain and Matthew Loveranes.
Part of the NZ Fringe Festival 2026.

Once Upon a Time in Homowood is a celebration of the LGBTTQIA+ community in a way that is silly, playful and unabashed in its queerness.

events.id: Pop Art and Wine Night in Wellington - POP the Kettle On-Southern Cross Garden Bar Restaurant, 39 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Pop Art and Wine Night in Wellington - POP the Kettle On
events.venue: Southern Cross Garden Bar Restaurant, 39 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Paint Pop Art with Paintvine, and create a vivid painting that evokes a printmaking aesthetic.

In this lively night out, we will entice your inner artist by experimenting with paint in the style of Pop Art. Made popular in the 50s & 60s by artists such as Andy Warhol and Roy Lichtenstein, Pop Art brings popular culture into the realm of art. This painted graphic style adds bold glamour to everyday consumer icons and objects, and really makes them pop!

So smooth out those brushes, buy a glass of your favourite tipple, and paint the night away!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available to purchase.

Food: Want to enjoy some delicious food? Food will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a social creative class set in New Zealand’s favourite local bars. Our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the painting materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes), all you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). All our events are in licensed venues, so you can purchase drinks to sip as you create! At the end of the night, you will have a vibrant Pop Art painting that you can hang in your home.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website ⇒ paintvine.co.nz

events.id: night ferals: a comedy in dreamland || NZ Fringe 2026-1 Kent Terrace, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: night ferals: a comedy in dreamland || NZ Fringe 2026
events.venue: 1 Kent Terrace, Wellington
events.long_description:
WARNING: DREAMLAND WAITS FOR YOU.
Fall into the liminal levels of your mind with the “help” of your wide-eyed dream guide mog.
It feels familiar but it’s not.
Night ferals: a comedy in dreamland is a 50-minute surrealist sketch, clown and improv show that blends elements of weirdcore, experimental visceral comedy, and just good old fashion absurdity.
Expect otherworldly characters, uncanny environments and nonsensical situations that make you question a whole lotta things but mainly... What is the point? (there isn’t one)
Be careful, this dream watches you back.
If you like Adult Swim, Aunty Donna, Portlandia, Tim Robinson, Sarah Squirm, Stath Lets Flats, insane deep web reel pulls and Cat in the Hat (2003), you’ll love this show.
Mog (Megan Connolly) is an award-winning comedian, performer and writer based in Poneke. Typically the ‘Minge’ in comedy duo ‘Ginge & Minge’, this is Mog’s debut solo hour. This work combines their love for surrealist humour, multiple disciplines and unearthly vibes.
Directed by award-winning performer Daniel Nodder (Only Bones).
“CHAOS GOBLIN”
THEATREVIEW
“CHARISMA UNMATCHED”

events.id: Fijian Flying Circus - Wellington Fringe Festival-12 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Fijian Flying Circus - Wellington Fringe Festival
events.venue: 12 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington
events.long_description:
Bold, breathtaking and human, Fijian Flying Circus is a world-first fusion of Fijian storytelling and contemporary circus.
Follow Loma, a curious young girl who stumbles into a mystical world where veli (forest spirits), giants, and elemental forces live in harmony with Fiji’s lush flora and fauna. When a cheeky veli steals one of her enchanted shoes, Loma embarks on a thrilling journey to retrieve it, guided by her mischievous sidekick Tui.
A vibrant mix of jaw-dropping stunts, cheeky humour, and deep Fijian warmth, expect to laugh, gasp, and maybe even tear up as these incredible humans remind us that we’re all part of one big, flying family.

events.long_description:
Kick off Lunar New Year with a flavour explosion of laughs!

Dirty Rice is serving up an all-Asian comedy showcase that's bold, spicy, and absolutely unforgettable. This variety show is packed with razor-sharp punchlines, outrageous stories, and cultural twists that will leave you hungry for more.

Starring a powerhouse lineup including Lily Catastrophe, Chen Wang, Elliott Lam, Ralph Hilaga, and more incredible Asian talent from across Aotearoa and beyond, this is your chance to experience comedy that's as vibrant and diverse as the Lunar New Year itself.

Expect a night of sizzling humour, unexpected surprises, and a celebration of voices that deserve the spotlight. Whether you're here for the fiery jokes, the cheeky banter, or the sheer joy of live performance, Dirty Rice promises a feast of funny you won't forget.

events.id: The Darkness tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: The Darkness tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Presented by: SBM
Multi-platinum UK rock royalty The Darkness are set to make their triumphant return to New Zealand in February 2026 with summer shows in Auckland and Wellington.
Following their massive 2024 Permission To Land 20th anniversary tour, the band are bringing their signature high-voltage energy and outrageous fun back to stages, serving up fan favourites like I Believe In A Thing Called Love and Love Is Only A Feeling, alongside new tracks from their latest album Dreams On Toast, including I Hate Myself and The Longest Kiss. This tour marks the first chance for fans to hear the new songs live.
Exploding onto the scene in 2003 with their now-classic debut Permission To Land, The Darkness quickly became one of the UK’s most beloved rock bands, racking up over 1.5 million album sales, a headline set at Reading & Leeds in 2004, and a string of major awards including BRITs, Kerrang!, and an Ivor Novell.
The band’s cheeky, spandex-clad anthems changed the face of British rock and continue to capture hearts and a new generation of fans around the world. Their live shows are pure spectacle: soaring falsettos, outrageous outfits, endless guitar solos, and crowds belting out every word. Don’t miss your chance to experience it all live in 2026 - it’s bold, loud, and gloriously over-the-top fun.
Joining The Darkness on their Australia & New Zealand tour is emerging Australian artist RAGEFLOWER – a magnetic force of cinematic alt-rock whose sound blurs the boundaries of emotion, experimentation and raw power. Her music balances fragility and strength in equal measure. Her live performances are powerful and deeply felt – part confessional, part spectacle – earning her a rapidly growing international audience across the U.S., Japan and Europe, and positioning her as one of Australia’s most compelling new voices.

events.id: F*ck the Small Talk: Wellington #2 🐳-Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: F*ck the Small Talk: Wellington #2 🐳
events.venue: Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
F*ck the Small Talk: Wellington #2 🐳
🎟️ Sign up here: https://luma.com/ftst2wellington 🎟️

F*ck the Small Talk has traveled the world from Berlin, Melbourne, London, Lisbon, and Mexico City, to Lisbon and is now coming to Wellington! 🇳🇿


📦 WHAT'S THIS ABOUT?

FTST is a one-of-a-kind social experience where strangers come together for an afternoon of meaningful, fun, and deep conversation. It’s also just a different & cool way of meeting new people by getting a bit out of your comfort zone and skipping the small talk!

Join us for games, talks, and connections with friends you haven’t met yet. Join if you get annoyed after being asked what you do, where you are from, and how long you have been in Wellington every single time you meet someone. If you feel that there are better questions in life then this is the place for you. 🙌


🎈 HOW DOES IT WORK?

We start with a short & sweet intro talk followed by a few light-hearted group games to warm up. Don't worry, nothing too awkward! After that, we split you up into small groups and start with the conversation rounds (with 3-4 people). We'll have awesome question cards that will guide the flow of the conversation. You’ll never have to speak in public if you don’t want to!


🕹 HOW TO JOIN?

Take 2 minutes to fill out our form 👇🏼
https://luma.com/ftst2wellington

Our events are limited to 30 handpicked guests to ensure a cozy atmosphere. We prioritize a balance in gender and cultural diversity, making each gathering a unique blend of perspectives! If you're invited you'll receive an invite with a special link via our ticketing platform Luma :)


🧧 HOW MUCH IS IT?

The cost to attend is NZD 23 (early llama) - NZD 25 (general llama) and includes the following:

⏰ 3 hours of facilitated and curated activities
🥪 Light snacks to keep the energy going (only if outdoors)
👥 A space to meet new people in the least boring way possible
💛 Supporting our mission to slowly eliminate small talk around the world
🎫 Also includes those pesky ticket fees!


🌳 WHERE IS IT?

We host our events in awesome cafes, rooftops, and bars across the city. We only reveal the location to ticket holders 24 hours before the event.


💛 WHAT THEY SAY

🗣 “Great way to connect with people in a more meaningful way. Get to the heart of the matter, dive straight into what really counts!” - Matthias


🗣 “This is the kind of activity humanity needs every weekend. Thank you for all.” - Sonya


🗣 “F*ck the Small Talk changes the narrative from "Where are you from?" to "When was the last time you laughed uncontrollably?" and I think that's beautiful.” - Monika


🗣 “I loved F*ck the small talk, I was a little bit nervous at first but they are pros at making you feel comfortable with the rest of the group, the activities are really fun and I enjoyed every second (consider that the one who's saying this is very, very shy). Give it a try!” - Brenda


🗣 "it’s a wonderful experience, it’s like being a kid again, when you were at the park, playing with other kids, and just decided you were going to be best friends for the next hours. Maybe you’ll never see those kids again. But that hour was amazing because you both opened up and trusted each other." - Sara


🗣 “Lively, interesting, introspective, completely open and no judgement. Everyone that joined was ready for great conversation and helped with different perspectives. So much fun! I can't wait for the next one! “ - Yaz


Check out our 100+ Google reviews: https://goo.gl/maps/TpZy77bfPFkGoikn7 🫶


🤓 FAQ

• Can I come alone?
Of course, in fact, we encourage it! 99% of people do.


• I signed up but never got an invite. Why?
We usually get a high volume of sign-ups yet we like to keep it cozy & only about 30 people. We believe this is a good number to ensure an awesome experience! Please try again next time if do not receive an invite - no hard feelings 💛


• Why do you charge?
We value our time and put a lot of love, planning, and effort into creating & designing these experiences. ♥️ This is our project/business and what we give to the world and we think everything should be a fair exchange! However, money should never be the reason for people not to attend. If you can’t afford it simply get in touch with us :)


• I'm digging this! Can I get involved somehow?
Sure thing, send us a message!


• Can I bring my cute dog/llama?
It depends on where the event is! Message us to make sure. But it's always a YES in our hearts.


• Can I get a refund if I can't make it?
Unfortunately, we do not offer refunds or ticket transfers to another event date if you cannot attend with a notice of less than 5 days notice. BUTTTT feel free to pass on your ticket to a friend, provided they also sign up for the form :)

--


𝘾𝙤𝙢𝙚 𝙘𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙤𝙪𝙨, 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙫𝙚 𝙘𝙤𝙣𝙣𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙚𝙙. ✨

* Only 30 spots available
* Location is only revealed to ticket holders!
* Age guide, 22-40 years old (only a reference, never a limit 💃)


🙅‍♀️📱This event is a no-phone experience. Keep them tucked in your pocket 🙅‍♀️📱


We started in Berlin back in 2019 out our frustration of being asked 'where are you from?' 40 times in one week. Now there are chapters in 11 cities around the world including Mexico City, Zurich, Lisbon, London, Berlin and Vancouver. 🌍


--

Stay in touch 👇

events.name: The Wellington Comedy Club Rainbow Showcase
events.venue: 29 Courtenay Pl, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
events.long_description:
The Wellington Comedy Club Rainbow Showcase
Experience big laughs and queer joy at the Wellington Comedy Club Rainbow Showcase.

Delightfully effervescent host Jak Darling is joined by Wellington legend and headmaster of the NZ Comedy School Neil Thornton; comedian, illustrator, producer and activist Anya Rzhevitskaya; genius improv, stand-up and sketch comedian Ralph Hilaga; exciting newcomer Jay Tiemann; recently disowned Syrian comic Edib Farhan; and 2025 Wellington Raw Quest finalist Emma Jean.

This line-up features bi, trans, gay, non-binary, and all kinds of queer comics from Aotearoa, UK, Syria, Philippines, USA and Russia.

These talented comedians will share their unique perspectives, hilarious stories and well-crafted jokes. From sharp wit to charming delivery, we promise an hour of immense talent and entertainment that is as diverse as it is fabulous.

Book your tickets now to secure your seat at this excellent comedy experience.

New venue for the New Zealand Fringe Festival: The Gods Paramount: Loft. It's at 29 Courtenay Place (between Lulu and Kaffee Eis)

This event made possible with support from the Wellington City Council, and the F*** Yes Fund

events.id: Unstuck - NZ Fringe Festival 2026-The Fringe Bar,28 Allen Street, Te Aro, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Unstuck - NZ Fringe Festival 2026
events.venue: The Fringe Bar,28 Allen Street, Te Aro, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Unstuck - NZ Fringe Festival 2026
Miranda Camden's on a mission to get unstuck.

She's undertaking an ill-conceived self-improvement journey she describes as "throwing sh*t at the wall to see what sticks". Desperate for change, she's willing to try anything once (or twice) depending on the circumstances. But it depends. Is isolation the same thing as self-care? Does exercise have to be part of the journey? Would I be happier if I break-up with New Zealand? What is the best rebound country? Come along for this work-in-progress show about finding the humour in being imperfect.

events.id: Spoon Show @ NZ Fringe 2026-The Gods - Paramount,29 Courtenay Place, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Spoon Show @ NZ Fringe 2026
events.venue: The Gods - Paramount,29 Courtenay Place, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Spoon Show @ NZ Fringe 2026
Ah, the humble kitchen spoon. So soft, so harmless, so simple.

A spoon can become many things. An airplane, an embrace, a swip-swap creating willy sords or perhaps two swords? A loved one, an enemy, a catapult, a shamefully niche musical instrument. Can a clown be a spoon? What actually IS a spoon, really? Does a spork count? Ponder these deep questions and more as Fumble the Clown explores the infinite comedic potential of cutlery.

It is unclear where the clown got so many of these metal wonders, or for what purpose. But with a fool’s brain, a dancer’s body and a determination usually reserved only for the truly idiotic, this charming clown will joke, dance, juggle (badly), sing and invite their audience to join the show, creating an unforgettable hour of ridiculous comedy.

Spoon Show is the sophomore solo work created by award-winning Aotearoa-based dancer-turned-clown Daniel Nodder, whose work has been described as a “tour-de-force”, “beyond human” and “pure artistry”. After developing this new work at École Philippe Gaulier, Daniel brings all of their absurdist comedy and multi-award-winning movement skills to this performance. Performing alongside quirky sound design & composition by Ben Kelly and clever technical design by Rebekah de Roo, this production is a perfectly balanced spoonful of comedy soup.

Be delighted by the simple stupidity and ironic inventiveness of a show about spoons.

Previous awards won by Daniel Nodder:
WINNER: Outstanding Performance Award - Dunedin Fringe 2025 (Only Bones)
WINNER: Dance / Physical Theatre Award - Dunedin Fringe 2025 (Only Bones)
WINNER: Artist's Pick Award - San Diego International Fringe 2024 (Only Bones)
WINNER: Outside the Box Award - San Diego International Fringe 2024 (Only Bones)
WINNER: Outstanding Solo Performance - New Zealand Fringe 2023 (Only Bones)
NOMINATED: Best in Fringe - New Zealand Fringe 2023 & 2025 (Only Bones; Entry: Encounter)
NOMINATED: Performer of the Year - Wellington Theatre Awards 2023 (Only Bones)

events.id: CPD: Mastering Masterspec Specifications WELLINGTON | ⭐ 20 CPD Points-110 Wakefield Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: CPD: Mastering Masterspec Specifications WELLINGTON | ⭐ 20 CPD Points
events.venue: 110 Wakefield Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
⭐ CPD Points: 20
Description
This CPD course, titled "Mastering Masterspec Specifications," is designed to provide specifiers with comprehensive training on effectively utilising the Masterspec platform for specification writing. Participants will learn the ins and outs of navigating the Masterspec platform, setting up their specifications, managing user accounts, and optimising the use of various features such as Office Masters, MasterKey, and mDocs. The course covers essential topics ranging from basic specification setup to advanced specification management techniques, ensuring participants gain practical skills to streamline their specification writing process.
Designed by specifiers for specifiers
This course is designed for specifiers, including architects, designers, engineers, and other professionals involved in the construction industry, who are responsible for creating specifications for building projects. Whether you are new to the Masterspec platform or looking to enhance your proficiency in specification writing, this course provides valuable insights and practical skills to optimise your workflow and maximise the benefits of using Masterspec for specification management.
Why should specifiers take this course
Specifiers should take this course to enhance their proficiency in specification writing and maximise the benefits offered by the Masterspec platform. By mastering the tools and functionalities covered in this course, specifiers can:
Improve Efficiency: Learn how to navigate the Masterspec website and utilise its features effectively, saving time and effort in specification writing tasks.
Ensure Accuracy: Gain insights into best practices for setting up specifications, assigning roles, and managing user accounts to maintain data accuracy and consistency.
Enhance Collaboration: Understand how to collaborate with team members, assign roles, and share specifications seamlessly within the organization, promoting teamwork and productivity.
Stay Updated: Stay abreast of the latest features and updates on the Masterspec platform, ensuring specifiers are equipped with the knowledge to leverage new tools for enhanced specification writing.
Optimise Workflow: Discover advanced techniques for managing specifications, utilising Office Masters, and integrating with drawing sets using MasterKey, leading to streamlined workflow and project efficiency.
Ensure Compliance: Learn about NZCIC guidelines and best practices for adding, editing, and exporting guidelines to ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations.
Boost Professional Development: Acquire valuable skills and knowledge that contribute to professional growth and advancement in the field of specification writing, enhancing career prospects and opportunities.

events.id: The Wellington Comedy Club Rainbow showcase - NZ Fringe Festival-The Gods Paramount, 29 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Wellington Comedy Club Rainbow showcase - NZ Fringe Festival
events.venue: The Gods Paramount, 29 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Experience big laughs and queer joy at the Wellington Comedy Club Rainbow Showcase.

Delightfully effervescent host Jak Darling is joined by Wellington legend and headmaster of the NZ Comedy School, Neil Thornton; comedian, illustrator, producer and activist Anya Rzhevitskaya; genius improv, stand-up and sketch comedian Ralph Hilaga; exciting newcomer Jay Tiemann; recently disowned Syrian comic Edib Farhan; and 2025 Wellington Raw Quest finalist Emma Jean.
This line-up features bi, trans, gay, non-binary, and all kinds of queer comics from Aotearoa, the UK, Syria, the Philippines, the USA and Russia.

These talented comedians will share their unique perspectives, hilarious stories and well-crafted jokes. From sharp wit to charming delivery, we promise an hour of immense talent and entertainment that is as diverse as it is fabulous.

Book your tickets now to secure your seat at this excellent comedy experience.

New venue for the New Zealand Fringe Festival: The Gods Paramount: Loft.
It's at 29 Courtenay Place (29 Courtenay Place, between Lulu and Kaffee Eis)

This event was made possible with support from the Wellington City Council and the F*** Yes Fund

events.id: Dungeons & Flagons - A February Expedition-31 Whitehouse Road, Tītahi Bay, Porirua 5022, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Dungeons & Flagons - A February Expedition
events.venue: 31 Whitehouse Road, Tītahi Bay, Porirua 5022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Every great Dungeons and Dragons adventure begins in a tavern.
Whether you’re a seasoned adventurer or you’ve never rolled a die in your life, this two-hour, beginner-friendly D&D experience at Titahi Bay’s own Beer Engine is for you.
Turn up solo or with friends and be guided through a fast-paced adventure by a professional Dungeon Master. Choose your hero — a silver-tongued bard, a fire-flinging wizard, a sword-swinging fighter, a sneaky rogue, or something else entirely, with all characters, dice, and rules provided.
Expect laughs, ridiculous moments, and just enough danger to make the beer taste sweeter. Because while you’re swinging swords and slinging spells, the bar will be open with Beer Engine’s excellent selection of craft brews on tap.
No prep. No pressure. Just great beer and a story you’ll still be talking about afterwards.
The inaugural Dungeons and Flagons sold out in a week - so book fast, adventurer!
This is an age 18+ event.

events.name: Quiz Night
events.venue: Eastbourne Sports & Services Club, South End Tuatoru Street, Eastbourne, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Come join us for the monthly ritual (third Wednesday of the month) on a Wednesday night at Eastbourne Sports & Services Club, where you and your crew will negotiate five rounds of amazing trivia with Gee Quiz.

Your team's street cred, life smarts and common sense will go a long way to ensuring success on the night.

Add to the mix delicious food and an incredible vibe, it's the place to be on a Tuesday night with plenty of time for laughter, banter and merrymaking!

The quiz kicks off at 7pm and runs for roughly 2 hours. So, grab your buddies and come on down and join us for one of Eastbourne's best quiz nights – ESSC style!

events.id: Embarrassed Naked Female (this show contains nudity) at NZ Fringe-Gryphon Theatre, 22 Ghuznee St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Embarrassed Naked Female (this show contains nudity) at NZ Fringe
events.venue: Gryphon Theatre, 22 Ghuznee St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
A lecture-performance following a stolen video down the rabbit hole of internet creeps -- the true story of five nude minutes sparking years of obsessive sharing, bizarre commentary, and surreal online encounters. A darkly humorous dive into consent in the digital age.

In 2020, during the first Covid lockdown, I made my solo show "The Sensemaker" temporarily available online.
Strangely, the video quickly became highly sought-after in certain corners of the internet -- all because of the five minutes of nudity it contains. Years later, I'm still having to take it down from various adult forums where it keeps resurfacing without my consent.
In trying to track where it had been shared, I stumbled into a bizarre world of posts and comments.
Let me read you a few.

"Embarrassed Naked Female (this show contains nudity)" has won the Virtuoso Award (Stockholm Fringe Festival 2025) and the Hot Potato Award (Gothenburg Fringe 2025).

This show is presented in tandem with "The Sensemaker".

events.id: Early Midnight Circus - NZ Fringe Festival-The Gods Paramount, 29 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Early Midnight Circus - NZ Fringe Festival
events.venue: The Gods Paramount, 29 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Early Midnight Circus is a chaotic late-night talk show staged as a theatrical spectacle, hosted by a desperate showbiz clown, Aaron James Douglas, clinging to a dying format he'll never control. Each night, Fringe Festival performers join as "guests" to promote their upcoming shows - only to be ambushed by rotating set pieces, absurd challenges and a crew determined to derail everything.

Featuring some of Wellington's top aspiring comedians, including award winners and nominees from the NZ Fringe Festival, NZ International Comedy Festival and the Billy T Award, the show is a curated madhouse of the city's wildest. It's a late-night gateway to the most absurd, experimental and ambitious shows of the season - with live music, sketch chaos and improvised mayhem in a format that's part cabaret, part meltdown, and all circus.

As part of the 2026 Fringe Festival in Wellington.

events.id: CBT skills for physical health practitioners in Aotearoa New Zealand-48 Mein Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: CBT skills for physical health practitioners in Aotearoa New Zealand
events.venue: 48 Mein Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Cognitive Behaviour Therapy (CBT) is a psychological intervention initially developed for emotional disorders. It is now widely used in supporting people to deal with the challenges of physical ill-health. Professionals from various backgrounds can learn to use a simplified CBT skills set, and use of these skills enables them to be more effective in managing aspects of their patients’ distress.
The training is a mix of theory, skills demonstration and skills practice, giving participants a better understanding of the applicability of the skill set in their area of practice and providing some skills to take away. Training sessions are spaced to allow participants to use their new skills in their clinical practice. Each participant reflects on their learning and their work with a specific patient, and the whole group reflects on lessons learned. In this way, learning remains rooted in participants’ clinical practice. These CBT courses are consistently evaluated highly by participants.
The Course
Teaching will be commenced with 2 days of in person sessions. 19th and 20th Feb 2026 at Mary Potter Hospice, Wellington and subsequently 2 sessions on-line via Zoom. The online sessions will be on 8th April and 27th May at 5pm for 3.5 hours.
Attendance at all sessions is mandatory to complete the course.
The courses cost is $850 per person (incl GST).
The Trainers
Kathy Burn was a Clinical Nurse Specialist in Palliative Care who went on to train in CBT and to develop the CBT service at St Christopher’s Hospice, London. She now works in CBT in chronic pain, and she teaches and supervises CBT trainees at the institute of Psychiatry, London.
Kathryn Mannix was a Palliative Medicine Consultant and CBT therapist. She developed ‘CBT First Aid’ to enable palliative care clinicians to adapt skills from CBT into their clinical practice. She is an author. There are insights into her use of CBT in her books With the End in Mind and Listen.
Terms and Conditions
Attendance: In order to create a learning community for each course, it is important that each person on a course attends every session and is able to join in the discussions by keeping up with the course. By accepting a place on a particular course, you agree to attend all the sessions, to arrive on time, and to work alongside your group members during the session to support each other's learning. Each session builds on the last, and you'll be asked to put your new learning into practice in- between sessions. Building learning groups in this way means we can't add new trainees after a course has begun.
We are not able to run catch-up sessions for sessions missed. If you miss sessions, you may be asked to withdraw from the course and no refunds will be given.
Refunds/Canellations: Once you sign up and pay, we won't be able to refund your payment unless we can reallocate your place to another person before the course begins. The deadline for cancelling your place is 28 days before the day and time of the first session. If you cancel and we can fill your place with another person, we'll offer you the choice of a refund or a place on a future course, if places are available. We will do our best to fill your place, but we can't promise this. Refunds will incur an administration fee.
Dates and Times of Sessions: all dates and times are given in NZ time, and this varies over the year. It is up to you to check the correct time in your time zone: you may find this website useful to check your own time zone with Auckland NZ time on each specific date: https://www.worldtimebuddy.com/
Trainers: we have a team of trainers, all of whom are experienced CBT therapists and trainers, and all are familiar with applying CBT in physical health settings. Different sessions may be taught by different trainers, or by 'guest appearances' by some of our team. The team of trainers will ensure there is continuity of content and of learning as the course progresses.
Special circumstances: Sometimes, life events appear unexpectedly. If something unexpected prevents you from attending, please let us know as early as you can, and we will give consideration to how we might be able to support you to continue your training if that is what you wish to do.

events.id: Early Childhood Centre Emergency Planning Workshop - Paraparaumu-Fytfield Place, Fytfield Place, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
events.name: Early Childhood Centre Emergency Planning Workshop - Paraparaumu
events.venue: Fytfield Place, Fytfield Place, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Would you and your staff be confident in an emergency? Do you have a plan, and more importantly have you practiced it recently?

We are holding a free workshop for Early Childhood Education Centres in the Kāpiti Coast to come together to discuss your emergency plans.

This workshop is an opportunity for ECEs to share challenges and solutions and get advice from our Emergency Management Advisors.

It aims to help ECEs plan for significant events such as earthquake, tsunami, armed intruders and to share ideas and network around emergency planning.

This is an opportunity for Centre Managers, Directors, Health & Safety Representatives or Leads to:

- Share solutions, practical advice and learnings from recent events.
- Discuss your current plans with emergency management professionals.
- Learn more about our local hazards and important planning information including lessons learnt from the Christchurch Earthquake, Christchurch Mosque Attack and Cyclone Gabrielle.

Hope to see you there as we build safer and more resilient ECEs and communities together.

Places are limited to a maximum of 30 people attending each session. This workshop is endorsed by the Ministry of Education.

For more information, please email info@wremo.nz

We aim to make our community events inclusive to all people. If you are attending the event and have specific accessibility requirements, you can send us an email at info@wremo.nz with the event name and we will get in touch to see how we can meet your needs as best we can.

events.id: Decadunce - a Sketch Comedy-BATS Theatre,1 Kent Ter, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Decadunce - a Sketch Comedy
events.venue: BATS Theatre,1 Kent Ter, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Decadunce - a Sketch Comedy
Award-winning Kiwi comedian Marshall Lorenzo (Canada's Drag Race) is back with a brand new sketch comedy extravaganza, 'Decadunce'. Fresh off of winning the 2025 NZ Fringe International Exchange Award, 'Decadunce' is the third chapter in the eight-time NZ Fringe award-nominated 'Baby Gorgeous' sketch comedy trilogy. While 2024's 'Baby Gorgeous' was the amuse-bouche and 2025's 'Build Ups' was the main course, get ready to eat good in the decadent and dizzying dessert of the Baby Gorgeous trilogy: 'Decadunce'.

Now fully committed to living a lifestyle outside of his means, 'Decudunce' is a brand new show about fraud, excess and stupidity. Let's just say we're a gun law away from finally eating the rich, and Marshall Lorenzo is ready to pull the trigger. Decadunce is about finding loopholes in the capitalist snake oil; to fight for bargains and blow off steam around the cost of living.

Featuring various unforgettable characters, including the Briscoes lady, and biting commentary on the dilapidated state of it all! Come see the sequel to the comedy show audience members called 'freakin hilarious', and 'on another level'.

***** - Now Magazine

"Roars of laughter" - Theatreview

"Devastatingly funny" - andrewwhiteside.com

He's here to kick ass and take kidneys. And he's all out of ass. And kidneys.

From the Tim Burton of Taranaki, The Most Haunted Comedian in New Zealand brings you a stand-up comedy show for anyone who's ever thought about donating a kidney, anyone who hasn't thought about donating a kidney, and anyone who might know a guy who knows a guy who does a sneaky cashie.

Callum's exhausted every possible avenue, from family, to friends, to strangers, to dead strangers.

events.id: [OFFSITE] Jim White (Aus) & Marisa Anderson (US) with Motte + UMU-Meow,17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: [OFFSITE] Jim White (Aus) & Marisa Anderson (US) with Motte + UMU
events.venue: Meow,17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
[OFFSITE] Jim White (Aus) & Marisa Anderson (US) with Motte + UMU
Offsite at Meow, 9 Edward Street, Wellington

Jim White & Marisa Anderson
The collaboration between renowned drummer Jim White (Dirty Three, PJ Harvey, Bonnie Prince Billy, Cat Power) and acclaimed US guitarist Marisa Anderson is a natural union of two of the most intuitive players and listeners working in music. White and Anderson are both in high demand as collaborators, in no small part because of their mastery, versatility and highly expressive playing. The duo have amassed an impressive body of work together (including their 2020 debut The Quickening and 2024’s Swallowtail), and each remain at the vanguard of their practices due to an insatiable curiosity and delight in exploration of new avenues of expression.

---

Marisa Anderson channels the history of the guitar and stretches the boundaries of tradition. Her playing is fluid, emotional, and masterful, featuring compositions and improvisations that re-imagine the landscape of American music. Her work applies elements of minimalism, electronic music, drone and 20th century classical music to compositions based on blues, jazz, gospel and country music.

---

Drummer Jim White first come to attention in the mid-1990s with the acclaimed Australian instrumental trio Dirty Three, and is now recognised internationally as one of the most creative and expressive drummers on the planet. His unique playing style and deft way with sound and rhythm has seen him become the go-to drummer for a huge number of alt-A-list vocalists with collaboration in mind. PJ Harvey has said there is ballet in White’s light, precise touch. And the other collaborators that he’s mesmerised, including the likes of Bonnie Prince Billy, Smog, Nick Cave, White Magic, Beth Orton, Marianne Faithfull, Kurt Vile, Cat Power and the iconic Cretan lyra player Psarantonis, all know that there’s more to White’s drumming than mere accompaniment. His intuitive beats and singular approach have created sparks in his collaborations. Whoever White is playing with, he is right there, present in the most inspirational sense.

---

Motte is the solo project of violinist and composer, Anita Clark. Riding the thin line between beauty and devastation, Motte weaves together a richly textured world with a violin, delay pedal, sampled sound and voice. Creating a world solely her own, the sound is modern classical, ambient, alt/experimental pop and improvised noise. Her musical gifts and skilful reach across genres makes her an indispensable collaborator with The Phoenix Foundation, Luke Buda, Marlon Williams, Don McGlashan, the Renderers, Nadia Reid, Lawrence Arabia, Delaney Davidson and plenty of others. As Motte, she dances around the shining candescence of her culture like a night insect, always seeking a better vantage point to the light.

---

UMU is a duo of Riki Gooch and Daniel Beban. Silver Apples meets Kuduro with Riki's deep grooves played on an 80s Roland electronic drum kit which are manipulated and dubbed out by Dan on two Tama Techstar drum synths.

$35 earlybird tickets via Meow / $20 unwaged

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

events.long_description:
The Bridie & Rebecca Variety Show @ NZ Fringe
There's no business like show business, and there's nobody who knows that better than Tāmaki Makaurau's hottest new chaotic, queer, comedic duo, Bridie and Rebecca!

Comedy Culture NZ presents "The Bridie and Rebecca Variety Show, (But It's Just Rebecca and Bridie)"! Bridie Thomson and Rebecca Mary Gwendolon are two outrageously silly, queer, multi-faceted performers who extend their funny bones from fast-paced improv to the delights of sketch comedy and beyond. As Rebecca and Bridie establish themselves as a comedy double-act, they're taking inspiration from some of the great dynamic duos of popular culture. This show will be funny, silly, and loose as they prepare to unleash joyful chaos within the NZ comedy scene in 2026.

Bring some pals, come make some new ones and laugh your way through the night with your favourite new duo.
Witness the chaos and tell everyone you were there to see it first!

events.id: Westpac Smarts: What’s next for Wellington property in 2026-Westpac Building,Level 10, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Westpac Smarts: What’s next for Wellington property in 2026
events.venue: Westpac Building,Level 10, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Westpac Smarts: What’s next for Wellington property in 2026
Westpac Smarts: What’s next for Wellington property in 2026

About this Event

Join Westpac and the Wellington Chamber of Commerce for the first Westpac Smarts session of 2026, featuring one of New Zealand’s most closely watched voices on property and economic trends.
Nick Goodall, Head of Research at Cotality, will unpack what’s ahead for Wellington’s property market as we enter a new phase - marked by stabalising interest rates, a new Reserve Bank Governor, and a market emerging from a period of prolonged value plateau.
After a sharp downturn from the 2021 peak, Wellington’s housing market is showing signs of stabilisation. With prices resetting, affordability improving, and buyer sentiment beginning to lift, Nick will explore what this means for homeowners, investors, and businesses alike.
Drawing on the latest regional and national data, Nick will share insights into:
How lower interest rates and policy changes are shaping buyer and investor behaviour
What evolving rental market dynamics mean for landlords and tenants
The impact of zoning and urban development changes on housing supply
Where potential value and opportunity may lie as the market rebalances
This session will provide a clear-eyed view of the risks, realities, and opportunities emerging in 2026, cutting through the noise with evidence-led insights and practical context.
Join this high-value briefing for business leaders, property owners, and investors looking to understand where the market is heading, and how to navigate the year ahead with confidence.

Event details:
12:00pm - Networking
12:15pm – Presentation
1:15pm – Wrap-up

Chamber members and Westpac customers: Free entry
Non-members: $5.00 donated to Life Flight Trust through the Westpac Chopper Appeal

events.id: Astrology: Your Personal New Year-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Astrology: Your Personal New Year
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Astrology: Your Personal New Year

Have you ever wondered why the same year can feel completely different for each of us?

Across the world, different cultures mark the New Year at different times — the Western New Year, the Chinese New Year, the Buddhist New Year. Alongside these collective beginnings, there is also your personal New Year. In this workshop, we’ll explore when the New Year begins for you individually. Your birth chart can highlight which areas of life may come into focus and what influences them. We will also discuss why planetary movements and transits affect some people more strongly than others.

We’ll explore the 12-year cycle, where a different area of life becomes the main focus each year. You will see how this pattern repeats every 12 years, and why — even as the cycle returns — each experience can feel unique.

By the end of the workshop you will get some ideas about why your New Year is personal to you from an astrological perspective. The workshop will be interactive, so feel free to share your stories and, if you would like, bring your natal chart with you.

Plus, there’s an amazing plant-based dinner and dessert included in your ticket!

Meet Jelena, your host
Jelena has been passionate about astrology and was fortunate to begin her studies under the guidance of one of New Zealand’s most respected astrologers, who helped her start on the right path. From the very beginning, she has pursued her learning independently, drawing extensively from recommended books. Last year, she completed a course in Horary Astrology through the School of Traditional Astrology (STA). She is currently continuing her studies through a one-on-one course with a traditional astrology teacher in the UK while also receiving mentorship from an astrologer based in Perth, Australia.

events.id: Dragonflies are Amazing and Important - Why? Forest & Bird Talk-The Garden Room at St Peter’s on Willis, 90 Ghuznee St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Dragonflies are Amazing and Important - Why? Forest & Bird Talk
events.venue: The Garden Room at St Peter’s on Willis, 90 Ghuznee St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Ruary Mackenzie Dodds and his wife Kari de Koenigswarter are rated as Dragonfly Ambassadors by the British Dragonfly Society. Although they have recently been involved in the setting up of a Dragonfly Hotspot at Exbury Gardens in Hampshire, England, their work currently centres on New Zealand where awareness of the significance of dragonflies is possibly behind that of the U.K, which has a growing understanding that dragonflies are a key indicator of the health of waterspaces. In this talk, Ruary takes his listeners back to basics on the amazing life-cycle of these insects. He outlines typical preferred dragonfly habitats, and touches on identification of New Zealand species. In addition to Ruary’s talk, Kari’s larva demonstration table shows actual examples of the larval stages on NZ species.

In their New Zealand work, Ruary and Kari are carrying out survey work on behalf of the Greater Wellington Regional Council, and are preparing a dragonfly education pack for schools. They have also carried out five summer seasons of night-filming an endemic dragonfly species – the Bush Giant – that lives in a burrow! A Radio New Zealand Our Changing World programme has been devoted to their work. (https://www.rnz.co.nz/news/ourchangingworld/546925/dragonflies-masters-of-flight).

Ruary and Kari have been working with dragonflies since 1985. They opened Europe’s first Dragonfly Sanctuary in 1991, and founded the National Dragonfly Biomuseum in Northamptonshire in 1995. They and their team of volunteers continued work with the National Trust at Wicken Fen in Cambridgeshire, and were instrumental in the setting up of the Dragonfly Centre there in 2009. Their adventures were published in Ruary’s memoir, The Dragonfly Diaries (Saraband, 2014). Kari and Ruary have also published a how-to book, Dragonfly-Friendly Gardening (Saraband, 2024). Ruary is a Fellow of the Linnean Society. He has given talks in eight countries. He has appeared on both television and radio, and was awarded BBC Springwatch’s ‘Dragonfly Geek’ award. He has been featured in BBC Wildlife Magazine, The Scottish Field, and in Wildlife Trust and National Trust publications. Kari specializes in the larval stages of odonate life, while – even after over forty years – Ruary’s heart lifts at the sight of a dragonfly in flight, and he loves sharing this enthusiasm with his listeners!

events.id: Gone By Lunchtime: 10th Birthday Party-10 Kent Terrace, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Gone By Lunchtime: 10th Birthday Party
events.venue: 10 Kent Terrace, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Three elections, five prime ministers, several hundred emotional junior staffers and 10 years ago, the podcast Gone By Lunchtime was born screaming into the political world.
Toby Manhire, Annabelle Lee-Mather and Ben Thomas have since then been huddling together to make sense and nonsense of political matters in Aotearoa. Join them on an odyssey down memory lane, recalling their own journeys to fronting New Zealand’s Only Podcast™ taking in everything from Jacindamania to suburban pigeons, from crown-Māori relations to the Bad Boys of Brexit, from coalition building to piss-filled Zorbs.
All that, plus a surprise guest, and we'll exclusively reveal precisely how election year is going to pan out.
-
Toby Manhire is an Auckland-based writer, editor and broadcaster. He is editor-at-large at The Spinoff and host of podcasts including Juggernaut 2: The Story of the Fourth National Government and Gone By Lunchtime.
Annabelle Lee-Mather (Ngāi Tahu, Ngāti Kahungunu, Ngāti Māmoe) is a journalist and producer who’s spent the last 25 years working in media, mostly by saying yes to things before thinking them through. She created The Hui, The Casketeers, Hongi To Hāngī and a bunch of other shows her kids refuse to watch.
Annabelle now runs Aotearoa Media Collective with her work wife Mihingarangi Forbes producing the long form current affairs series Mata Reports and the NZ Wars series. She sings the high part in the Gone By Lunchtime trio, slightly off-key, but with conviction.
Ben Thomas is a political commentator and director of Capital Government Relations and Communications, a Wellington and Auckland based public affairs firm. He is a former political editor of the National Business Review and was a press secretary in the previous National government. He writes a regular column for The Post and Stuff.

events.id: Wankernomics — Just Touching Base-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Wankernomics — Just Touching Base
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
At work, do you struggle with simple tasks like using the phrase “circle back” in every email? Have you never used the word “synergies” in a LinkedIn post? You might be a failure at office life and need a pep talk. Luckily, some Australian satirists have a solution. ‘Wankernomics — Just Touching Base’ live at The Opera House reveals the secret to workplace success through the ancient art of being annoying.   
The shows are hilarious and include many ‘oh-my-god-that’s-exactly-what-happens-at-my-workplace’ moments. You’ll get a demonstration of the buzzwords, bureaucracy, banality, and baloney of modern working life. You’ll get tips on how to speak at work, how to look like a genius in meetings, and how to get promoted by simply dropping the phrase ‘360 degree all-hands ideation session’ into an email to your boss. 
So, pop some time in the diary for an outcomes-focused, value-added, best-practice, deep-dive into the realities of the working world.

Upper Hutt Night Market
This vibrant community event promises an exciting evening of entertainment, artisan crafts and delectable food options for attendees of all ages.

Over 80 artisan craft stalls will showcase the talent and creativity of local artists. Attendees will have the opportunity to browse and purchase a wide range of unique handmade products, including artwork, jewellery, candles, home décor, plants, clothing and much more.

To satisfy the appetites of hungry visitors, the Upper Hutt Night Market will also feature 30 carefully selected food trucks offering a diverse range of culinary delights. From international cuisines to local favourites, attendees can indulge in a variety of mouthwatering dishes, ensuring there is something to satisfy every palate.

At the heart of the event will be live music. Lively melodies and infectious tunes will grace the sound stage, ensuring a memorable night filled with music and joy.

FREE ENTRY

events.long_description:
✨ NOSTALGIA ✨
A celebration of circus artistry, equestrian brilliance, and the greatest music across the generations.
Step back in time with us as we journey through the decades, showcasing unforgettable moments in musical history through breathtaking circus and equestrian performances. From inspiring big and small horses of all disciplines to some of Kāpiti’s finest performers, Nostalgia brings together the stars of yesterday and the rising stars of today.
Prepare to be amazed by a spectacular range of skills:
• Equestrian vaulting
• Dancing horses
• A thrilling fire-jumping act
• Spinning wheel performances
• Acrobatics and ensemble acts
• Aerial silk and hoop artistry
This is a truly family-friendly show with something for all ages—and we promise an experience you’ll never forget. We can’t wait to share it with you!
Food & Refreshments
A full food and drink stand will be open throughout the event, including a licensed bar, hot food, snacks, and refreshments. The stand will also be available during intermission.
Parking & Venue
We have plenty of onsite parking with helpers to guide you on arrival. Simply follow the driveway down to the Kapiti Equestrian and Vaulting Club—your suburban oasis for an unforgettable evening.
Don’t miss out—get your tickets now and join us for a magical celebration of music, movement, and memories!

events.long_description:
100 Things - NZ Fringe
3 actors. 60 minutes. 100 Things. Can this improv comedy show from Tamaki Makaurau really do it?

In an improv show, the performers typically ask for a suggestion from the audience. In 100 Things, the actors craft ONE HUNDRED audience suggestions into a narrative show. Imagine if Taskmaster and Whose Line Is It Anyway? had a baby ... it'll be kind of like that!

This cast of women and non-binary actors from Aotearoa are driven by a powerful desire to do the best damn improv show ever and prove Guinness World Records wrong.

Winner of Late Night Knife Fight Tāmaki Makaurau 2023

Nominated for “Best Ensemble” and “Best Show” at NZ Improv Festival 2024

Rejected by Guinness World Records 3 times and counting

“Guinness World Records should be devastated to have missed it” Theatreview

NYPDEEZ NUTS @ NZ FRINGE 2026
Detective Constables John McMally & Hughie Rothman have eradicated crime in New York, and now they must go to the one place where corruption and crime reign terror upon every city.. New Zealand.

After being voted as the winners of their November 2024 Late Night Knife Fight in Tāmaki Makaurau, Improvisers Izzy Renton and Bridie Thomson are now ready to unleash their absurd moider (murder)-solving, donut-dunking, justice-fighting duo upon the world.

This is a highly interactive, fully improvised, murder-mystery style show where members of the audience play everyone from witness, to perpetrator, to the manager at Animates in Palmerston North.

Justice has never been so hard.

events.id: Marsha & Velveteen Aotearoa Tour - Wellington-Valhalla,154 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Marsha & Velveteen Aotearoa Tour - Wellington
events.venue: Valhalla,154 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Marsha & Velveteen Aotearoa Tour - Wellington
Ōtautahi post punks Marsha and alt-rock outfit Velveteen are taking their loud and energetic live shows across the country. At the end of the 2025/26 summer, the two bands are taking on four shows in Wellington, Auckland, Christchurch, and Dunedin. Joining the tour are some of Aotearoa's finest bands around including Cruelly, Back to the Hillside, Pearly*, and Gracie Snow.

Marsha are Christchurch post punk, leaning on elements of indie and experimental rock. Taking influence from bands such as SPIRIT OF THE BEEHIVE, The Smiths, and Black Country, New Road. Following a successful 2025, Marsha are warming up for another big year.

Velveteen is the solo project of Jai Tudor Oakley based in Christchurch. It blends alternative rock, punk, and electronica with strong melodic hooks.

20th of February - Te Whanganui-a-Tara, Valhalla w/ Cruelly
21st of February - Tāmaki Makaurau, Whammy Bar w/ Back to the Hillside
6th of March - Ōtautahi, Space Academy w/ Gracie Snow
7th of March - Ōtepoti, Pearl Diver w/ Pearly*

events.name: Lamentations | New Zealand Fringe 2026
events.venue: The Gods - Paramount,29 Courtenay Place, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Lamentations | New Zealand Fringe 2026
An evening of opinions and ideas from a diverse group of speakers, hosted with an irreverent deft touch by comedian James Nokise, all centred around a simple question: What's wrong with Wellington?

No idea is too small, no concept too big, the premise is simple, the answers as complicated as the guests require. A different lineup each night, for a colourful collection of insights.

James Nokise is an internationally award-winning Comedian, Theatremaker, and Podcaster with a history of innovative work in the NZ Fringe Festival, including Rukahu, Faovale Imperium, We Built This City, and Puppet Fiction.

events.id: Alexia Pizza Nights with Roving Pizza-Alexia Urban Winery, 197 West Street, Greytown-Event Finder
events.name: Alexia Pizza Nights with Roving Pizza
events.venue: Alexia Urban Winery, 197 West Street, Greytown
events.long_description:
On occasional Friday evenings Alexia is doing a little pizza pop-up with Roving Pizza!

Roving Pizza make beautiful wood-fired Napoletana style pizzas. Fresh spins on authentic Italian flavours with delightfully soft and crunchy bases achieved through a 24-hour dough fermentation process. All handmade, using the best ingredients, cooked in front of you. Delicious!

How it works:

• Alexia is open from 4pm – 8pm. Pizzas are available to order 4.15pm – 7.00pm or until sold out. Bar snacks and a little sweet finish are also available.
• No bookings taken – just turn up and find a spot. If the weather is nice we’ll be on the terrace and lawn. If the weather is not so nice we’ll be on the terrace and in the winery (all covered).
• Takeaway pizza is also available, walk-in only - no email/phone orders. You need to turn up to order your pizza. Enjoy a glass of Alexia while you wait, and grab a bottle of something delicious to take home.
• Apologies but Roving Pizza does not currently offer gluten free pizza bases. GF and want to join in the fun? We have some GF food options available.
• No BYO food/drinks.

Te Huarahi: The Pathway of Faith + Justice
Te Huarahi Passionfest is a grassroots festival for young adults chasing after Jesus and justice in Aotearoa. It’s about camping under the stars, worship and kōrero, music and art, shared kai and whanaungatanga.
We want to form a new generation of Jesus-followers who care deeply about people and creation. Alongside you will be families and older adults who’ve walked this path for decades — cheering you on and sharing the journey.

events.id: Panel Talk: Interconnected [Breathe | Mauri Ora]-Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Panel Talk: Interconnected [Breathe | Mauri Ora]
events.venue: Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Discover how art, science, nature, and Indigenous knowledge converge as Marshmallow Laser Feast and experts share insights inspired by Breathe | Mauri Ora: An Immersive Journey into Nature by Marshmallow Laser Feast.

Hosted by Miriama Kamo, Interconnected brings the relationships of art, science, nature, and mātaurangagloss to life in a panel discussion where London-based art collective Marshmallow Laser Feast joins leading researchers and curators for an evening of sharing how we understand the world and ourselves, inspired by Breathe | Mauri Ora.

This thought-provoking kōrero explores how technology makes the invisible visible, and how creativity, science, and Indigenous knowledge together can transform how we see our planet and our place within it.

Featuring
* Representative from Marshmallow Laser Feast – artist/director
* Dr Dan Hikuroa – Earth systems scientist and expert in integrating mātauranga Māori
* Dr Huhana Smith – artist, curator, and researcher exploring climate adaptation and Māori knowledge
* Dr Rebecca Rice – Senior Curator Art at Te Papa
* Dr Thom Linley – Curator Fishes at Te Papa

The panel will explore
* How technology and art reveal nature’s hidden systems
* The meeting of mātauranga Māori and the scientific method
* Ethics and responsibility in an age of ecological change
* Reimagining humanity’s relationship with the living world
* Future visions for the next generation’s environmental consciousness.

Programme
* 6pm to 7pm – Exhibition Viewing
Experience Breathe | Mauri Ora after hours – an internationally acclaimed digital art exhibition that reveals the unseen forces connecting all living things.

* 7.30pm to 9pm – Panel Talk
Audience Q&A and closing reflections.

Spaces are limited – book your ticket today.

events.id: Upper Hutt Night Market-RACE Trentham (Trentham Racecourse), 10 Racecourse Road, Trentham, Upper Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Upper Hutt Night Market
events.venue: RACE Trentham (Trentham Racecourse), 10 Racecourse Road, Trentham, Upper Hutt
events.long_description:
This vibrant community event promises an exciting evening of entertainment, artisan crafts and delectable food options for attendees of all ages.

Over 80 artisan craft stalls will showcase the talent and creativity of local artists. Attendees will have the opportunity to browse and purchase a wide range of unique handmade products, including artwork, jewellery, candles, home décor, plants, clothing and much more.

To satisfy the appetites of hungry visitors, the Upper Hutt Night Market will also feature 30 carefully selected food trucks offering a diverse range of culinary delights. From international cuisines to local favourites, attendees can indulge in a variety of mouthwatering dishes, ensuring there is something to satisfy every palate.

At the heart of the event will be live music. Lively melodies and infectious tunes will grace the sound stage, ensuring a memorable night filled with music and joy.

FREE ENTRY

*Applications for Food Vendors & Stallholders will open in January 2026. Email markets@jointheaction.co.nz to be notified when these open.

events.id: Nostalgia-Kapiti Equestrian & Vaulting Centre, 13b Nimmo Ave, Waikanae-Event Finder
events.name: Nostalgia
events.venue: Kapiti Equestrian & Vaulting Centre, 13b Nimmo Ave, Waikanae
events.long_description:
Nostalgia - A celebration of circus artistry, equestrian brilliance, and the greatest music across the generations.

Step back in time with us as we journey through the decades, showcasing unforgettable moments in musical history through breathtaking circus and equestrian performances. From inspiring big and small horses of all disciplines to some of Kāpiti’s finest performers, Nostalgia brings together the stars of yesterday and the rising stars of today.
Prepare to be amazed by a spectacular range of skills:
• Equestrian vaulting
• Dancing horses
• A thrilling fire-jumping act
• Spinning wheel performances
• Acrobatics and ensemble acts
• Aerial silk and hoop artistry
This is a truly family-friendly show with something for all ages—and we promise an experience you’ll never forget. We can’t wait to share it with you!

Food & Refreshments
A full food and drink stand will be open throughout the event, including a licensed bar, hot food, snacks, and refreshments. The stand will also be available during intermission.

Parking & Venue
We have plenty of onsite parking with helpers to guide you on arrival. Simply follow the driveway down to the Kapiti Equestrian and Vaulting Club—your suburban oasis for an unforgettable evening.

Don’t miss out—get your tickets now and join us for a magical celebration of music, movement, and memories!

events.id: Avalanche City + Mountain Boy-Wairarapa Events Centre, Holloway St, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Avalanche City + Mountain Boy
events.venue: Wairarapa Events Centre, Holloway St, Carterton
events.long_description:
Fresh off a completely sold-out 2025 New Zealand tour, Avalanche City returns with a renewed creative spark and a live show that highlights the heart of Dave Baxter’s songwriting. Since breaking through with the global hit Love Love Love, followed by another #1 hit Inside Out, Baxter has become known for his warm, cinematic indie-folk.

His performances are intimate, engaging, and full of the storytelling that has earned Avalanche City a devoted following.

Joining the tour is Mountain Boy, an NZ Folk-Rock artist who has made waves internationally with their EP From The Dust and self-produced debut album The Days. Mountain Boy has toured with The Paper Kites, Ziggy Alberts and Boy & Bear and sold out headline shows locally. If you were lucky enough to attend a show in the Avalanche City 2025 sold-out NZ tour, you may have caught a glimpse of his multi-instrumental genius. On this tour, he will be returning with a full set.

Audiences can expect a powerful blend of fan favourites and new material, an evening shaped by honesty, connection, and the unmistakable charm of Avalanche City + Mountain Boy.

events.id: Song Weavers-11 Hutchison Road, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Song Weavers
events.venue: 11 Hutchison Road, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join Lala Simpson (Madagascar & New Zealand) and Jitsvinger (South Africa) for a night of pure magic. Add your voice to create a tapestry of sounds that blends tradition to contemporary. Experience the joy of singing in community and journey together as wound weavers to empower and inspire each other. ALL WELCOME.
Jitsvinger is a multi-award-winning South African artist and educator whose practice centres on mentoring emerging writers and musicians through creative workshops focused on confidence, language, rhythm, and finding your own sound. His work uses spoken word, hip hop, theatre, and live music as tools to explore identity, heritage, and voice.
Rooted in the linguistic and musical cultures of Cape Town, his performance practice is known for its immediacy, wit, and high energy — creating intimate, shared spaces where poetry meets pulse.
Lala Simpson is a well-known and well respected song leader, composer and singer who delights young and old alike with her energetic and joyful way of teaching. She draws inspiration from her Malagasy roots where a singing circle is a welcoming place for all and rhythm, dance and melody are part of the whole. As a song leader, Lala is passionate about creating an environment where each singer can contribute and belong.
events.description:

events.id: MARSHA AND VELVETEEN WITH CRUELLY-Valhalla, Wellington-Valhalla
events.name: MARSHA AND VELVETEEN WITH CRUELLY
events.venue: Valhalla, Wellington
events.long_description:
Ōtautahi post punks Marsha and alt-rock outfit Velveteen are taking their loud and energetic live shows across the country. At the end of the 2025/26 summer, the two bands are taking on four shows in Wellington, Auckland, Christchurch, and Dunedin. Joining the tour are some of Aotearoa's finest bands around including Cruelly, Back to the Hillside, Pearly*, and Gracie Snow.
Marsha are Christchurch post punk, leaning on elements of indie and experimental rock. Taking influence from bands such as SPIRIT OF THE BEEHIVE, The Smiths, and Black Country, New Road. Following a successful 2025, Marsha are warming up for another big year.
Velveteen is the solo project of Jai Tudor Oakley based in Christchurch. It blends alternative rock, punk, and electronica with strong melodic hooks.
Tickets via UTR
