events.id: Weekend Laughs at Abandoned Taproom Petone - NZ Fringe Festival-Abandoned Taproom Petone, 38 Fitzherbert St, Petone, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Weekend Laughs at Abandoned Taproom Petone - NZ Fringe Festival
events.venue: Abandoned Taproom Petone, 38 Fitzherbert St, Petone, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Brought to you by LT McGuinness Ltd and Laughs on Tour

Weekend Laughs is a comedy showcase of some top NZ and international talent, right in the heart of Petone at Abandoned Taproom.

Each show features a changing lineup of your favourite comedians and up-and-coming talent.

Friday 21st and Saturday 22nd February features:
Jeremy Corbett
The host of 7Days, and one of NZ's favourite MCs and comedians, Jeremy has headlined stages around NZ, and is appearing for one night only on the Fringe Bar stage.
"A Classic Comedy legend" Scott Blanks, Director of The Classic

and Justine Smith
Having won the Billy T Award, the NZ Comedy Guild Best MC (three or four times) and the NZCG Best Female Comedian (like five or six times, losing count), Justine has established herself as one of the best bloody stand ups we have here in New Zealand.
Along with
Katy Borrows (Friday 20th Feb)
Elliott Lam (Friday 20th Feb)
Ralph Hilaga (Saturday 21st Feb)
Guanny Liu-Prosee (Saturday 21st Feb)

Friday 27th and Saturday 28th February
Jack Ansett - as seen on TaskmasterNZ
Jack has also appeared on Guy Montgomery's Guy-Mont Spelling Bee, the NZ Comedy Gala, and 7Days.

James Nokise
James has carved out a reputation in New Zealand going after everything from gangs, to politicians, to stereotypes within Pacific culture. Winner of the 2019 Fred Award, and the 2025 Topp Prize for contributions to NZ comedy.
Also featuring
Bobby Ghee
Lydia Sainsbury

Friday 6th and Saturday 7th March
Hoani Hotene - 2025 Billy T Award winner
A rising star in the NZ comedy scene, Hoani has opened for Joe Daymond, Tofiga, and more. His NZ Comedy Festival show sold out in 2025, and he returns for two nights only to his home base in Petone.

Also featuring 2026 Billy T Award nominee Kipling DC
Gabby Anderson (Friday 6th March)
Keegan Thomas (Friday 6th March)
and
Lianne Karaitiana (Saturday 7th March)
Leo Hollbrook (Saturday 7th March)


This event made possible with support from LT McGuinness Ltd, Kiwi Gaming Foundation, Hutt Mana Trust, Ava Lodge, and the Creative Communities scheme

events.id: SABRINA vs BILLIE: A Drag Fundraiser Smackdown-Ivy Bar and Cabaret, 63 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: SABRINA vs BILLIE: A Drag Fundraiser Smackdown
events.venue: Ivy Bar and Cabaret, 63 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Sabrina vs Billie
A drag fundraiser smackdown for InsideOUT

Friday 20 February 2026
Ivy Bar, Pōneke
Doors open 9.30pm | Show starts 10.00pm
R18
Tickets $20 (excluding Ticketing fees)
All ticket sales support InsideOUT

Kia ora pop girlies, sad banger devotees, fun and fierce lyrical loyalists, it’s time to pick a side…
Two chart icons. Four drag heavyweights. One stage. One night only.
Sabrina vs Billie is a glitter soaked drag smackdown where Wellington drag royalty channel the angst, allure and the absolute hits of Billie Eilish and Sabrina Carpenter, all in the name of fundraising fabulousness!
Think charity boxing meets Drag Race. Big lashes. Bigger feelings. No mercy for missed lyrics.

Fight Night
Three lip sync rounds.
Mystery tracks drawn from each diva’s discography.
Performers battle it out on accuracy, commitment and star power, with the final decision landing in the hands of you, the audience, alongside our judge!

Carpenters vs Eyelashes

Team Sabrina
Rainn Bowes (the hyper mobile hottie)
Faux Femme (she puts the pro in prolapse)

Team Billie
Veronica Heart (fatherless femme fatale)
Bobby Bottle Blonde (living proof blondes have more fun)

Judge
Robin Yablind (Burlesque Bro, known thief)
Hosted by
Selina Simone (Sinner & Showgirl, ya dad’s favourite)

Every ticket sold supports InsideOUT, helping create safer and stronger futures for queer and trans rangatahi.
Eyelashes and Carpenters, put your heels on, choose your fighter.
Sabrina vs Billie is coming to the ring.

This show is R18 - adults only. Expect drag, drama and a lot of chaos.

Accessibility
Wheelchair accessibility: Ivy Bar’s main entrance stairs can be avoided with prior notice. Please reach out so we can help with your specific access needs. We want your night to be perfect and apologies for the inconvenience this may cause.
Contact: steven@ivybar.co.nz
Subject line: Accessibility for Sabrina vs Billie

LGBTQIA+ friendly: Ivy Bar staff and security are trained to meet the needs of all patrons, ensuring a safe and welcoming space for everyone.

Big thanks to @jaredmakespictures for donating their incredible digital art and design.

events.name: Pre-'85 Classic's Trip into Orange Hut
events.venue: Akatarawa Forest,Upper Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Pre-'85 Classic's Trip into Orange Hut
SAVE THE DATE – PRE-’85 4x4 BBQ at ORANGE HUT!

Saturday, 21 February 2026

Classic 4WDs. Good Food. Great Company.

Dust off those old rigs, fire up your engines, and join us for a laid-back BBQ and catch-up with fellow classic 4x4 enthusiasts!

This isn’t your typical off-road trip — it’s a celebration of the vehicles that built the tracks we love. Whether it’s a bit rusty, beautifully restored, or a bush-basher with stories to tell — if it’s Pre-1985 and 4WD, it’s welcome.


Eligible Vehicles Include:

Toyota's | Series Land Rovers | Patrols | Jeeps | Suzuki's | And all classic off-road legends


️ Proposed Route:

(Subject to change based on weather & group size)

Valley View Road

McGhies Road → McGhies Bridge

Karapoti Road → 3rd Crossing

Pram Track, Dopers Track

Whakatikei Road → Titi Road

Fenceline Track → Hydro Valley Road

Cross the ford to Orange Hut for BBQ lunch

Hydro Road → Pylon

Toi Toi Road → Clearys → Cooks Ridge → Cooks Gate



LUNCH @ ORANGE HUT:

We’ll be firing up the wood BBQ to serve:

Sausages

Build-your-own Burgers
Bring a chair, bring your appetite, and bring your stories!



Post-Trip Dinner (Optional):

Depending on interest, we’re planning a casual dinner catch-up at Brewtown in the evening. Let us know if you're keen!



️ BONUS TRIP – SUNDAY 22 FEBRUARY

We're also planning a Sunday run into Orongorongo Station for those sticking around. Details to follow in the next update.



Tell your mates. Save the date. More info coming soon!

This is one for the books — let’s celebrate these classic rigs the right way.

#Pre85BBQ #Classic4x4s #OrangeHutRun #OldRigsNewMemories

Day Membership fee to NZFWDA $20 for all non NZFWDA Members


To register https://ccvcwellington.wildapricot.org/event-6350069?CalendarViewType=1&SelectedDate=2/10/2026

events.id: USUI REIKI LEVEL TWO IN KAPITI with Heartsong-Paraparaumu Memorial Hall-All Events In
events.name: USUI REIKI LEVEL TWO IN KAPITI with Heartsong
events.venue: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall
events.long_description:
USUI REIKI LEVEL TWO IN KAPITI with Heartsong
Level Two Usui Reiki is a significant development on from Level One. Get in touch to enquire. You can study Level Two with me if you had your Level One attunement elsewhere.

This TWO DAY course offers 10 hours of in person training, a full manual, certificate of completion, a follow up Zoom call and ongoing support. Maximum of 6 participants to enable close support and interaction.

Level 2 involves a new powerful attunement and learning new techniques such as Distance Reiki, sacred reiki symbols, and preparing for working on people you may not know. You can start charging for your Reiki services after completing level two.

We learn about three Reiki symbols and practice drawing them. By Day 2 it is expected that you have memorized how to draw Level 2 Symbols (I teach with a gap between day 1&2 so this is very achievable).

Becoming competent at distance healing is a significant priority of Level 2 training and we will have plenty of practice doing this. Distance healing is practiced on people and animals. Basic business set up is discussed.

Advanced Practitioner Level Reiki is a great tool if you want to feel centered in your life, it helps to balance and align our energy bodies, and can cause positive changes in many areas of our lives. Reiki can be used to help heal a wide number of conditions and to initiate and support positive life changes. Further details on enquiry. Reiki Level 2 opens you to a deeper channel of healing energy and enables you to offer healing professionally.

Dates are specially chosen to be auspicious in relation to the moon and cosmic energies

Saturday FEBRUARY 21ST, 10.am-4.30pm

Saturday MARCH 14TH, 10am-4.30pm

The gap in between the two training days allows you to receive support as you experience the 21 day 'cleanse' and integration period after the Reiki attunement - and also enable time to work on developing and practicing the material learnt in the first days training.

Total of 12 hours tuition time plus some at home practice/study required.

Light simple shared lunches are provided - you will need to bring a contribution.

Herbal teas and light snacks are also provided.

Location: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, Corner of Aorangi and Tutanekai Streets, Paraparaumu

Pre-enrollment questionnaire -

Investment:

£555 for full TWO day course, training, all support materials including manual, certificate, light healthy lunch, refreshments and ongoing support. Plus extra hours online in follow up Zoom call on 21st day.

Pay in Full Here - https://buy.stripe.com/9B628q2W4ahTghqdcKew81V

A non-refundable $155 deposit secures your place - book here: https://buy.stripe.com/eVqcN4bsA89LaX6b4Cew81S

There is a payment plan available - contact me

Bryony is a Usui Reiki Master Teacher and she has 27 years healing experience. She loves teaching this precious, versatile healing skill and it gives her great pleasure to offer this training in Lancaster

Bryony says:
Reiki has had a powerful positive influence on my life, helping me to heal and change mindset, physical and emotional conditions, and to see life in a new light. Reiki helped with my recovery from Chronic Fatigue syndrome and Depression ❤ I will share this with you in this course and help you open your life to the positive transformation that Reiki can bring.

If you are interested in coming on this course, please contact me by email at to receive a questionnaire to answer which gives me a sense of your interest, previous experience of Reiki healing and conditions I should be aware of.

Cancellation Policy:

If Heartsong Healing needs to cancel the course all payments are refunded. If you withdraw from the course before 14 days before start date, your payment will be refunded minus the 55 deposit, kept as an admin fee. If you withdraw within 14 -7 days 50% of your payment will be refunded, 7-3 days 75% of your payment will be refunded, 3 days no refund. If you need to withdraw, you may be entitled to a discount on future bookings, at our discretion.

events.id: Queen Elizabeth Park Open Day-Queen Elizabeth Park,Paraparaumu, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Queen Elizabeth Park Open Day
events.venue: Queen Elizabeth Park,Paraparaumu, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Queen Elizabeth Park Open Day
A summer celebration on the Kāpiti Coast!

Bring the whānau and join us for a fun-filled day at Queen Elizabeth Park next to beautiful Whareroa Beach. We’re celebrating 25 years of Greater Wellington’s summer events in your regional parks.

Explore the heart of this beloved park. Enjoy activities like:

Historic tram rides through the park

Face painting and crafts for the tamariki

Artisan Craft Market will be onsite with stalls and food trucks with delicious treats

Live performers Fairy Cat and her fairy friends will bring their magic.

This is your chance to experience one of our most iconic regional parks, known for its WWII U.S. Marines Camp history and wetland restoration projects. Pack a picnic, relax by the beach, and make a day of it!



Get the whānau involved in Summer Events

Discover the magic of your regional parks. For 25 years, Greater Wellington has been hosting recreational events that help people connect with nature, get active outdoors, and enjoy time together.

Queen Elizabeth Park is more than just a beautiful coastal space—it’s a hub for conservation. Greater Wellington’s work here protects freshwater and wetlands, restores native habitats, preserves historic sites, and helps build resilience to climate change. Our partners, mana whenua, and volunteers play a vital role in making this park a special place for everyone.
events.description:
Queen Elizabeth Park Open Day A summer celebration on the Kāpiti Coast!
Bring the whānau and join us for a fun-filled day at Queen Elizabeth Park next to beautiful Whareroa Beach.
We’re celebrating 25 years of Greater Wellington’s summer events in your regional parks.
Explore the heart of this beloved park.
Enjoy activities like: Historic tram rides through the park Face painting and crafts for the tamariki Artisan Craft Market will be onsite with stalls and food trucks with delicious treats Live performers Fairy Cat and her fairy friends will bring their magic.

events.id: Lacuna presents: Nice Girl tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: Lacuna presents: Nice Girl tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Presented by: Lacuna
Lacuna returns to Meow Nui for the first time in 2026 with an artist who has quietly become one of the most compelling selectors in underground dance music – Nice Girl.
Known for deep, emotive sets that move effortlessly between house, breaks, downtempo and leftfield club sounds, Nice Girl’s approach is patient, narrative-driven, and deeply human. Her selections feel intimate yet expansive, making her a perfect fit for the immersive setting of Meow Nui’s old church.
Following last year’s closer, Lacuna returns with a new setup and a renewed vision – reshaping the space to fully envelop sound, light, and atmosphere, drawing the room inward and closer to the music.
Following last year’s closer, Lacuna returns with a new setup and a renewed vision – reshaping the space to fully envelop sound, light, and atmosphere, drawing the room inward and closer to the music.
Support comes from Lacuna residents Benny Balance and Parry, going back-to-back for another extended B2P (Benny 2 Parry) session – a format that debuted at our last show and proved so natural and effective it had to return – built on groove, restraint, and trust in the dancefloor.
Also joining the lineup is a very special guest: Connor Tomoana – a dear friend of the project and a master of warm, rolling house selections, whose sets consistently blur the line between club energy and soulful release.
This is a night designed for listeners, dancers, and those who value the details.
Artist links:
www.instagram.com/jackpaz_
www.instagram.com/connortomoana/
www.instagram.com/benny.balance/

events.id: Lunar New Year: Tea Ceremony Demonstration With Wellington Xiamen Association-3 Jervois Quay, New Zealand 6011,3 Jervois Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Lunar New Year: Tea Ceremony Demonstration With Wellington Xiamen Association
events.venue: 3 Jervois Quay, New Zealand 6011,3 Jervois Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Lunar New Year: Tea Ceremony Demonstration With Wellington Xiamen Association
Ring in the Lunar New Year with a joyful celebration! Members of the Wellington Xiamen Association will host a special tea ceremony demonstration, sharing the artistry, history, and cultural significance of tea from Xiamen, Wellington’s ‘sister city’ and home to some of China’s finest teas.

This is a chance to pause, connect, and experience the beauty of tea culture in a welcoming setting. Wander through, listen to stories, and soak up the atmosphere as we mark the beginning of the Year of the Horse.

The Wellington Xiamen Association works to strengthen ties between our two cities through cultural exchange, education, and collaboration.


Saturday 21 February | 1pm–2:30pm

Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum

events.id: Haewai Summer Celebration Dinner-Houghton Bay-All Events In
events.name: Haewai Summer Celebration Dinner
events.venue: Houghton Bay
events.long_description:
Haewai Summer Celebration Dinner
Come and join our friendly local food celebration in our lovely old local Community Hall. The meal will include locally grown and foraged ingredients as well as some from not far away. We have another delicious vegetarian menu with plant based and gluten free options, created by Leone and the Seeds-to-Feeds helpers, including:

Mushroom tortellini, ratatouille, quinoa salad, foraged salad and ciabatta and rye bread;

Fruit and nut-based cakes and desserts;

Drinks from the wild South Coast.

We can’t wait to share beautiful kai from our ngāhere and local mārakai with you! Please sign up soon so that we have a good idea of numbers leading up to the event. Bookings are koha based, with a recommended $20 for an adult and $10 for a child if you can afford it. Otherwise you can just pay what you can afford, or if you can't afford anything we don't mind, we'd love to see you anyway!

Houghton Valley Community Hall
80 Houghton Bay Road

events.name: Microsoft Excel - Beginners
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
An introduction to this popular spreadsheeting package - basic Windows skills essential. Learn how to create and use spreadsheets, as well as identify elements of a workbook, enter and edit data, generate basic calculations and use built-in spreadsheet functions.

Windows skills essential - this is not a course for absolute beginners to computing.

By the end of the course, you'll have had a basic introduction to using MS Excel, including how to:
- Identify elements of a workbook
- Page setup and printing
- Enter and edit data and basic formatting
- Generate basic calculations
- Use cell references and built-in functions

Presented by Lachman Prasad.

events.id: Upper Hutt Gypsy Fair-Riverbank Park,42 Riverbank St, Upper Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Upper Hutt Gypsy Fair
events.venue: Riverbank Park,42 Riverbank St, Upper Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Upper Hutt Gypsy Fair
The Gypsy Fair is a nationwide travelling event, bringing family fun, live music and an unbeatable vibe to each town we visit.🌞💜

Having been on the road for over 45 years, it’s safe to say our roots run deep. Our people are incredible, and house trucks/buses are pretty cool too! So don’t forget to check out our unique way of living while you’re here 🫶🌿🌻💜

Whether you’re just having a browse, letting the kids loose on our rides, parking up with some food or coffee, or checking out some funky handmade crafts, we would love to see you! Come and hang out for the day, we’re sure to bring smiles to your faces, and create lifelong memories💜

🌞Free entry for everyone🌞 We pride ourselves on being an affordable event for every family. With free entertainment all day, plenty of chill out zones, and loads of life size games laying around, we truely love to see the community getting amongst it all! Can’t wait to see you there🌞👣🐝🌿🌊

Follow us on Facebook – ‘Gypsy Fair’ for updates on our travels and creations! We’re always open to anyone who wants to come and live the dream, so please email us if this sounds like a bit of you. –

You may also like the following events from The GypsyFair:
Next month, 26th September, 11:00 pm, Papamoa Gypsy Fair in Tauranga
This October, 3rd October, 11:00 pm, Gisborne Gypsy Fair in Gisborne
This October, 10th October, 11:00 pm, Havelock North Gypsy Fair in Havelock North
Also check out other Music events in Upper Hutt, Entertainment events in Upper Hutt.

events.long_description:
2026 Lunar New Year - Fireworks Display
Come celebrate the 2026 Lunar New Year with thunderous rhythms of taiko drumming and dragon dancers in the heart of Wellington and a spectacular fireworks by the Wellington Waterfront. 🎆

🎶 Galloping into the New Year | Courtenay Place, Te Papa, and Upper Frank Kitts Park | 7.30 - 9 pm

Taiko drummers and dragon dancers will provide pre-Fireworks entertainment in Courtenay Place, Te Papa and Upper Frank Kitts Park.

✨ Fireworks Display | Wellington Waterfront | 9.30 pm
Watch the night sky light up in brilliant red, symbolising strength, unity, and the spirit of a new year filled with prosperity, good health and happiness.

If the fireworks can't go ahead due to bad weather, it will move to 28 February 2026, 9.30 pm.

🏮For more information on what the evening will bring, check out the Galloping into the New Year event https://www.facebook.com/events/1250303523797629/

events.id: Women's Health and Aging Workshop-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Women's Health and Aging Workshop
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Movement and function can be challenging for women as we age. Join experienced physiotherapist Sara Dore and explore how you can manage the effects on your health and wellbeing as you age as a woman. (Free for NZ Citizens/Residents, others pay fee of $99)

An interactive workshop presented by experienced physiotherapist Sara Dore, focusing on how movement and function can be challenging for women as they age. Particularly for women, there is more to the core than abdominal muscles and strength and we explore these broader aspects. Most importantly, you will come to understand that movement is medicine and we can make a difference.

You will be able to make a positive difference for yourself! The objective of this workshop is to give you knowledge and understanding about how you can manage the effects on your health and wellbeing as we age as women
Knowledge is power!

In this one-day workshop you will discover:
- The base of the pelvic floor. Anatomy of the pelvic floor, and the common conditions urinary incontinence, and pelvic organ prolapse will be discussed. Education on basic pelvic floor advice and management as well as appropriate exercises will also covered.
- The middle deep abdominal muscles. Trunk stability versus core strength as we age and the impact on our other core muscles and pelvic floor will be discussed. The principles of Clinical Pilates versus traditional Pilates will be presented together with he key principles of movement is medicine.
-The importance of the diaphragm and breathing well will also be discussed to enhance optimal movement and function for women.

Please wear comfortable clothes and socks as this is an interactive workshop.
Tea and coffee provided, please bring your lunch and snacks.

A condition of enrolment is that you must provide photo ID when you attend the workshop.
Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions "What You Need to Know".
events.description:
Movement and function can be challenging for women as we age.
Most importantly, you will come to understand that movement is medicine and we can make a difference.
The objective of this workshop is to give you knowledge and understanding about how you can manage the effects on your health and wellbeing as we age as women Knowledge is power!
In this one-day workshop you will discover: - The base of the pelvic floor.
Trunk stability versus core strength as we age and the impact on our other core muscles and pelvic floor will be discussed.

events.id: Lost Wax in Three Sessions - Hard Wax - Sat mornings-Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Lost Wax in Three Sessions - Hard Wax - Sat mornings
events.venue: Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki
events.long_description:
Over three sessions, create stunning jewellery using the age-old lost wax technique. This is an excellent opportunity to treat yourself to some creative fun on Saturday mornings!

In weeks one and tw,o you'll learn how to work with jeweller's hard wax to create beautiful textures in metal that can be used to create amazing rings or objects. Your waxes will be sent away for casting in the metal of your choice.

Then there will be a week's break before the third session, to allow time for everyone's waxes to be cast. The third session covers how to trim, clean and finish your casts, turning them into original jewellery ready to wear!

More advanced students can use these sessions to complete projects in a class setting.

Included in the class fee are all your different types of waxes, sandpaper and courier costs.

Not included are the casting and metal costs, which vary from student to student depending on what-sized ring they want to make and the type of metal they choose. Small castings can cost around $6.65 - $12 and might cost between $7 - $30 in metals, depending on whether you use red bronze, white bronze or silver.

This class is great for teens and kids over 12 or so. Anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

events.long_description:
Petone Rotary Fair 2026 is a vibrant community fair and market event in Petone, bringing Jackson Street to life with food trucks, market stalls, live entertainment, and family-friendly activities.

This popular annual Wellington event features a wide range of artisan stalls, handmade crafts, local businesses, street food, coffee, and sweet treats, making it a must-visit for food lovers and market fans. Enjoy live music and performances from the stage on Elizabeth St, helping create a lively festival atmosphere for all ages.

Proudly organised by Rotary Club members of Petone, the Petone Rotary Fair supports local community projects and charities, so every visit helps give back. With free entry, a welcoming atmosphere, and something for everyone, it’s one of the best family events in Lower Hutt and Wellington.

events.name: Wairarapa Wines Harvest Festival, presented by James Henry Ltd
events.venue: The Cliffs, Dakins Road, Carterton
events.long_description:
James Henry Ltd presents Wairarapa Wines Harvest Festival, a celebration of wine, food, and entertainment. This event brings together Wairarapa's finest wineries, high-profile eateries, and food producers for a day of indulgence set amidst the stunning backdrop of ancient native trees and a picturesque riverside setting.

Indulge your taste buds as you sample the region's finest wines, savour delicious culinary creations, and discover the incredible flavours of Wairarapa. From award-winning wineries to renowned eateries, the festival showcases the very best the region has to offer.

Conveniently located just 10 minutes from both Masterton and Carterton, the festival site is easily accessible to both locals and visitors to the district. For those who prefer to drive, free parking will be available. However, we encourage you to make life easier by taking advantage of our regional shuttle service. The shuttle will run to and from the festival site at the beginning and end of the day, ensuring a hassle-free experience for all.

Don't miss out on this extraordinary event that combines the rich flavours of Wairarapa wines, delicious kai, and a vibrant atmosphere filled with live entertainment. Join us at Wairarapa Wines Harvest Festival presented by James Henry Ltd and immerse yourself in a day of pure indulgence and enjoyment.

events.name: 3 Course Lunch at Le Cordon Bleu | 21 FEBRUARY 2026
events.venue: Le Cordon Bleu New Zealand,Level 2, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
3 Course Lunch at Le Cordon Bleu | 21 FEBRUARY 2026
Step out of Wellington and enjoy a 3 course Parisian Bistro menu. 

IMPORTANT NOTE: Tables arranged per order

About this Event


This 3-Course lunch expertly prepared by our Cuisine students is not to be missed.
FRENCH BISTRO: This menu is not like our fine dining dinner services, it is a relaxed service designed to emulate an authentic bistro experience from the streets of Paris.

Ticket Information
IMPORTANT NOTE: Tables are arranged per order. If you purchase tickets separately you need to e-mail to advise which other ticket holders you wish to be seated with.
(We are hosting additional lunch sessions, to purchase tickets for alternate dates please click here. Tickets are non-transferable, please ensure you purchase tickets for the correct date.)
Date: Saturday 21st February
Price: $45 per person
Booking Times: 12:00pm | 12:30pm | 1:00pm
Dietary Requirements: Our menu is set and we are unable to make any menu alterations or cater to any specific dietary requirements (including religious diets) or food allergies. We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause.
The Menu: will not be released before the event. Please be aware that the menu will include fish, meat and shellfish components.
Tickets are allocated for specific seating times, please ensure you arrive promptly at the time indicated on your ticket.
The estimated time to enjoy the full Le Cordon Bleu 3 course dining experience is 1 hour. We invite you to sit back, relax and enjoy our students' creations.




What is Brasserie Le Cordon Bleu?
Brasserie Le Cordon Bleu is our training restaurant where our students get practical experience in a real restaurant environment - all under the expert guidance of their chef lecturers. In the kitchen, we have students from our Diplôme de Cuisine programme. In the dining room we have our Bachelor of Culinary Arts and Business students serving you and putting their theory skills into practice.

Brasserie & High Tea Refund Policy
• No refunds are provided unless the event is cancelled by Le Cordon Bleu NZ.
• Customers can arrange for someone else to take their place.

events.name: Lunar New Year: Tea Ceremony Demonstration With Wellington Xiamen Asso
events.venue: Wellington Museum, 3 Jervois Quay, Queens Wharf, Wellington
events.long_description:
Ring in the Lunar New Year with a joyful celebration! Members of the Wellington Xiamen Association will host a special tea ceremony demonstration, sharing the artistry, history, and cultural significance of tea from Xiamen, Wellington’s sister city, and home to some of China’s finest teas.

This is a chance to pause, connect, and experience the beauty of tea culture in a welcoming setting. Wander through, listen to stories, and soak up the atmosphere as we mark the beginning of the Year of the Horse.

The Wellington Xiamen Association works to strengthen ties between our two cities through cultural exchange, education, and collaboration.

Saturday 21 February | 1pm–2:30pm

Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum

events.id: A Journey Through the Chakras Workshop - Journey 1- the Root Chakra-Lotus Yoga Centre, 91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
events.name: A Journey Through the Chakras Workshop - Journey 1- the Root Chakra
events.venue: Lotus Yoga Centre, 91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
A Kundalini Yoga and Gong Bath workshop to provide grounding, safety and stability

In 2026, I’ll be guiding a journey through the chakras — a series of workshops designed to support balance, awareness, and nervous system regulation throughout the year.

The Root Chakra Journey is the first step in this series and focuses on creating a strong, steady foundation from which everything else can grow.

The Root Chakra (Muladhara) is the base of our energy system. It governs our sense of safety, stability, belonging, and connection to the physical world — home, body, trust, finances, and basic needs. By strengthening this energetic centre, we cultivate resilience, stability, and a deeper sense of being held and supported in life. When it’s out of balance, we may experience anxiety, restlessness, fatigue, or a sense of disconnection.

This workshop is an invitation to slow down, reconnect with your body, and strengthen your inner foundation through movement, breath, sound, and rest.

- Kundalini Yoga - to awaken and stabilise the root chakra: 1.30pm – 3.00pm

- Break: Herbal tea, healthy snack & oracle cards

- Gong Bath - a restorative practice to settle the body and mind: 3.30pm – 4.30pm

** Come for one session or enjoy the full workshop experience.

** Open to all levels – no experience with yoga or sound healing needed.

** Bring an open heart, a yoga mat, blanket, water bottle and anything you need to feel cozy + supported.

Investment: $35 Yoga | $30 Gong Bath | $55 Both

*** 3 workshop special: $150 to attend both the Yoga and the Gong Bath sessions for Chakra Journeys 1 - 3 (being held on 21 Feb, 3 May and 31 May).

Lay down strong roots, regulate your nervous system, and begin a year-long journey of energy awareness and self-connection.

events.name: Roses: a Symbol of Love - Guided Walk
events.venue: Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington
events.long_description:
Rose gardens have had a focus in our Botanic Garden since 1886 when they were established in the area of Hector's Teaching Garden. In this walk we will enjoy the roses as they emerge from their winter rest. We will learn how hybridisers and their families have fallen in love with roses, devoting their lives to develop varieties influenced by history and those they wanted to remember.

Meet at the Lady Norwood Rose Garden beside the Begonia House
Cost: $10 - book now
Free for Friends

This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden. They run throughout the year with a different topic every time.
Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

events.name: Draw It Out - Direction for the New Year
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
THEME: Curiosity and direction for the new year.

Guided drawings to explore the vibe for your year ahead and what you may need to support you.

Join us for a DRAW IT OUT drawing for wellness workshop. Practice the ‘art’ of drawing and writing for wellness. This 1.5 hour workshop takes you through guided cues (similar to meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at, draw out how you are feeling, and draw out your own inner guidance.

We all have the resources within to guide us, this workshop creates the space to access this by using a modality called Interactive Drawing Therapy. Facilitated by Lara Phillips, this is not therapy rather drawing for wellness; a guided workshop to build one’s relationship with oneself, to strengthen self-reflection and self-care.

No drawing skills required, this is more mark making not art making.

events.id: Stacking Rings - Taster-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Stacking Rings - Taster
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Create your very own ring stack from copper, brass and sterling silver in this fast, fun and highly rewarding workshop!

Guided by our experienced and supportive tutors, you’ll be introduced to the fundamental skills of jewellery making while creating a small collection of rings to take home and treasure.

During this 3-hour class, you’ll learn how to measure your finger, cut metal to size, and add textures and patterns using hammers and punches. From there, you’ll be shown how to solder your rings together with a jeweller’s torch before finishing them with filing, sanding and polishing techniques. Along the way, our tutors will share tips and tricks, patiently guiding you so you feel confident every step of the way.

By the end of the session, you’ll have crafted a thick sterling silver ring and stack of a copper or brass rings. Two plain round wires to texture up as you like, and a choice of decorative brass pearl-wire, or square wire.

Each ring you make is completely your own, whether you keep them sleek and simple or experiment with texture and pattern. You’ll leave not only with a stylish, wearable ring stack, but also with the joy of having made something truly unique with your own hands.

This class is perfect for beginners, groups of friends, or visitors wanting a memorable creative experience. Many students find jewellery making a wonderfully mindful activity - slowing down, working with their hands and enjoying the calming rhythm of making.

Your class fee includes all materials, plus all consumables such as solder, sandpaper and polishing materials. Extra silver and other metals are available for purchase in the studio if you’d like to expand your collection or upgrade one of your brass / copper wires for a second silver one.

Children aged 12 and up are welcome, though anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

Come along, have fun, and create jewellery you’ll be proud to wear, or a gift for someone special!
events.description:
Create your very own ring stack from copper, brass and sterling silver in this fast, fun and highly rewarding workshop!
During this 3-hour class, you’ll learn how to measure your finger, cut metal to size, and add textures and patterns using hammers and punches.
By the end of the session, you’ll have crafted a thick sterling silver ring and stack of a copper or brass rings.
You’ll leave not only with a stylish, wearable ring stack, but also with the joy of having made something truly unique with your own hands.
Extra silver and other metals are available for purchase in the studio if you’d like to expand your collection or upgrade one of your brass / copper wires for a second silver one.

events.id: Summer Sessions I Under the Stars I An Evening at Ata Rangi-Ata Rangi Winery, 14 Puruatanga Rd, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Summer Sessions I Under the Stars I An Evening at Ata Rangi
events.venue: Ata Rangi Winery, 14 Puruatanga Rd, Martinborough
events.long_description:
Join us at Ata Rangi for a long-table dinner amongst the vines - an evening brimming with beautiful food, exceptional wine, and lively company.

Savour seasonal, locally inspired cuisine by Ant North, celebrated for dishes that bring the best of the Wairarapa to the table. Served family-style, each course is paired with a hand-picked selection of Ata Rangi wines, while Sam Auger’s warm, intimate evening sets create the perfect soundtrack for the night.

Your ticket includes a generous, joy-filled evening:

- Welcome drinks at sunset
- Long-table dining amongst the vines
- Seasonal food shared family-style
- A curated selection of Ata Rangi wines
- Time to connect, relax, and celebrate
- Live music to match the evening

Set beneath the stars of Wairarapa’s Dark Sky Reserve, this promises to be an unforgettable night. Gather your friends and join the extended Ata Rangi family for an intimate celebration full of laughter, wine, and magic from dusk until dark.

events.id: Earth Tongue-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Earth Tongue
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
Fresh off the announcement of their forthcoming third album Dungeon Vision, Aotearoa’s heavy-psych duo Earth Tongue return home this February for a run of six exclusive shows across the country. The tour comes off the back of the band’s whirlwind international touring cycle and gives fans the earliest chance to hear brand-new material. 
The first show lands on the day of Dungeon Vision’s release, playing at the Turner Centre, Kerikeri on Friday 13 February. They’ll follow that up in Auckland’s Double Whammy on Saturday 14 February and then Last Place, Hamilton on Sunday 15 February. The duo then travel south for a run in Dunedin at Pearl Diver on Thursday 19 February, Space Academy in Christchurch on Friday 20 February before heading to Wellington on Saturday 21 February to finish the tour at the iconic San Fran. 
Guitarist Gussie Larkin and drummer Ezra Simmons have been based in Berlin, writing and recording Dungeon Vision with Los Angeles garage-rock icon Ty Segall who together have captured Earth Tongue’s most immersive and ambitious work yet. With anticipation building after unveiling their towering title track ‘Dungeon Vision’ and its handcrafted, cinematic music video - Earth Tongue edge fans toward a set of shows which bring a fully realised Dungeon Vision experience.  
Earth Tongue - Dungeon Vision (Official Music Video)
With their world-building aesthetic, relentless energy and cemented spot as one of our most electrifying psych-rock acts, Earth Tongue are sure to provide an unforgettable show - celebrating the release of their most visionary record to date. Don’t miss them playing in Aotearoa this February.
events.description:
Fresh off the announcement of their forthcoming third album Dungeon Vision, Aotearoa’s heavy-psych duo Earth Tongue return home this February for a run of six exclusive shows across the country.

The duo then travel south for a run in Dunedin at Pearl Diver on Thursday 19 February, Space Academy in Christchurch on Friday 20 February before heading to Wellington on Saturday 21 February to finish the tour at the iconic San Fran.
Guitarist Gussie Larkin and drummer Ezra Simmons have been based in Berlin, writing and recording Dungeon Vision with Los Angeles garage-rock icon Ty Segall who together have captured Earth Tongue’s most immersive and ambitious work yet.
With anticipation building after unveiling their towering title track ‘Dungeon Vision’ and its handcrafted, cinematic music video - Earth Tongue edge fans toward a set of shows which bring a fully realised Dungeon Vision experience.

events.id: The Night Ali Died-Gryphon Theatre, 22 Ghuznee St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Night Ali Died
events.venue: Gryphon Theatre, 22 Ghuznee St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Ali is wanted dead by a vicious London Gangster and is placed under police surveillance for the protection of him and his family, yet for some reason, on one night, Ali decides to sneak out into the night and leave his family behind, sparking a bloody domino effect that ricochets through the sleepystreets of Norwich.

Through the brutal accounts of Ali, a henchman, a detective and a mob boss, find out what on earth happened on the night Ali died.

The Night Ali Died is the second multi-award winning solo thriller by Christopher
Sainton-Clark (A Year and a Day). It premiered at Prague Fringe 2025 and won three awards in its first ever run including a vote as audience favourite. Described as ‘like watching a Tarantino film onstage’ by Theatreandartsreviews.com, its cinematic style and bold and punchy soundtrack took over the Prague festival with an electric buzz.

'BLOODY, GRIPPING AND EXCITING' Binge Fringe
'SAINTON-CLARK GIVES AN OUTSTANDING PERFORMANCE' Theatre and art reviews
'LIKE WATCHING A TV CRIME DRAMA CONDENSED INTO ONE HOUR' Broadway Baby
WINNER OF THE PRAGUE FRINGE PERFORMANCE AWARD
WINNER OF THE PRAGUE FRINGE AUDIENCE AWARD
WINNER OF THE BROADWAY BABY PICK OF THE FRINGE AWARD
NOMINEE FOR THE PRAGUE FRINGE INSPIRATION AWARD
NOMINEE FOR THE NEW YORK SOHO PLAYHOUSE FRINGE ENCORE SERIES

Through the brutal accounts of Ali, a henchman, a detective and a mob boss, find out what on earth happened on the night Ali died.
The Night Ali Died is the second multi-award winning solo thriller by Christopher Sainton-Clark (A Year and a Day).

Wellington's premiere Asian drag divas, Ness Quick, Faux Femme and Foxy Cleopatra, have come together to put on a brilliant, show stopping, lunar new year spectacular.

Ring in the Lunar New Year with a dazzling drag celebration honoring the power, artistry, and traditions of Asian performers! inspired by Lunar New Year symbolism, East and south Asian heritage, and its connection to our drag, Join us as we welcome luck, prosperity, and new beginnings through sickening drag performances. Artisan Craft Market (22/2/26 Lower Hutt)
The Artisan Craft Market is a premium handmade event that takes place across various locations in the broader Wellington region. This high-quality market is designed to foster a welcoming and friendly atmosphere.

Our vision at Artisan Craft Market is to make the market accessible to those who appreciate shopping locally. We aim to provide a platform that supports local artisans, allowing them to showcase their meticulously crafted, high-quality products. By bringing the market directly to the people, we hope to celebrate and promote the unique talents of our community’s skilled artisans.

events.long_description:
BANQUET DINNER - CNY/LUNAR NEW YEAR Of The Horse at Dragons Restaurant, Wellington
1-Night Only! Let’s Celebrate the Year of the Horse together!
RSVP NOW – OPEN FOR ALL
CNY / Lunar New Year Celebration Dinner 2026

Join the New Zealand Malaysian Society for a festive dinner to welcome the Lucky Year of the Horse. Bring your family and friends and enjoy a night of good food, prosperity, and the traditional Malaysian-style Yee Sang toss for good fortune in the year ahead.

Date: Sunday, 22 February 2026
Time: 6:30 pm
Venue: Dragons Restaurant, 25 Tory Street, Wellington
Ticket Prices
• $53 – NZMS 2026 Members
• $58 – Non-members
• $42 – Children (5–12 years old)
• Or BOOK A TABLE OF 10

Amazing Banquet MENU!
1- Prosperity Salmon fish YEE SANG aka Lo Sang (Fresh Salmon toss salad)
2- Crispy Roast Pork or Fried Squid (Squid is for Halal table only)
3- Lohan Chai with Fatt Choy
4- Roast Duck
5- Fried Kai Lan with garlic
6- Flavourful Chicken with Chestnuts and Lotus Root
7- Vegetarian Long Life Noodles
8- Steam WHOLE FISH
9- Salt and Pepper Prawns
10- Pan-fried Nien Gou ( Sweet Festive Glutinous Rice Cakes)
11- Fresh Fruit Platter
12- Steam Rice

Food prices have gone up but we ensure our tickets remain the same as last year. Seats are not provided for children under 5. Baby chairs available on request, first come first served.

What’s included
Festive Malaysian dishes, Traditional Lion Dance, Lucky Draws, and Raffle Prizes. Prize donations and sponsors are welcome.

RSVP Now to:

Your RSVP Details (must include):
Whether you and your guests are NZMS 2026 members
Full names of all guests
RSVP closing and final payment date: 18 February 2026
Tickets are non-refundable within 72 hours of the event

events.id: An Audience with Sam Neill-1 Taranaki Street, New Zealand 6011,1A Taranaki St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: An Audience with Sam Neill
events.venue: 1 Taranaki Street, New Zealand 6011,1A Taranaki St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
An Audience with Sam Neill
An Audience with Sam Neill
In conversation with Ian Fraser
7pm drinks, 7.30pm show
Sunday 22 Feb 2026

Join us for a rare and intimate evening with one of Aotearoa’s most celebrated performers. As Circa marks its 50th anniversary, we are honoured to welcome Sir Sam Neill back to the theatre where he first appeared in 1976 in Juno and the Paycock.

In conversation with broadcaster and writer Ian Fraser, Sir Sam will reflect on his extraordinary career spanning more than 150 film, television and documentary roles; his early life in Christchurch; his deep commitment to environmental advocacy; and his enduring connection to Aotearoa.

This special one-night-only event is a fundraiser for the Theatre Artists Charitable Trust (TACT), supporting the next generation of theatre-makers to build sustainable careers and continue creating world-class work in Wellington.

events.long_description:
NEW SHOW | Hothouse Flowers // Wellington // Meow Nui // 18+
𝑫𝒆𝒔𝒕𝒓𝒐𝒚 𝑨𝒍𝒍 𝑳𝒊𝒏𝒆𝒔 𝑷𝒓𝒆𝒔𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒔

𝐇𝐨𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐮𝐬𝐞 𝐅𝐥𝐨𝐰𝐞𝐫𝐬
𝘝𝘪𝘴𝘵𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘕𝘡 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘧𝘪𝘳𝘴𝘵 𝘵𝘪𝘮𝘦 𝘪𝘯 20 𝘠𝘦𝘢𝘳𝘴

Sᴜɴᴅᴀʏ 22 Fᴇʙʀᴜᴀʀʏ, 2026
Mᴇᴏᴡ Nᴜɪ, Wᴇʟʟɪɴɢᴛᴏɴ 18+
Dᴏᴏʀs 7.00ᴘᴍ

𝗧𝗶𝗰𝗸𝗲𝘁𝘀:
➟ https://daltours.cc/26HHF-well

*********

Renowned for their explosive blend of rock ‘n’ roll, Irish folk and American gospel, Ireland’s legendary Hothouse Flowers, are set to return to Australia for the first time in 20 long years for a highly anticipated tour in February 2026.

The Dubliner's passionate fusion of rock, folk and gospel has captivated audiences worldwide for the last four decades. From their humble street performing roots in Dublin to global stages, the band continues to deliver electrifying performances that blend cultural storytelling and raw musical spirit with spontaneity and soulful energy.

After winning the Street Entertainers of the Year award in 1985, the band caught the eye of U2’s Bono, leading to a record deal with PolyGram. Their 1988 debut album, People, topped the Irish charts and hit number two in the UK, establishing them as a captivating live band with a dedicated global fanbase. The album features their highest streaming single to date, the utterly sublime, Don't Go.

Home followed in 1990 and featured the band’s gorgeous cover of the Johnny Nash classic, I Can See Clearly Now, which was given a new lease of life and used to stunning affect in the opening scene of 2016's Jeremy Clarkson's Grand Tour TV show. Watch the incredible intro here. Home along with 93’s Songs From the Rain cemented the bands place as one Ireland’s greats. The Australian tour follows the release of their latest album, Let’s Do This Thing (2020)

Known for their unpredictable energy and impromptu improvisation, every Hothouse Flowers show is unique experience. From rock anthems to soulful ballads and traditional songs that evoke the emotional weight of Irish storytelling, the band’s performances are a journey through musical and cultural landscapes. Their shows are marked by humour, raw expression and a deep connection with audiences, making each gig a one of a kind event.

Don’t miss one of the most celebrated returns of the year!

events.id: Artisan Craft Market-Dowse Square, Laings Road, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Artisan Craft Market
events.venue: Dowse Square, Laings Road, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
The Artisan Craft Market is a premium handmade event that takes place across various locations in the broader Wellington region. This high-quality market is designed to foster a welcoming and friendly atmosphere.

Our vision at Artisan Craft Market is to make the market accessible to those who appreciate shopping locally. We aim to provide a platform that supports local artisans, allowing them to showcase their meticulously crafted, high-quality products. By bringing the market directly to the people, we hope to celebrate and promote the unique talents of our community’s skilled artisans.

Come support local at our monthly market in Lower Hutt City outside at the Dowse Square!

events.id: 2026 Lunar New Year - Asian Market - Craft Stalls-TSB Arena, Queens Wharf, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: 2026 Lunar New Year - Asian Market - Craft Stalls
events.venue: TSB Arena, Queens Wharf, Wellington
events.long_description:
Celebrate Lunar New Year by immersing yourself in a bustling street market in the heart of TSB Arena where you will experience a rich tapestry of Asian arts, craft and culture!

Explore a kaleidoscope of stalls and displays from local community groups and organisations.

The market will be a celebration of the beauty and diversity of the cultural traditions and heritage of our Asian communities, with plenty of things to buy – unique trinkets, or things to try – traditional Chinese robes and costumes.

This will be a fantastic experience of an Asian street market in the coolest little capital in the world.

Floor plan to come!

events.id: Forest & Bird WALK a New Reserve - Mātai Moana / Watts Peninsula-Massey Memorial, Massey Rd, Maupuia, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Forest & Bird WALK a New Reserve - Mātai Moana / Watts Peninsula
events.venue: Massey Memorial, Massey Rd, Maupuia, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us for a guided walk over Mātai Moana / Watts Peninsula (North end of Miramar Peninsula). This guided walk will celebrate the Government announcement (September 2025), that the 72 hectare area is now a Public Reserve and DOC land.
The area's attractions include:
1. strong historical, cultural and military values, (several kainga and pā, and military history from 1880s), and has hosted several prisons, including a prison garden
2. some superb 360 degree views of Wellington Harbour
3. no major animal pest species and while much of the land is grass or in pines, there are several sizable and growing areas of regenerating native bush.
Moderate fitness will be needed. Our walk is expected to take a little over 2.5 hours. It will traverse a mixture of sealed roads and walking tracks with some uneven ground and two quite steep sections, from sea level to 163m above sea level. One section has a gradient of 30 degrees for a short section. There are some stiles to climb over.
Meet opposite the steps up to Massey Memorial at 130 Massey Road, Point Halwsell, Mapuia, Wellington, 6022. This is about 450m south of Point Halswell, and 500m north of the northern end of Shelly Bay. Location of the meeting point: approx 41°17'15" S, 174°49'26.5" E. A Forest & Bird Flag will be on display. See map for meeting spot and car parking suggestions. Please arrive in time to confirm your attendance and receive a quick pre-walk briefing.
Arrive by 12.50 p.m. on Sunday 22 February 2026. Please register on EventFinda in advance - limited to 40 walkers. All aged 10 or more, are welcome - you do not have to be a Forest & Bird member. All children must be accompanied by an adult who takes responsibility for them. Please bring your own sunhat, sunblock, snacks, any personal medications plus water bottle and wear good walking shoes/boots. There is no public transport to the meeting point.
If weather is wet/unsuitable, a decision to postpone will be made by 11:00 a.m. on Sunday 22 February 2026, and a group email will be issued to all those who have registered. Contact Ken New on ken.new@branch.forestandbird.org.nz for any enquiries.
Please register on EventFinda.

events.id: Summer Wild Edible Weeds Foraging Workshop-Innermost Gardens, Wellington, Lawson Place, Wellington, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Summer Wild Edible Weeds Foraging Workshop
events.venue: Innermost Gardens, Wellington, Lawson Place, Wellington, Wellington
events.long_description:
Explore the wonders of Wild Edible Weeds Foraging Workshops, situated in the scenic community gardens in Mount Victoria, Wellington.

Embark on a journey into nature, uncovering a world teeming with wild, edible plants. This workshop, centred on abundant, delicious, and nutritious edible weeds and commonly found plants, will leave you enthusiastic about foraging in your own backyard and local neighbourhood.

During this immersive, outdoor, multi-sensory learning experience, we will:

Delve into the basic principles of sustainable and ethical foraging and wild harvesting.
Learn the botanical names of plants along with their various common names.
Confidently identify 10-20 wild plants, including details about lookalikes and toxic plants to avoid.
Explore the nutritional and medicinal properties of each plant, discovering how to prepare simple healing remedies at home.
Understand how to prepare each plant for maximum nutrition and flavour, discussing easy recipes and cooking tips.
Uncover the folklore and history of each plant, hearing fascinating and often amusing stories that help us connect with the plants and our ancestors.

Leave the workshop feeling empowered with the skills and knowledge needed to deepen your connection to food, bolster local food resilience, and enhance security throughout the natural cycles of the seasons. Say goodbye to the supermarket; instead, gather your own wild greens on the way home for a delightful dinner.

For more info: www.wildbotanica.co.nz
or email Felicity@wildbotanica.co.nz

From Elton John and Fleetwood Mac to Ed Sheeran, Bruno Mars, and Queen, Cam & Sam bring decades of hits to life — the perfect soundtrack to a Sunday session.

events.id: Giant Crepe Wallflower-Ventana Art Space, 7 Kitchener Street, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Giant Crepe Wallflower
events.venue: Ventana Art Space, 7 Kitchener Street, Martinborough
events.long_description:
Hands-on learning to create your very own voluminous, oversized crepé paper flower, a sculptural statement piece that’s equal parts art and joy.

In this immersive workshop, you’ll be guided through every step of the process from choosing the perfect colour palette to cutting, curling, shaping, and assembling each petal by hand. It’s a meditative, rewarding craft that requires patience, but with the right techniques (and a few of my favourite tricks!), you’ll be amazed at what you can create.

Price: $90

Martinborough:
Sunday 22nd Feb | 2-430pm
Saturday 14th March | 10-1230pm
Easter Monday 6th April | 10-1230pm

Location:
Ventana Art Space
7 Kitchener Street, Martinborough

events.id: Tiptoe Through the Tombstones-Bolton Street Cemetery, Bolton Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Tiptoe Through the Tombstones
events.venue: Bolton Street Cemetery, Bolton Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Starting at the Bolton Street Cemetery Museum, lower Bolton Street at 2.00 pm, the Tiptoe Through the Tombstones tour makes its way at a leisurely pace through the cemetery from the Museum in lower Bolton Street to the Seddon Memorial at the top gates, traversing a number of heritage features of Bolton Street Cemetery, while recounting fascinating stories about many of the people buried therein.

The tour is 1.5 hours in duration, is easy walking, and ends at c. 3.30 pm. Cost $10 per person, children under 12 free, good dogs on leads always welcome.

events.id: Climate Action Week Marlborough 2026-Blenheim, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Climate Action Week Marlborough 2026
events.venue: Blenheim, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Climate Action Week 2026 - Agenda
Dates: February 2026 - 23rd - 27th February
Theme: Leading by Doing: Local Businesses, Local Solutions, Collective Action
Each day features:
Morning: Local Business Story Sessions (Curated stories for our business community to get inspired with raw, honest and authentic stories)
Midday: Action Design Workshops (Crafting Plans & Solutions)
Afternoon: Immersion Experiences and Hands-On Field Visits (Applied Learning & Practical Support)
Day 1 - Water, Risk and Resilience 
Morning: Marlborough businesses facing water risks (horticulture, viticulture, manufacturing, nature, tourism) share adaptation stories: irrigation shifts, stormwater projects, water reuse innovations.
Midday: Business-specific water risks and trials of resilience-building solutions.
Afternoon: Immersion experiences to diverse water initiatives across the region
Day 2 - Circular economy & waste
Morning: Circular leaders (including wine, food and beverages, building, construction, fisheries, nature) show how they have reduced waste, repurposed byproducts, or created new revenue streams from "waste."
Midday: Waste Challenge Mapping: Identify business-specific waste streams + select 1 trial action for next 6 months.
Afternoon: Immersion experiences to waste initiatives and innovative approaches across the region
Day 3 - Nature and Biodiversity 
Morning: Farmers, viticulturists & landscapers share regenerative planting, biodiversity corridors, and ecosystem services initiatives.
Midday: Biodiversity on Your Site Toolkit Workshop — Co-design biodiversity plans for business properties (guided by local ecologists & farming leaders)
Afternoon: Immersion experiences to nature, land and biodiversity initiatives across the region.
Day 4 - Energy & Carbon
Morning: Businesses share their real decarbonisation journeys: EV transitions, renewable installations, process efficiencies — including the unexpected savings, costs and impacts.
Midday: Carbon Reduction Sprints — Design quick-win carbon actions + long-term projects with support from energy consultants and local peers.
Afternoon: Site visits to Carbon and Energy initiatives across the region
Day 5 - Taking the courage to act
Morning: Businesses share how they initiated climate actions, including failures, lessons, and unexpected wins.
Midday: Climate Action Map Workshop — Business leaders build their tailored action roadmaps (guided by peers + facilitators).
Afternoon: Immersion to unique businesses focussed on climate resilience
Immersion Experience Hosts Confirmed
Yealands Estate Winery
Carbonscape
Wineworks
Climate Action Marlborough has had the support of Yealands Estate Wines from its inception and we are super grateful to have their support for Climate Action Week Marlborough 2026. They are committed to influencing the Marlborough business community, driving collaboration that impacts climate resilience, education, health and wellbeing of a thriving region and growing our regions expertise.

events.long_description:
Parent Support Group – Lower Hutt
Grab a free coffee and chat with other parents and carers who know what it’s like to care for a disabled child, a neurodivergent child, or a child with health impairments.


Parent to Parent hosts regular Parent Support Groups in Lower Hutt to support carers and parents just like you. These groups are a safe space for family and whānau to share their experiences, their challenges, their triumphs, and to learn from each other in an open and 100% judgement- free environment. No topic is too ‘weird’, no question too ‘out there’. We get it, and we are here to help.


So if you’d like to share a struggle, celebrate a success, raise a concern, or simply have a cuppa and chat with other parents and carers in your area, you are always welcome at our Parent Support Group. Children are welcome too! Drop in for as long or as short a time as you want. And did we mention there’s free coffee??


Contact Jack Baigent for more information:
| 027 808 3952

events.id: Capital City Complex Systems Symposium 2026-National Library of New Zealand, Tiakiwai Conference Centre,70 Molesworth Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Capital City Complex Systems Symposium 2026
events.venue: National Library of New Zealand, Tiakiwai Conference Centre,70 Molesworth Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Capital City Complex Systems Symposium 2026
Join us in Wellington, New Zealand this summer for a gathering of leading researchers and practitioners working on complex systems.

About this Event

Nau mai haere mai ki tēnei hui!
Ka mihi mātou ki ngā mana whenua o tēnei takiwā, ki a Taranaki whānui, me ngā hapū, iwi iwi katoa kua tau i kōnei, me ō rātou mahi whakahirahira, mahi tiaki i ngā taonga o ēnei whenua.
Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington, is the capital city of Aotearoa New Zealand. Māori have lived in Te Whanganui a Tara for 800 years. We acknowledge Taranaki whānui, and all the peoples who have lived here, and their close relationship with the lands and waters.


The Capital City Complex Systems Symposium 2026 will explore cutting-edge knowledge of complex systems and complexity, and how this knowledge is being used to better understand systems and drive system change. It will be held in Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington, Aotearoa New Zealand, during summer in the Southern Hemisphere.
The theme for the conference is ‘Understanding complex systems: Theory, practice and impact’.

Our programme, including speakers, can be viewed here

Following the success of previous symposia in 2023 and 2024, this event will continue to foster interdisciplinary, cross-sector and cross-society collaboration in complex systems thinking, research and action. In 2026, the symposium will integrate the latest insights from complex systems science with the pressing concerns facing communities, businesses, and policymakers today. A particular focus will be how complexity science has evolved and how it is informing contemporary actions and solutions for prosperous, resilient, equitable and democratic societies – amid growing global challenges.
The symposium will explore complexity through a rich interdisciplinary lens, bringing together philosophical and epistemological perspectives alongside practical insights from fields including artificial intelligence, infrastructure, health, education, climate, and the environment, and cutting-edge insights from Māori and local communities. Attendees will engage with understandings of complexity, examine innovative methods and tools for working within complex systems, and discuss the implications for public policy, governance, leadership and Indigenous system change.
This inclusive, supportive event is essential for anyone interested in understanding the trajectory and practical applications of complex systems knowledge — including researchers, leaders, policymakers, innovators, changemakers, practitioners, and students. Whether you’re deeply experienced in complex systems research or newly curious about its potential, the symposium will provide valuable insights, networking opportunities, and inspiration.


We are taking expressions of interest (EOI) for an optional pre-event workshop on Monday 23 February, also held at the National Library. Will we notify you of the agenda and ticket price closer to the date
The Capital City Complex Systems Symposium 2026 will take place on 24–25 February 2026 at the Tiakiwai Conference Centre, National Library of New Zealand, Wellington.



Optional pre-event workshop
10am-5pm Tiakiwai Conference Centre

D ay 1
9am-5pm Symposium, Tiakiwai Conference Centre
5pm-6pm Networking Cocktail Hour
6pm-9pm Dinner, Thistle Inn

D ay 2
9 am - 5pm Symposium, Tiakiwai Conference Centre

events.id: The Effective Speaker, Wellington, 24th & 25th Feb-Level 28/100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: The Effective Speaker, Wellington, 24th & 25th Feb
events.venue: Level 28/100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
1 or 2 Day Presentation Skills Workshop
Limited tickets available. Get in now so you don't miss out!
When effective presenters speak, they do more than inform - they influence, persuade, and inspire. That isn’t magic; it’s method. With the right tools, anyone can build genuine connection and move a room.
This workshop is for leaders, emerging leaders, technical specialists, and professionals who want practical tools and techniques for speaking in both formal and informal settings.
Short on time? Attend 1 Day (Foundations) for all the core skills. Ready for a bigger shift? Choose 2 Days (Advanced) for one on one coaching and deeper transformation. Pick what’s right for you.
You’ll leave with the tools to present more clearly, confidently, and with the influence your role demands. This is not just for the stage. You will use these skills everyday.
The workshop format
Small group format for maximum practice and feedback (no massive groups).
Learning is adapted and personalised for maximum value (no cookie-cutter approach).
Hands on, practical learning, with easy to apply tools and techniques (no sitting around listening to theory).
The Effective Speaker - One Day Workshop (Foundations):
Tuesday 3rd March
A hands-on day where you’ll learn our step-by-step SpeakerMap™ system to plan valuable presentations quickly and with ease.
You’ll learn the principles behind useful visuals, how to manage nerves, and three delivery techniques you can use immediately.
Foundations is best for technical experts who know their stuff but struggle to get it across, and nervous presenters who want a safe, practical reset.
What you’ll learn
Plan engaging content (fast)
Use the SpeakerMap™ to develop a clear Key Message and structure that keeps audiences attentive without overload.
Plan faster, make better decisions about what to include (and what to ditch).
 Design useful slides (not wallpaper)
A simple but revolutionary way to design slides that support — not sabotage — your message.
Practical guidance on using AI to fast-track draft slides and create supporting documents.
How to use PowerPoint to keep you on track without putting your audience to sleep.
 Keep nerves under control
A proven psychological approach to calm the mental chatter that causes waffling, speed talking, and blank moments.
Build a personal plan to shift focus from “me” to the audience and the outcome you want.
 Deliver in a natural, engaging way
Three delivery techniques that help you look credible, be engaging and feel confident.
How to vary pace and emphasis so your key points actually land.
How to cut the filler - the “ums” and “ahs” - and keep your flow.
 Plenty of practice
You’ll practise each technique in pairs or threes — supportive, safe, and highly practical.
Includes
A full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
The Effective Speaker workbook
30minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $1,200 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $995+GST)
 
The Effective Speaker - Two Day Workshop (Advanced)
Tuesday 3rd & Wednesday 4th March
Gain all the skills from Day One - and then take them further. If presenting is central to your career growth, this is the coaching workshop you need.
Over two full days, you’ll create a significant shift in your communication skills.
Day One gives you the foundations to make presenting easier and more effective.
Day Two consolidates and extends these skills. You’ll go deeper into content planning, adapt the tools to your real work presentations, and get personalised coaching to develop your own authentic style.
You’ll also learn strategies for handling even the toughest audiences. The workshop is practical, hands-on, and focused on learning by doing - presenting, receiving coaching, and observing your peers.
If you’re ready for lasting, transformative change in your communication skills, the two-day option is the best choice.
What you’ll learn
Everything from Day 1 (Foundations) PLUS
Go deeper with planning
Apply the SpeakerMap to plan an actual presentation that you can give. 
Dive deeper into crafting valuable messages that you can use in the future. 
Rehearse in a way that actually works
A practical way to prepare when time is tight — so you own your words.
Shift from competent to compelling
One-on-one coaching targeted to your specific needs.
Video feedback plus our inside-out coaching methodology to reconnect you with the techniques you use naturally in conversation.
How to use silence, pace, notes, and the remote without looking stiff or artificial.
How to speak with energy and authenticity, not speed and panic.
Eliminate “ums” and “ahs”, look confident (even when you’re not), and create a sense of commitment that audiences feel.
An understanding of your personal communication strengths and the areas you need to focus on for growth.

Handle audiences like a pro
Strategies for side chats, interruptions, distractions, disagreement, and the odd angry voice - while staying calm and in control.

Includes
Everything in Day 1, plus:
A second full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
Videos of your presenting and coaching sessions
The Effective Speaker workbook
60minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $2,500 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $2.200+GST)
What past participants say:

"The overall experience of the course far surpassed my expectations. I came in hoping to gain some valuable insights and tips for better public speaking, but what I received was so much more. I developed a newfound confidence in my ability to communicate effectively, learned how to captivate an audience, and discovered strategies for managing nerves and overcoming stage fright. I would recommend this effective speaking course to anyone looking to enhance their communication abilities. It's not just another course; it's a transformative experience that will empower you to become a more confident and persuasive speaker" Alex Goryachev, New Zealand Green Building Council

“This course not only met my expectations, but it completely exceeded them. This has been one of the most transformative courses I’ve attended. Jane totally revolutionised the way I now approach presentations. Having felt fear in the past each time I have to present to large groups, for the first time I now feel like I have the tools, understanding and ability to approach presentations and conquer my fear. I can’t thank Jane enough.” Nadia Marsh, Head of Bids, Tonkin & Taylor
"I have never been in such a well-run course (I've done a lot) Jane was amazing she held our attention from start to finish each day. I feel we all learnt so much and I will definitely be taking her advice on how I can improve myself. This course was well above what I expected, Jane had a great way of communicating. Typically, people tune out or lose interest by the end of the day. This was not the case for us. I honestly thing it’s the best course I’ve been on in my 4 years with WCC." Joshua Harding, Team Leader Consents, Wellington City Council

“The course is awesome. The balance between talk time, practical learning and feedback is perfect. The trainer really made the course for me - she is sensitive and responsive to people’s needs and is genuine in her approach to give the learners as much out of the time as possible. A very polished and well-planned course.” Huia Grey, Department of Conservation
"By far the best course i have attended in any organisation, either here in NZ or abroad. The format of the course was engaging and there was a great balance between listening, engaging and participating. I look forward to using the skills used presenting at our next Team Hui!"
Matthew Townsley, Medical Council of New Zealand


"Really great course, no pressure environment with a good mix of interactive and book work. Have walked away feeling more confident in how I am going to put my presentations together."

Jessica Stokes, Emergency Management Team, New Plymouth District Council
"It was good, practical and useful tools "not rules" for business comms and pressos. Good to learn some of the other things you don't often learn in traditional presentation skills training. Really good engagement and interaction - the team were impressed we were all engaged right until the end! Easily one of the best courses I have been on in this line of work. Keep up the good work! "
Brad Stansell, Channel Account Manager, Pax 8

events.id: Mothers Network - Draw It Out morning-level 2/105 High Street, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Mothers Network - Draw It Out morning
events.venue: level 2/105 High Street, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Mothers Network - Draw It Out morning
Theme: Self-compassion
Join a special Mothers Network morning tea combined with a Draw It Out workshop - You’ll be guided through wellness drawings that help you support yourself, while connecting with other mums.

About Mothers Network
Mothers Network is a not-for-profit organisation that has been running in Wellington for over 40 years. Run by mums, for mums, we support and connect women facing the changes and challenges of being a mum through discussion groups. We also consider the impact motherhood has on other aspects of life, including relationships, career and sense of wellbeing.
Included in your workshop
You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance. No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.
This gentle yet powerful tool uses drawing and writing as a way to access your subconscious and to listen to your heart rather than your head for guidance. A tool often used in therapy, it is made accessible for self-care and community wellness through these fun and friendly workshops.
About Lara Phillips
Lara Phillips is a creative facilitator trained in Interactive Drawing Therapy. With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a way of wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.
“We all have the wisdom within to help ourselves, if given the space.”
For more workshops or to book individual sessions visit www.drawitout.co.nz.
Liability disclaimer
Draw It Out offers creativity for wellbeing. It is not intended as therapy nor does it replace counselling, therapy, or any other medical or clinical professional help. Participants are guided to draw out where they are at, whilst drawing out their own inner resources for support and guidance.
Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.

events.name: My Puppet Who Sighs in Pearl Shavings
events.venue: BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington
events.long_description:
My Puppet Who Sighs in Pearl Shavings returns to BATS for its premier season.

An intimate confessional that blurs narrative modes from conversational anecdote, to spoken word, to grand myths of creation. Blending the tragic, the comic, and the surreal, the voice of the sole performer constantly shifts and switches.

Cass, an anxious-avoidant trans person relating stories of her life in Wellington after the onset of a slow and uneventful apocalypse. The Oracle, one of the few who still hold separate the aspects of both mind and body, cruelly stitched together. The Monarch of Lambs; The Dog of Kings; that which was before, and will be after.

My Puppet is a design-forward, multidisciplinary collaboration brought to you by Landfish, a collective of emerging and established artists and designers.

Written and spoken by Raven Harvey-Lomas
Set and costumed by Anne Amber
Lit by Gabriella Eaton
Scored by Scarlett Peckham

events.id: Please Let Me Remain-Gryphon Theatre, 22 Ghuznee St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Please Let Me Remain
events.venue: Gryphon Theatre, 22 Ghuznee St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Please Let Me Remain, is A/Motion's debut work as an emerging project-based contemporary dance collective, founded by Aylin Atalay. The work is an intimate exploration of sisterhood through the lens of Aylin's roots and identity as a Turkish/Pakeha woman.

Five dancers will explore how sisterhood affects the individual and the group as one entity. Women together in comfort, sharing the same mundane experiences.

The games we make up, the‬ ‭future we see together, the life we romanticise. The culture we are all at the root of, and the‬ hope there are better days ahead.

Taking influence from Turkish traditions and Aylin's interest in reflecting the human experience, the audience will witness intertwined female connections that hold up the group and carry stories, memories and values. Viewers will observe how this culture stays rooted in the individual while they are alone and how sisterhood is a bond that keeps things moving.

It is a journey of surrendering to the space together and enjoying simplicity, nostalgia, and the tangents relationships have. We are a result of the women who raised us. How do we continue to carve this path for others?
