What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality watercolour paper, watercolour paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). All our events are in licensed venues, so you can purchase drinks to sip as you create! At the end of the night, you will leave with your own watercolour painting!

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website ⇒ paintvine.co.nz

events.id: Amble | Wellington-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Amble | Wellington
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
Amble, the critically acclaimed three-piece folk group hailing from Ireland, today announce their return to Australia and New Zealand in February 2026, in support of their highly anticipated debut album, Reverie.
Irish trio Amble harness a rare magic threaded into the fabric of their novelistic folk.
Originally hailing from the West Region of Ireland, the group—Robbie Cunningham (lead vocals/guitar), Ross McNerney (mandolin/bouzouki), and Oisin McCaffrey (vocals/guitar)—have unassumingly gone from quitting their day jobs in rural Ireland to the doorstep of an international breakthrough, buoyed by over 100 million streams and sold-out shows around the world.
Amble’s debut album, Reverie, set for release on Friday, 23 May this year, showcases Amble's signature sound: relatability, intimate storytelling, and authenticity seamlessly blended with no-frills acoustic instrumentation, serene soundscapes, and heavenly natural harmonies.
The album, recorded live in various studios between Ireland and Los Angeles, captures the spirit of the band's early days.

events.id: The Music of Greece-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: The Music of Greece
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Marking its Aotearoa debut, the Hellenic Music Ensemble brings the unforgettable soundscape of Greece to life in a landmark global tour. The group will be under the direction of acclaimed composer and conductor Panos Liaropoulos. This 21-piece orchestra honours the genius of Greece’s most iconic composers: Mikis Theodorakis (BAFTA-winning ‘Zorba's Dance’) and Manos Hadjidakis (‘Never on a Sunday’). 
The orchestra will be joined by legendary voices Manolis Mitsias, Giannis Haroulis, and Natassa Bofiliou. Together, they’ll bring the quintessential melodies of Greece to the Michael Fowler Centre. This one-night-only show is part of the Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts. Soar through a century of song — celebrating the soul, poetry, and passion of Greece.

After entertaining 700,000 guests across the UK, USA and Europe, The Rock Orchestra by Candlelight is kicking off the first ever tour of New Zealand. Prepare for a spellbinding 90-minute spectacle that infuses iconic Rock & Metal anthems with a hauntingly beautiful energy.

In ethereal candlelit settings, this band of 13 classical musicians unleash effortlessly enchanting melodies alongside powerful walls of distortion. Witness the unexpected union of Classical music and Metal. The Rock Orchestra is a rotating collective of classical musicians, featuring some of the world's greatest instrumentalists and vocalists.

Performing the music of iconic bands including:
Metallica, AC/DC, Rage Against The Machine, My Chemical Romance, Linkin' Park, SOAD, Guns N Roses, Evanescence, Aerosmith, The Cranberries & MORE!

👉 “Perfect blend of classical bravado and hard rock!”
👉 “It is a unique experience: the music, the show, the stage… something incredible”

The Rock Orchestra and its events are not affiliated with the artists and composers listed. All trademarks are the property of their respective owners.

events.id: Dare to Lead™ | Wellington | 25-27 February-Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa,55 Cable Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Dare to Lead™ | Wellington | 25-27 February
events.venue: Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa,55 Cable Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Dare to Lead™ | Wellington | 25-27 February
Dare to Lead is the ultimate starting point for brave leaders, courageous cultures, and organisational change.

About this Event


The ultimate starting point for brave leaders, courageous cultures and organisational change.


"Highly recommend."
"Inspiring."
"An amazing experience."
"One 'aha moment' after the other."

Founded on the research of Dr. Brené Brown, Dare to Lead™ is an empirically based courage-building programme, delivered by Boma New Zealand CEO and Certified Dare to Lead™ Facilitator Kaila Colbin.
Brené has spent two decades studying shame and more than seven years specifically looking at leadership. During her research, she interviewed leaders from all over the world — from Fortune 100 companies, non-profits, public sector entities, and more — and asked one question: what is the future of leadership?
Remarkably, their answers pointed to one thing: we need braver leaders.


We need more courage.

The most significant finding from Brené’s latest research, and the foundation of Dare to Lead™, is that courage is a collection of four skill sets that are teachable, measurable, and observable.


After completing the three-day Dare to Lead™ programme you'll understand how to:
Effectively navigate vulnerability and unlock change
Turn values from fluffy language into tangible, practical behaviours
Build a common culture of trust in your team
Cultivate the skills to rise from setbacks and be more resilient


This curriculum is essential for teams who want to:
Be better equipped to deal with difficult conversations
Reduce unhealthy and unproductive behaviour
Be more creative and innovative
Build resilience and improve alignment
Foster a culture of accountability and trust


This experience is for you if:
You're in a position of leadership within your organisation
You see the potential in people and processes, and are willing to take responsibility for achieving that potential
You’re passionate about accelerating performance in yourself and others
You have to navigate organisational change as part of your role



Need help with the cost?
If you are an Educator or at a Not-for-Profit, you can automatically access a special price of $1,995 + GST when you register.
We also have partial scholarships available to attend the programme. Apply here and we’ll be in touch.
Boma is a Regional Business Network Provider. Your organisation may be eligible for funding support to attend this programme. Find out more at regionalbusinesspartners.co.nz


Our Health and Safety Plan
Boma is committed to delivering safe events. We follow best practices suggested by the New Zealand health authorities and work closely with our suppliers to prioritise health and wellbeing.
Our comprehensive health and safety plans ensure you can book with certainty and attend with confidence.



Our refund policy
For details on event refunds and transfers, please see our refund policy.


Contact us
Please email with any questions.

events.id: Distilled Comedy 25th February-The Bond Store,3C Magrath Ave, Paraparaumu Beach, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu-All Events In
events.name: Distilled Comedy 25th February
events.venue: The Bond Store,3C Magrath Ave, Paraparaumu Beach, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Distilled Comedy 25th February
The monthly merriment will commence on 25th February.

Welcome to the comedy open mic that politely asks structure to wait outside while we set fire to it.

This is the Home of The Jar — our slightly unhinged, deeply democratic system where the audience randomly selects who goes up next. No lineups. No pecking order. No sacred cows. Just brave humans, questionable decisions, and whatever name comes out of the jar. It’s equal parts comedy show, social experiment, and mild psychological thriller.

You might see a first-timer doing their very first set. You might see a seasoned comic testing brand-new material. You might see someone absolutely smash it. You might see someone discover, in real time, that jokes are harder than they look. That’s the magic.

Come early, grab some food, sip a cocktail, and settle in. The room fills fast, the energy builds quicker, and being there from the start means you’re fully invested when the jar starts causing trouble.

If you love comedy in its rawest, most unpredictable form — this is your night.
If you’ve ever thought “I could probably do that” — the jar would love to meet you.

Cheap laughs. Big vibes. Absolute chaos.
Welcome home.

That’s the magic.
If you’ve ever thought “I could probably do that” — the jar would love to meet you.

events.id: Allan the Shearer - Blade Shearing Demonstration-Rewa Rewa Station, 166 Rewa Rewa Road, Tinui, Masterton-Event Finder
events.name: Allan the Shearer - Blade Shearing Demonstration
events.venue: Rewa Rewa Station, 166 Rewa Rewa Road, Tinui, Masterton
events.long_description:
Come join Allan the Shearer and ShearSheep NZ Blade School and up to 10 Golden Shears competitors in this Blade Shearing Demonstration event hosted by Rewa Rewa Station.

You will be in the Wool Shed up close to the action as these competitors sharpen their blades and skills in preparation for the World Champion at Golden Shears 2026.

Allan the Shearer, 2019 World Champion Shearer, is hoping to reclaim his title that was lost to the South African team in 2023 and show what it takes to be a World Champion. This is your opportunity to see him flash his blades.

Using Blades not machines, this skill is an art form and being able to do it in a competitive environment with time pressures while remaining calm is what makes a world champion.
The 
Golden Shears World Championship is held in Masterton and is the pinnacle international event for sheep shearing and wool handling.

This is a ticketed event and tickets cost $10 per person.
Tickets are available on our website - www.rewarewastation.co.nz or via email pvieno@hotmail.com

events.id: Smartphone Video Workshop with Bazzacam: Wellington-100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Smartphone Video Workshop with Bazzacam: Wellington
events.venue: 100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
This event is for SBN Impact Investors only.
Join us for a free, hands-on workshop with the brilliant Baz Caitcheon (Bazzacam). Baz has helped organisations across the country transform the way they create content, and now he’s here to help you do the same.
In just half a day, you’ll learn how to shoot, edit and publish polished, professional-quality videos directly from your phone or tablet. Think of it as a year of film school condensed into one powerful, practical session. Perfect for anyone who wants to create better, faster, more engaging video content.
You’ll discover:
Smart techniques for capturing great footage on your device
Easy editing workflows using CapCut and iMovie
How to publish content that cuts through the noise
Third-party gear that makes a big difference (mics, stabilisers, lighting)
Plus, you’ll walk away with post-workshop notes, links to tutorial videos, and recommendations for the best gear to buy.
What to bring
Your smartphone or tablet, and a pair of headphones
Ensure your device is fully charged, and if your battery life is weak please bring your charger/powerbank
1–2GB free storage on your device
Apps: Download CapCut (free, Apple + Android) and iMovie (free, Apple users only)
Please arrive a few minutes early so we can do a quick device check before we begin.

events.id: Okawa Glass Workshop-31 Waring Taylor Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Okawa Glass Workshop
events.venue: 31 Waring Taylor Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Coffee Supreme is proud to host Okawa Glass, the makers of exceptional glass bottle containers since 1916 in Tokyo, Japan, for a special pop-up and workshop at Midland Park, Wellington.
Event Overview
To mark 110 years of Okawa Glass, this event brings their iconic BINKOP glassware to New Zealand through a limited-time pop-up and hands-on workshops led by Japanese artist MAKIKO SASA.
BINKOP Decal Workshops
Participants will customise their own BINKOP piece by applying special decals, creating a unique, one-of-a-kind design. After the workshop, all pieces will be returned to Japan for firing before being shipped back to Midland Park for collection from the store.
There are 3 workshops in total, each accommodating 4 participants:
25 Feb (Wed) 2:30–4:30pm
26 Feb (Thu) 4–6pm
27 Feb (Fri) 3–5pm
A small selection of Okawa Glass works will also be available for purchase during the event.

Ticket Information
Okawa Glass Workshop Ticket secures your place in one of the intimate, hands-on workshops. Includes 1xBinkop and bottomless filter coffee.

events.id: Downstairs at the Manor (Austen Role Playing)-The Green Man Pub, Cnr of Willeston & Victoria Sts, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Downstairs at the Manor (Austen Role Playing)
events.venue: The Green Man Pub, Cnr of Willeston & Victoria Sts, Wellington
events.long_description:
Play Good Society (a Jane Austen role playing game) with your Facilitator, Johnny Bowtie.

As part of this year's diversity theme, we will explore one of Austen's manors from the perspective of the servants, with their own secrets and ambitions.

This session gives us a glimpse below stairs into the lives of the servants as they deal with dramas of their own. In it, you will explore stories in a harsh world that genteel society could never understand. Each servant not only possesses a desire, relationship, and position within the manor, but also a secret burden, vice, or ambition.

Ticket includes game play and table snacks. Drinks & further food is additional.

We aim to provide an accessible and safe environment. Discounts are available for nonwaged members, early birds, volunteers and people buying multiple tickets. Please let us know how we can ensure you're included.

Led by acclaimed composer and conductor Panos Liaropoulos, this 21-piece orchestra honours the genius of Mikis Theodorakis ('Zorba's Dance') and Manos Hadjidakis ('Never on a Sunday'), joined by legendary voices Natassa Bofilou and Giannis Haroulis. You're invited on a soaring journey through a century of song celebrating the soul, poetry and passion of Greece.

All Tickets are Mobile Ticket Only. 
Mobile Tickets are like Print-at-Home tickets but instead of having to print off the tickets yourself, you can just show the barcode on your mobile phone. It is the easiest way to access tickets to your events. For more information visit Ticketmaster.co.nz/mobileticket

events.id: Werewolf-Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Werewolf
events.venue: Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts and PANNZ present Werewolf

Attention: Multiple new occurrences are now confirmed and verified. Healthy citizens must report to their safehouses by sunset and shelter in place. Your designated safehouse is Circa Theatre.

Three ill-equipped wardens keep watch over a makeshift community who must learn to work together. But as the threat outside takes shape, the atmosphere inside begins to turn.

Inspired by the classic game of deception, Werewolf is a gripping blend of thriller and comedy that pulls you into an immersive world of suspicion, survival, and uneasy laughter.

With heart-pounding sound design, razor-sharp performances, and a daring, darkly funny style, this international cult hit asks: When night falls—who do you trust?

Review
“Has people screaming in terror one minute then giggling like children the next” – ★★★★★ – British Theatre Guide

Please indicate, when buying your ticket, if you need a sighted guide or a free companion ticket. For ANZFA access and/or companion tickets email circa@circa.co.nz or call 04 801 7992

ANZFA access tickets: $20.00pp + free for a companion/whānau member

*Contains periods of complete darkness, flashing lights, loud noises, content designed to unsettle, and non-compulsory audience participation. Recommended for ages 12+

events.id: Zonnis Live (Canadian Duo)-Moon, 167 Riddiford Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Zonnis Live (Canadian Duo)
events.venue: Moon, 167 Riddiford Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Canadian duo Zonnis performs their unique brand of “Eclectic Cabaret Folk”.

Expect Laughter, Harmony, and Heart with Zonnis.

Victoria’s own Zonnis have built an international reputation for their quirky charm, heartfelt songwriting, and ability to leave audiences smiling long after the show ends. Having performed at over 500 festivals and venues across 10 countries, the duo blends sharp wit, soulful folk-roots melodies, and real-life honesty into performances that are both hilarious and deeply moving.

Their music fuses warm vocal harmonies, rich storytelling, and a refreshing dose of theatrical playfulness—resulting in performances that feel intimate, hilarious, and deeply heartfelt all at once.

events.id: Royal New Zealand Ballet Presents Macbeth-St James Theatre, 77-87 Courtenay Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Royal New Zealand Ballet Presents Macbeth
events.venue: St James Theatre, 77-87 Courtenay Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
A bold and bloody re-telling of Macbeth marks the start of the Royal New Zealand Ballet’s 2026 season, bringing this most visceral of tragedies to the stage in an explosion of high-octane contemporary ballet.

Choreographer Alice Topp (Aurum, Logos, High Tide) brings naked ambition, political power and transgression to the fore in this new, original staging, propelling Shakespeare’s iconic characters into a shadowy world of manipulation by media, boardroom intrigue and sudden violence. As the Macbeths emerge as a dazzling new power couple, triumphantly atop a glamorous social set, the view from the top is dizzying – and the fall vertiginous.

The seduction of success and adulation give way to doubt, paranoia and madness, with Alice Topp’s mesmerising movement and Christopher Gordon’s pounding new music, layering a full orchestral and heavy metal score with live string octet, inexorably driving Macbeth and his Lady to a conclusion that is as inevitable as it is devastating.

Macbeth has been created with significant support from the Haythorne Circle. Presented in association with Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts and Te Ahurei Toi o Tāmaki Auckland Arts Festival, Macbeth is a co-production with West Australian Ballet.

‘Stars, hide your fires. Let not light see my black and deep desires.’ – Macbeth, Act I Scene IV

Book Macbeth as part of a ticket package with The Sleeping Beauty or Winter Season and save 20%.

Recommended for audiences aged 14 and over; parental discretion is advise

As the Macbeths emerge as a dazzling new power couple, triumphantly atop a glamorous social set, the view from the top is dizzying – and the fall vertiginous.

events.id: SKWERT: The Reunion-Hannah Playhouse, 12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: SKWERT: The Reunion
events.venue: Hannah Playhouse, 12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
It's a Boy Band Murder Mystery Musical! After the tragic death of their leader, Scott, SKWERT is reuniting for one massive memorial tour. However, not is all as it seems as the show is taken over by a mysterious force that exposes the band's secret: one of them killed him. Can the band pull themselves together and solve the mystery before SKWERT is destroyed forever?

Get your glowsticks ready and unleash your inner fangirl/fanboy at this immersive boy band concert experience!

SKWERT: The Reunion is an original musical featuring music and lyrics by local Wellingtonians, Elliott Lam and Finn McKinlay.

events.id: Twin Peaks: Fire Walk With Me-5 Park Road, Miramar, Wellington 6022, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Twin Peaks: Fire Walk With Me
events.venue: 5 Park Road, Miramar, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
"Faster and faster. And for a long time you wouldn't feel anything. And then you'd burst into fire" - Laura Palmer
TWIN PEAKS: FIRE WALK WITH ME.
DAVID LYNCH | USA & FRANCE | 1992 | 135mins | R18+| 4K DCP PROVIDED BY JANUS FILMS DISTRIBUTION
Join us for this very special community fundraiser screening of the prequel to the critically acclaimed series, "Twin Peaks".
ABC cancelled the original series after season 2 but a month later, Lynch announced he was "not yet finished with the material" and principal photography for the full length prequel film, began on September 5th 1991 at a caravan site in Snoqualmie Washington. Which became the "Fat Trout Trailer Park" where the story of the last 7 days of Laura Palmer begins.
Since its showing at the 1992 Festival De Cannes, no other Lynch film had polarized audiences to such an extent. Fans that wanted more "Cherry Pie" and "Donuts" from the TV show were served a much darker, unflinching and unforgiving work - in Lynch's own words, a movie about "the loneliness, shame, guilt, confusion and devastation of the victim". Derided by critics and many fans at the time it was a commercial box office flop.
Yet in the years since the initial reaction, a gradual wave of reappraisal and appreciation began. With time it's brilliance came into focus with growing acknowledgment, that the film is a more accurate, complex and powerful account of trauma. Combining the dramatic ferocity of Sherly Lee's tour de force and the beauty of Angelo Badalamenti's score, Lynch reclaimed full ownership of the material creating a harrowing, compassionate and enigmatic hymn to Laura Palmer.
As we approach the films 34 year anniversary and since Lynch's passing in 2025, it is now regarded by critics and fans worldwide, as a revered epilogue, essential predecessor to "The Return", and Lynch's most chilling, terrifying, and yet empathetic and humane cinematic masterpiece.
WHERE: The Roxy Cinema. 5 Park Road. Miramar. Wellington.
Cinema 1 - The big cinema upstairs with the massive screen, red italian leather sofas, and of course those red curtains!
WHEN: Wed 25th Feb 2026. Seating is unreserved so arrive early to check-in at the table upstairs, enter the raffle and get seated.
8:15pm - Doors close and the film starts. (no trailers)

COST: Tickets are $20 per person. (plus booking fee). This is a not for profit community screening put on for the pure love of Twin Peaks and the fans. All proceeds go to help pay for the cinema hire and licensing the film with any extras donated to charity. So spread the word and come celebrate "Twin Peaks Day 2026"!
TWIN PEAKS RAFFLE: Check-in at the desk upstairs and get a complimentary raffle ticket, to enter into the draw for 1 of these companion books.
The Secret Diary of Laura Palmer - By Jennifer Lynch with foreword by Mark Frost & David Lynch (paperback, 2012 edition)
Fire Walk With Me: Your Laura Disappeared - By Scott Ryan with foreword by Jeff Jensen (paperback, 2022 edition)
Laura's Ghost: Women Speak about Twin Peaks - By Courtney Stallings with foreword by Sheryl Lee (paperback, 2020 edition)
Cutoff to enter is 8:10pm and prizes drawn just before the start of the film.
RULES:
1. Tickets are per person. There will be NO door sales at the Roxy, so DO purchase it beforehand please. 
2. The film is classified R18+. All attendees MUST be 18yo + and have ID
4. The Roxy have strict no BYO food/drinks. Only Food/drinks purchased at the Roxy can be taken into the screening.
3. This is a safe, friendly, INCLUSIVE place. There is ZERO tolerance for discrimination, disrespect or creepy gross behavior of any kind. By attending you agree to the Code of Conduct.
4. Arrive early to enter the raffle before the cutoff if you want to be in it to win it. Good Luck!
Thank you and Happy Twin Peaks Day!
Join us for more Twin Peaks community screenings at:
www.facebook.com/fishinthepercolator
www.instagram.com/fishinthe.percolator

With time it's brilliance came into focus with growing acknowledgment, that the film is a more accurate, complex and powerful account of trauma.
WHERE: The Roxy Cinema.
This is a not for profit community screening put on for the pure love of Twin Peaks and the fans.

events.id: Wellington Education Law and Leadership Conference 2026: Navigating Change in Aotearoa Schools-Rydges Wellington,75A Featherston St, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Wellington Education Law and Leadership Conference 2026: Navigating Change in Aotearoa Schools
events.venue: Rydges Wellington,75A Featherston St, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Wellington Education Law and Leadership Conference 2026: Navigating Change in Aotearoa Schools
This comprehensive full-day conference brings together leaders in education governance, employment, and inclusive practice to explore the evolving legal and cultural landscape of Aotearoa’s schools. Unpack key developments in education law and policy, from recent legislative changes under the Education and Training Act to updates on collective agreements, employment law and best practices in workplace investigations. Focus on creating culturally grounded and future-focused school leadership, with insights into kaupapa Māori practices, strategic planning and governance and policy issues surrounding the introduction of AI. Designed for principals, board members and education professionals, this conference offers both legal clarity and practical inspiration for navigating today’s complex education environment.



Session 1: Navigating Change: Governance, Employment and Investigations

Chair: Maria McKenzie, Cluster Manager, Remutaka Resource Teacher and Learning and Behaviour, Masterton Primary School


> Unlocking Excellence: A Framework for Effective School Governance
Presented by Belinda Weber, Chief Advisor Governance, Te Whakaroputanga Kaitiaki Kura o Aotearoa New Zealand School Boards Association


> Collective Bargaining Outcomes: An Update for School HR Leaders
Presented by Maynard Scott, National Employment Relations Advisor, Te Whakarōputanga Kaitiaki Kura o Aotearoa, New Zealand School Boards Association


> Employment Law Update: The Evolving Landscape in New Zealand/Aotearoa’s Employment Law
Presented by Murray Grant, Special Counsel, Wotton Kearney and Alex Sclater, Solicitor, Wotton Kearney


> Workplace Investigations in the School Environment
Presented by Andrew Scott-Howman, Barrister and Workplace Investigator, Port Nicholson Chambers



Session 2: Empowering School Communities: Kaupapa Māori, Strategic Planning and AI

Chair: Simon Kenny, Principal, Fergusson Intermediate School


> Culturally Empowering Practices in Aotearoa Schools
Presented by Nathan Mahikai Riki, Director , Riki Consultancy


> Strategic Planning: Empowering Schools to Design and Own Their Strategic Direction
Presented by Bruce Kearney, Principal, Rangiora High School


> AI in Schools: Governance, Risk and Implementation Challenges
Presented by Dr Rod Lane, Director, Learning and Innovation, Te Whakarōputanga Kaitiaki Kura o Aotearoa, New Zealand School Boards Association

events.id: The Rock Orchestra by Candlelight-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: The Rock Orchestra by Candlelight
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
When you think of hard rock and metal, you might not naturally connect them to the refined sounds of classical music. The Rock Orchestra by Candlelight has done just that. After entertaining 700,000 people across the UK, USA and Europe, it’s coming to Wellington. 
Prepare for a spellbinding 90-minute spectacle infusing rock and metal anthems with beautiful orchestral energy. A band of 13 classical musicians will accompany the fiery tunes. Through a wall of distortion, you’ll witness the unexpected union of classical and metal music. 
In an ethereal candlelit setting, you’ll experience the music of famous bands. Hear Metallica, AC/DC, Rage Against the Machine, My Chemical Romance, Linkin' Park, SOAD, Guns N’ Roses, Evanescence, Aerosmith, The Cranberries, and more.

events.id: Leadership And Management Part 1-Toitu Poneke Community & Sports Centre - The , 49 Kilbirnie Crescent, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Leadership And Management Part 1
events.venue: Toitu Poneke Community & Sports Centre - The , 49 Kilbirnie Crescent, Wellington
events.long_description:
Learn how to make the transition from buddy to the boss and lead a successful team. Managing staff can be a very rewarding, interesting and fun role, it can also be a tough and demanding job. Between managing your own time and projects, helping your team members solve problems and complete tasks, and helping other managers, your day can fill up before you know it.
This workshop aims to maximise your leadership and management potential and help you become a more confident, effective and efficient leader and manager with information on understanding personality types, effective communication, setting expectations and goals, assigning work, effective delegation, motivating staff, leadership styles, giving feedback and having courageous conversations, understanding what is required to be a good leader and manager and encouraging teamwork.
 
The workshop is designed for those who have been promoted recently into a supervisory management role or for those who have been there for some time but need to improve their leadership and management skills. To book: email - info@biztrainers.co.nz or call 04 974 8790.

events.id: Jundas Capone - Hokitika is the new Berlin @ NZ Fringe.-167 Riddiford Street Newtown, 6021,167 Riddiford St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Jundas Capone - Hokitika is the new Berlin @ NZ Fringe.
events.venue: 167 Riddiford Street Newtown, 6021,167 Riddiford St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Jundas Capone - Hokitika is the new Berlin @ NZ Fringe.
One hour of Jundas Capone Stand Up Comedy in the New Zealand Fringe Festival 2026. 'Hokitika is the new Berlin'. Thursday 26th of February 2026 at 7pm and 8.30pm.

Tickets here -
https://tickets.fringe.co.nz/event/446:8341

Hastings Born, Wellingtonian, Jundas Capone, was a staple of the Berlin comedy scene for a number of years. Within a month of starting stand up, he won Wellingtons last comic standing competition, then went on to be a raw quest finalist. His style is alternative, going from one-liners, observations, and storytelling, to left-field surrealism. Accessibly random, surfing the awkwardness, which turns into waves of memorable and uncontrollable laughter.

events.long_description:
Ferry Replacement Update - the Cook Strait Connection
Get the latest news on the Cook Strait ferry replacements - join us in person (or online) for all the details at Marlborough Events Centre!

About this Event


Ferry Replacement Update

Join us for an in-person (and online) industry update where we'll dive into all the latest on the Interislander ferry replacement programme. It's your chance to hear from Ferry Holdings - the entity leading the procurement and delivery of the new ferries and associated port infrastructure.
Representatives from Interislander, Bluebridge, and Port Marlborough will also be attending to provide an update on managing demand with only four vessels.
Get the latest updates, ask questions, and see how the Cook Strait connection will operate through to 2029 and beyond.
Whether you're a transport operator, freight customer, or an affected local, this event's for you!
The 12pm-1pm presentation will be followed by a light lunch and refreshments.
Register today to secure your place.

After entertaining 700,000 guests across the UK, USA and Europe, The Rock Orchestra by Candlelight is kicking off the first ever tour of Australia. Prepare for a spellbinding 90-minute spectacle that infuses iconic Rock & Metal anthems with a hauntingly beautiful energy.

events.id: Women of Pōneke February 2026 Event-70 Molesworth Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Women of Pōneke February 2026 Event
events.venue: 70 Molesworth Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Women of Pōneke : Big dreams for a cool Capital
26 February |5-7.30 | Te Ahumairangi Foyer
National Library 70 Molesworth St
We begin the year by inviting you to Dream Big!
We love Wellington for its quirk, culture, connection to nature and its infectious energy. In your wildest dreams what would our future capital feel and be like? How would you live in it and what would you want it to stand for on a world stage? — How can we create a city future generations will love to live in?
As Eleanor Roosevelt once said  “ The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams”
Who better to dream than the Women of Pōneke!
We are delighted to have the team behind Dear Wellington – Claire Sharpe and Sophie Jacques from Warren & Mahoney and Helen Milner associate at Think Place — to share their dreams for our city in inspired visual imaginings and letters from a future Wellington. They will invite you to join in re-imagining our cool little capital, express your hopes and think about how we can turn ideas into action. 
This is an event where you can surround yourself with great company, enjoy delicious food and wine - unleash your imagination, connect and spark action.  We can’t wait to see you there! 
Tickets are limited to 180 guests.
Get your tickets now! 
Numbers are limited due to space, so we recommend you get in and quick! We are limited to 180 only. 
We will be serving wine, beer and amazing non-alcoholic drinks, inclusive in the ticket price. Platters will also be shared throughout the evening. 
So grab your ticket now and share with at least one amazing woman (and/or ally) in your life.
To cover our costs, we are charging for this event. We know that things are tough at the moment for many, so if this is a barrier for you to attend, please contact us and we will do everything to support you to attend. 
Help a woman in need
If you wish to support someone else who may have a financial barrier, please buy one of the "Buy-One, Give-One" tickets, so we can support more of the amazing women of Pōneke to attend.
Get in quick!
Tickets for previous events have sold out fast. For this event we are capped at 180 people attending and we will be updating our social media channels on the progress of the ticket sales, so get your tickets quick.  
Accessibility
The Te Ahumairangi Foyer, National Library is fully accessible. If you are not able to use the steps on Molesworth Street, you will be able to access the venue via the lift off Aitken Street. There will be staff at the door to be able to support and guide you to the venue space.
A bit about us 
Me.We.Pōneke is our signature quarterly event designed to inspire, connect and raise the voices of our wonderful community of Wellington women, and people who identify as women. 
We believe that magic happens when women come together. We’ve seen it. We’ve felt it. And we want to create more of it with regular events that are open, welcoming, supportive and empowering for the women of Wellington.
Come along, bring a friend and join us as we continue to raise the voices of Wellington women and invite you all to be part of Me We Pōneke.
You can join our mailing list from our brand new website, thanks to our amazing partner Springload. Check it out here and make sure you sign up to our mailing list: https://www.womenofponeke.org....
We are also on Insta! Follow us here: https://www.instagram.com/wome…

Help a woman in need If you wish to support someone else who may have a financial barrier, please buy one of the "Buy-One, Give-One" tickets, so we can support more of the amazing women of Pōneke to attend.

events.long_description:
Positive Futures 2026 Launch at Green Thinks
Join us this February for the exciting launch of our 2026 theme, Positive Futures, at Green Thinks! This event will take place simultaneously in Wellington, Auckland, and Tauranga, with an online option for those joining us from other regions.
We envision a thriving future for our communities, landscapes, and urban environments, and we invite you to be a part of this vital conversation. Engage with fellow members, committee, partners, and thought leaders in the built environment as we explore what positive futures could mean for our cities and beyond.
Throughout 2026, we aim to facilitate meaningful discussions and host a variety of events and forums designed to spark new ideas and collaborative efforts. This is your chance to contribute to shaping the world we want to see.
Be part of the conversation that aims to shape sustainable and resilient futures for our communities.

We can’t wait to see you there!

events.id: Unity Book Club February 2025 | Service-57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Unity Book Club February 2025 | Service
events.venue: 57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
About the book: 
What's this book about? Is there a restroom? Do you have gluten-free bagels? Do you work here? Do you have a restroom? Do I buy books or rent books or what?
The worst thing about a bookshop is the customers. Then there's the gift-wrapping, the invoicing, the stock takes. The Yelp reviews that inevitably contribute to self-loathing.

In his late forties, Sean is still a frustrated bookseller who should have written his novel already. Instead, he spends his days drowning in his overwhelming sense of contempt -for LA, for its readers, for its casual disdain for service. And what, or whom, is he serving anyway?

Biting, hilarious and self-aware, John Tottenham's debut novel is a razor-sharp dissection of the modern scourges of gentrification, male vanity, jealousy and the worth of literature in a digital age.

Melissa and Eden will be hosting our monthly book club to discuss some of the excellent recently released books.

In February we will be discussing Service by John Tottenham.

We have limited tickets available so grab a ticket sooner rather then later and tell your friends and whānau.

Drinks and snacks provided. If you have any specific allergies, let us know and send an email.

If you have any further queries send us an email to wellington@unitybooks.co.nz and address it to Melissa.

events.id: Rethinking Career: From 9 to 5 to Thrive-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Rethinking Career: From 9 to 5 to Thrive
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Rethinking Careers: From 9 to 5 to Thrive

What if thriving at work isn’t about doing more — but about expressing who you already are?

This event explores how meaningful work emerges when we understand our natural temperament and disposition. According to the Career Dharma framework, each person is wired to create value in a particular way — driven by distinct motivations, values, and strengths.

This natural orientation is known as your field of work.

Rather than starting with job titles, Career Dharma identifies four archetypal fields of work, drawn from timeless wisdom about human nature:

Ideas – teaching, guiding, researching, healing

Government – organising, protecting, leading

Artistry – creating beauty, sensing emotion, responding to needs

Resources – building, managing, sustaining, and sharing value

When we work within the field that matches our nature, work feels purposeful and sustainable. When we don’t, even “successful” careers can lead to burnout or inner conflict.

Through guided exercises and reflection, you’ll:

Identify your natural field of work

Understand what genuinely motivates and drains you

See why certain roles feel heavy — and others feel more alive

Connect your disposition to real-world roles and possible pathways

This session isn’t just about fixing your career. It’s about learning the language of your own nature, and letting that understanding quietly guide what comes next.

Please note this is one of two careers workshops this month. While they complement each other, each session is designed to be meaningful on its own.

A plant-based dinner and dessert are included in your ticket.
Both hosts are available to support participants who wish to explore their career path further.

Meet your hosts, Sri Jiva & Chanchala
Since childhood, Sri Jiva has been fascinated by meaning, purpose, and authentic life fulfilment. This, among other things, led him to join a monastery at the age of 19. After years of monastic training, he chose to marry and pursue a career. He felt called to use his monastic experience to help others understand themselves, and to find wisdom, meaning, and purpose in their own lives. Inspired by this calling, he went to university to study counselling. Now, Sri Jiva and his wife live near Wellington, where he works with a small team of counsellors, supporting clients individually and in groups.

Chanchala studied psychology and education and brings a coaching-based approach to career exploration. She supports people to uncover work they love by helping them understand what truly nourishes their nature and psychology. Chanchala’s work is grounded in curiosity, self-trust, and creating careers that feel sustainable and life-giving.

events.id: Yoga Nidra: Moon Bathing-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Yoga Nidra: Moon Bathing
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Slow down, settle in, and let the soft glow of the moon guide you inward.

This calming evening will center around the deeply restorative practice of Yoga Nidra—a guided meditation designed to bring your body into a state of deep rest while your awareness gently drifts between waking and dreaming. Known to activate the parasympathetic nervous system and reduce stress, Yoga Nidra supports emotional balance, mental clarity, and a profound sense of ease.

This moon-themed session invites you to tune into the gentle, reflective energy of the lunar cycle—a time for slowing down, softening, and simply being.

After the practice, we’ll be sharing a nourishing plant-based dinner together. It’s included in your ticket and is a lovely way to gently transition back, connect, and enjoy wholesome food in good company.

events.id: The Miracle Tone | A Handpan Concert with Taylor Sol | Wellington-257 Riddiford Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: The Miracle Tone | A Handpan Concert with Taylor Sol | Wellington
events.venue: 257 Riddiford Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
A live, seated handpan concert with Taylor Sol
Join Taylor Sol for a 90-minute handpan concert in 432 Hz, offering a deeply immersive listening experience through rhythm, melody, and resonance.
This is a concert-style event where guests are invited to sit comfortably and witness the music as it unfolds. The evening includes a brief spoken opening, one hour of live handpan music, and a gentle closing reflection to complete the journey. The handpan’s warm, organic tones create an ambient soundscape that supports relaxation, nervous system balance, and a sense of connection, both to nature and to the inner listening space. This offering is intentionally simple and inclusive. No participation, movement, or prior experience is required. Just arrive as you are and allow the music to carry you.
WHEN & WHERE
Date: Thursday 26 February 2026
Time: 6:30pm – 8:00pm
Venue: The Polish Association In NZ Inc - 257 Riddiford Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
WHAT TO EXPECT
• A 90-minute seated concert experience
• One full hour of live handpan music in 432 Hz
• Opening and closing reflections & storytelling
• Ambient, immersive soundscapes
• A calm, grounded atmosphere
• Space to rest, listen, and receive
WHO IS THIS FOR?
This concert is open to everyone, all ages and walks of life are welcome.
Perfect for those seeking:
• Deep listening and presence
• Calm and nervous system renewal
• Musical beauty and inspiration
• A unique live concert experience
No prior experience with sound journeys or meditation is needed.
Children, families, elders, and first-time listeners are warmly welcome.
WHAT TO BRING / SEATING
• Seating will be provided as well as a floor seated option (optional - bring chair cushion, shawl)
• Water bottle
• An open mind
See you there!
Taylor Sol

events.id: February Full Moon Drumming-Wellington-Facebook
events.name: February Full Moon Drumming
events.venue: Wellington
events.long_description:
Please remember this is a ZERO WASTE and *NO ALCOHOL* community gathering.
Kia ora!
Full Moon Drumming Wellington is a registered public event with the Wellington City Council. We are a group of humans from all walks of life who gather under the full moon each month to connect through drumming and dance around the fire. This gathering is co-creative and participatory, that means if you made it to the circle you are part of the circle. There is no audience, everyone is invited to participate as part of the ‘chorus’ (singing/clapping), dancing, or drumming.
The event is weather permitting, we check the forecast a few days prior and aim to make a decision the day before the event, although this is not possible and sometimes we make the decision on the day. All updates are posted on the event page.
This gathering is entirely run by volunteers, if you'd like to contribute in any way please get in touch.
There are a few things that we need help with:
- FIREWOOD: Please bring dry firewood as a koha, no wood no fire! Please NOTE we DO NOT burn pallets (due to nails) or treated timber. Feel free to post or reach out if you have a vehicle and are keen to help gather firewood on the day of the event.
- BEAUTIFYING THE CIRCLE SPACE: Anyone has fairy lights, oil burners, or is keen to make some signs?
NOTE: We hold a fire permit for this event. For safety reasons we don't allow participants to feed the fire, and while is generally okay to roast some marshmallows early in the evening we don't allow the use the fire for cooking or heating food.
This is an **ALCOHOL FREE EVENT**, please help us uphold this kaupapa and remind those who are unaware and might be new to the event that alcohol is not permitted. As hosts we are responsible for your safety and we take that responsibility seriously, especially given that the event is authorised through both fire and event permits. Large, public, all ages gatherings require administration and logistics so please respect this and the guidelines provided.
Princess Bay is within Taputeranga Marine Reserve (https://octopus.org.nz/taputeranga-marine-reserve), we are welcomed to gather each month in this special place so let’s all make sure there is NO RUBBISH LEFT BEHIND and that we take care of the space. Dogs are NOT ALLOWED at the gathering - there are Korora (Blue Pinguins) nesting under the rocks nearby and we've had issues with dogs in the past.
Children are welcome at the fire, though, especially after dark, please make sure that all children have adult supervision, that the supervisors are aware of the children they are looking after, and that the children are aware of who is looking after them.
Feel free to bring:
- Your friends.
- Drums or any percussive instrument.
- Warm clothing; jackets and wool blankets are good.
- Something to seat on (otherwise sand is often wet)
- Drinking water.
- Food, tea to share.
- Your lovely selves.
- Fire spinning kit and fuel.
FIRE SPINNERS: Please take all precautionary safety measures and make sure to set up fire-spinning downwind from the fire circle.
PARKING: There's a parking lot a few hundred meters from the fire circle where there's also public toilets. Please also be aware of our neighbors driveway opposite the stairway and do not park directly in front of it.
CARPOOLING: If you don't have a way to get to Princess Bay, or if you have spare seats in your car, feel free to post it on the event page. The less cars driving the better.
Feel free to share the event page and send an event invite to whomever you feel would be interested, not everyone sees the notifications and advertising

events.id: King Lear - Bard in the Yard Summer Shakespeare-166 Muritai Road, Eastbourne, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: King Lear - Bard in the Yard Summer Shakespeare
events.venue: 166 Muritai Road, Eastbourne, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand
events.long_description:
This summer, Eastbourne’s prize-winning Butterfly Creek Theatre Troupe proudly celebrates its 30th year of Shakespeare with a strikingly contemporary production of King Lear. In this two-hour adaptation the tragedy is sharpened to its core: the fraught family dynamics of Lear and Gloucester, two parents whose misguided choices unleash betrayal and heartbreak. Lear’s reckless division of his kingdom and Gloucester’s misplaced trust in her children reveal how pride and blindness can devastate generations. Performed as the sun sets on a summer evening—with the adjacent school hall ready should the weather turn—this production offers a fresh perspective on parental folly, loyalty, and love, making Shakespeare’s timeless themes resonate anew.
The show will be presented to a seated audience in the school courtyard. It can get chilly so wrap warmly but it will move indoors in poor weather. There is a bar (cash or Eftpos). Parking in the school grounds accessible from Oroua Street.
Warning: The play contains graphic violence.

events.id: Ludovico Einaudi | Wellington - Michael Fowler Centre-Michael Fowler Centre, 111 Jervois Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Ludovico Einaudi | Wellington - Michael Fowler Centre
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, 111 Jervois Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Ludovico Einaudi
Sunday 1 February 2026
Michael Fowler Centre
The world’s most popular classical music composer, Italian pianist, Ludovico Einaudi, returns to Australia and New Zealand this January with his new album The Summer Portraits.
He has performed on an Arctic ice-floe for Greenpeace and has seen his music become the soundtrack for Oscar and Golden Globe winning films ('Les Intouchables', 'Nomadland', 'The Father') and TikTok phenomena (his 2012 track 'Experience' exploded on the app) alike. From his earliest work composing for theatre and ballet in the 1980s to his multi-million-selling albums like 'In a Time Lapse' and his popular soundtracks across film and television, Einaudi has drawn upon neo-classical, pop, ambient, rock and experimental styles to create a sound that crosses boundaries and generations, becoming the world’s best known – and most streamed – classical music artist in the process.
In January 2025, Einaudi released 'The Summer Portraits'. The record is a lush return to full-band textures and is the result of a cascade of personal memories triggered by sun, summer and family holidays. On his last Australian tour, before a gig at the Sydney Opera House, Einaudi sat down and started composing the single 'Rose Bay', based on his sense impressions of the bay his grandfather made home.
Don’t miss your chance to experience the world’s most popular contemporary classical artist.

events.id: Wellington Art Show 2026-Tākina Wellington Convention and Exhibition Centre-Wellington NZ
events.name: Wellington Art Show 2026
events.venue: Tākina Wellington Convention and Exhibition Centre
events.long_description:
Art is for everyone. That’s the mantra of The Wellington Art Show. It’s an event for New Zealand artists to display their latest creations. You can meet the artists, view their works, and purchase them when the show comes to Tākina Wellington Convention and Exhibition Centre. Whatever your budget, you’ll be able to find a treasure to take home and enjoy. You can also watch artists demonstrate their craft and listen to live music. 
The organisers think art can make a difference in people’s lives. The artists involved are encouraged to engage directly with the public, communicating information about their practice. It makes for a warm and interesting experience for visitors. 
The Wellington Art Show has a range of awards to encourage emerging and established artists. The public can also get involved with a People’s Choice Award. Go visit, enjoy the stellar lineup of kiwi artists and vote for your favourite work.

events.id: 2026 Wellington POCUS Fundamentals Course / EGLS Course-24 Hawkestone Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: 2026 Wellington POCUS Fundamentals Course / EGLS Course
events.venue: 24 Hawkestone Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
POCUS Fundamentals + EGLS
2 Days of Comprehensive POCUS education for Acute Care Clinicians
Take part in a flexible learning experience designed for real-world acute care:
Day 1: POCUS Fundamentals
Master the essentials – focus on AAA & eFAST.
Day 2: EGLS (Echo Guided Life Support)
Confidently assess and manage the shocked patient using focused cardiac and lung ultrasound.
Attend either day independently, or combine both for a complete acute care ultrasound experience.

Day 1 – POCUS Fundamentals
Focus on essential diagnostic ultrasound skills with Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm (AAA) & eFAST (extended Focused Assessment with Sonography in Trauma) modules. This is ideal for clinicians seeking to build confidence and competence in core applications that can be immediately applied in clinical practice.
https://www.emugs.org/pocusfundamentals
Day 2 – EGLS (Echo-Guided Life Support)
Take your resuscitation skills to the next level with EGLS. Learn a structured, protocolised approach to using cardiac and lung ultrasound in the assessment and management of shock and respiratory failure. This course is designed to empower acute care clinicians with the practical skills to make rapid, life-saving decisions.
https://www.emugs.org/egls
Combo of Fundamentals + EGLS - Whether you're new to ultrasound or looking to enhance your skills, this comprehensive two-day course  is ideal for acute care clinicians aiming to integrate POCUS into daily practice.
You'll cover the core emergency medicine ultrasound modules: FELS, eFAST, AAA, and lung. The course aligns with ACEM and ASUM credentialing requirements for core ultrasound modalities.
By the end, you'll be proficient in four essential techniques: focused echo in life support (FELS), extended FAST, aortic scanning, and lung/thoracic ultrasound.
The program includes online pre-course work, brief lectures, image review, hands-on scanning, and networking opportunities—all within a supportive learning environment.
Suitable for all experience levels:
ACEM trainees beginning their ultrasound journey
Acute care doctors looking to upskill
Clinicians in critical care, rural, and urgent care settings
Beginners will build a solid foundation; experienced users can refine skills with expert feedback

events.long_description:
JOURNEY TO SERENITY Yin Yoga and Sound Healing Special Series # 5
Welcome to the Journey to Serenity Yin Yoga and Sound Healing twice monthly session!!!

These beautiful, nourishing Yin and Sound Sessions are on the second and Fourth Friday of each month (between November 28th and March 28th 2026) and are held in the Meeting / Supper Room of the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall on Tutanekai Street.

It would be lovely to share this healing, nourishing restorative practice in the special energy and support you to give your life a boost of wellbeing and good feeling!!

INTRODUCING - SPECIAL WELCOME OFFER - TWO PEOPLE FOR $90 (You don't have to be a couple) - Book through bank transfer or message me directly

Unique Yin Yoga, Sound Healing, breathwork and meditation come together to create this specially guided, deeply relaxing and healing experience, held within a unique holistic framework that encourages reflection and self-care.

Take the time and space that this session offers, for yourself, and give yourself a gift of true nourishment.

Bryony Shanti from Heartsong Healing will use a wide range of special healing sound instruments along with her voice to guide you into peace, relaxation and stillness. The healing vibration of the specially chosen sounds will wash over you bringing deep clearing, balance and alignment. There is a experience of gratitude and blessing.

Bryony's sound works to strengthen and deepen the powerful work of Yin yoga teacher Bianca who will guide you through 90-minutes of restorative and uplifting poses that are intended for you relax, heal and to open more to receive the healing vibration of sound.

Bianca's Yin Yoga focuses on easily accessible and effective poses
which work into the deeper connective tissues of the body. These poses are held for anywhere between 90 seconds to 5 minutes to allow for an opening in the body, the perfect way to receive the sound vibrations.

Yin yoga invites us into stillness and gives space for both the mind and body to relax and release tension and stress.

OPEN TO ALL: Whether you have experience in either Yin Yoga and Sound Healing or are looking to try something completely new, you are very welcome to join in the journey into a sense of serenity. Beginners and experienced practitioners alike will find something nourishing for themselves in this session.

events.long_description:
Are you looking to enhance your story-sharing skills and visitor engagement?

This workshop is a foundational step towards mastering interpretation and transforming visits into unforgettable experiences. Perfect for those working in museums, galleries, parks, zoos, heritage sites and tourist attractions.
Designed and presented by Lynda Burns this workshop offers a full day of immersive learning. With decades of experience as a practitioner, trainer, and mentor across Aotearoa and abroad, Lynda brings a wealth of knowledge and expertise and is a leader in the field of interpretation.
Throughout the day, you will: 
Experiment with new ideas and skills.
Share your existing knowledge with like-minded professionals. 
Explore the role of place interpretation in visitor experience. 
Learn how to reach the hearts and minds of visitors through meaningful story-sharing. 
Take a closer look at visitor demographics and behaviours. 
Discover the steps to start your interpretation projects, including research, goal setting, media choices, budgeting, and collection analysis. 
Gain basic project management tips to get things done efficiently. 
Explore how to work alongside iwi, stakeholders and managers. 
Please bring actual project ideas or content research to trial what you have learned throughout the day. This hands-on approach ensures that you get to test your new skills and leave with actionable insights. 
"Lynda recently facilitated a workshop on guiding for our team at Cornwall Park. Her amazing, tailored response to our programme has vastly improved the visitor experience and how we interpret this place. Our guides love the new skills they have learnt and are enjoying updating the entire programme of park-led walks.”
- Charlotte Taylor Visitor Experience 2IC Cornwall Park
Join us for this incredible opportunity to enhance your professional skills and elevate your visitor experience. 
Friday 27 February
9.30am-5pm
Wellington Zoo, 200 Daniell Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021
Tickets:
Non member $250
INNZ Member $215
Student/unwaged $190

Morning tea, lunch and afternoon tea will be provided, and all dietary requirements will be accommodated. Please let us know if you have any accessibility requirements.

Discover highlights from our Auckland Interpretation 101 workshop

events.id: Transvision Vamp - Meow Nui, Wellington, NZ-92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011-All Events In
events.name: Transvision Vamp - Meow Nui, Wellington, NZ
events.venue: 92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
events.long_description:
Transvision Vamp - Meow Nui, Wellington, NZ
UK pop rockers Transvision Vamp are bringing those glorious hits to NZ in February - their first tour here since 1991!

Formed in 1986, Transvision Vamp quickly rose to fame. Their songs Baby I Don’t Care, Revolution Baby, I Want Your Love, The Only One, and If Looks Could K*ll, were all NZ chart hits.

Joining original Transvision Vamp's Wendy James and Dave Parsons onstage are guitarist Alex Ward (The Thurston Moore Group) and James Sclavunos (Nick Cave and The Bad Seeds) on drums.

Says Wendy James: "I am so very excited to be coming back to New Zealand to play the songs which started my whole musical journey! I remember vividly so many incredible moments gigging in New Zealand, moments of enormous success, enormous love and enormous fun."

events.long_description:
Join us the for the weekend at Wellington’s first MTB Festival from Feb 27th - March 1st 2026.

A free event celebrating our city’s trails and community with three action-packed days of rides, events, and fun for all riders and non-riders!

Day 1: Makara peak, 27th Feb, 2026, 3pm - 9pm
Location: Festival Hub outside Mud Cycles, 424 Karori Road, Karori

what's on offer
- Free Shuttles looping from 3:00-7:00pm
- Bike shop and product showcase, including demo bikes
- On Top of the World - run by WORD this is a fun kids ride to the top of Makara Peak with snacks and party vibes at the top
- Food trucks, craft beer and beverages
- DJ playing laid back festival vibes

For who?
- All abilities and ages – No matter your riding level there’s an activity for you
- Riders and non-riders – don’t ride, no problem. Music, food and off the bike activities are plenty

events.long_description:
5 Course Dinner at Le Cordon Bleu | 27 FEBRUARY 2026
This 5-Course dinner expertly prepared by our Cuisine students is not to be missed. 

IMPORTANT NOTE: Tables arranged per order

About this Event


This 5-Course dinner expertly prepared by our Intermediate Cuisine students is not to be missed.


Ticket Information
IMPORTANT NOTE: Tables are arranged per order. If you purchase tickets separately you need to e-mail to advise which other ticket holders you wish to be seated with.
Date: Friday 27th February
(We are hosting additional dinner sessions, to purchase tickets for these events please click here and select your chosen date. Tickets are non-transferable, please ensure you purchase tickets for the correct date.)
Price: $99 per person
Booking Times: 5:30pm | 6:00pm | 6:30pm | 7:00pm
Matched Wine Option: If you would like to add matched wines to your dining experience you can do so on the day by paying an additional charge. Alternatively, we have a selection of wines to purchase by the glass or bottle as well as beers and soft drinks. We are a fully licensed restaurant and do not offer BYO.
Dietary Requirements: Our menu is set and we are unable to make any menu alterations or cater to any specific dietary requirements (including religious diets) or food allergies. We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause.
The Menu: will not be released before the event. Please be aware that the menu will include fish, meat and shellfish components.
Tickets are allocated for specific seating times, please ensure you arrive promptly at the time indicated on your ticket.
The estimated time to enjoy the full Le Cordon Bleu 5 course dining experience is 2 hours. We invite you to sit back, relax and enjoy our students' creations.




What is Brasserie Le Cordon Bleu?
Brasserie Le Cordon Bleu is our training restaurant where our students get practical experience in a real restaurant environment - all under the expert guidance of their chef lecturers. In the kitchen, we have students from our Diplôme de Cuisine programme. In the dining room we have our Bachelor of Culinary Arts and Business students serving you and putting their theory skills into practice.

Brasserie & High Tea Refund Policy
• No refunds are provided unless the event is cancelled by Le Cordon Bleu NZ.
• Customers can arrange for someone else to take their place.

events.id: Widows & Widowers Meet-Up-Kanteen Cafe, 7 Waterloo Quay, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Widows & Widowers Meet-Up
events.venue: Kanteen Cafe, 7 Waterloo Quay, Wellington
events.long_description:
Before the main speed dating event begins, we invite widows and widowers to join us for a relaxed, supportive meet-up designed especially for those who’ve experienced loss and are taking the brave step of meeting new people again.

This quiet pre-event gathering offers a chance to connect with others who truly understand the journey you’re on. Share a conversation, enjoy a drink, and ease into the evening at your own pace. There’s no pressure, no expectations—just a friendly space where you can feel comfortable, understood, and welcomed before the larger event starts.

If you do not wish to attend the speed dating, feel free to come to this meet up and then leave when the speed dating starts, or when you’re peopled out!

A landmark piece of New Zealand theatre by acclaimed writer and director Hone Kouka, Waiora explores the impact of colonisation, the urban drift, and the tension between past and future. An "urgent and vibrant story" (Stuff), Waiora is a powerful reflection on family, culture, and belonging.

All Tickets are Mobile Ticket Only. 
Mobile Tickets are like Print-at-Home tickets but instead of having to print off the tickets yourself, you can just show the barcode on your mobile phone. It is the easiest way to access tickets to your events. For more information visit Ticketmaster.co.nz/mobileticket

Please note: There is no elevator in the Opera House and access to the Dress Circle and Gallery are via stairs. The Gallery may be unsuitable for patrons with accessibility requirements or experience vertigo. For further information, please contact us on 04 916 1205.

events.id: Transvision Vamp-Meow Nui, 92 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington, 6011, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Transvision Vamp
events.venue: Meow Nui, 92 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington, 6011, Wellington
events.long_description:
Transvision Vamp announce first New Zealand tour in 31 years!
British pop rock band Transvision Vamp are bringing their hits down under for the first time in almost three decades. With shows in Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch lined up for February 2026, the group will be playing their nostalgia-filled favourites.
‍
Formed in 1986, Transvision Vamp quickly rose to fame. Their songs 'Baby I Don’t Care', 'Revolution Baby', 'I Want Your Love', 'The Only One' and 'If Looks Could Kill' all hit the Top 50 in the New Zealand singles chart from 1988 - 1991. Wendy James, the lead singer and focal point of the group, attracted media attention with her sexually charged and rebellious image.

Transvision Vamp became known for their collision of brash punk and commercial pop, and joining James on this tour are some musical luminaries: Alex Ward (The Thurston Moore Group) on guitar, Dave Parsons (Transvision Vamp) on bass, and James Sclavunos (Nick Cave and The Bad Seeds) on drums.

Wendy James went on to pursue a successful solo career spanning an additional seven studio albums, including a notable collaboration with Elvis Costello. She served as a feminist symbol in the 80’s for unapologetic self-expression and fearless leadership.

James says, "I am so very excited to be coming back to New Zealand to play the songs which started my whole musical journey! I remember vividly so many incredible moments gigging in New Zealand, moments of enormous success, enormous love and enormous fun. I’m bringing with me a set full of music that will thrill and musicians who will amaze!"

events.id: Hannah Virk - Musos Club Video Premiere - NZ Fringe Festival-The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Hannah Virk - Musos Club Video Premiere - NZ Fringe Festival
events.venue: The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Get your best gig gear on and join indie-pop artist Hannah Virk for the premiere screening of the Musos Club music video from her sophomore album Pocket Clocks, including an exclusive live performance, behind-the-scenes stories and more.

Hannah Virk is an independent musician based in Wellington, New Zealand, exploring music on guitar, ukulele and keyboard. Hannah uses her own beats and layers instruments and vocals to create upbeat and captivating songs. Hannah's songs bring together electronic, folk and pop styles to create a truly unique flavour. Described as both quirky and like poetry to music, Hannah's songs are set apart by their vivid imagery and explorative sounds, surprising listeners with every note and melody.

Musos Club is the first single from Hannah's sophomore albu,m Pocket Clocks. The album is an exciting step for Hannah, who began her musical career as an independent artist and producer after getting a guitar at age 30 and letting her creativity bloom. Musos Club dives into the live music scene and her experiences growing up around 'the cool kids' before she started her own musical journey and found her 'wild and free' pathway.

You can find Hannah's music here: https://linktr.ee/hannahvirk
Music video credit: Kobenaboo Productions: @kobenabooproductions2912

events.name: Blenheim Gypsy Fair
events.venue: Pollard Park,Mayfield, Blenheim 7201, Blenheim, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Blenheim Gypsy Fair
The Gypsy Fair is a nationwide travelling event, bringing family fun, live music and an unbeatable vibe to each town we visit.🌞💜

Having been on the road for over 45 years, it’s safe to say our roots run deep. Our people are incredible, and house trucks/buses are pretty cool too! So don’t forget to check out our unique way of living while you’re here 🫶🌿🌻💜

Whether you’re just having a browse, letting the kids loose on our rides, parking up with some food or coffee, or checking out some funky handmade crafts, we would love to see you! Come and hang out for the day, we’re sure to bring smiles to your faces, and create lifelong memories💜

🌞Free entry for everyone🌞 We pride ourselves on being an affordable event for every family. With free entertainment all day, plenty of chill out zones, and loads of life size games laying around, we truely love to see the community getting amongst it all! Can’t wait to see you there🌞👣🐝🌿🌊

Follow us on Facebook – ‘Gypsy Fair’ for updates on our travels and creations! We’re always open to anyone who wants to come and live the dream, so please email us if this sounds like a bit of you. –

You may also like the following events from The GypsyFair:
Next Friday, 26th September, 11:00 pm, Papamoa Gypsy Fair in Tauranga
Next month, 3rd October, 11:00 pm, Gisborne Gypsy Fair in Gisborne
Next month, 10th October, 11:00 pm, Havelock North Gypsy Fair in Havelock North
Also check out other Music events in Blenheim, Entertainment events in Blenheim.

We will be holding a gold coin donation garage sale once again. We collect donations of furniture, toys, tools, household items, craft supplies just about anything you can imagine well maybe not unicorns but you never know. events.id: Paula Tape + Christopher Tubbs tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: Paula Tape + Christopher Tubbs tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Paula Tape lands in Wellington at Meow Nui on Saturday 28 February, bringing her unmistakable blend of rhythm-forward house, Balearic warmth and cosmic disco to the dancefloor.
Originally from Santiago, Chile, Paula Tape (Paula Soto Carmona) is a multifaceted DJ, producer and fashion designer whose musical foundations were forged behind the drum kit in metal and indie-electro bands. That percussive instinct still drives her sound today, where classic house meets sun-kissed Balearic moods and left-of-centre club cuts. As the founder of Tempo Dischi, she’s built a platform dedicated to adventurous dance music—championing disco, afro and cosmic influences while spotlighting emerging artists from across the globe.
Joining Paula Tape on the night is Christopher Tubbs, Aotearoa DJ royalty and a recent collaborator with Paula: Christopher’s and Eden Burns’s ‘Drums Are Dangerous’ (feat Paula Tape) came out last year on Germany’s Public Possession, to widespread acclaim.
Christopher Tubbs is a DJ, producer, and broadcaster. More than that he is a true godfather of the New Zealand dance music scene. His productions as Tubbs, Atlantic Conveyor and collaborations with Eden Burns for Public Possession have resulted in strong support from luminaries as varied as Gilles Peterson, Mark Ronson, Zane Lowe, Optimo and Axel Boman.
As a globetrotting DJ, Christopher Tubbs has played at almost every notable club internationally, from Privilege in Ibiza to Fabric in London. Christopher also co-owned the cult vinyl-only record label Untracked (heavily supported by the likes of Mark Ronson and Gilles Peterson), giving debut releases to underground heroes Red Rack’em and NZ’s very own Frank Booker.

Joining Paula Tape on the night is Christopher Tubbs, Aotearoa DJ royalty and a recent collaborator with Paula: Christopher’s and Eden Burns’s ‘Drums Are Dangerous’ (feat Paula Tape) came out last year on Germany’s Public Possession, to widespread acclaim.

events.id: Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga 28th of Febraury 2026-Pause Yoga,28 Moana Rd, Days Bay, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga 28th of Febraury 2026
events.venue: Pause Yoga,28 Moana Rd, Days Bay, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga 28th of Febraury 2026
Join us for this special evening of harmonising pure sounds, inspiring music and relaxation in the beautiful Pause Yoga studio in Eastbourne.
Give yourself a peaceful moment and space of quiet awareness. Discover the power of your own voice, mantra and silence working to find inner peace and contentment. Bring an intention, get comfortable and let the sound waves take over. Invite the sound to take you into a journey within, into your heart, to rest, to release physical, mental and emotional tension.

Surrender to the sound of Gong, Tibetan and Crystal Bowls, Native American flutes, Harmonium, Sitar ,Esraj, Bells etc..Claudio brings high quality amplification so you can feel the sound in your body and take into a immersive experience.

Feel free to bring a pillow and blanket to assure comfort.


About Claudio: Claudio is a 3rd generation Multinstrumentalist Musician from Mexico City now based in Wellington. Claudio comes from a musicians family he started playing music since very early years. When he finished music school as a classical guitarist he moved to Montreal, Canada and explored new genres such a Jazz, World Music, and Spiritual Music. Traveling he discovered Indian Music and the Yoga Tradition and they became a very important influence on his career and lifestyle, and allowed him to study Music and Yoga with teachers in Europe and Asia. He learnt to play the Tibetan Singing Bowls in Kathmandu Nepal and Varanasi India.He explored many instruments and music styles such as Classical Guitar, Sitar, Esraj, Bansuri, Harmonium, Flutes, Gongs and Voice.Claudio is an active Sound Healing practitioner and performer. He has been playing the Tibetan bowls for more than 10 years now.

-Website:

www.claudioescutia.com

-SoundCloud

https://soundcloud.com/claudioescutiasounds

-Instagram

https://www.instagram.com/claudio_yoga_sound_healing

-Facebook

https://www.facebook.com/soundhealingyogamusicclaudio

70s and 80s Disco Karaoke!
Get Down Tonight! It's Time to be Stayin' Alive at Our 70s & 80s Disco Karaoke Night! 🕺✨

Do you Wanna Be Startin' Somethin'? Well, STOP! In the Name of Love and come on down to The Beer Engine on Saturday 28th Feb for a night where the music is loud, the fashion is fierce, and your vocal cords are the main event!

Forget about being Under Pressure—we’re here to Relax and boogie! Whether you're a Dancing Queen or just want to Take a Chance on Me, this is your moment to shine brighter than a disco ball. We’ve got all the tracks that make you say, “Good Times!”

Are you feeling brave enough to go full Bohemian Rhapsody? Or maybe you're ready to show us your best Thriller moves? We're talking pure, unadulterated 70s and 80s Sledgehammer hits. Think Bee Gees, ABBA, Chic, Madonna, Queen, Prince, and everyone in between.

Don't let this chance Pass on By! If you're tired of listening to the Sounds of Silence, it's time to make some joyful noise. Our karaoke stage is calling your name!

When: Saturday 28th Feb, from 7 PM until The Last Dance
Where: The Beer Engine – Where every night is a Celebration

If you dress up in a great costume, Boss says he'll give you a free drink. If you sign up to sing (and y'know... sing), you'll get 15% off your next one.


Come and see MC Rob in a big wig


Come Jump on the stage and show us what you've got! We promise to be your biggest fans and make you feel like you're Livin' on a Prayer right up there with the best of them. It's going to be absolutely Electric Dreams!

P.S. If you miss this, you’ll be so sad you might just cry Tears (for Fears!)

events.id: NZTrio “Groove Café”-Te Raukura ki Kapiti, Coastlands Theatre, 34a Raumati Road, Raumati, New Zealand 5032,34 Raumati Rd, Raumati Beach, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu-All Events In
events.name: NZTrio “Groove Café”
events.venue: Te Raukura ki Kapiti, Coastlands Theatre, 34a Raumati Road, Raumati, New Zealand 5032,34 Raumati Rd, Raumati Beach, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
NZTrio “Groove Café”
NZTrio He Taonga Wairere in association with Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts presents "Groove Café"

Welcome to Groove Café, where the music is strong and the vibe is even stronger. John Psathas’ Island Songs bring sun, surf, and a dash of Kiwi cool - no sunscreen required. Then you’re kept guessing with Eliodoro Sollima’s Tre movimenti, leaping from atonal intrigue to melodic surprises faster than you can say “cin cin”. Vivian Fung’s Ominous Machine whirs, glitches, and grooves like your favourite gadget on a caffeine rush. And it all ends with Nikolai Kapustin’s Divertissement, the ultimate musical cocktail: equal parts classical poise and jazz swagger, shaken (not stirred) into four sparkling movements.

Described as a “national treasure” (NZ Herald), NZTrio He Taonga Wairere is renowned for its eclectic repertoire, outstanding talent and warm kiwi stage presence. Bringing together three incredibly accomplished artists: Amalia Hall (violin), Matthias Balzat (cello) & Stephen De Pledge (guest piano), every NZTrio performance powerfully reaffirms the importance and cathartic nature of a live musical experience in today’s digital world.

John Psathas (NZ) - Island Songs
Eliodoro Sollima - Tre movimenti
Vivian Fung - Ominous Machine
Nikolai Kapustin - Divertissement in 4 Movements

Duration approx 60mins, no interval.
