Irresistible. Captivating. Unforgettable.

When Matt Joe Gow sings, everything else stops, such is the power of his voice and his songs. Those songs have won awards, from Music Victoria Country Album of the Year (twice) to a New Zealand Country Music Award, with nominations such as an Aotearoa Music Award and various chart positions along the way.

Matt’s voice has been heard in festivals in the United Kingdom and the United States; in venues small and large across Australia and New Zealand; on radio and playlists, and supporting artists such as Chris Isaak and Justin Townes Earle. And every time, he wins new fans, drawn to his amazing vocal tone and his way of bringing the listener closer, telling them stories they will carry with them.

Few artists have that combination of indelible songwriting and an extraordinary voice, along with the commitment to create better art each time and bring it to the audience so they have a transformative live experience. Matt Joe Gow is one of those few. Having recently stepped back from the stage to focus on writing his new album whilst producing other artists, Matt’s upcoming Summer 2026 shows mark a unique and special opportunity to reconnect and see him perform live once again in his home town where it all started.

715PM DOORS
730PM PERFORMANCE

Info tickets email:

Mobile: 027 245 7887 – Anna


TOUR DATES NZ
Sat Jan 31st Ophir Peace Memorial Hall, Ophir
Sat Feb 7th Niagara Falls Bluegrass & Roots Festival, Catlins*
Sat Feb 21st Moons, Dunedin*
Sat Feb 28th Hilltop House Concerts, Wellington
Fri Mar 13th Wanaka A&P Show, Wanaka

* W/ Trio

Further info at: https://mattjoegowmusic.com

events.id: Photography Symposium – Slow Burn-Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Photography Symposium – Slow Burn
events.venue: Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable St, Wellington
events.long_description:
To celebrate the upcoming photography exhibition Slow Burn | Ahi Tāmau, opening in 2026, we're hosting a day of collegial conversation about contemporary photography in Aotearoa. Slow Burn highlights the contribution of women and non-binary photographers, drawing on over a decade of research and collecting.

Tickets $60 (waged) / $40 (unwaged) with lunch included.

Held on opening day, this symposium begins with a special opportunity to view the exhibition before the museum opens to the public, followed by a keynote presentation from Natalie Robertson, a leading photographer, moving-image artist, and Associate Professor at Auckland University of Technology. Her practice centres her ancestral river, Waiapu, exploring how “lens-based practice can contribute to iwi-based aspirations for environmental reinvigoration”.

Across a series of discussions with Aotearoa photographers, we will explore key threads in contemporary practice – including collaboration, process, and evolving photographic culture – offering insights into the ideas and relationships that shape photography today. We'll close the day in the galleries, with a new performance work by Ann Shelton from the physical garden series.

Open to photographers, curators, researchers, students, and anyone with an interest in photography, this event invites participants to connect, reflect, and share.

events.id: Acing The Interview-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Acing The Interview
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Are low confidence, anxiety and your lack of interview experience, getting in the road of you succeeding in getting offered jobs? Get practical, cutting-edge tools and techniques to Ace your interview!

Description
People have skills which they want to offer to employers, however, low confidence and anxiety combined with a lack of interview experience results in them not gaining employment.

'Acing The Interview' is a 3-module one day workshop that provides practical, cutting-edge tools and techniques to prepare participants to 'Ace the Interview'.

The 3 modules are:

1. Resourceful You - Think
2. Managing You - Feel
3. Acing the Interview - Do

Explore how to manage your thoughts under pressure and control your critical voice. Understand how to manage anxiety and stress. Demonstrate your interview skills and use body language and well-formed responses to create a powerful and positive first impression.

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:

- Manage your thoughts and critical voice under pressure
- Visualise and mentally rehearse for success
- Recognise your emotional reactions and manage your emotions under pressure
- Utilise techniques to manage anxiety
- Demonstrate interview skills and deliver well-formed responses to questions
- Understand the star model and other communication techniques and how and when to use them

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

Presented by Tony Yuile.

This course is free for NZ residents of Citizens. Please bring photo ID to the class.

events.id: Get the Job: Strategy, Skills & Self-Awareness-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Get the Job: Strategy, Skills & Self-Awareness
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Take charge of your job search with confidence. This course equips you with smart strategies, emotional intelligence, and practical tools to navigate today’s job market. Learn to avoid common mistakes, present your best self, and approach the process with intention, adaptability, and professionalism. (NZ citizen and residents free with ID, all others pay listed price).

Description
Get the Job: Strategy, Skills and Self-Awareness

This course is free for NZ citizens and residents. Please enrol online and bring photo ID when attending the workshop.

If you are not a NZ citizen or resident, a fee of $120 applies and you must phone the office on 04 385 8919 to register.

Equip yourself with the tools and strategies to thrive in today’s competitive job market. This course is designed to help job seekers at all stages across any industry. Whether you're applying for your first job, changing careers, or re-entering the workforce, this course is relevant for everyone because it requires you to self-reflect on your own journey. You’ll learn to reflect deeply on your goals and strengths while building practical skills to stand out from the crowd.

You’ll leave with a set of practical tools, clear strategies, and a better understanding of what employers want, so you can step into your next opportunity with confidence.

You’ll develop a tailored job search strategy that works for you. One that has purpose, highlights your transferable skills, sharpens your professional image, and helps you connect authentically with hiring managers. From crafting a digital-ready CV and setting job alerts, to working with recruiters and networking effectively, you’ll gain tools and insights to streamline the process.

The course also addresses the emotional journey of job hunting. Learn to manage time and energy, stay adaptable, and build resilience as you face the highs and lows of searching for the right opportunity. You’ll explore how emotional intelligence, digital literacy, and critical thinking play essential roles in first impressions, interviews, and long-term career decisions.

By the end of this course, you’ll be able to:

Identify and articulate your transferable skills.
Apply both emotional and intellectual strategies to mentor and coach yourself from within.
Develop a job search strategy that aligns with your goals.
Build confidence in presenting yourself professionally and authentically.
Develop a confident, authentic approach to your personal branding and professional networking.
Create and manage a job search plan using shortcuts like job alerts, recruitment agents, and focussed applications.
Maintain a polished digital presence and decide whether the use of professional platforms are for you (LinkedIn).
Understand how to navigate the emotional demands of job hunting with self-compassion, motivation, and adaptability.
Build and maintain a network of trusted referees who reflect your work ethic and potential.
Whether you're starting from scratch or just need a refresh, this course offers a structured, encouraging path forward to help you land your next opportunity.

NOTE: This course is subsidised with funding from the Tertiary Education Commission (TEC) and you must provide photo ID when you attend your session, if applicable.

Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

Prerequisites
This course does not deep dive into CV or interview preparing materials. If you need a more focussed session on CVs, cover letter writing or job interview preparation, make sure to attend the other Get The Job courses.

events.id: Psychology of Money Management-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Psychology of Money Management
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
"Everything starts with awareness and a good plan." This isn't your typical financial budgeting session where I tell you to stop buying coffee. It's about understanding the psychology behind how you spend or save, and discovering how we can make preparing for our future easier and more enjoyable. Once you understand how you regard money, you can take control of yours!

Managing finances should be empowering and enjoyable, yet traditional methods often make money a stressful, taboo topic—even with your closest loved ones. In this workshop, we're not here to tell you to cut your budget or skip your favourite treats. Instead, we’ll come together to design a financial plan tailored to your unique needs, making you feel confident, excited, and in control.

In this workshop, you’ll explore the psychology of money and how it influences your financial decisions. Through real-life case studies, step-by-step guidance, and collaborative exercises, you’ll design a financial system that suits your lifestyle, reduces stress, and helps you achieve your goals.

If you want to simplify your finances and live without the worry of every dollar spent, then this is the workshop for you!

NOTE: This course is subsidised with funding from the Tertiary Education Commission (TEC) and you must provide photo ID when you attend your first session, if applicable.

Disclaimer: The tutor is not a financial advisor. No investments, products or specific recommendations will be provided. A step-by-step planning process will be taught by working through a case study. Any product names or websites used in examples and explanations to help participants understand financial concepts and the planning process are used for clarity only. They are not given as any type of recommendation.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead, so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email, so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

events.name: Speaking To An Audience
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Need to “step up” and speak to an audience as part of your working life, and find it difficult? This course will equip you with strategies to assist and provide opportunities to build your confidence in this role.

Build your skills and confidence in speaking to an audience, whether it’s for a work presentation, a more formal speech, or part of a performance. In this experiential course, we’ll explore and practise skills to be better prepared to speak, build rapport with your audience, and deliver content effectively.

By the end of the day’s session, you’ll be given:

Essential elements of a great talk - from impromptu talks to formal presentations.
Tools to prepare, organise, practice, and deliver a meaningful, persuasive, and effective presentation.
Actions that build rapport with your audience.
Strategies to maximise the impact of your words, voice, and body language.
Mindsets and actions to reduce stage fright and appear more confident.
Memory techniques and strategies for impromptu speaking.

Note: You must be a NZ citizen or resident to qualify for the free course fee option. A condition of enrolment is that you must provide photo ID when you attend.

Courses need a minimum number to go ahead, so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by emai,l so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

events.id: Mould making - sculpture workshop-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Mould making - sculpture workshop
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
Learn the process of mould making in this introductory workshop. You'll take home a negative plaster mould and a positive wax. There is potential for other mediums to be used in the mould such as Fimo clay. The end result could also be cast in bronze(not included in this workshop). Moulds offer the potential for multiple editions.

The key steps involve -

- drawing the design on clay
- preparing a master model
- building a containment(mould) box
- applying the mould material (pour or brush-on)
- letting it cure
- then demoulding to get a reusable negative,

Basic materials are included.

events.id: Photograms: Paper, Light & Shadow-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Photograms: Paper, Light & Shadow
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
Discover the hidden beauty of everyday objects in the darkroom, through the camera-less process of the photogram.

Explore the surreal beauty of everyday objects through the historic photographic process of the photogram. Working in the darkroom, you’ll create striking black-and-white images without a camera – using light, photo paper, chemistry, and carefully chosen small items. Bring along objects and items to work with – jewellery, mementos, small ornaments – particularly those with interesting edges, varying translucency, or the ability to reflect or filter light. We’ll experiment with pattern, tone, and shadow, and you’ll leave with a series of prints that provide a new perspective on the familiar.

All materials included.

You must be at least 16 years of age to attend this course.

events.long_description:
We often believe we can know something about other people based on what we see of their bodies. Before we’re even conscious of it, we label, compartmentalise or judge - and it can be a real struggle to relish our own bodies when this judgment happens in front of a mirror. 
The Stories of Our Bodies is an affirming and liberating circle, firmly
held in dignity, that redirects this judgement towards positive body image and bodily autonomy. This workshop builds on the living lineage of Australian Radical Faerie elder Uncle Teacosy. It is shaped from gay men’s survival of the 90’s AIDS epidemic, evolved to uplift queer&trans communities and has been offered internationally by only one facilitator.
Each participant is invited into deep connection with their body and then in turn, we share the stories of our bodies from birth til now, removing as many articles of clothing as we choose. Stories often include histories of illness, injury, gender affirmation, addiction, aging, intentional modification, shape, ability or size
What stories can the marks and folds of a body tell when witnessed in belonging and respect? How can we uplift each story and every storyteller?
This circle is for participants from the Takatāpui, MVPFAFF+, LGBTQIA+ communities, active in engaged consent and includes partial or full nudity in a non-sexual atmosphere.
Your Facilitators: Eleven Greenstones and val smith
Eleven Greenstones (she/they, Pakeha) is a cultural worker, community educator, researcher, gardener and facilitator who seeks deep and fertile justice by cultivating rich soil and robust, adaptive communities. For three decades, Eleven has informed and performed behind a radio desk, on stage, in community centres and cultural hubs. Her work spans the Pacific Ocean including in Aotearoa, Australia, Timor Leste, China, Korea, Mongolia and the US: educating in high schools, AOD rehabs, hospitals, police stations, co-housing cooperatives, squatted warehouses, international language schools and mentoring in arts workshops and community gardens.
Eleven is a life-long student, recently in decolonial Fieldwork with Leah Manaema Avene and with Héctor Aristizábal, founder of ImaginAction. They’ve studied post-activism with fugitive philosopher Bayo Akomolafe, Generative Somatics and Undoing Racism® (People’s Institute for Survival and Beyond). They’ve been mentored by First Nations ecologists to work for a living planet, Undoing White Supremacy Austin (Texas) to design and deliver anti-racism ‘unlearning circles’ and by Radial Faerie elders to facilitate liberating spaces for the LGBTQIA+ community.
val smith (Pākehā, they/them) is a choreographic artist-researcher and educator based in Tāmaki Makaurau, Aotearoa. Their practice engages critical somatics and friendship-based collaboration to explore the socio-political dimensions of whiteness, queerness, and transness within the cultural context of Aotearoa. Recent performance work investigates more-than-human kinship, queer intimacies, and temporalities in relationship with marginal urban places.
val’s teaching and facilitation engages with community, secondary and tertiary learning environments. They have a Postgraduate Diploma in Dance and Drama Secondary Teaching, and have worked with kids, young people with disabilities, the Disability dance sector, older folks, as well as queer and trans communities. They teach somatic practices, improvisation, performance skills, critical dance, yoga, creative practice and research methodologies.
A recipient of the Arts Foundation Laureate Award (2019), val was also the 2016 Caroline Plummer Fellow at Te Whare Wānanga o Ōtākou, University of Otago, where they undertook a community dance project with the local queer community.

events.id: Comedians Getting Tattooed and Doing Stand-Up While Sitting Down in a Sterile Environment-The Fringe Bar,30 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Comedians Getting Tattooed and Doing Stand-Up While Sitting Down in a Sterile Environment
events.venue: The Fringe Bar,30 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Comedians Getting Tattooed and Doing Stand-Up While Sitting Down in a Sterile Environment
Get ready for chaos, courage, and comedy under the needle! Presented by Drug of Choice and Flash of Jeanius, this one-night-only Fringe spectacle brings together powerhouse comedians, one of whom has never been tattooed before, for a show that is part stand-up, part endurance test, and all entertainment.
As the buzz of the tattoo gun hums, these comedians will deliver fresh, fearless stand-up sets while real tattoos, that are chosen by the audience, are etched in real time. Expect the perfect mix of adrenaline, laughter, and slightly questionable life choices.
Each performer is bearing skin and soul, proving that the line between pain and pun is thinner than you think. With live tattoo artistry unfolding on stage, audience banter flying, and sterling performances this is not your average comedy show.

events.id: Empower & Protect: A One-Day Self-Defense Course-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Empower & Protect: A One-Day Self-Defense Course
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
In an unpredictable world, knowing how to protect yourself is essential. A self-defense course equips you with practical skills to stay safe, boosts confidence, and enhances awareness of potential threats. It’s not just about physical techniques—it’s about empowerment, quick thinking, and ensuring you can navigate any situation with greater security and peace of mind.

Description
Empower & Protect: A One-Day Self-Defense Course

Course is free for NZ citizens and residents (please bring photo ID when attending workshop). If you are not a NZ citizen or resident a fee of $120 will apply, please phone the office on 04 385 8919 to register.

This dynamic, hands-on course will teach you practical self-defense techniques to increase confidence, awareness, and personal safety. Under the guidance of Wellington’s top self-defense expert, you’ll learn:

Situational Awareness – Spot danger before it happens and make smart safety decisions.
De-escalation Tactics – Learn how to defuse conflicts and avoid physical confrontations.
Effective Self-Defense Moves – Master simple but powerful techniques to escape grabs, strikes, and holds.
Using Your Voice & Body Language – Understand how assertiveness and posture can deter threats.
Defending Against Common Threats – Learn what to do in real-life scenarios like public spaces, car parks, or at home.
This course is engaging, empowering, and packed with practical skills you can use immediately. Come ready to learn, move, and gain confidence in your ability to protect yourself and those around you.

Wear loose clothing and footwear so you can move about (such as active wear and runners) and that you are happy to sit on the floor in. Also bring water and some snacks for the breaks.

[This is a physical activity that involves an element of risk. While all possible measures are taken to prevent accidents or injury, please note that participation is at your own risk].

You must be a NZ citizen or resident to register in this course for free and you must provide photo ID when you attend.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

Prerequisites
Who It’s For: Everyone! Whether you're a student, professional, parent, or retiree, this course is designed to equip you with essential self-defense skills, regardless of your fitness level or experience.

events.id: The Secret Life of Desert Plants - Guided Walk-Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Secret Life of Desert Plants - Guided Walk
events.venue: Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington
events.long_description:
In this one-hour walk we will look at cacti and other succulents which live in desert conditions where rainfall is rare. How do plants survive in such hostile conditions? And does New Zealand have its own deserts and specialised plants that live here?

Meet at the Treehouse veranda at 1.30pm and finish at the duck pond.
Cost: $10 or Free for Friends – bookings required (you’ll get the option to choose your ticket type after clicking ‘Buy Tickets’)

This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden. They run throughout the year with a different topic every time.
Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

events.id: Songwriters Speaks – Free Talk Featuring MĀ, MAJIC and Chris Tamwoy.-11 Hutchison Road, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Songwriters Speaks – Free Talk Featuring MĀ, MAJIC and Chris Tamwoy.
events.venue: 11 Hutchison Road, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts proudly partners with APRA AMCOS NZ (Australasian Performing Right Association NZ) to present Songwriters Speaks 
Featuring acclaimed songwriters as they share the stories behind their waiata and compositions, offering personal insights into where the words come from. 
Hosted by Festival Co-Director Tama Waipara MNZM, this event brings the abundance of their musical kete for all to enjoy. 
Soulful singer-songwriter MAJIC and Torres Strait “guitar virtuoso” Chris Tamwoy unite for their Aotearoa debut. Prolific as individual artists, they collaborated through APRA AMCOS NZ SongHubs, resulting in the recent release of their bilingual waiata “Malu Tangata”.
One of Aotearoa’s most exciting new artists, rapper and singer-songwriter MĀ brings her genre-blending sound to Tāwhiri Warehouse. Seamlessly fusing neo-soul, jazz, and hip hop, you can catch her performance at 10pm on Saturday 28th Feb - buy tickets here
Don't miss MAJIC and Chris Tamwoy's debut performance at Māoriland on Saturday 7th March - buy tickets here
and you can catch MĀ back at Tāwhiri Warehouse at 10pm - buy tickets here

5 Course Dinner at Le Cordon Bleu | 28 FEBRUARY 2026
This 5-Course dinner expertly prepared by our Cuisine students is not to be missed. 

IMPORTANT NOTE: Tables arranged per order

About this Event


This 5-Course dinner expertly prepared by our Intermediate Cuisine students is not to be missed.


Ticket Information
IMPORTANT NOTE: Tables are arranged per order. If you purchase tickets separately you need to e-mail to advise which other ticket holders you wish to be seated with.
Date: Saturday 28th February
(We are hosting additional dinner sessions, to purchase tickets for these events please click here and select your chosen date. Tickets are non-transferable, please ensure you purchase tickets for the correct date.)
Price: $99 per person
Booking Times: 5:30pm | 6:00pm | 6:30pm | 7:00pm
Matched Wine Option: If you would like to add matched wines to your dining experience you can do so on the day by paying an additional charge. Alternatively, we have a selection of wines to purchase by the glass or bottle as well as beers and soft drinks. We are a fully licensed restaurant and do not offer BYO.
Dietary Requirements: Our menu is set and we are unable to make any menu alterations or cater to any specific dietary requirements (including religious diets) or food allergies. We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause.
The Menu: will not be released before the event. Please be aware that the menu will include fish, meat and shellfish components.
Tickets are allocated for specific seating times, please ensure you arrive promptly at the time indicated on your ticket.
The estimated time to enjoy the full Le Cordon Bleu 5 course dining experience is 2 hours. We invite you to sit back, relax and enjoy our students' creations.




What is Brasserie Le Cordon Bleu?
Brasserie Le Cordon Bleu is our training restaurant where our students get practical experience in a real restaurant environment - all under the expert guidance of their chef lecturers. In the kitchen, we have students from our Diplôme de Cuisine programme. events.id: NZTrio He Taonga Wairere presents “Groove Café”-Te Raukura ki Kapiti, Coastlands Theatre, 34a Raumati Rd, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
events.name: NZTrio He Taonga Wairere presents “Groove Café”
events.venue: Te Raukura ki Kapiti, Coastlands Theatre, 34a Raumati Rd, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Welcome to Groove Café, where the music is strong and the vibe is even stronger. John Psathas’ Island Songs bring sun, surf, and a dash of Kiwi cool - no sunscreen required. Then you’re kept guessing with Eliodoro Sollima’s Tre movimenti, leaping from atonal intrigue to melodic surprises faster than you can say “cin cin”. Vivian Fung’s Ominous Machine whirs, glitches, and grooves like your favourite gadget on a caffeine rush. And it all ends with Nikolai Kapustin’s Divertissement, the ultimate musical cocktail: equal parts classical poise and jazz swagger, shaken (not stirred) into four sparkling movements.

Described as a “national treasure” (NZ Herald), NZTrio He Taonga Wairere is renowned for its eclectic repertoire, outstanding talent and warm kiwi stage presence. Bringing together three incredibly accomplished artists: Amalia Hall (violin), Matthias Balzat (cello) & Stephen De Pledge (guest piano), every NZTrio performance powerfully reaffirms the importance and cathartic nature of a live musical experience in today’s digital world.

John Psathas (NZ) - Island Songs
Eliodoro Sollima - Tre movimenti
Vivian Fung - Ominous Machine
Nikolai Kapustin - Divertissement in 4 Movements

Duration approx 60mins, no interval

--

For accessibility seating information and wheelchair space bookings please email kiaora@teraukura.nz or call 04)9740535 during office hours.

events.id: Charlotte Yates and Show Pony Play The Shed-46a Victoria Street, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Charlotte Yates and Show Pony Play The Shed
events.venue: 46a Victoria Street, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Two of our favourites are back after a sold out show in 2025 at The Shed!
Charlotte Yates and trusted musical ally Show Pony look forward to performing a two-set show featuring all songs from critically acclaimed release Winter’s Eye and more.
Hailing from Wellington, singer-songwriter Charlotte Yates wields acoustic guitar while multi-instrumentalist Show Pony aka the ‘Swiss Army Knife of NZ music’ plays trumpet, violin, percussion and backing vocals… but not all at the same time!
“This show was so good I wanted to share this post. Charlotte Yates is surely one of NZ's most talented singer/songwriters. Her show on Saturday night with fiddler/trumpeter Show Pony was outstanding.” Peter Revell, Mayor, Thames-Coromandel
Winter’s Eye was co-produced with fellow Wellington-based artist, Brooke Singer (French for Rabbits), who contributed synthesiser, piano and backing vocal performances on the seven-track release. Winter's Eye is available on Bandcamp and all online platforms. Physical copies will be available for sale at their shows.
Doors Open 7PM for a 7.30PM Start.
The Shed is an unlicensed seated venue.

events.description:
Break out your feather boas and waistcoats as we take you back to the roaring ‘20s for an evening of dancing and razzle-dazzle!
Our jazz band will get you on the dance floor or just raise your spirits if you prefer to be a wall flower!
Featuring special guest star vocalist Eugene Wolfin.
We’ll also run a quick Charleston lessons for the adventurous.
There is a bar and entry is by koha.

events.id: Matt Joe Gow-Hilltop, 17 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Matt Joe Gow
events.venue: Hilltop, 17 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington
events.long_description:
Gate opens 7pm Music Starts 7.30pm
Matt is coming back in 2026!
From large festivals to boutique gatherings, from supporting Chris Isaak to Justin Townes Earle, Matt Joe Gow has built a reputation as an earnest performer to go alongside the authentic alt-country tones. Receiving his second consecutive Music Victoria Award for his album Between Tonight & Tomorrow—which charted on both the ARIA and Australian Independent charts—the 2023 New Zealand Country Music Award winner and critically acclaimed kiwi troubadour captures barroom Americana with a confiding closeness.
Having recently stepped back from the stage to focus on writing his new album and producing other artists, Matt’s upcoming Summer 2026 shows mark a unique and special opportunity to reconnect and see him perform live once again.“Joe Gow’s world-class songs show once again he is essential listening.”
—Rhythms Magazine
“Recording my next album I decided to do things a little differently. Rather than record the whole album at once, instead, I wrote the first half (which we’ve finished recording), we’ll mix those songs during the year, and then I’ll start writing the second half of the album. I’d been writing songs whilst living in different cities around the world, places I’d never been, and found the experience rejuvenating, not only in terms of creation but for the soul.”
Come along and enjoy this great gig in our special space, up close and personal.
These are private house concerts, not for profit, supporting our dedicated musicians. Visit www.hilltophouseconcerts.co.nz to reserve a seat. Suggested donation $30. Email confirmation will include address and details.
Teas, Coffee and Snacks provided. You're welcome to bring anything you'd like to eat or drink.
Parking available in the Coupon zones of Upland Rd & Glasgow St free after 6pm weekdays, and free all through the weekends. The Wilson Carpark at the top of the Cable Car charges 24/7.

events.id: Zonnis Live (Canadian Duo)-The Raumati Social Club, 34 Poplar Ave, Raumati South, Raumati-Event Finder
events.name: Zonnis Live (Canadian Duo)
events.venue: The Raumati Social Club, 34 Poplar Ave, Raumati South, Raumati
events.long_description:
Canadian duo Zonnis performs their unique brand of “Eclectic Cabaret Folk”.

Expect Laughter, Harmony, and Heart with Zonnis.

Victoria’s own Zonnis have built an international reputation for their quirky charm, heartfelt songwriting, and ability to leave audiences smiling long after the show ends. Having performed at over 500 festivals and venues across 10 countries, the duo blends sharp wit, soulful folk-roots melodies, and real-life honesty into performances that are both hilarious and deeply moving.

Their music fuses warm vocal harmonies, rich storytelling, and a refreshing dose of theatrical playfulness—resulting in performances that feel intimate, hilarious, and deeply heartfelt all at once.

Paula Tape lands at Meow Nui for one NZ show only. From Santiago, Chile, Paula Tape delivers rhythm-forward house, Balearic warmth and cosmic disco, shaped by her roots as a drummer and her forward-thinking label Tempo Dischi. Deep, percussive, sun-kissed dancefloor magic.

Joined by Christopher Tubbs, Aotearoa DJ royalty - producer, broadcaster and globe-trotting selector, fresh from his collab with Paula and Eden Burns on Drums Are Dangerous (Public Possession). A true godfather of NZ dance music with an international legacy.

events.id: Comedians Getting Tattooed and Doing Stand-Up While Sitting Down-The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Comedians Getting Tattooed and Doing Stand-Up While Sitting Down
events.venue: The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Get ready for chaos, courage, and comedy under the needle! Presented by Drug of Choice and Flash of Jeanius, this one-night-only Fringe spectacle brings together powerhouse comedians, one of whom has never been tattooed before, for a show that is part stand-up, part endurance test, and all entertainment.

As the buzz of the tattoo gun hums, these comedians will deliver fresh, fearless stand-up sets while real tattoos, that are chosen by the audience, are etched in real time. Expect the perfect mix of adrenaline, laughter, and slightly questionable life choices.

Each performer is bearing skin and soul, proving that the line between pain and pun is thinner than you think. With live tattoo artistry unfolding on stage, audience banter flying, and sterling performances this is not your average comedy show.

events.venue: Big Mac Slabs Furniture,289 Mazengarb Rd, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Big Mac Slabs learn to coil build a honey pot or bowl
This workshop is in Paraparaumu
When: 1st of March 2026
Time: 1.00pm
Where: 289 Mazengarb Road, Paraparaumu 5032

Coil building is a classic way to make both sculptural and functional ware. In this class you will be taught how to make coils of clay and join then together to create a honey pot or bowl. This is a fun class the can often take a twist of you not leaving with the intended creation but you will leave with something you are happy with in the end. come with a friend or make new ones in this class and enjoy the journey of making with with clay.
tea, coffee and biscuits will be offered.
After the class Fiona will take the items home to dry and be fired and the colour you choose.
The class is held in Paraparaumu NOT Whanganui.

events.id: One Dog and a Whole Lot of Murder-Sushil's Musclechef Café,27 Aotea drive, Aotea, Porirua Pa, New Zealand, Porirua-All Events In
events.name: One Dog and a Whole Lot of Murder
events.venue: Sushil's Musclechef Café,27 Aotea drive, Aotea, Porirua Pa, New Zealand, Porirua
events.long_description:
One Dog and a Whole Lot of Murder
You're welcome to come along and join me in launching the new Nicolette Briggs Mystery.

Finding the dog might just be murder
On the surface it seems like an easy case for private investigator Nicolette Briggs. Retrieve a stolen dog from her client's ex-husband, Richard Townsend. But things are never that easy. Soon the husband ends up dead, and the dog is nowhere to be found. To make matters worse, Nicolette is accused by the police of being involved in the murder.

But Richard Townsend was a con artist, leaving a trail of victims behind him, and there's no shortage of suspects. None of that is Nicolette's concern though, she just needs to find the dog. Meanwhile her daughter, Chloe, has a drama performance coming up, Nicolette somehow invites her family around for dinner, and then there's the mystery of why her step-brother is so determined to break into her house.

Just a standard week for Nicolette.

One Dog and a Whole Lot of Murder is the second book in the Nicolette Briggs series of cozy mysteries. Part Gilmore Girls, part Stephanie Plum, this is the perfect book for those that like their mysteries with a touch of humour and alot of heart.

Copies will be available on the day (cash and eftpos sales) or you can pre-order your copy at

https://www.theundergroundbookstore.nz/One-Dog-and-a-Whole-Lot-of-Murder-Nicolette-Briggs-Mystery-2-p808007800

Use the code LAUNCH2026 at checkout to get the Launch price.

events.id: Audio Described Show - Waiora Te Ūkaipō - The Homeland, Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts-The Opera House, 111 Manners Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011,111 Manners St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Audio Described Show - Waiora Te Ūkaipō - The Homeland, Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts
events.venue: The Opera House, 111 Manners Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011,111 Manners St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Audio Described Show - Waiora Te Ūkaipō - The Homeland, Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts
Set in the summer of 1965, Waiora follows Hone, who brings his whānau from the East Cape to the South Island in search of a better life. As they gather for a beachside birthday hāngī with their Pākehā guests, buried secrets and cultural tensions rise to the surface. Far from their tīpuna, the family must navigate questions of identity, belonging and survival. Can they find a place to stand together or will they be set adrift in an ocean of change? Waiora explores the impact of colonisation, the urban drift, and the tension between past and future.

In association with the Auckland Arts Festival and the Auckland Theatre Company.

When: Sunday, 1 March: 3:00pm touch tour; 4:00pm audio described performance.
Where: The Opera House, 111 Manners Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011.
Run time: 2 hours 15 minutes, including interval.
Tickets: All access tickets are $20. Companion tickets are free.
To book: email , or phone 04 830 7854.

events.long_description:
Feast Your Eyes | Carrie
50th Anniversary

In this chilling adaptation of Stephen King's horror novel, withdrawn and sensitive teen Carrie White (Sissy Spacek) faces taunting from classmates at school and abuse from her fanatically pious mother (Piper Laurie) at home. When strange occurrences start happening around Carrie, she begins to suspect that she has supernatural powers. events.id: Breathe and Draw-Hey Coastie, Wellington, 42 Tutere Street, Waikanae-Event Finder
events.name: Breathe and Draw
events.venue: Hey Coastie, Wellington, 42 Tutere Street, Waikanae
events.long_description:
Join our (totally beginner-friendly) Breathe and Draw workshop. An art class focusing on drawing itself rather than the outcome of your work. This month's class is all about turning inner chaos into calm, visual order through mindful drawing. Starting with simple, spontaneous lines and adding as we go.

Why people do it:
Reduces stress and anxiety
Helps process emotions
Supports mindfulness

We start each class with some interactive drawing exercises before we start our final piece.
$25 fee, includes all supplies.
We meet at Hey Coasties at Waikanae Beach by the Banana trees. We will be in the outdoor area if the weather is fine, please bring a jacket just in case.
Spots are limited, please get in touch to book in advance.

events.id: Otaki Market - March-Otaki Market, 58 Main Highway, Ōtaki, Kapiti Coast, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Otaki Market - March
events.venue: Otaki Market, 58 Main Highway, Ōtaki, Kapiti Coast, Ōtaki
events.long_description:
Nau Mai Haere Mai, meet you at the Market.
Discover a vibrant outdoor market nestled on State Highway One in Ōtaki, just across from New World. Join us to greet our regular stallholders and special guests from the community.
---
PARKING
There is plenty of free parking available at the Otaki train station.
Main Highway is a perfect spot for customers to the market
60 Minute Parking zone behind Riverstone Cafe.

CASH / ATM
Some vendors have eftpos, and all take cash. There is an ATM located on the main highway.

FOOD VENDORS
And when hunger strikes, our lineup of food trucks and stalls is ready to tantalize your taste buds. From waffles to hangi, seafood chowder to fry bread, sausage sizzles, and a delectable assortment of rice, noodles, and home baking – a feast awaits.

BUSKER
We often have an awesome busker, who'll be playing chilled out middle of the road tunes.

- Art & Craft
- Native trees, flowers and plants
- Candles, soaps and wax melts
- Antiques and collectables
- Produce, including yummy honey!
- Pre-love clothing, shoes and accessories
- Tools for the home and garden
- Toys and books for tamariki

---
STALL HOLDERS
Would you like to be a stall holder?
Join our market family, fill out the enquiry form: www.otakiwomensclub.org/stall-holder

events.id: Friends of Karori Cemetery: Off the Beaten Track Tour (March 2026)-76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Friends of Karori Cemetery: Off the Beaten Track Tour (March 2026)
events.venue: 76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Off the Beaten Track Tour. 
Stretch your legs on this tour! Off the Beaten Track takes you off the main road, exploring a bit further into the older sections of Karori Cemetery. We walk up and down the hills, through the gullies and alongside the creek to discover some interesting characters and some of the history of the cemetery as well.
Each tour is $10 per person (plus non-refundable booking fee). Children under 12 are free.
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.
Please note:
If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you on the day 1 hour before the tour starts by email and on our Facebook page. The booking fee is non-refundable.
This tour is approximately 2 hours long.
Please dress appropriately for the conditions. While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, during the winter months the ground can become slippery in places.
Some of our walks require a moderate degree of fitness and are not suited for those with limited mobility.
There is only one toilet which is located by the cemetery office at the main entrance.
If you have purchased tickets for other people can you please pass our tour information on to them as well.
Please meet us at the shelter (shown as the Historic Chapel on the map at the main entrance)
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.

events.id: Learn to Play Taiko Drumming In 8 Weeks-Seido Karate, 32 Brooklyn Rd, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Learn to Play Taiko Drumming In 8 Weeks
events.venue: Seido Karate, 32 Brooklyn Rd, Wellington
events.long_description:
From the basics to the stage! Join Taikoza for an immersive 8-week journey into the heart of Japanese percussion.

If you’ve felt the rumble of the bass and want more, our Beginners Course is designed to build your skill, stamina, and spirit. Taiko is a unique "full-body" art form, it’s a physical workout, a rhythmic challenge, and a powerful way to connect with others as part of a high-energy ensemble.

What You’ll Achieve:
- Learn the basics of Taiko Drumming
- Learn the Repertoire: a number of traditional and unique Taiko pieces, basic taiko rhythms and rhythm practice.
- The Performance Experience: At the end of the term, you’ll have the chance to join us for a public performance! Show your friends and family what you’ve learned (performance is optional, but highly encouraged!).

Course Details:
- Start Date: 1 March 2026 to 26 April 2026 (no lesson on 29 March due to CupaCupa)
- Cost: $115 for the full 8-week term.
- Special Discount: Only $100 if you attended our Intro Workshop!
- What to bring: Comfortable movement clothes and water bottle

Why Learn with Taikoza?
Founded in Hiroshima in the mid-1980s and based in Wellington since 1991, Taikoza is the region's longest-running Taiko ensemble. By joining this course, you aren't just learning drums, you are becoming part of a tradition that stretches back centuries.
We’ve brought the thunder to Cuba Dupa, Newtown Festival, and Blossom Valley.

Secure your place Head to our website to register. For a look at Taikoza in action, check out our videos online or follow us on Facebook and Instagram.

events.id: Friends of Karori Cemetery: Hangman's Noose Tour (March 2026)-76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Friends of Karori Cemetery: Hangman's Noose Tour (March 2026)
events.venue: 76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Hangman's Noose Tour
In total, 85 people have been executed for crime in New Zealand with the first in 1842 and the last in 1957. Seventeen of those men were executed in Wellington and 11 are buried in Karori Cemetery.  This walking tour will visit some of their graves to account their crimes, trials and convictions. It will also visit the plots of some of the victims.

The graves are unmarked and placed in remote and disparate locations making this a tour about 2.5 hours long. The route is 2.5km and requires reasonable physical fitness due to the steep terrain and unsealed paths in places.
The tour contains a number of adult themes and some graphic descriptions and so is not suitable for everyone.
Each tour is $10 per person (plus non-refundable booking fee). Children under 12 are free.
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.
Please note:
If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you on the day 1 hour before the tour starts by email and on our Facebook page. The booking fee is non-refundable.
Please dress appropriately for the conditions. While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, the ground can become slippery in places.
Some of our walks require a moderate degree of fitness and are not suited for those with limited mobility.
There is only one toilet which is located by the cemetery office at the main entrance.
If you have purchased tickets for other people can you please pass our tour information on to them as well.
Please meet us at the shelter (shown as the Historic Chapel on the map at the main entrance)
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.

events.id: From the Ordinary to the Extraordinary with Sarah McGregor-The Dowse Art Museum, 45 Laings Rd, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: From the Ordinary to the Extraordinary with Sarah McGregor
events.venue: The Dowse Art Museum, 45 Laings Rd, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Join us for an inspiring NZIPP Wellington event featuring 2025 New Zealand Professional Photographer of the Year, Sarah McGregor (Minime Photography).

In this session, Sarah will explore how seemingly ordinary photographs can be transformed into powerful, emotive conceptual works. Known for her imaginative storytelling and distinctive creative style, Sarah will break down the thinking, planning, and problem-solving behind some of her most recognised images—demonstrating that impactful concepts do not rely on large teams or elaborate productions, but on vision, intent, and creative courage.

The afternoon will conclude with a step-by-step creative editing walkthrough, where Sarah will demonstrate how she builds atmosphere, depth, and narrative through her editing process, offering practical insights photographers can apply to their own work.

This session is ideal for photographers looking to push beyond technical execution and develop stronger creative intent, conceptual confidence, and visual storytelling.

Doors open at 1:30pm, Sarah will start her presentation at 2pm.
Tea/coffee will be provided with some treats to nibble on!

events.id: Dave Flynn - Celtic Guitar Master-St Peters Village Hall, Cnr Beach Rd and Ames St, Paekākāriki-Event Finder
events.name: Dave Flynn - Celtic Guitar Master
events.venue: St Peters Village Hall, Cnr Beach Rd and Ames St, Paekākāriki
events.long_description:
Fresh from a highly successful 34-date European tour, acclaimed composer and master guitarist Dave Flynn returns to Aotearoa in 2026 with a brand new show Celtic Guitar Master.

Hailed for working “effortlessly across musical boundaries” (Radio NZ) and giving “Irish music a classical twist” (NZ Listener), Dave Flynn directs performances that are “played with intoxicating verve” (Elizabeth Kerr, Five Lines).

Dave’s prior NZ tours have won widespread acclaim, including sold-out shows with the NZ String Quartet at the 2025 Wanaka Festival of Colour and collaborating with Dunedin legend Robert Scott (The Bats, The Clean) at Dunedin Folk Club.

Flynn is a musician of many hats: orchestra conductor, guitar virtuoso and award-winning composer who is as renowned for his collaborations with Irish fiddle star Martin Hayes as he is for his own ensemble the Irish Memory Orchestra.

Expect a Celtic celebration of the 20th anniversary of Flynn’s groundbreaking debut album Draíocht– a magical mix of songs and instrumentals. Be immersed in the Kiwi-Celtic suite "Sketches of Aotearoa", alongside a selection of music from across the Celtic music world, from Ireland to Scotland, Quebec to Brittany.

An unmissable event for lovers of Celtic songcraft and guitar mastery.

Doors at 1.30pm for a 2pm show.
Tickets in advance from Eventfinda or cash only sales on the door.

events.id: Textured Bracelets - Taster-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Textured Bracelets - Taster
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
This lively, hands-on workshop is designed for complete beginners, but it’s also a great opportunity for more experienced students to enjoy a creative session making their own unique bangle!

Everyone will leave with a beautifully finished bracelet of their own preferred texture.

We’ll begin by experimenting on a sample strip of copper, where you’ll practice creating textures using hammers, punches and stamps. Once you’re confident you’ll move on to your main project: a 3mm wide flat strip bracelet in either sterling silver or copper, crafted entirely by you from start to finish. Along the way, you’ll learn essential jewellery making skills including measuring, texturing, soldering, shaping, and finishing.

Students are free to personalise their bangle with textures or stamped designs. This could be a simple hammered finish, decorative patterns, or meaningful words, names, dates, or poetry lines - making your bracelet truly one of a kind.
Beginners will work with the 3mm strip provided, ensuring a rewarding project that’s manageable to complete. Wider metal is much harder to form and solder, so we are learning to walk before we can run ;)

Copper is included in the course fee, if you wish to work in silver you can purchase it on the day.

Experienced students may choose to challenge themselves by making a wider bracelet from flat strip or by creating additional bangles in silver wire. (Please note: extra silver for wider bangles is available to purchase at the workshop for experienced students only, and let us know if you wish to go wider so we can make sure we have the strip in stock).

This workshop is a taster class: perfect for anyone seeking a fun, creative experience with a beautiful result, or for those looking to dip their toes into jewellery making and build foundational skills.

events.id: Leftfield-Shed 6, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Leftfield
events.venue: Shed 6, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
UK electronic pioneers Leftfield will celebrate 36 years of music-making when they play Wellington in March. Their influence helped define progressive house and experimental electronic music. Leftfield is expected to bring huge energy to Shed 6. For the tour concerts, they will delve into back catalogue hits as well as their most recent remix collection ‘Full Way Round’. 
The group, made up of duo Neil Barnes and Paul Daley, emerged from London’s club scene in 1989. They were among the first to bring fully live electronic music production into large-scale venues and festivals. Their 1995 Mercury Prize-winning debut album ‘Leftism’, and its 1999 follow-up ‘Rhythm and Stealth’, placed them alongside electronica acts like the Chemical Brothers and The Prodigy.

events.id: Leftfield tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: Leftfield tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Presented by: MG Live & Frontier Touring
MG Live and Frontier Touring proudly announce Leftfield – one of electronic music’s all-time greatest acts – with very special headline shows for 2026 as they continue their celebration of their 35th anniversary (36 at the time of writing).
Speaking on the shows, Neil Barnes shared, “It will be 36 years since I released the first Leftfield track, ‘Not Forgotten’, and 31 years now of Leftism. It feels like the perfect time to celebrate and I’m so pleased that finally we get to come back to New Zealand and Australia. Let’s make it unforgettable. Can’t wait to see you there!”
Leftfield’s most recent release was a collection of remixes of ‘Full Way Round (Ft Grian Chatten)’, and they have also been touring across the UK and Europe throughout 2025 to bring their 2022 album This Is What We Do to life.
“Pure Genius? It wasn’t far off.” — The Times (live review in 2025)

events.id: Cooking Classes-Sheila's Indian Kitchen, Ashton Fitchett Dr, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Cooking Classes
events.venue: Sheila's Indian Kitchen, Ashton Fitchett Dr, Wellington
events.long_description:
Authentic Indian cooking classes in Wellington with panaromic views over Wellington Harbour.

In each class, you will learn 4-5 recipes like: potato stuff roti, roasted eggplant curry, wholemeal, roti, naan; shahi paneer; dhal, samosa; palak paneer; gourmet chickpeas; vegetable korma; gulab jamun; kheer; mango lassi; masala chai, and many more...

The classes start at 6 pm or 10:30 am on weekends and weekdays with a 2-hour session followed by a dinner or lunch afterwards. The ingredients, copies of recipes, organic karma drink will be provided with a full course meal in a banquet setting. Custom made classes available for gluten free, dairy free and any other food intolerance and dietary requirements.The ingredients, recipes, complimentary organic karma drinks will be provided with a full course meal.

There are 2 to 8 people in each class in purpose built cooking studio. Also a private cooking classes available.

The menu for the class can be:

1) Spicy potato stuffed paratha and roti, rajasthani tomato relish, aalu matter or spicy peas- potato curry, roasted cumin yogurt raita and fresh mint- coriander chutney.

2) Shahi Paneer (cottage cheese cubes with spices and rich tomato-cashew gravy), garlic coriander naan, cumin jeera basmati rice and sweet fragrant rice pudding with cardamom. Also I will teach how to make fresh paneer.

3) Roasted eggplant curry, plain whole wheat chapatti or roti, jeera aaloo or potato curry, Tuar dahl (split yellow lentil) and Basmati rice with homemade pickle.

4) Palak paneer (creamy spinach curry with cubes of paneer), jeera rice (basmati rice with fragrant spices, panjabi chhole or spicy chickpeas curry and mango lassi. Also fresh paneer making.

5) Khadi (chickpeas fritters in yogurt and chickpeas flour soupy gravy), Aloo-Gobhi (cauliflower and potato curry),  savoury wraps with herbs and spices, fresh pickle and basmati rice.

The total cost is $130 per person, this includes ingredient cost. (As an alternative we also sell cooking class gift vouchers.The food options are unlimited and the class provides fresh and best ingredients)
For booking a class please contact indiancooking@xtra.co.nz

Just bring your taste buds! and Enjoy!!

events.id: Review Revue - NZ Fringe 2026-The Gods - Paramount,29 Courtenay Pl, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Review Revue - NZ Fringe 2026
events.venue: The Gods - Paramount,29 Courtenay Pl, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Review Revue - NZ Fringe 2026
What if the review was the show?

For NZ Fringe 2026, an election year that couldn't come any sooner, musical comedy duo Bethany Miller and Logan Hunt imagine a best-of-all-possible-worlds-Aotearoa.

That's a tall order, so we've invited some friends (foes?) for feedback...

Each night we're bringing in a local theatre reviewer to critique us live onstage, and you'll get to witness the results, over and over again.

______

Presented as part of NZ Fringe 2026
3-6 March, 5.30pm
@ The Gods, Paramount

TICKETS AVALABLE NOW FROM NZ FRINGE https://tickets.fringe.co.nz/event/446:8283/

______


CREATIVE TEAM:

Logan Hunt - Co-Creator & Performer, Composer
Bethany Miller - Co-Creator & Performer, Producer

Finn McKinlay - keyboardist
Beans Wright - violinist
Chloe Marshall - lighting designer, tech operator
Austin Harrison - Dramaturg
Em Maguire - Publicist

Reviewers? - We are SO excited about who we have onboard, and will announce the who & when soon!

______


ABOUT THE DUO:

Nominated for "MOMENTOUS MUSIC" (NZ Fringe), Logan and Bethany have made a new musical comedy each year since 2023, complete with crunchy social commentary, witty lyrics, and loveable/hateable characters. Logan loves to write, Bethany loves to improvise. This time, they've agreed to do both, at the mercy of live reviewers.

Their previous shows have been described as:

"Supremely relevant social satire cleverly written and gorgeously portrayed" - Theatreview

"heartwarming, wholesome and features a wickedly talented cast showcasing the best of their abilities." - Wellyott

"It’s incredible how quickly Miller is able to get the audience calling out lyrics to a song they’ve never heard before. She is a consistently strong vocalist, as anyone who’s ever seen her perform will attest to." - Wellyott

"[Logan Hunt's] Tim Minchin-esque lyrics are brilliant and Miller’s performance of them a delight as she parodies the breathy, pouting sincerity of so many young popsters." - Regional News

"Delightfully ‘Fringey’, frenetic and buoyant with glorious energy and musicality" - Theatreview

events.id: REDEMPTION || NZ Fringe || Ginge & Minge-BATS Theatre,1 Kent Ter, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: REDEMPTION || NZ Fringe || Ginge & Minge
events.venue: BATS Theatre,1 Kent Ter, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
REDEMPTION || NZ Fringe || Ginge & Minge
2025 winners of ‘Most Spectacular Organised Chaos’, Ginge & Minge (Nina Hogg and Megan Connolly) are at it again, taking rejected comedy pitches and turning them into comedy gold!!!

REDEMPTION offers three hopeful ‘redeemables’ a chance to direct their dream sketches, improvised formats, scenes or comedic characters that haven’t worked, been rejected, or just didn’t receive the love they deserve.

With a cast of talented funny people (Lesa Macleod-Whiting, Ralph Hilaga, Mo Munn and Matt Hutton), prepare for epic flops and surprising superstar successes during this 50 minute special that combines Ginge & Minge’s love of sketch and improv comedy.

BUT THE POWER IS IN YOUR HANDS.

Only YOU, the audience, gets to decide what will be REDEEMED and what will be REDUMBED.

If you love witnessing magic moments being made right before your eyes, commitment to big stupid ideas, gambling, or just a good spectacle, this show is for you.

3-7 March, 6.30PM
Bats Theatre, 1 Kent Tce
TICKETS: www.bats.co.nz/whats-on/redemption-fringe

events.id: SwapRox | NZ Fringe-BATS Theatre,1 Kent Terrace, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: SwapRox | NZ Fringe
events.venue: BATS Theatre,1 Kent Terrace, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
SwapRox | NZ Fringe
Some people are tops, some are bottoms but here at PopRox we're all switches. In the age of Tik Tok and Reels, our average attention span has maxed out at 7 minutes so PopRox has crafted a show where everything swaps on a buzzer. The cast, the musician and even the tech operator swap roles with each other after just 7 minutes. It's a character based, high-speed romp pushing top improv comedians to the brink of their skills and their sanity. If you don't like what you see, you'll have the chance to change it up and swap it around.

Expect huge characters, heaps of laughs, stitch-ups and people so far out of their skill zone it'll remind you of the coalition government. No night is the same. Not even every quarter hour is the same.

PopRox is a professional improv theatre company entering its 5th year of operation. Having dazzled audiences across Te-Whanganui-A-Tara, the motu and even the world, PopRox's slick and stylish improvisation has received critical acclaim and delighted sold out audiences.

PopRox is:

Tara McEntee
Austin Harrison
Dylan Hutton
Jed Davies
Lesa Macleod-Whiting
Lia Kelly
Mamaeroa Munn
Millie Osborne
Nina Hogg

events.id: Book Group: A Tree Grows in Brooklyn by Betty Smith-The Library, 1/53 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Book Group: A Tree Grows in Brooklyn by Betty Smith
events.venue: The Library, 1/53 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Do you keep meaning to read more of the great classics of literature? At Wellington Classic Literature Club, we read novels that have stood the test of time, whether they were written in 1780, 1880 or even 1980. We meet on the first Tuesday of the month.

In March we discuss A Tree Grows in Brooklyn, the beloved American classic about a young girl's coming-of-age at the turn of the century. Betty Smith's 1943 novel is a poignant and moving tale filled with compassion and cruelty, laughter and heartache, crowded with life and people and incident.

Wellington City Libraries have several copies as well as an ebook you can borrow.

RSVP
If you use Facebook, you can RSVP to the event on our Facebook page (above) - it really helps us keep track of numbers. Otherwise, just come along...

VENUE
We meet in the ‘Games Room’, The Library bar's private area overlooking Courtenay Place. After you enter the bar, head to your right (up the step) and through a smaller space with booths to the large carpeted space beyond.

ABOUT US
Wellington Classic Literature Club has been running for more than a decade - since the start of 2013 - and we have a great bunch of regulars as well as readers who come along for particular books or simply when it suits. All welcome.

events.id: Under Pressure: How to Thrive in a Hyper-Competitive Youth Sport World-NZ Campus of Innovation & Sport (NZCIS), 20-48 Somme Road, Heretaunga, Upper Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Under Pressure: How to Thrive in a Hyper-Competitive Youth Sport World
events.venue: NZ Campus of Innovation & Sport (NZCIS), 20-48 Somme Road, Heretaunga, Upper Hutt
events.long_description:
Youth sport today asks more of young people than ever before. Selection starts earlier, competition runs deeper, and pressure moments arrive before many athletes have the skills to cope. When this gap exists, confidence wavers, enjoyment fades, and potential remains untapped.

In this keynote, Dr Craig Harrison reveals what’s really happening under pressure, and what it takes to thrive within it. Drawing on developmental science, lived stories from youth sport, and practical tools, this session shifts the conversation from “handling pressure” to working with it.

First, you’ll learn how the adolescent brain, stress response, and social dynamics influence behaviour under pressure. Then, you’ll discover how to build the skills to meet pressure moment by moment, and create the conditions for confident, adaptable performance.

Who is this talk for?
- Parents of youth athletes wanting to better support their child
- Coaches of youth athletes wanting to develop more resilient players
- Teen athletes wanting to perform under pressure

Bond-Murray Room - Doors open 645 PM for a 7 PM start

About Dr Craig Harrison:
With over 20 years’ experience working with developing athletes, coaches, and families, Craig is one of New Zealand’s leading voices on helping young people thrive in sport. His work blends cutting-edge research in long-term athlete development and child psychology with real-world stories from schools, clubs, and academies around the world.

events.id: Tolerance | NZ Fringe-BATS Theatre,1 Kent Terrace, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Tolerance | NZ Fringe
events.venue: BATS Theatre,1 Kent Terrace, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Tolerance | NZ Fringe
Eight of Te Whanganui-a-Tara's most acclaimed emerging playwrights (Rachel Atlas, Rachel McLean, Campbell Wright, Zachary Klein, Viki Moananu, Amy Wright, Sophie Maree, and Matt Loveranes) tolerated one another, as they paired up to create four short plays on the theme of Tolerance. Come witness the result, an eclectic work about the ways we should (and shouldn't) put up with those around us, as the world burns down.

"Compromise was something special; I'm genuinely grateful that I got to witness this nexus of talent. Varied and out-there, yet restrained and expertly-crafted, it had it all. " - Salient

Tolerance is the continuation of a project started last year with Compromise (Nominee, Best Organised Chaos NZ Fringe 2025) focused on bringing together playwrights to collaborate, build community amongst writers and supply a little bit of creative chaos. It is once again directed by Lia Kelly (Most Original Production Wellington Theatre Awards, One Night Band), and features a cast of vibrant local talent.


Featuring plays about self care at the end of the world, the power games of celebrity power couples, office politics, and interventions gone awry, Tolerance is bursting at the seams with ideas, laughs, and fluids of all varieties. Make sure to "witness this nexus of talent" (Salient), only in NZ Fringe.

events.venue: Sweet Axe Throwing Co.,60 Cambridge Ter, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
NZ Fringe: PING PONG BALLER feat. Jarrod Cook
"Winning in life isn’t about the size of your balls.
It’s about how you spin them." - Albert Einstein

Wouter Moerloose presents his debut stand-up hour about the triumph of attitude over accolades.

This Belgian raconteur spins sharp, self-aware stories from his chaotic journey towards the only thing he never knew he wanted: to make you laugh!
Expect crying on planes, poorly chosen hobbies, and an unhealthy obsession with celebrities’ wealth – featuring (without their consent) an AK-47 hoarding grandfather, Latvia’s worst kidnapper, and some surprisingly horny sea mammals.
PING PONG BALLER: the nearly-award winning show where almost does count!

Get tickets: https://tickets.fringe.co.nz/event/446:8266/

Wouter’s accolades (just in case):
* Raw Comedy Quest 2025: Canterbury Finalist / Auckland Semi-Finalist
* Winner, Good Times Comedy Club 2025 “Goodest Newcomer” + Nominee, “People’s Choice”
* Nominee, Best Newcomer South Island, 2025 NZ Comedy Guild Awards


With support from Ōtautahi-based Jarrod Cook (Winner, 2025 NZIF Pearls of Wisdom Award and Nominee, 2024 Best Newcomer South Island, NZ Comedy Guild Awards)


BALLERS BONUS (because why not):
• Every ticket goes into a nightly raffle to win a SMASH ROOM + axe-throwing session for two (worth $120). Buy a “Ticket + 10” and double your chances!
• First 8 ticket buyers each night get a free drink ($12)

Get tickets: https://tickets.fringe.co.nz/event/446:8266/

events.id: Wellington - Building Science Summit New Zealand 2026-Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa,55 Cable Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Wellington - Building Science Summit New Zealand 2026
events.venue: Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa,55 Cable Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wellington - Building Science Summit New Zealand 2026
Leading industry experts share practical insights and proven principles for advancing building envelope design and construction practices.

About this Event

Welcome to the Building Science Summit New Zealand 2026 in Wellington!
Join us on Wednesday 4 March 2026 at Te Papa, Wellington for a day filled with insightful discussions and networking opportunities. Bringing together leading industry experts from Aotearoa, Australia, Germany, and Canada to share practical insights and proven principles for advancing building envelope design and construction practices. Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity to connect with like-minded individuals and expand your knowledge.

Key Highlights:
Insights from international and local experts
In-depth discussions on building performance and durability
Case studies showcasing real-world solutions
Networking with industry leaders and peers

We are excited to welcome leading building science experts from New Zealand, Australia, Germany, and Canada. Including Brian Hubbs, Hartwig Künzel, Jess Clarke, Stijn Van den Eeden and Bernard Farrington.
Valid for 60 NZIA CPD Points.

We look forward to seeing you there!

Sponsors:
Nuralite, Oculus Building Science & Façades, Pro Clima, Outright Continuous Insulation, ROCKWOOL


Agenda


🕑: 07:50 AM - 08:20 AM
Registration

🕑: 08:20 AM - 08:30 AM
Opening message
Host: Peter Raimondo

🕑: 08:30 AM - 09:30 AM
TBA
Host: Bernard Farringon
Info: Bernard Farrington is a Laboratory Manager at Shelby Wright Test Labs while also working as a Senior Specialist at Oculus Architectural Engineering. He specialises in building enclosure performance, testing, and practical detailing, combining hands-on technical experience with consulting expertise to support high-performance construction and improved building outcomes.


🕑: 09:30 AM - 10:30 AM
TBA
Host: Stijn Van den Eeden
Info: Stijn has 25 years of experience in external envelopes and was involved in the design and construction of projects on 5 continents, before settling in New Zealand 15 years ago. His expertise includes building materials, façade system development, project delivery and remedial work.


🕑: 10:30 AM - 11:00 AM
Morning Tea Break

🕑: 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM
TBA
Host: Jess Clarke
Info: Jesse Clarke holds more than 15 years of experience in the construction industry. He holds the technical lead role of the Innovation and R&D Manager, servicing pro clima in New Zealand and Australia. Jesse is an active advocate for a holistic approach to the development of industry guidance, standards and codes.


🕑: 12:00 PM - 01:00 PM
Lunch Break + Networking

🕑: 01:00 PM - 02:00 PM
TBA
Host: Hartwig M. Künzel
Info: Prof. Hartwig M. Künzel is Head of the Hygrothermics Department at the Fraunhofer Institute for Building Physics (IBP) in Germany and an Honorary Professor at the University of Stuttgart. With a PhD in Civil Engineering, he has led pioneering research on heat and moisture transport in building envelopes for over three decades. Prof. Künzel is the creator of the internationally recognised WUFI hygrothermal simulation model and has contributed extensively to building standards and best practices for moisture control, energy efficiency, and indoor comfort. He has authored hundreds of publications and is a sought-after speaker at international conferences, sharing expertise that bridges scientific research and practical application in building physics.


🕑: 02:00 PM - 03:00 PM
TBA
Host: Brian Hubbs
Info: Brian Hubbs is a Founder, Principal, and Senior Building Science Specialist at RDH Building Science. With over 30 years of experience as a consultant practicing exclusively in the field of building science, he is a practical façade engineer and researcher. He has broad experience with a variety of building enclosure systems, delivering consistent innovative solutions. Brian brings a unique blend of theoretical and hands-on knowledge gained from designing façades for new buildings, as well as completing hundreds of forensic investigations, rehabilitation, and research projects. He has extensive experience with high-rise and iconic façade systems, components, and materials, designing new and innovative facade systems for high-rise wood and Passive House projects.


🕑: 03:00 PM - 04:00 PM
TBA
Info: TBA


🕑: 04:00 PM - 04:15 PM
Closing Notes and Comments
Host: Peter Raimando

Host: Stijn Van den Eeden Info: Stijn has 25 years of experience in external envelopes and was involved in the design and construction of projects on 5 continents, before settling in New Zealand 15 years ago.

events.id: Unlocking Accessibility in Microsoft Office - Wellington-11/15 Willeston Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Unlocking Accessibility in Microsoft Office - Wellington
events.venue: 11/15 Willeston Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Hosted by Amanda Mace & Dr Ann Knettler - this practical, hands-on session will teach participants how to create accessible content using Microsoft Office tools. Ideal for communications teams, educators, government staff, and business professionals who need to ensure their content reaches and supports the human rights of all users - including users with disabilities. This session will cover:
Understanding accessibility fundamentals in digital documents
Applying accessibility best practices in Word, PowerPoint, and Excel
Using built-in accessibility checkers and tools effectively
Structuring content for screen reader compatibility
Managing images, charts, and tables for inclusive access
Exporting to accessible PDF formats
Increasing your SEO through accessibility practices

Participants will leave with confidence and practical templates to apply accessibility immediately in their daily work.

events.id: Black Country, New Road with Ringlets | Meow Nui, Wellington-92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011-All Events In
events.name: Black Country, New Road with Ringlets | Meow Nui, Wellington
events.venue: 92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
events.long_description:
Black Country, New Road with Ringlets | Meow Nui, Wellington
Handsome Tours are pleased to present the return of Black Country, New Road to Australia + New Zealand in 2026!

Critically acclaimed British collective Black Country, New Road are thrilled to announce their forthcoming Australia + New Zealand tour, set to take place this summer. The announcement arrives in the wake of the band’s most recent studio album, Forever Howlong, which has attracted widespread praise for its recent harmonious reinvention- and recorder solos.

Released earlier this year via Ninja Tune, Forever Howlong marks a bold transformation for the group. Songwriting and vocal duties now shared amongst band members, give rise to a richly collaborative sound and warm communal spirit. ‘Triumph in the face of adversity’ goes some way to explaining the resulting joy.

Described by The Guardian as “a gentler, more bucolic direction” Forever Howlong has made notable chart inroads for the band, revealing new audiences and a revived sense of self.

Now Black Country, New Road are ready to share their evolving sound with Australian and New Zealand audiences. These theatrical live performances are a ‘mustn’t miss’ kind of situation.

events.long_description:
4 Weeks
Wed 4th March 7pm-9pm
Wed 11th March 7pm-9pm
Wed 18th March 7pm-9.30pm
Wed 25th March 7pm-9.30pm

This class is run by the owner operator of a Wellington based Engineering firm with over 20 years of Welding experience. Participants will get to learn the theory and safety aspects of welding before gaining experience MIG welding Tee Joints, Lap Joints and But Joints. Some of the joints will then be cut through to inspect and learn more about how to improve their quality and strength.

Only 6 students per class.

_______________________________________________________________________________

Tim Blair is an excellent tutor. Pace was perfect, content excellently presented, really approachable. Incredible patience and feedback. Really recommend for women especially wanting to learn the art of welding, Tim's a good guy!
I'll be back for advanced lessons.

events.name: Sir El Tom
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Here’s a chance to hear Sir Elton John’s music performed live by someone who cares about authenticity. Tom Cridland is an Anglo-Portuguese musician from London. The Opera House hosts his alter ego, Sir El Tom, in homage to one of the great living musicians. Sir El Tom performs Sir Elton John’s music in an exhilarating concert full of famous hits. You’ll hear songs like Can You Feel the Love Tonight, Don’t Go Breaking My Heart, I’m Still Standing, Goodbye Yellow Brick Road, Crocodile Rock, and many more. 
Whether it’s singing at a grand piano or with a full band, you’ll hear as authentic a performance as possible. Sir El Tom is known for extraordinary attention to detail, where the music always comes first and everything is live and natural.
