events.id: SIKA Sound Journey - KAPITI-Raumati South Memorial Hall. Tennis Court Road, Raumati South.,43 Tennis Court Rd, Raumati South, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu-All Events In
events.name: SIKA Sound Journey - KAPITI
events.venue: Raumati South Memorial Hall. Tennis Court Road, Raumati South.,43 Tennis Court Rd, Raumati South, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
SIKA Sound Journey - KAPITI
SIKA Sound Journey - 'Between the Worlds'
Something between an ancient ceremony and a movie soundtrack.

Please bring a yoga mat, pillow and blanket. Be prepared to drop into a deep space.
Door sales will be available if there is space. Advanced booking is recommended.

Between the Worlds is an evening Sound Journey shaped by over thirty years of deep ceremonial and immersive sound practice. Blending primal rhythm, atmospheric voice, deep didgeridoo, and field recordings, the journey unfolds organically — shifting from dynamic, embodied energy into vast, cinematic stillness.

This is not passive listening.
It is an experience to be entered.

As sound layers, dissolve, and reform, participants are guided into a liminal space where time softens and inner landscapes awaken. The journey becomes a passage — one that listeners don’t just hear, but inhabit.

Guided by the myth of the Wandering Forest Spirit, Between the Worlds invites a reconnection with self, with nature, and with something older than language. Ceremonial, immersive, and deeply evocative, this is an evening to slow down, listen deeply, and cross into the unseen.
It's like a soundtrack that is crafted to go with your life.

Sika's Sound Journeys are truly unique. They are sonic explorations that feature didgeridoos, drums, flutes, voice and orchestral elements. A collection of foraged sounds from objects he has recorded in nature, add even more textures. Many of his sounds are completely unrecognisable and abstract. Immersed in this cocoon of abstract sound, we can find ourselves in the most surprising places in our mind. In this timeless realm, beyond the normal limitations of rational reality, anything is possible.
An epic adventure deep inside yourself.
Journey to worlds within worlds on incredible sound waves.

Sika creates a safe space to relax deeply and connect with our inner guidance. This Sound Journey begins and ends with a short guided visualisation.
There will be two journeys with an interval. Most people choose to lie down, so bring a yoga mat, pillow and blanket and get really comfortable.
A journal is also recommended.

events.id: Joanne McNally — Pinotphile-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Joanne McNally — Pinotphile
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
She’s a comedian boasting stage, television, and podcast success. Joanne McNally heads to The Opera House in Wellington for a new stage show. Pinotphile displays the Irish comic’s wry wit and sense of the absurd. Hailed by Variety as One to Watch, McNally has been keeping herself busy since her last tour by ruining men’s lives (and her own). For Pinophile, she’s still single, still unfertilised, and laden with irreverent, ridiculous and hilarious war stories. Join Joanne for a wild ride as she navigates situationships, revenge, frenemies and rejection. The Irish Examiner describes her trademark style as ‘joyously nuts’. 
You may have come across Joanne as a co-host of the award-winning podcast My Therapist Ghosted Me. She’s also had riotous appearances on Taskmaster, The Jonathan Ross Show and The Big Fat Quiz of Everything.

events.id: Friends of Karori Cemetery - Evening Tour (April 2026)-15 Rosehaugh Avenue, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Friends of Karori Cemetery - Evening Tour (April 2026)
events.venue: 15 Rosehaugh Avenue, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Evening Tour
Would you like to join us and explore the beauty of Karori Cemetery in the evening?
This tour is for anyone who would like to see the Cemetery through a different lens, as the landscape settles in from dusk to darkness. On this walk you'll be accompanied by two guides who will take you on a wander through some of the most magical parts of the cemetery, with a story or two of early Wellingtonians along the route. We might even spy a Ruru/Morepork or two! The tour does not have any scary themes. There are points on the tour where we may pause and turn off our torches to enjoy the landscape in the darkness.
The tour is of approximately 1.5 hours duration and starts and finishes at the Main Chapel on Rosehaugh Avenue, where there is plenty of easy parking.
Each attendee needs to bring their own torch that they can comfortably carry for the duration. No head torches please for the comfort of your fellow walkers.
The route mostly follows paved surfaces but there are some areas of unevenness. Surefootedness is required. This tour involves approximately 2km of walking, with some slow paced but uphill stints.
The tour is not suited for children under the age of 12 or unaccompanied minors. There are no toilets on the route.

Each tour is $10 per person (plus non-refundable booking fee).
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.
Please note:
If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you on the day 1 hour before the tour starts by email and on our Facebook page. The booking fee is non-refundable.
Please dress appropriately for the conditions. While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, the ground can become slippery in places.
Some of our walks require a moderate degree of fitness and are not suited for those with limited mobility.
If you have purchased tickets for other people can you please pass our tour information on to them as well.
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.

The Extravaganza Fair - Palmerston North
🎪✨ ROLL UP, ROLL UP – THE EXTRAVAGANZA FAIR IS BACK! ✨🎪

🎉 Celebrating 11 epic years of magical mayhem on the road! 🎉

New Zealand’s biggest and most fabulous travelling fair is rolling back into town – and you’re invited!

We’re bringing grassroots charm, vintage flair, and old-school fun to town – a joyride for all ages! Whether you’re 5 or 95, there’s something here to make your heart happy.

💫 FREE ENTRY for kids! Gold coin for adults – that’s it!
Get ready for a weekend packed full of FREE entertainment the whole whānau will love.

Expect a kaleidoscope of colour, creativity, and community vibes with:

🎨 Unique market stalls, arts,crafts & more!
🌮 Yummy street food galore
🎡 Kids rides & games all day
🎭 The fabulous Ashton Family Circus
🐉 Burns the Dragon breathing fun
🧜‍♀️ Enchanting Mermaid Storytime
🎪 Sparkling LuckyStar Zone (as seen at Splore!)
🎶 Live music all day
🔮 Tarot, past-life readings & mystical moments

⚡ Tiny homes, solar setups & sustainable inspiration
🕶️ Retro lounges & shady chill zones = your new favourite hangout spot 🛋️

See you there this summer 2025 - 2026!! 💥 🌼

events.id: Irish Set Dancing - day of dance 2026-81 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Irish Set Dancing - day of dance 2026
events.venue: 81 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Does Irish music get your feet tapping?  This is your opportunity to get up and dance. 
Set dances are the traditional social dances of Ireland, and are so much fun to dance.
 No experience necessary.  Suitable for beginners and experienced alike.   You just need a bit of coordination, a sense of fun, and some energy.  (This is not Irish step dancing, not Riverdance!)
You can come along without a partner, there will always be someone to dance with.
Age 10 upwards.
We recommend smooth soled shoes if you have them.
 Experienced teacher Helen Stonehouse will guide you through the moves and figures.  There are 2 workshops on Saturday and on Saturday evening we have a Ceili when we'll dance some of what you learnt in the workshops plus some more Irish ceili dances.
Anyone is welcome to the Ceili without having been to the workshops.
 Our amazing Round The House Ceili Band will be playing all the jigs and reels and polkas for us throughout the weekend.
 Good music, fun and friends.

events.id: Telescope Mastery-Star Safari Observatory, 1169 Ponatahi Road, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Telescope Mastery
events.venue: Star Safari Observatory, 1169 Ponatahi Road, Carterton
events.long_description:
Our Telescope Course is back!

You already own a telescope, but...

If you already have a telescope and would like to learn more about how to use it, how to collimate it and any other maintenance they need, what type of eyepieces are the best to buy and any other equipment.

BRING YOUR TELESCOPE ALONG!
OR

You don't have a telescope, but...

would like to learn how to use one, don't fret! We have 14, and you can learn all about them.

Your instructor:
Sam, our resident astrophysicist.

Sam is skilled in explaining the intricacies of telescope operation and makes learning both accessible and engaging. Our course offers hands-on experience with our diverse collection of 14 telescopes, ranging from classic reflectors to sophisticated refractors and versatile catadioptrics.

Where: Star Safari Observatory - 10 minutes from Martinborough


There's no "but" after our course. You'll know exactly:

- Where to start?

- What to do?

- How to get the best out of your telescope?

- What must you consider if you wish to plunge into deep-sky astrophotography?

You get:
A collimation cap - no more guesswork on how to collimate your telescope. With this tool, you can keep your telescope sharp.

Tea and coffee - refreshments.

Bring your lunch and a picnic blanket! We have a spectacular setting at Star Safari Observatory, and we will stop for a lunch break to enjoy our Moon garden and the surroundings.

Take the giant leap; reach for the stars!

At the end of the course, you'll learn all about the types of telescopes available and mounts, attachments, and eyepieces. We cover the whole lot. We have been using telescopes for a long time and now have an excellent range for our public sessions and at our home observatory.

We're not affiliated with retailers, so our advice is unbiased and based on our years of experience with lugging telescopes around the world, maintaining them and using them.

events.name: NZ Brewers Fest
events.venue: 25 Blenheim Street, New Zealand 5014,25 Blenheim St, Maidstone, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand, Upper Hutt
events.long_description:
NZ Brewers Fest
NZ Brewers Fest is moving to April!
Lining up with Fresh Hop season, we will be bringing the all the incredible beers, outstanding entertainment and delicious kai you expect, with a fresh hop twist!

Save the date and watch this space for more info, coming soon!


Drinks!
It wouldn’t be NZBF without great beer, and this year 20 of Aotearoa’s best breweries will descend on Brewtown to pour every style you could possibly desire, from crisp Lagers, cold IPAs and hoppy Pale Ales, to funky Sours, smoky Porters, rich Pastry Stouts – and everything in between!

Visit Brewtown’s own custom Unimog Bar for 13 beers handpicked by our craft beer experts, but get in quick – we only have 1 keg of each, and they won’t last long!

New for this year! Step into our cocktail bar for some seriously scrumptious spirits! Our mixologists have been hard at work creating some delicious drops just for you.

We’re bringing in some of the best wines the Wairarapa has to offer, so whether you prefer a crisp Sauv, a fruity Pinot or a refreshing Frosé there will be something to enjoy.

Still not enough for you? Then head down to the Everything Else Bar, for NZ crafted ciders, as well as bourbon, rum, gin and vodka alongside a range of low and no alcohol beers, cocktails and soft drinks.

Kai!
The NZBF food court hosts the region’s top foodies, bringing you big, bold, flavour-packed festival eats that’ll satisfy every craving.
Watch this space as we announce our festive foodie lineup!

Entertainment!
Lose yourself in a cabaret of the bizarre, where the performances are as dark as they are dazzling.

Witness the brutal thrill of buhurt armoured combat, as warriors face off in full medieval kit in a raw display of might and mayhem.

Dance the day away at the main stage, as Welly’s top talent smash out tune after tune, all building up to a headline show from Brewtown favourites, The Blueprint.

Grab your mates and get stuck in at the Games Zone, where a bit of friendly rivalry meets festive fun, and the loser buys the next round.

With affordable return coaches from Welly and Petone and great discounts for group tickets it's scarily easy to get involved!
🎃 R18

events.id: HAWTHORNE HEIGHTS | LONELY WORLD TOUR-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: HAWTHORNE HEIGHTS | LONELY WORLD TOUR
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
HAWTHORNE HEIGHTS  | LONELY WORLD TOUR
Celebrating the 20th Anniversary of If Only You Were Lonely — April 2026

Emo pioneers Hawthorne Heights are set to return to New Zealand in 2026 as part of their global Lonely World Tour, commemorating the 20th anniversary of their influential 2006 album If Only You Were Lonely. The band will perform the album in full, alongside a selection of fan favourites spanning their two-decade career.
Since its release, If Only You Were Lonely has become a defining record of the 2000s emo and post-hardcore movement, featuring anthems such as “Saying Sorry”, “Pens and Needles”, and “This Is Who We Are.” The anniversary tour offers fans the rare chance to experience the album live, in an intimate and high-energy setting.

Hawthorne Heights will play two New Zealand shows only:
Friday 17 April – Auckland | Double Whammy
Saturday 18 April – Wellington | San Fran

Tickets and VIP packages are available now through: waxstartouring.com & hawthorneheights.com

events.id: Mozart Requiem-Michael Fowler Centre-All Events In
events.name: Mozart Requiem
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre
events.long_description:
Mozart Requiem
Experience two masterpieces in one exceptional concert as Orpheus Choir Wellington present Christopher Tin’s To Shiver the Sky alongside Mozart’s Requiem. This concert spans five centuries of imagination and purpose, from the earliest dreams of flight to one of the greatest choral masterpieces ever written.

To Shiver the Sky is an epic choral spectacular from Grammy winning composer Christopher Tin. Drawing on texts from da Vinci, Hildegard von Bingen, Ovid, Jules Verne, Amelia Earhart and John F. Kennedy, it builds a sweeping musical history of human flight from imagined wings to the Moon landing. Born from a record breaking Kickstarter campaign, the work opens with Sogno di Volare, known worldwide as the main theme of Civilization VI, one of the most celebrated strategy games of the decade. Its sound world spans luminous stillness and immense choral climaxes, evoking the exhilaration and peril of human flight.

Mozart’s Requiem stands as one of the greatest choral works ever composed. Written in the final months of his life, it sets the sacred Requiem Mass with blazing dramatic power and a depth of feeling that has captivated audiences for more than two centuries. From the fierce energy of the Dies Irae to the aching beauty of the Lacrimosa, the music moves with a haunting power that remains unmatched in the choral repertoire.

Together these works form an extraordinary musical journey. One celebrates the daring that pushes humanity forward. The other reveals the full dramatic power of the Requiem tradition at its most intense and expressive. Performed by the mighty Orpheus Choir Wellington with Orchestra Wellington, conducted by Brent Stewart and featuring celebrated soprano Emma Pearson, this is a night of immense musical colour and emotional impact.

events.id: Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo 2026-Paraparaumu Memorial Hall,Tutanekai Street, Paraparaumu, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo 2026
events.venue: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall,Tutanekai Street, Paraparaumu, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo 2026
Get ready for a day of love, celebration, and unforgettable inspiration at the Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo 2026 – the Kapiti Coast’s premier event for anyone planning a wedding, special event, or milestone celebration. Taking place on Sunday, 19 April 2026, from 10am to 3pm at the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, this vibrant expo brings together over 40 of the region’s top wedding and event professionals, all in one beautiful space. Best of all? Entry is completely FREE!

From breathtaking florals and stunning venue styling to expert celebrants, creative photographers, world-class entertainment, and delectable food and drink offerings, this expo has it all. Whether you’re newly engaged, planning a birthday bash, organising a corporate event, or simply love all things celebration, the Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo is your one-stop destination for inspiration and expert advice.

This year’s expo promises an immersive experience packed with exclusive show-only offers, giveaways, and dazzling live performances on the Main Stage. Meet the creative minds behind Kapiti’s most iconic celebrations, explore dreamy decor ideas, and uncover the latest wedding and event trends that will help you bring your vision to life. Our hand-picked exhibitors are the best in the business, offering fresh ideas and tailored solutions to make your event truly unforgettable.

But that’s not all – your free ticket also unlocks exclusive deals across the Kapiti Coast. From boutique shopping and cosy cafes to scenic stays and local attractions, our Explore Kapiti program gives you access to fantastic discounts and experiences from our local business partners. Simply show your expo ticket to take advantage of these offers while you’re in town.

The Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo is proudly brought to you by Kapiti Castles, experienced event organisers who understand how to make moments magical. With a deep love for creativity, community, and connection, we’ve crafted this event to help you dream big and plan with confidence.

So don’t miss out – grab your free tickets today and join us for an extraordinary day of discovery, excitement, and inspiration. Whether you're planning a wedding, a party, or something truly unique, this is where your perfect celebration begins.

Also check out other Business events in Paraparaumu, Exhibitions in Paraparaumu, Workshops in Paraparaumu.

Exploring this year's theme of diversity, we look over to the Continent, where we have an extra long session featuring masked identities, daring deeds, and evil plots - while still trying to secure a respectable and advantageous marriage.

events.long_description:
Presented by: Handsome Tours
Handsome Tours are proud to present Sleaford Mods 2026 Australian & New Zealand Tour
This will be Sleaford Mods first time back to Australian and New Zealand soil since May and June of 2023, where they performed at events like Sydney's Vivid LIVE and Hobart's Dark Mofo.
“We took a year off ’cause I needed to get my nails did, and now we’re itching to get back out there and play live”, says Sleaford Mods' Jason Williamson. “We released a new single Megaton last month, it’s an absolute banger so we’re buzzing to play that live for the first time. Who knows, we might have a few more new tracks to drop by then. Either way, it’s been a while since we toured, and we’re gagging for it.”
Sleaford Mods has partnered with PLUS1 to support War Child. $1.15 inc GST from every ticket sold will help War Child to protect, educate, and stand up for the rights of children affected by war.
www.warchild.org.uk

events.id: Faultline Ultra--Wellington NZ
events.name: Faultline Ultra
events.long_description:
Calling all athletes on foot or bike. National and international competitors are invited to test their endurance at Faultline Ultra. For runners and mountain bikers, it’s a dream come true — the ultimate stamina challenge set against the wildly beautiful Wellington landscape. 
In April 2026, the hills and trails around Wellington offer six possible routes for athletes to push their limits. Beginning with 6-kilometre and 12km tests, the routes grow in length to 25km, 53km, 103km, and a colossal 161-kilometre challenge. You choose the length depending on your ability. 
The fault lines around Wellington have pushed and pulled the land to create soaring peaks, rugged ridgelines, and bush-clad hills. Athletes can choose trails that wind through Wellington City, Karori, Porirua, Belmont, the Hutt River Trail, and Kāpiti. Sign up and compete — you’re likely to get the best after-match stories you will ever tell.

events.long_description:
It’s a global phenomenon hailed as the most electrifying celebration of the King of Pop’s music. ‘The King of Pop Show — Michael Jackson Live Concert Experience’ makes its way to New Zealand — and Wellington — for the first time. If you never had the chance to see Michael Jackson live, this is the closest you’ll ever get. From the famous moonwalk to the spine-tingling vocals, every moment of this production channels the spirit of the King of Pop at his peak. Witness the power of hits like Billie Jean, Thriller, Beat It, Smooth Criminal, and plenty more. 
The star of the show is TJ Cappola. His stunning vocals and commanding stage presence make for a flawless embodiment of Michael Jackson. With sold-out performances across Australia and Asia, thousands have been mesmerised by his performance. Backing TJ is a live band and world-class dancers. The replica costumes and cutting-edge lighting and visual display make this more than just a show — it’s an experience.

events.id: One New Zealand Warriors ANZAC Weekend-Sky Stadium, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: One New Zealand Warriors ANZAC Weekend
events.venue: Sky Stadium, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The One New Zealand Warriors and Sky Stadium are proud to invite you to the Ultimate Weekend Warriors Experience.
This exclusive experience will give the biggest Rugby League fans a unique opportunity to get closer to the action than ever before as the One New Zealand Warriors return to Sky Stadium on ANZAC weekend 2026. With a jam-packed schedule of behind-the-scenes access, enthralling events, and an epic showdown on the Saturday, it’s bound to be a weekend you won’t forget.
What’s Included:
Friday Night Welcome
Kick off the weekend with some of the biggest Warriors fans in the country! Start in the Warriors changing room, feel the hype build, and then emerge through the players tunnel with pyrotechnics, smoke, lights and music - experience entering Sky Stadium just as the teams themselves do. The entourage will then move up to Sky Stadiums’ premium lounges for snacks, a cash bar, and a Q&A from some legendary ex-Warriors.
Saturday Match Day Hospitality
Enjoy the Anzac Day match and entertainment with fellow Warriors fanatics from the comfort of one of our premium lounges. Included is a premium food offering, private seats with epic views and dedicated bar facilities.
Hosted by Warriors Legends
Throughout the weekend you’ll also be in the company of some of the Warriors greats. You’ll have ample opportunity to ask questions, get insights, tips and tricks, or hear a play by play of some of your favourite Warriors action moments straight from the source.
Exclusive Prizes
Be in to win some exclusive signed Warriors merchandise and other spot prizes over the course of the weekend as a cherry on top of a fantastic Ultimate Weekend Warriors Experience.
Don’t miss out! We expect tickets to go quick, so call up your mates and lock it in today.

events.id: The King of Pop Show: Michael Jackson Live Concert Experience-Opera House-All Events In
events.name: The King of Pop Show: Michael Jackson Live Concert Experience
events.venue: Opera House
events.long_description:
The King of Pop Show: Michael Jackson Live Concert Experience
Get ready for the ultimate thrill! Experience Michael Jackson like never before with TJ Cappola's electrifying live concert: Beyond Imagination! Feel the magic of the King of Pop as if he was performing right in front of you.

If you never had the chance to witness Michael Jackson live, “The King of Pop Show – Michael Jackson Live Concert Experience” offers the closest experience to reliving the legendary artist’s magic. This dynamic show continues to captivate audiences across Australia and Asia with its sold-out performances.

This spectacular and powerful show captures all the excitement of Michael performing live in concert. From the electrifying energy to the iconic dance moves and unforgettable hits like “Billie Jean,” “Thriller,” “Beat It,” and more, audiences are transported to the peak of MJ’s career.

TJ Cappola’s remarkable portrayal, vocals and persona, supported by a live band, professional dancers, replica costumes and a state-of-the-art light show and visuals that will leave you in awe! This experience is a true homage to the King of Pop that fans won’t want to miss. It’s a thrilling opportunity to immerse oneself in the music and spectacle that defined Michael Jackson’s unparalleled legacy.

events.long_description:
Super Street Society True Nationals Prizegiving & Off-Season Party 🎉
Come celebrate the end of a genuinely history-changing Super Street season and the True Nationals Prize Giving.
A brand-new, racer-led national series doesn’t work unless people actually back it… and you did.

By showing up, travelling, supporting tracks, bringing mates, crews, families and good attitudes, you helped turn an idea into something real. The True Nationals became what it is because of the people in it — and that’s worth celebrating properly.

📅 Saturday 25 April
📍 Mendoza Mechanical, Upper Hutt - WELLINGTON
🕔 Arrive from 5pm
🏆 Awards at 6pm
🔥 BBQ from ~6:30pm
(depending on how long Cindy rambles)

On the night:
🏆 True Nationals championship prize giving
🏁 Super Street season highlights
😏 A few moments that deserve revisiting
👀 Including the now-famous Naughty Boy List (10-second club)

Laid-back awards, plenty of laughs, and a chance to look back on a season that honestly shifted the needle for Super Street.

Drivers, crew, families, sponsors, track crew and Super Street supporters — you’re all welcome.

Accomodation Discount - contact Trentham Motel on and mention the Super Street Society Prizegiving for 20% off per night on Studio & King Studio units.
Let’s make this a night to remember (or not be able to remember at all!)

👉 RSVP appreciated for catering
🍔 Food provided | 🍻 BYO | 👶 Kids welcome

Built by racers. For racers.
Thanks for backing it and helping make it what it became.
— HRH Princess of the Swamp 👑

events.id: Cringeworthy - Trippin’ in the ‘90s - Opening-280 Church Street, New Zealand 4410,280 Church St, Palmerston North 4410, New Zealand, Palmerston North-All Events In
events.name: Cringeworthy - Trippin’ in the ‘90s - Opening
events.venue: 280 Church Street, New Zealand 4410,280 Church St, Palmerston North 4410, New Zealand, Palmerston North
events.long_description:
Cringeworthy - Trippin’ in the ‘90s - Opening
Following the success of Cringeworthy ‘50s, ’60s, ‘70s and ’80s this show pays homage to NZ music and culture in the last decade of the 20th century. Expect a 'rad' mix of local and international hits delivered with snappy dance moves, scintillating vocals and a generous dollop of cheesy comedy.

The ‘90s was a decade bursting with diverse musical genres, from boy bands and girl groups to MMMBop and hip hop, grunge and country (Achy Breaky Heart), The Macarena and re-releases of iconic hits such as Silly Love Songs, and Killing Me Softly.

What's the time, Mr Wolf? Time to grab your ticket to ride this retro rollercoaster! Nostalgia invites you to relive a decade that still resonates today.

“A fantabulous blast from the past, high energy, fun and a belly full of laughs!”

“A unique blend of uplifting vocals, brilliant choreography and personality personified!”

Starring Andrea Sanders, Kali Kopae, Devon Neiman, and Mackenzie Htay - get ready to party like it's 1999, cos Backstreet’s back!

events.id: Friends of Karori Cemetery: Military Tales from the Services Section (April 2026)-76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Friends of Karori Cemetery: Military Tales from the Services Section (April 2026)
events.venue: 76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Military Tales from the Services Area
Come and hear tales from our military history. The Servicemens Cemetery was opened in 1916. It was the first and remains the largest such cemetery to be established in New Zealand.  The tour has about 25 brief stops and includes prominent army leaders Major General Sir Howard Karl Kippenberger, Major General Charles William Melvill, Lieutenant-General Sir Leonard Thornton, Major General Sir Keith Lindsay Stewart, and army nurse commander Hestor Maclean.
Each tour is $10 per person (plus non-refundable booking fee). Children under 12 are free.
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.
Please note:
If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you on the day 1 hour before the tour starts by email and on our Facebook page. The booking fee is non-refundable.
This tour is approximately 1 hour and 30 minutes long.
Please dress appropriately for the conditions. While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, during the winter months the ground can become slippery in places.
Some of our walks require a moderate degree of fitness and are not suited for those with limited mobility.
There is only one toilet which is located by the cemetery office at the main entrance.
If you have purchased tickets for other people can you please pass our tour information on to them as well.
Please meet us at the shelter (shown as the Historic Chapel on the map at the main entrance)
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.

events.id: The Effective Speaker, Auckland, 28th & 29th April 2026-8 Customs Street East, Auckland Central, Auckland 1010-Humanitix
events.name: The Effective Speaker, Auckland, 28th & 29th April 2026
events.venue: 8 Customs Street East, Auckland Central, Auckland 1010
events.long_description:
1 or 2 Day Presentation Skills Workshop
Limited tickets available. Get in now so you don't miss out!
When effective presenters speak, they do more than inform - they influence, persuade, and inspire. That isn’t magic; it’s method. With the right tools, anyone can build genuine connection and move a room.
This workshop is for leaders, emerging leaders, technical specialists, and professionals who want practical tools and techniques for speaking in both formal and informal settings.
Short on time? Attend 1 Day (Foundations) for all the core skills. Ready for a bigger shift? Choose 2 Days (Advanced) for one on one coaching and deeper transformation. Pick what’s right for you.
You’ll leave with the tools to present more clearly, confidently, and with the influence your role demands. This is not just for the stage. You will use these skills everyday.
The workshop format
Small group format for maximum practice and feedback (no massive groups).
Learning is adapted and personalised for maximum value (no cookie-cutter approach).
Hands on, practical learning, with easy to apply tools and techniques (no sitting around listening to theory).
The Effective Speaker - One Day Workshop (Foundations)
Tues 28th April 2026
A hands-on day where you’ll learn our step-by-step SpeakerMap™ system to plan valuable presentations quickly and with ease.
You’ll learn the principles behind useful visuals, how to manage nerves, and three delivery techniques you can use immediately.
Foundations is best for technical experts who know their stuff but struggle to get it across, and nervous presenters who want a safe, practical reset.
What you’ll learn
Plan engaging content (fast)
Use the SpeakerMap™ to develop a clear Key Message and structure that keeps audiences attentive without overload.
Plan faster, make better decisions about what to include (and what to ditch).
 Design useful slides (not wallpaper)
A simple but revolutionary way to design slides that support — not sabotage — your message.
Practical guidance on using AI to fast-track draft slides and create supporting documents.
How to use PowerPoint to keep you on track without putting your audience to sleep.
 Keep nerves under control
A proven psychological approach to calm the mental chatter that causes waffling, speed talking, and blank moments.
Build a personal plan to shift focus from “me” to the audience and the outcome you want.
 Deliver in a natural, engaging way
Three delivery techniques that help you look credible, be engaging and feel confident.
How to vary pace and emphasis so your key points actually land.
How to cut the filler - the “ums” and “ahs” - and keep your flow.
 Plenty of practice
You’ll practise each technique in pairs or threes — supportive, safe, and highly practical.
Includes
A full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
The Effective Speaker workbook
30minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $1,200 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $995+GST)
 
The Effective Speaker - Two Day Workshop (Advanced)
Tues 28th & Wed 29th April 2026
Gain all the skills from Day One - and then take them further. If presenting is central to your career growth, this is the coaching workshop you need.
Over two full days, you’ll create a significant shift in your communication skills.
Day One gives you the foundations to make presenting easier and more effective.
Day Two consolidates and extends these skills. You’ll go deeper into content planning, adapt the tools to your real work presentations, and get personalised coaching to develop your own authentic style.
You’ll also learn strategies for handling even the toughest audiences. The workshop is practical, hands-on, and focused on learning by doing - presenting, receiving coaching, and observing your peers.
If you’re ready for lasting, transformative change in your communication skills, the two-day option is the best choice.
What you’ll learn
Everything from Day 1 (Foundations) PLUS
Go deeper with planning
Apply the SpeakerMap to plan an actual presentation that you can give. 
Dive deeper into crafting valuable messages that you can use in the future. 
Rehearse in a way that actually works
A practical way to prepare when time is tight — so you own your words.
Shift from competent to compelling
One-on-one coaching targeted to your specific needs.
Video feedback plus our inside-out coaching methodology to reconnect you with the techniques you use naturally in conversation.
How to use silence, pace, notes, and the remote without looking stiff or artificial.
How to speak with energy and authenticity, not speed and panic.
Eliminate “ums” and “ahs”, look confident (even when you’re not), and create a sense of commitment that audiences feel.
An understanding of your personal communication strengths and the areas you need to focus on for growth.

Handle audiences like a pro
Strategies for side chats, interruptions, distractions, disagreement, and the odd angry voice - while staying calm and in control.

Includes
Everything in Day 1, plus:
A second full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
Videos of your presenting and coaching sessions
The Effective Speaker workbook
60minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $2,500 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $2.200+GST)
What past participants say:

"The overall experience of the course far surpassed my expectations. I came in hoping to gain some valuable insights and tips for better public speaking, but what I received was so much more. I developed a newfound confidence in my ability to communicate effectively, learned how to captivate an audience, and discovered strategies for managing nerves and overcoming stage fright. I would recommend this effective speaking course to anyone looking to enhance their communication abilities. It's not just another course; it's a transformative experience that will empower you to become a more confident and persuasive speaker" Alex Goryachev, New Zealand Green Building Council
“This course not only met my expectations, but it completely exceeded them. This has been one of the most transformative courses I’ve attended. Jane totally revolutionised the way I now approach presentations. Having felt fear in the past each time I have to present to large groups, for the first time I now feel like I have the tools, understanding and ability to approach presentations and conquer my fear. I can’t thank Jane enough.” Nadia Marsh, Head of Bids, Tonkin & Taylor
"I have never been in such a well-run course (I've done a lot) Jane was amazing she held our attention from start to finish each day. I feel we all learnt so much and I will definitely be taking her advice on how I can improve myself. This course was well above what I expected, Jane had a great way of communicating. Typically, people tune out or lose interest by the end of the day. This was not the case for us. I honestly thing it’s the best course I’ve been on in my 4 years with WCC." Joshua Harding, Team Leader Consents, Wellington City Council

“The course is awesome. The balance between talk time, practical learning and feedback is perfect. The trainer really made the course for me - she is sensitive and responsive to people’s needs and is genuine in her approach to give the learners as much out of the time as possible. A very polished and well-planned course.” Huia Grey, Department of Conservation
"By far the best course i have attended in any organisation, either here in NZ or abroad. The format of the course was engaging and there was a great balance between listening, engaging and participating. I look forward to using the skills used presenting at our next Team Hui!"
Matthew Townsley, Medical Council of New Zealand


"Really great course, no pressure environment with a good mix of interactive and book work. Have walked away feeling more confident in how I am going to put my presentations together."

Jessica Stokes, Emergency Management Team, New Plymouth District Council
"It was good, practical and useful tools "not rules" for business comms and pressos. Good to learn some of the other things you don't often learn in traditional presentation skills training. Really good engagement and interaction - the team were impressed we were all engaged right until the end! Easily one of the best courses I have been on in this line of work. Keep up the good work! "
Brad Stansell, Channel Account Manager, Pax 8

events.id: Stage 1 Health and Safety Representatives-Business Central,Level 13, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Stage 1 Health and Safety Representatives
events.venue: Business Central,Level 13, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Stage 1 Health and Safety Representatives
This course introduces you to the key elements of effective worker participation and engagement.

About this Event

The purpose of this two-day course is to prepare anyone who wants to be officially recognised as an H&S Representative in their workplace. The course introduces you to the key elements of effective worker participation and engagement. It also covers the key strategies and tools you will need to be an effective representative in your workplace.


Key audience:
This course is suitable for people who have been chosen to be the H&S Representative for their organisation and need to be well-prepared for the role. It would also be useful for anyone who would like to know about the requirements for the role or who have employees in these positions.


Learning outcomes
Understand the key duty holders and their respective duties under the Health & Safety at Work Act 2015.
Learn how to identify and report on links to low productivity due to health and safety practices.
Generate improvements to reduce injury costs, occurrence and rehabilitation.

If you would like to register with Business Central directly and receive an invoice for payment, please contact our training team via .


Course details
Duration: two full days, in person.
Time: 9am-4pm
NZQA Unit Standard: 29315 (Assessment costs additional)

To view our Terms and Conditions click here.

events.id: Boney M — The Final Curtain Tour-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Boney M — The Final Curtain Tour
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
It’s one of the most beloved bands to emerge from the golden age of disco, Boney M are back with The Final Curtain Tour, and it will feature original member Maizie Williams. The band is renowned for mixing the glitz and glamour of the 70s with catchy upbeat songs. Head to St James Theatre in May and enjoy all of their greatest hits. The full live band will play Rasputin, Daddy Cool, Sunny, Rivers Of Babylon, Ma Baker, Gotta Go Home, Brown Girl In The Ring and plenty more. 
Boney M recorded eight albums between 1976 and 1985, and they have gone on to sell over 150 million copies worldwide. The phenomenon continues fifty years later — here’s your last chance to sing along and relive the magic live.

events.id: Fat Freddy’s Drop-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Fat Freddy’s Drop
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Doing it for the love of music, Fat Freddy’s Drop takes to the Michael Fowler Centre stage in May 2026. They’ll be there for two nights performing their ground-breaking debut album, ‘Based On A True Story’. The tour will mark the first live performances since the sudden death of founding band member Chris ‘MU’ Faiumu.
Lead singer Dallas Tamaira says, “It’s important for us to honour the intentions we had with MU and playing this album live is part of that.” ‘Based On A True Story’ was independently released in 2005. It became Aotearoa’s longest-charting album with 111 weeks in the Top 40. It also won eight NZ Music Awards and took out Giles Peterson’s Worldwide Music Awards in the UK.
Twenty years later, and the band’s unique funk and roots style has become a defining sound of Aotearoa. “[Based On A True Story] was the band’s first full-length studio album and its success was the springboard for what has been an incredible journey together,” explains saxophonist Scott Towers. “We want to pay tribute to the music, to MU, and the band he established. And, of course, to play to our fans around the world who have supported us through everything.”

events.id: James Reyne tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: James Reyne tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Presented by: The Sound
Everything has a beginning, a middle, and an end. And in February 1986, so it was for Australian Crawl.
It was a wrap. Time to sign off. A swan song, a kiss-off. Sometimes a relief, sometimes a little sad — but always resolute. Put to bed, polished off, and left behind as one of Australia’s most iconic chapters in rock history.
Now, in 2026, we mark The Fall of Crawl — a commemorative run celebrating the music, the memories, and the madness.
The songs you know. The stories you love. A reminder that time really does fly — but the soundtrack stays forever.
We can’t wait to get the band back to NZ !

events.id: Wellington WikiCon 2026-2 Taranaki Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Wellington WikiCon 2026
events.venue: 2 Taranaki Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
WikiCon is the annual gathering for editors of Wikipedia, Wikidata, Wikimedia Commons, and other Wikimedia platforms. Organised by Wikimedia Aotearoa New Zealand (WANZ), our local chapter of the Wikimedia Foundation, this conference brings together Wikimedians from across the country. In 2026, WikiCon will be held in Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington.
This event will provide opportunities for editors and contributors to connect face-to-face, helping to build collaborative relationships. The conference will also provide opportunities for editors and contributors to share and develop their skills and knowledge in working with Wikimedia projects. All are welcome, from complete beginners to highly experienced editors.
Conference sessions will be run on Saturday 2 and Sunday 3 May 2026, with informal welcome activities kicking off on the afternoon of Friday 1 May.
Further information will be posted on the event page.
If you’ve got a project you’d like to share with other Wikimedians, or suggestions for topics you’d like to learn more about, please feel free to get in touch at info@wikimedia.nz — we’d love your input.
We are offering grants covering registration, travel, accommodation and meals. Apply now by contacting info@wikimedia.nz with the following information:
Location
Occupation
Areas/topics of interest
Wikipedia editing experience

events.long_description:
The Dawn: KWARENTA Live in Wellington 2026
The Dawn hits Wellington for KWARENTA celebrating 40 years of powerhouse Pinoy rock live on the Down Under Tour 2026!

About this Event

Get ready to rock as The Dawn celebrates 40 years of timeless music. This in person concert is your chance to experience the band live on stage bringing their iconic hits and unforgettable sound straight to Wellington.
Where Pinoy rock lives on The Dawn stands as one of the true pillars of the OPM rock movement a band whose music has shaped generations and continues to unite fans across the world.
Don’t miss this spectacular night filled with energy nostalgia and pure Pinoy rock spirit a once in a lifetime celebration you won’t want to miss 🎸

All ticket sales are final. Tickets are non-refundable and non-transferable, except as required under the Consumer Guarantees Act 1993 and the Fair Trading Act 1986.
If the event is cancelled and not rescheduled, refunds or remedies will be provided in accordance with New Zealand law.

Children under 16 must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian at all times.
Children aged 5 and under may enter free but must remain seated on a guardian’s lap and may not occupy a separate seat.
All children must comply with venue safety rules and remain under active supervision.

No food or beverages are permitted inside the auditorium.
Food may be consumed only in designated areas.

events.id: Fat Freddy's Drop: Based on a True Story 21st Anniversary Tour | Fri 1 May | Michael Fowler Centre-Michael Fowler Centre-All Events In
events.name: Fat Freddy's Drop: Based on a True Story 21st Anniversary Tour | Fri 1 May | Michael Fowler Centre
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre
events.long_description:
Fat Freddy's Drop: Based on a True Story 21st Anniversary Tour | Fri 1 May | Michael Fowler Centre
Doing it for the love of music, legendary band Fat Freddy's Drop are returning to the stage in 2026 to perform their ground-breaking debut album Based On A True Story.

The 51 dates across Australia, Aotearoa, Europe & UK will be Freddy’s first shows following the sudden death of founding band member Chris ‘MU’ Faiumu. The band is united in its decision to continue with this long-planned tour.

Lead singer Dallas Tamaira says, ‘It’s important for us to honour the intentions we had with MU and playing this album live is part of that.’

Based On A True Story was independently released in 2005, an album of 10 fresh slices of future funk, with surprises, fakes & freaky sidesteps. In a historic run, the album became Aotearoa’s Longest-Charting Album with 111 weeks in the Top 40, won eight NZ Music Awards and took out Giles Peterson’s Worldwide Music
Awards in the UK.

‘This was the band’s first full length studio album and its success was the springboard for what has been an incredible journey together’, explains saxophonist Scott Towers. ‘We want to pay tribute to the music, to MU and the band he established. And, of course, to play to our fans around the world who have supported us through everything.’

events.id: Best Foods Comedy Gala-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Best Foods Comedy Gala
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
There’s no better way to kick off a three-week festival of side-splitting laughs. The Best Foods Comedy Gala heralds the beginning of the NZ International Comedy Festival. For one night in Wellington, national and international comedians from the festival lineup gather to give a taster of their comedy. The fast-paced, ever-changing smorgasbord is hosted by Kiwi comedy legend Dai Henwood. He’ll introduce you to old hands and fresh voices. With every imaginable type of comedy covered, the energy is electric. Best of all, you won’t stop laughing all night.   
Dai Henwood has graced the Comedy Gala stage in previous years as a performer. This is his first time hosting. He joins a long line of Kiwi comic royalty in the role, including Hayley Sproull, Chris Parker, Melanie Bracewell, Justine Smith and Pax Assadi. Jay Law, Producer of the NZ International Comedy Festival, said the gala is like Christmas morning for comedy fans. “It’s a night where everyone can come together — artists, producers, audiences, locals, internationals — and celebrate how important comedy is.”

events.id: Body & Soul PD Day-6 Elena Place, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Body & Soul PD Day
events.venue: 6 Elena Place, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Body & Soul: Somatic Practice PD Day
Join counsellor, trainer and equine therapist Courtney Brown for a day of professional learning and personal rejuvenation. Courtney brings a dynamic, compassionate and playful approach to her work at the leading edge of somatic theory and practice.
Nervous system regulation is a major focus of research and interest for the power of the mind-heart-body connection to release stress and aid trauma recovery. Courtney integrates this with a passionate Christian faith through with her rich experience working with people and horses to calm the stress response and build resourcefulness.
Saturday 2 May, 9.30am-3.30pm (5 hours PD)
Fully catered.
An event of NZCCA Wellington, Rōpu Tohutohu Kairaitiana
Suitable to counsellors, pastors, chaplains, and anyone interested in holistic wellbeing and trauma.
Courtney Brown, MNZCCA, Holistic Horse Wisdom
https://holistichorsewisdom.com/
More seminars at: https://www.conversationscounselling.nz/seminars.html

events.id: Fat Freddy's Drop: Based on a True Story 21st Anniversary Tour | Sat 2 May | Michael Fowler Centre-Michael Fowler Centre-All Events In
events.name: Fat Freddy's Drop: Based on a True Story 21st Anniversary Tour | Sat 2 May | Michael Fowler Centre
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre
events.long_description:
Fat Freddy's Drop: Based on a True Story 21st Anniversary Tour | Sat 2 May | Michael Fowler Centre
SOLD OUT! Doing it for the love of music, legendary band Fat Freddy's Drop are returning to the stage in 2026 to perform their ground-breaking debut album Based On A True Story.

The 51 dates across Australia, Aotearoa, Europe & UK will be Freddy’s first shows following the sudden death of founding band member Chris ‘MU’ Faiumu. The band is united in its decision to continue with this long-planned tour.

Lead singer Dallas Tamaira says, ‘It’s important for us to honour the intentions we had with MU and playing this album live is part of that.’

Based On A True Story was independently released in 2005, an album of 10 fresh slices of future funk, with surprises, fakes & freaky sidesteps. In a historic run, the album became Aotearoa’s Longest-Charting Album with 111 weeks in the Top 40, won eight NZ Music Awards and took out Giles Peterson’s Worldwide Music
Awards in the UK.

‘This was the band’s first full length studio album and its success was the springboard for what has been an incredible journey together’, explains saxophonist Scott Towers. ‘We want to pay tribute to the music, to MU and the band he established. And, of course, to play to our fans around the world who have supported us through everything.’

events.id: John Maus NZ Tour 2026 | WELLINGTON-Meow,17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: John Maus NZ Tour 2026 | WELLINGTON
events.venue: Meow,17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
John Maus NZ Tour 2026 | WELLINGTON
BANISHED MUSIC & STRANGE NEWS PRESENT
JOHN MAUS ~ NEW ZEALAND TOUR 2026

WEDNESDAY 6 MAY - MEOW, WELLINGTON
THURSDAY 7 MAY - DOUBLE WHAMMY, AUCKLAND

Tickets from Banished Music

The musical career of John Maus has been riddled with iconic moments. Now, to celebrate the release of his brand new album Later Than You Think, the synth-tastic American songwriter with the unmistakable baritone is headed to New Zealand for two extraordinary shows next May. Brought to you by Banished Music and Strange News, Mr Maus is set to make good on a long-held promise.

In 2019, after a series of personal tragedies and the stresses of touring his high-intensity show left Maus feeling unable to perform here, he flew home urgently to recover, with shows here cancelled at short notice. Now, with five years of contemplation, retreat and recuperation, and time spent crafting his new record, John Maus is set to make his return.

Throughout his long career, Maus considered himself to have been “constantly fighting the status quo: the Mickey Mouse Club, Coca-Cola, and all the institutions that reduce culture to its lowest common denominator”. Then, in 2020, he was infamously photographed at the January 6 riots, and was himself promptly “cancelled”.

In hindsight, he says, he now knows he should have been a lot clearer about his ethos and political beliefs in the wake of it all. “I thought my legacy would speak for itself,” Maus told Stereogum in a recent interview. Stating he was only at the protest to shoot footage for a new documentary film alongside film-maker Alex Moyer, these days he realises he ought to have stated his position a lot more bluntly. “I should have been clearer that I’m absolutely against Trumpism,” he says. “It wasn’t as forthright a denunciation as it should have been.”

Powered by “genuine emotion and radical sincerity”, the new album includes I Hate Antichrist, a song Maus describes as a sort of sequel to Cop Killer, and features a secular Gregorian chant that embraces French philosopher Alain Badiou’s anti-xenophobic sentiment that “All the people who are here are from here”.

From the death of ego and descent into madness, this is a party we’re all invited to.
events.description:
John Maus NZ Tour 2026 | WELLINGTON
Brought to you by Banished Music and Strange News, Mr Maus is set to make good on a long-held promise.
Now, with five years of contemplation, retreat and recuperation, and time spent crafting his new record, John Maus is set to make his return.
Stating he was only at the protest to shoot footage for a new documentary film alongside film-maker Alex Moyer, these days he realises he ought to have stated his position a lot more bluntly.
“I should have been clearer that I’m absolutely against Trumpism,” he says.

events.id: Aled Jones - My Story, My Songs tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: Aled Jones - My Story, My Songs tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Presented by: TEG Live
The My Story, My Songs tour takes Aled Jones on a regional journey across Australia and New Zealand, bringing fans a rare chance to get up close and personal with one of the country’s most loved performers.
A witty raconteur, Aled also performs the hits from his extraordinary career, and a self-penned track from his Number One album Full Circle.
“The response to my most personal tour yet has been incredible. I have absolutely loved sharing some of my most special untold stories and personal photographs.”
“From growing up in Bangor and becoming the world’s most famous choir boy through to present day, as host of Songs of Praise, and appearing on Strictly Come Dancing and The Masked Singer, I’ve loved sharing my journey.
“It’s been wonderful to meet my fans, a golden opportunity to get up close and personal in some of the country’s most beautiful, intimate venues.”
Aled was the boy treble who captivated the world with his angelic voice, most notably voicing the score to Raymond Briggs’s The Snowman. Selling more than seven million albums, he’s equally at home on the classical stage, or starring in musical theatre productions in London West End, his credits include lead roles in Joseph and the Amazing Technicolour Dreamcoat, Chitty Chitty Bang Bang and Irving Berlin’s White Christmas.

events.id: Kyla Cobbler — Gone Rogue-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Kyla Cobbler — Gone Rogue
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Known for raw storytelling, razor-sharp crowd work, and unfiltered honesty, Kyla Cobbler commands the stage with total confidence. The comic from Cork in Ireland brings her show ‘Gone Rogue’ to Wellington. In it, Kyla covers everything from the chaos of Barcelona dating life, navigating a friend crush, and the power plays of a barbecue. 
Kyla is one of the fastest-rising names in comedy. She first gained attention through her viral Instagram reels before stepping on stage for her first open mic in 2021. Five years later, Kyla has built a global following, with close to 700K Instagram followers and 100M+ video views. 
Kyla brings quickfire wit and a knack for spinning real-life chaos into killer stories. Get ready for a performance that is electric, unpredictable, and unforgettable.

events.long_description:
Established in 2020, R Exchange provides a regional opportunity for open-source data science enthusiasts from New Zealand and Australia to connect and learn from each other about how to make the most out of R and Python in your organisation and projects – from research to corporate to public sector.
If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to contact us  events@epi.group and keep up-to-date on the latest announcements via LinkedIn and our newsletter.
Our call for speakers is open!
Submit a talk to share your experience and ideas and join our distinguished line up of speakers at R Exchange 2026 and be a part of an event that fosters knowledge sharing and collaboration within the open-source community. If you would like to contribute, please send your proposed title and a short bio (<100 words) and abstract (<300 words) to events@epi.group.

events.id: & Juliet-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: & Juliet
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
What might have happened if Shakespeare’s Romeo and Juliet had ended differently?
& Juliet explores the idea of what the Bard’s heroine might have done if she’d lived beyond the end of the play.
The result is a fabulous, feel-good journey of self-discovery, empowerment, and second chances.
It features chart-toppers like Since U Been Gone, Roar, Baby One More Time, Larger Than Life, and Can’t Stop the Feeling!
The retelling of a classic love story through a bold new lens makes & Juliet more than just a musical.

events.id: The Pink Floyd Experience — The Wall-TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: The Pink Floyd Experience — The Wall
events.venue: TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Some of Pink Floyd’s most iconic tracks feature in a live concert destined for Wellington in May. The Pink Floyd Experience returns to the city with another show. This time, the tribute band brings back the legendary production of Pink Floyd’s eleventh studio album, ‘The Wall’. It’s an epic reimagining of the powerful concept album, complete with sound, lighting, and visual effects. 
As always with this tribute act band, the music will be performed to the highest standards. Everyone from the most casual Pink Floyd listener to the diehard fan will be impressed with the performance. The Pink Floyd Experience 2026 Tour - Wellington
TICKETS ON SALE WEDNESDAY 3RD DECEMBER

Coming April/May 2026, an unforgettable return of one of rock’s greatest masterpieces.

After nearly three decades of captivating audiences, The Pink Floyd Experience proudly brings back the legendary production of 'The Wall', an epic live reimagining of Pink Floyd’s most powerful concept album.

This breathtaking tour recreates the spectacle of the original, complete with the monumental construction and dramatic destruction of The Wall itself. It’s not just a concert; It’s an immersive journey through sound, light, and emotion — from isolation to transcendence.

Led by the commanding vocals of Stan Gratkowski and the seasoned musicians who have shaped this act for 28 years, this show captures the magic, precision, and raw feeling that
defined Pink Floyd’s legacy.

You’ve heard the songs. You’ve seen the tributes.
But have you felt it — the pulse of the music, the surge of the light, the goosebumps as the first notes hit?

This tour promises all that — and more:

A full-scale visual and sonic experience

Prepare to be immersed, moved, and utterly blown away.

This show is a MUST-SEE for any Floyd fan!

events.id: Dolores Mosquera Wellington New Zealand May 2026-55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Dolores Mosquera Wellington New Zealand May 2026
events.venue: 55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Day 1 – May 10, 2026 (9:00am–4:30pm)
Topic: Working with Dissociative Parts and Their Voices in Complex Trauma and Dissociative Disorders
Overview:
This seminar focuses on adapting EMDR for individuals with dissociative disorders, using the Trauma-Informed Relational Approach for Dissociative Parts (TADP) Dolores has developed. It provides strategies for working with dissociative parts and their voices and integrating a trauma-informed approach to inner conflict safely from early treatment stages.
Key Learning Points:
·         Identifying and working with dissociative parts and their voices.
·         Understanding the function and purpose of “hostile” parts.
·         Addressing dissociative phobias through EMDR informed techniques.
·         Managing resistance and treatment impasses.
·         Structuring work with dissociative parts effectively.
Program Description:
After many early cautions about the potential dangers of using EMDR with individuals suffering from dissociative disorders, limited methods have been offered for adapting standard EMDR procedures to this specific population. Based on these early cautions, EMDR is still considered by many clinicians as limited to the treatment of traumatic memories in high-functioning dissociative clients and only after a long preparation phase that depends on other treatment modalities. Confined by this conceptualisation, the use of EMDR is too often limited, and many survivors of severe traumatisation are unable to benefit from EMDR reprocessing and, if at all, only much later in the treatment process.
Dolores Mosquera developed (with AnabelGonzalez, M.D.) the Progressive Approach model for treating complex trauma and dissociation (2012) and the Trauma-Informed Relational Approach for Dissociative Parts (TADP) (2019, 2025). Using this trauma and AIP-informed models, clinicians can safely utilise a wide range of EMDR interventions (including BLS) from early in the preparatory phase of treatment for patients with dissociative disorders.
In this seminar, she will present her current practice of working with clients, including video demonstrations. Mosquera's deft clinical skills and ground-breaking innovative thinking teach a middle ground between "dissociation blind" aggressive EMDR interventions and overly cautious delays to the use of EMDR reprocessing.
Many dissociative clients have difficulty with hostile, critical voices. The internal conflict is sometimes so intense that the person even has difficulty carrying on an ordinary conversation. One factor that affects this conflict is how the patient deals with the voices or parts of the self.
Key Program Content:
Identify the internal system of dissociation and internal voices that are hostile and critical
How to read the function and purpose behind the saboteur parts of self
Using compassion and understanding to help deal with dissociative phobias within the internal system
Skills to reduce impasses and resistance that may complicate or reduce the efficacy of the treatment
Specific steps to organize the work with hostile parts and voices
 Days 2–3 – May 11–12, 2026 (9:00am–4:30pm)
Topic: From Fragmentation to Integration: A Master Class in Treating Complex Trauma and Dissociation
Format: 2-Day Masterclass: Three Clinical Cases from Start to Finish
Across two days, Dolores will present three distinct new cases illustrating varying levels of dissociation — including one with frequent switching and no initial Adult Self. Each session is interactive, highlighting the therapeutic process from assessment to completion.
Over two immersive days, this advanced master class offers a rare opportunity to observe and analyse complete therapeutic processes under the expert guidance of Dolores Mosquera.

Dolores will present three new and distinct clinical cases, each representing different manifestations of complex trauma and dissociation — including one client who experiences frequent switching and begins therapy without an integrated adult self.
Participants will follow these clients’ journeys from the initial stages of therapy through to treatment completion, gaining deep insight into decision-making, pacing, and the integration of EMDR strategies within complex systems. The format is designed to be highly interactive and reflective, combining video demonstrations, live commentary, and group discussion to deepen understanding of safe, flexible, and attuned clinical practice when working with dissociative clients.
This master class is ideal for clinicians seeking to refine their skills, expand their conceptual framework, and enhance clinical confidence when navigating the challenges of trauma-related dissociation.
Additional Details
·         Eligibility: Must have completed at least Part One of EMDR Basic Training (University of Otago or equivalent).
·         Certification: Participants receive a Professional Development Certificate of Attendance.
·         Dietary needs: Provided upon registration.
·         Parking: Paid on-site parking available.
·         Accommodation: Discounted rates at a local Musuem hotel
To access your special rates please visit: https://www.independentcollection.com.au/
Select your hotel, enter your dates and number of guests and click 'Check Rooms'
Click ‘I have a code’
In the ‘Corporate ID’ field enter your booking code: MOSQUERA
Click ‘UPDATE’
Your special rates will appear on the rates screen
These rates are available for stays between 07/05/2026 and 15/08/2026 .

events.id: Connecting Aotearoa Summit 2026-Ground Floor/1 Molesworth Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Connecting Aotearoa Summit 2026
events.venue: Ground Floor/1 Molesworth Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
We’re excited to announce the Connecting Aotearoa Summit 2026—the premier event for shaping New Zealand’s digital future. We launched the expanded event last year to ensure the issues we cover are relevant and pertinent to the nation’s most pressing challenges. In 2026, this is more critical than ever, as the general election looms. We need to make digital connectivity and equity front-and-centre of political debate, economic prosperity, and social wellbeing. The decisions made this year will lock in New Zealand’s digital trajectory for the rest of the decade.

This year, we are proposing that the Summit tackles the crucial question: “How do we get everyone connected to the best broadband service that meets their needs to live and thrive in our digital future by 2030?”

This ambitious national goal demands immediate, coordinated action from policymakers, industry, and community leaders. Join us as we delve into the critical issues surrounding digital connectivity in Aotearoa, directly influencing the next government’s mandate. At this early stage, we are proposing that our sub-themes include:

Policy & Political Mandate: Developing the definitive roadmap for universal connectivity ahead of the 2026 election, securing cross-party commitment to the 2030 target.

Rural Connectivity: Bridging the digital divide and ensuring resilient, future-proof access for all, regardless of location.

Affordability & Digital Equity: Examining the total cost barriers (device, data, skills) to internet access and advancing practical solutions for true inclusion.

Future-Proofing Connectivity: Looking ahead to emerging technologies and innovative, sustainable solutions that will make the 2030 target a reality.

These are all critical to us meeting our vision that by 2030, everyone in Aotearoa is connected to the best broadband service that meets their needs. This prospectus outlines how you can partner with this Summit to influence the national agenda and help us address the question around how we connect all of Aotearoa.
The Minister for Media and Communications, Hon Paul Goldsmith, is confirmed to present the closing Ministerial address.
Platinum Partner for 2026:

events.id: Confident & Competent Suicide Prevention Training Series - Te Whanganui-a-Tara-Wellington (CC2026/02)-2 Rhine Street, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Confident & Competent Suicide Prevention Training Series - Te Whanganui-a-Tara-Wellington (CC2026/02)
events.venue: 2 Rhine Street, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand
events.long_description:
CONFIDENT AND COMPETENT SUICIDE PREVENTION TRAINING
To reduce the high rates of suicide in this country a workforce confident and competent in assessing risk and providing ongoing support to suicidal people is essential.
Recent coroners’ findings highlighted the need for workers in the health, social services and counselling/psychotherapy sectors to regularly update their knowledge and competency in suicide risk assessment and intervention. This training should be a core component of practitioners’ ongoing professional development. Advanced practitioners such as counsellors, psychotherapists and clinicians should not only be knowledgeable about suicide risk assessment but also highly competent in undertaking an assessment and assessing the level of risk. The training attended should match the worker's scope of practice. Those working in the non-mental health sectors must be also be competent in making an informed referral to crisis services.They must also be up to date in their competency and capability to engage with the suicidal individual.
This advanced-level workshop address the concerns raised by coroners and are designed for clinicians counsellors and psychotherapists. Rather than a siloed approach to assessment and support strategies, this training emphasises the interconnection of the two and presents them as part of the continuum of suicide intervention and care.
Designed specifically for the New Zealand context, this training is being recommended by counsellors all over the country as a must attend workshop.

events.id: New Zealand International Comedy Festival--Wellington NZ
events.name: New Zealand International Comedy Festival
events.long_description:
Every May, the capital comes alive with laughter, thanks to the New Zealand International Comedy Festival (NZICF). New Zealand’s homegrown talent shares the stage with some of the world’s most exciting comedians. You could catch a big-name international artist, or discover a new local rising star. 
Since it began in 1993, the aim of the festival has been to champion the craft of comedy so everyone can share a laugh. Every year, a huge group of comedians descend on Wellington from local shores and beyond to deliver three weeks of merriment. 
The festival offers a diverse range of high-quality laughs. It showcases the best of local comedy and gives audiences a taste of some of the world’s best acts. Catch over 100 comics performing at The Opera House, BATS Theatre, Fringe Bar, San Fran, and more.
