Happy Mondays // Wellington // Celebrating 35 years of Pills 'n' Thrills & Bellyaches
𝑫𝒆𝒔𝒕𝒓𝒐𝒚 𝑨𝒍𝒍 𝑳𝒊𝒏𝒆𝒔 𝒂𝒏𝒅 𝑺𝑩𝑴 𝑷𝒓𝒆𝒔𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒔 𝒑𝒓𝒆𝒔𝒆𝒏𝒕
𝐇𝐀𝐏𝐏𝐘 𝐌𝐎𝐍𝐃𝐀𝐘𝐒
𝐂𝐞𝐥𝐞𝐛𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝟑𝟓 𝐘𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐬 𝐨𝐟 "𝐏𝐢𝐥𝐥𝐬 '𝐧' 𝐓𝐡𝐫𝐢𝐥𝐥𝐬 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐁𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐲𝐚𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐬

Sᴀᴛᴜʀᴅᴀʏ, 12ᴛʜ Sᴇᴘᴛᴇᴍʙᴇʀ 2026
Mᴇᴏᴡ Nᴜɪ, Wᴇʟʟɪɴɢᴛᴏɴ

⏰ 𝐊𝐞𝐲 𝐝𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐬 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐓𝐢𝐜𝐤𝐞𝐭𝐬:
DAL Presale: Wed 28 Jan @ 9AM 𝑳𝑶𝑪𝑨𝑳
𝐒𝐢𝐠𝐧 𝐮𝐩: 𝐃𝐀𝐋 𝐏𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐚𝐥𝐞 ➟ https://daltours.cc/HappyMondays
General On Sale: Fri 30 Jan @ 9AM 𝑳𝑶𝑪𝑨𝑳

Pioneers of the iconic Madchester sound, the 𝐇𝐚𝐩𝐩𝐲 𝐌𝐨𝐧𝐝𝐚𝐲𝐬 are heading back to Australia and New Zealand to celebrate the 35th anniversary of their seminal album, 𝑃𝑖𝑙𝑙𝑠 '𝑛' 𝑇ℎ𝑟𝑖𝑙𝑙𝑠 𝑎𝑛𝑑 𝐵𝑒𝑙𝑙𝑦𝑎𝑐ℎ𝑒𝑠.

Fusing funk, rock, psychedelia, and house with the pulsating energy of the UK’s burgeoning rave scene, the 𝐇𝐚𝐩𝐩𝐲 𝐌𝐨𝐧𝐝𝐚𝐲𝐬 became the face of a cultural revolution. Their 1990 release, 𝑃𝑖𝑙𝑙𝑠 '𝑛' 𝑇ℎ𝑟𝑖𝑙𝑙𝑠 𝑎𝑛𝑑 𝐵𝑒𝑙𝑙𝑦𝑎𝑐ℎ𝑒𝑠, catapulted them into the mainstream, spending over six months on the UK Albums Chart and earning its place as one of the defining records of the decade.

Fronted by the inimitable 𝐒𝐡𝐚𝐮𝐧 𝐑𝐲𝐝𝐞𝐫, with 𝐁𝐞𝐳 ( freaky dancing and percussion), 𝐌𝐚𝐫𝐤 𝐃𝐚𝐲 (guitar), 𝐆𝐚𝐫𝐲 𝐖𝐡𝐞𝐥𝐚𝐧 (drums), 𝐌𝐢𝐤𝐞𝐲 𝐒𝐡𝐢𝐧𝐞 (bass) 𝐃𝐚𝐧 𝐁𝐫𝐨𝐚𝐝 (musical director/guitar/keys), and 𝐅𝐢𝐫𝐨𝐮𝐳𝐞𝐡 𝐁𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐲 (backing vocals), the band will perform highlights from the classic album; including anthems like 𝑆𝑡𝑒𝑝 𝑂𝑛, 𝐾𝑖𝑛𝑘𝑦 𝐴𝑓𝑟𝑜, and 𝐿𝑜𝑜𝑠𝑒 𝐹𝑖𝑡, alongside fan favourites such as 24 𝐻𝑜𝑢𝑟 𝑃𝑎𝑟𝑡𝑦 𝑃𝑒𝑜𝑝𝑙𝑒, 𝐻𝑎𝑙𝑙𝑒𝑙𝑢𝑗𝑎ℎ, 𝐽𝑢𝑑𝑔𝑒 𝐹𝑢𝑑𝑔𝑒, and 𝑊.𝐹.𝐿.

Their enduring influence on British music was formally recognised in 2016 when they received the prestigious 𝐈𝐯𝐨𝐫 𝐍𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐨 𝐈𝐧𝐬𝐩𝐢𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐀𝐰𝐚𝐫𝐝, a testament to their legacy as one of the UK’s most beloved and groundbreaking bands.

‘Always a great buzz when we play Australia and New Zealand . Looking forward to bringing the Happy Mondays Pills ‘n’ Thrills party there in September’’ - 𝐒𝐡𝐚𝐮𝐧 𝐑𝐲𝐝𝐞𝐫

This isn’t just a tour, it’s a full-throttle revival of Madchester chaos, and the year's wildest party is coming.

‘’Funky dancing, maraca shaking, and incredible vocal performances Happy Mondays showed why they were so big in the 90s and have been able to keep that special place in the hearts of the fans for so long.’’ – 𝐌𝐮𝐬𝐢𝐜 𝐍𝐞𝐰𝐬 𝐌𝐨𝐧𝐭𝐡𝐥𝐲

‘’With Bez and Ryder’s between song banter raising the amusement stakes, the promised Hallelujah was given an airing and its iconic sounds had the crowd bouncing and swaying, it was clear that the Monday’s have lost none of their magic. They are still funky, downright vulgar but so endearing.’’ – 𝐔𝐊 𝐌𝐮𝐬𝐢𝐜 𝐑𝐞𝐯𝐢𝐞𝐰𝐬

‘’The show was packed with anthems. Friday night's headline set from the Happy Mondays provided a wonderful dose of nostalgia from one of Manchester's most iconic outfits.’’ – 𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐍𝐨𝐫𝐭𝐡𝐞𝐫𝐧 𝐄𝐜𝐡𝐨

Their 1990 release, 𝑃𝑖𝑙𝑙𝑠 '𝑛' 𝑇ℎ𝑟𝑖𝑙𝑙𝑠 𝑎𝑛𝑑 𝐵𝑒𝑙𝑙𝑦𝑎𝑐ℎ𝑒𝑠, catapulted them into the mainstream, spending over six months on the UK Albums Chart and earning its place as one of the defining records of the decade.
Fronted by the inimitable 𝐒𝐡𝐚𝐮𝐧 𝐑𝐲𝐝𝐞𝐫, with 𝐁𝐞𝐳 ( freaky dancing and percussion), 𝐌𝐚𝐫𝐤 𝐃𝐚𝐲 (guitar), 𝐆𝐚𝐫𝐲 𝐖𝐡𝐞𝐥𝐚𝐧 (drums), 𝐌𝐢𝐤𝐞𝐲 𝐒𝐡𝐢𝐧𝐞 (bass) 𝐃𝐚𝐧 𝐁𝐫𝐨𝐚𝐝 (musical director/guitar/keys), and 𝐅𝐢𝐫𝐨𝐮𝐳𝐞𝐡 𝐁𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐲 (backing vocals), the band will perform highlights from the classic album; including anthems like 𝑆𝑡𝑒𝑝 𝑂𝑛, 𝐾𝑖𝑛𝑘𝑦 𝐴𝑓𝑟𝑜, and 𝐿𝑜𝑜𝑠𝑒 𝐹𝑖𝑡, alongside fan favourites such as 24 𝐻𝑜𝑢𝑟 𝑃𝑎𝑟𝑡𝑦 𝑃𝑒𝑜𝑝𝑙𝑒, 𝐻𝑎𝑙𝑙𝑒𝑙𝑢𝑗𝑎ℎ, 𝐽𝑢𝑑𝑔𝑒 𝐹𝑢𝑑𝑔𝑒, and 𝑊.𝐹.𝐿.

events.id: BHNZ Convention 2026-Takina Convention and Exhibition Centre,50 Cable St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: BHNZ Convention 2026
events.venue: Takina Convention and Exhibition Centre,50 Cable St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
BHNZ Convention 2026
The 2026 Barbershop Harmony New Zealand Convention will take place in Wellington from September 25–27, 2026, hosted at the modern Tākina Convention Centre. This three-day event will bring together barbershop singers, quartets, choruses, and enthusiasts from across the region for a celebration of harmony, performance, and community.

Attendees can look forward to a full schedule featuring competitions, workshops, coaching sessions, mass sing-alongs, and showcase concerts highlighting both emerging talent and seasoned performers. Tākina’s world-class facilities provide an ideal setting for vibrant performances and social gatherings, all within walking distance of Wellington’s cultural and culinary attractions.

The convention aims to inspire musical excellence, foster connection within the barbershop community, and offer an unforgettable experience for performers and audiences alike.

events.id: Grey Not Blue: Depression and suicide in older people - Te Whanganui-a-Tara - Wellington (GNB2026/07)-2 Rhine Street, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Grey Not Blue: Depression and suicide in older people - Te Whanganui-a-Tara - Wellington (GNB2026/07)
events.venue: 2 Rhine Street, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Take the opportunity to learn more about suicide in older people, the forgotten population in mental wellbeing and suicide prevention
There are some suicide risk factors that are particular to older people yet rarely are included in suicide risk assessment tools nor covered in suicide prevention training.
Many general population suicide prevention and mental wellbeing campaigns do not or inadequately address the unique contributing factors to depression and suicide in older people.
Studies indicate that the aged care sector is underprepared, the workforce under skilled and there lacks leadership to champion effective prevention strategies and promoting wellbeing in older people.
It is critical that those working with older people are:
knowledgeable about the latest research and understanding of suicide in older people
confident and competent in responding to the depressed or suicidal older person
Suicide in the over-65 age group is more prevalent than commonly understood. Recent statistics indicate a rising trend in suicide among the elderly. Often under-reported, depression and suicide are significant mental health concerns for this demographic.
An emerging mental health concern for Retirement Villages and Aged Care Facilities
As the baby boomer generation ages, many will enjoy reasonable physical health. However mental health issues particularly depression will become more prevalent. This is not just a concern for primary care or aged care facilities but requires serious consideration by management and staff in retirement villages. A study of suicide locations in New Zealand found that aged care facilities and retirement villages were the most common places where older people killed themselves. This has implications for family, staff and other residents.
Older People Suicide vs Assisted Dying
An understanding of the distinction between assisted dying and suicidality in older people is crucial for those working with older people. The workshop will cover the complex interrelationship of factors the between suicidality and assisted dying.
TAYLORMADE TRAINING AND CONSULTING IS PROUD TO BE AN AGE CONCERN DIGNITY CHAMPION - TAKING A STAND AGAINST AGEISM & PROMOTING POSITIVE AGEING

events.id: Cornelia Parker-City Gallery Wellington-Wellington NZ
events.name: Cornelia Parker
events.venue: City Gallery Wellington
events.long_description:
After three years of closure, the newly renovated and strengthened City Gallery Wellington Te Whare Toi will host the art of Cornelia Parker. The English visual artist is best known for her innovative and contemporary sculpture and installation art. Her large-scale, immersive installations explore themes of destruction and reconstruction, transformation and metamorphosis. Objects are exploded, crushed, and suspended in a world upended and remade anew.
Curated by independent UK-based curator Andrea Schlieker and City Gallery Wellington’s Senior Curator Aaron Lister, City Gallery Wellington's exhibition will encompass Parker’s long career as an artist. This includes an immersive sound and light installation, ‘Stolen Thunder’. The work gathers the sounds of approaching storms from around the globe and across time. The exhibition will also showcase her paintings, photos, films, and sculptures.
“I have always said this is the one exhibition I want to do before I die,” said Charlotte Davy, Ringatohu Toi Director Art and City Gallery Wellington. “I have been following Cornelia Parker’s work for the last twenty years. Bringing her mischievous, dark, and literally explosive work to Wellington is incredible.” 
Parker’s work often fills entire rooms and invites the viewer to move through and around the art. Given its physical scale, the blank canvas of the reopened gallery offers the perfect opportunity to host the exhibition. The exhibition will kick off in October 2026, carrying through to March 2027. 
Charlotte notes the exhibition’s themes are also of particular relevance to Wellington. “I hope that the exhibition and our return to Te Ngākau Civic Square will reflect our city and also help remake it. We are looking forward to opening with a bang.”
Hero image: © Cornelia Parker. Courtesy of the artist and Frith Street Gallery, London

events.id: Book Club: Emiko by Chieri Uegaki-Level 2/57 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Book Club: Emiko by Chieri Uegaki
events.venue: Level 2/57 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us in person to discuss Emiko, a contemporary version of Jane Austen's Emma set in Canada.
(Order your copy through us by 20 March 2026 for delivery at the 23 May meeting or couriered in NZ)
About Emiko:
A busybody foodie avoids questions of her own future as she meddles in the love lives of those around her. Has this matcha-maker met her match?

Self-declared matchmaking GENIUS (a la Beyonce) Emiko Kimori has already found success by helping her aunt find true love, so when the new girl in town becomes her new BFF, it's only natural for Emiko to help set her up for social success with a suitable love match.

Emiko lives with her Ojiichan in a small town on BC's West Coast surrounded by friends and neighbors, including her childhood friend Kenzo Sanada, who wishes she'd spend less time playing matchmaker. But Emiko can so clearly see who belongs together, even when her targets don't know it themselves. She simply has to meddle - for the sake of true love!

As for her own romantic life though . . . who has time for that? Emiko is far too busy with her matchmaking schemes, her brunch recipes, volunteering, her bustling social life, keeping up her grades, eating said brunch recipes and making plans for after graduation. Plans she will absolutely decide on soon. Definitely. Maybe? But when Emiko ends up falling for the last person she expects, she finds herself caught in the tangled web of her own love matches. For the first time, instead of arranging from afar, Emiko has to figure out what it means to be in love herself, and that friendship and romance are more complicated than she ever imagined . . .
About the Author:
Chieri Uegaki is a second generation Japanese-Canadian and award-winning children’s author living and writing on Vancouver Island, in the traditional and unceded territory of the lək̓ʷəŋən speaking peoples, today known as the Esquimalt and Songhees Nations.
She graduated with a Bachelor of Fine Arts from the University of British Columbia’s Creative Writing Department and has written a number of stories for children, including the picture books Suki’s Kimono and Rosie and Buttercup (both illustrated by Stéphane Jorisch); Hana Hashimoto, Sixth Violin (illustrated by Qin Leng); and Ojiichan’s Gift (illustrated by Genevieve Simms).
When not reading or writing, Chieri consumes rom-coms and mysteries in any form, chooses appetizers over dessert most of the time, and tries to stay on top of her collecting problem. She is currently working on a number of projects.
Rachel Pilois (Book Buyer) on this selection:
There have been many retellings of Austen’s novels in the last 200 years. Pride and Prejudice easily wins the prize of Austen’s most adapted novel in both film and literature. In the last 20 years there’s been a noticeable growth in culturally (and gender) diverse takes on Austen’s work, with the most popular retellings being of Indian (i.e Bride and Prejudice) or African-American (i.e. Ibi Zoboi’s Pride) heritage. Sadly, some of her less popular novels (Mansfield Park and Northanger Abbey) have few adaptations in both film and literature, faithful or modern retelling.
With the 2026 theme of the JASNZ being diversity it made sense to choose a slightly less popular novel (only in terms of how many adaptations) and a slightly less common culture used in Austen retellings. Thus I settled on the upcoming YA novel Emiko by Chieri Uegaki, a Japanese-Canadian retelling of Emma.
Emma is a much beloved story and a much beloved character, who’s thoughts, actions and motivations are very recognisable in a modern teenager. Adding in the deep cultural etiquette of Japan as a likeness to the rules of regency society, makes Uegaki’s Emiko a brilliant and well thought out modern retelling of the Emma.
As it publishes on 9 September 2025, we can discover and discuss this new and exciting adaptation for the first time together! 
NB: Ticket numbers are limited to ensure ease of discussion. Afternoon tea is provided
FRIEND: bring a friend, get 10% off! Discount automatically applied
We aim to provide an accessible and safe environment. Discounts are available for nonwaged members, early birds, volunteers and people buying multiple tickets. Please let us know how we can ensure you're included.

events.id: Creedence Clearwater Collective-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Creedence Clearwater Collective
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Take a walk back in time to enjoy some of the most famous music of the 60s and 70s. Creedence Clearwater Revival was a juggernaut of phenomenal proportions. From their album debut in 1968 to their last album in 1972 the band produced some highly memorable songs. Many of them are still regularly played today. The Creedence Clearwater Collective recreates the success of the original band. The St James Theatre stage in Wellington will come alive with a six-piece tribute band. There’ll be a guest saxophonist and a vocalist who emulates the distinct sounds of original vocalist John Fogerty. 
The night promises to be full of iconic tunes including songs they wrote and songs they covered. Listen to hits like Have You Ever Seen The Rain, Fortunate Son, Bad Moon Rising, and Proud Mary.

events.id: From Sad Blokes to Well Men: Changing the focus in male suicide prevention - Te Whanganui-a-Tara - Wellington (FSB2026/03)-2 Rhine Street, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: From Sad Blokes to Well Men: Changing the focus in male suicide prevention - Te Whanganui-a-Tara - Wellington (FSB2026/03)
events.venue: 2 Rhine Street, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand
events.long_description:
From anxious boys through to lonely old men: Tracking male suicide across the lifespan.
Are traditional notions of masculinity meeting the needs of men in 2026? How the changes in men’s roles and identity contribute to suicide in men.
A vision for men’s wellbeing: An holistic approach to conceptualising men’s wellbeing and key mental wellbeing messages for men.
IT'S TIME FOR A SERIOUS RETHINK IN HOW WE PREVENT MALE SUICIDE AND TO TAKE SUICIDE IN MEN OUT OF THE TOO HARD BASKET
Hear a comprehensive critique of why the suicide rate in men continues to remain high despite numerous prevention initiatives, the reasons why we need to focus more on men and what are proven effective strategies for preventing male suicide.
BE PART OF THE SOLUTION
IN THIS MONTH OF MOVEMBER TAKE THE OPPORTUNITY TO PARTICIPATE  IN A WORKSHOP WITH INTERNATIONALLY RESPECTED AND AWARD WINNING MALE SUICIDE PREVENTION SPECIALIST BARRY TAYLOR
It matters that men are able to optimise their wellbeing.  Well men contribute to well whānau, communities, workplaces, economy and society.
Drawing on his lived experience and his extensive experience in engaging, assessing and supporting suicidal men of different cultures, age groups, genders and sexualities, he offers practical and time proven approaches to both preventing male suicide, engaging with a suicidal man and effective initiatives to optimise men's wellbeing.
"Helping men and boys to transition from sad blokes to well men must be our focus"
events.description:
How the changes in men’s roles and identity contribute to suicide in men.

It matters that men are able to optimise their wellbeing.
"Helping men and boys to transition from sad blokes to well men must be our focus"

events.id: Last Song, Actually - Opening-280 Church Street, New Zealand 4410,280 Church St, Palmerston North 4410, New Zealand, Palmerston North-All Events In
events.name: Last Song, Actually - Opening
events.venue: 280 Church Street, New Zealand 4410,280 Church St, Palmerston North 4410, New Zealand, Palmerston North
events.long_description:
Last Song, Actually - Opening
Step into the whirlwind two years after the beloved China Inn changed hands.

The community is buzzing: tragedy, mystery, and mayhem collide as wedding bells threaten to ring. But who’s the real bride? Where’s the elusive groom? Why is everyone glued to their phones?

Continuing with the lovable characters we met in Last Song, Last Song, Actually is a comedic rollercoaster that is a love letter to the magic of karaoke, the warmth of the Palmy community and the haziness of late-night shenanigans.

NOTE: You do not have to see Last Song to understand Last Song, Actually – no one really understood that one anyway, but it was fun though!

events.id: Wellington Wild Coffee & Tea Workshop, forage, cook and taste + Healthy potluck-berhampore island community orchard,Community Orchard, Adelaide Rd, Berhampore, Wellington 6023, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Wellington Wild Coffee & Tea Workshop, forage, cook and taste + Healthy potluck
events.venue: berhampore island community orchard,Community Orchard, Adelaide Rd, Berhampore, Wellington 6023, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Wellington Wild Coffee & Tea Workshop, forage, cook and taste + Healthy potluck
Foraging and Growing Workshops coming to Wellington. No need for prior knowledge we will learn everything from scratch.

Workshop description:

Come to enjoy learning over a foraged cuppa with a fun and hands-on workshop all about wild coffee and tea! We’ll head out to forage for plants that can be used as a coffee alternative, then cook, brew, and taste our way through the process together.
You’ll learn how to spot potential coffee subs in nature, prep them from scratch, and sip your way through a few different brews. Tasting is a big part of this one—so come hungry and curious!
No experience needed—just bring your sense of humor
neighbors, friends or come solo💚

_______
Come with your family, friends, neighbors and furry companions, please share this event.
_________
I encourage everyone to walk, cycle or bus to the event as part of the experience and help not to impact the environment. I will have some special gifts for the ones who do 🌻💚
________
Please allow enough time to immerse into the workshop with no rush"
_______
REGISTRATION IS Essential the event is number of registered people dependent.
50$ per person per workshop, 80$ for 2 ppl within a family, children are free, animals welcome. Volunteers of non profit organization's and community gardeners are welcome to come on a koha or vegetables from their garden bases if you prefer, make sure to indicate upon registration, numbers are limited. Please register here:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1JDsUTlOZYvF870A1bJ7JNxR5-eGL3tlCX3PZtMRRjV0/viewform

🔗 Learn more about my work: foraging and growing corner
https://www.facebook.com/foragingandgrowingcorner/

Registration is essential, helps to keep our events clear, organized and respectful.

Warning: bring your cuppas and a spare one in case someone forgets <3 and a healthy food platter to share with others. i will have some interesting edibles to share <3

at 3pm - 5:30 pm grow your own Fungi workshop
Looking forward to seeing you there!
https://www.facebook.com/share/1H9a69MFTp/

See you all soon!

Cambridge Road team.

events.id: Lavender & Flower Farm PYO-Lavender Magic, 61 Blakes Road, Mt Holdsworth, Carterton, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Lavender & Flower Farm PYO
events.venue: Lavender Magic, 61 Blakes Road, Mt Holdsworth, Carterton, Carterton
events.long_description:
Your weekend escape starts at Lavender Magic surrounded by the calming scent of Lavender. As the evening cools, wander through rows of fragrant blooms and gather fresh flowers — the perfect gift for friends and family.

Nestled in a charming country garden, Lavender Magic offers breathtaking views of the Tararua Ranges, creating a stunning backdrop for relaxation and discovery. Whether you’re picking flowers, strolling among the lavender, or simply soaking in the peaceful atmosphere, this is the place to unwind and reconnect with nature.

Come experience the magic. Lavender Magic — where tranquility blossoms and the stars are brighter.

Lavender Magic is a Lavender farm and a Cut Flower Farm. It has about 5000 lavender plants and grows a range of cut flowers. In season you will find pockets roses, lilies, sunflowers, zinnias and dahlias. You can pick lavender and cut flowers!

Since 2007 Lavender Magic has won many awards for the quality of their lavender oil, which can be purchased on site along with balms, creams and sprays in the small farm shop.

We will provide you with everything you need. Cutting nips, rubber band and bucket. We will let you know which flowers are in season and available to cut.

Plan your visit: Lavender Magic is a great place to take time out, relax and recover.
Wear - Good footwear to explore the lavender field and surrounding gardens.
Wear - Sunglasses and slip, slop, slap on if a sunny day as we get full sun.
Bring - BYO food and drink is allowed. Or grab a coffee and something to eat from OUR PLACE CAFE who set up when available, check socials for details.
Bring - A rug if you want to sit in the lavender, but not on the ground. Some seating may be available on quiet days.
Bring - A journal or magazine, to ensure you take time out to reflect and relax
Bring - A friend and whanau to share your experience
Bring - A Team of friends, a pack of cards or games and just hang out for awhile
Bring - Your pet, if you are a responsible owner and promise you will pick up its mess and will not let it annoy others.
Bring - A camera to capture some of the magic and create memories.
A toilet is on site.

Lavender Magic is a scenic drive, about 75 minutes from Upper Hutt and Palmerston North.

Cut flower bouquets are available or can be ordered in advance to surprise someone special.

If you want something a little more private, we do hire out our property for photography and special events, contact Pauline on lavendermagic@outlook.com

How to get there:
Drive past the pizza place to get to Lavender Magic - Pizza at the Water Mill Bakery is open (Friday Only 5pm-9pm). Other things to do in the Mt Holdsworth area - Fernado Oscar Calligo may have Choripan the Argentinian Food Cart open (Check socials for dets) Paul Melser Pottery (Weekends Only), Jackie Pearson's Fine Art Gallery (Check for details), Rivenrock Mountain Biking Park (Check for details) and DOC walks (24/7) as Holdsworth is the main entrance to the eastern side of the Tararua Forest Park.

Mt Holdsworth, Carterton, Wairarapa is a great place to visit.
events.description:
You can pick lavender and cut flowers!
We will provide you with everything you need.
We will let you know which flowers are in season and available to cut.
Bring - A journal or magazine, to ensure you take time out to reflect and relax Bring - A friend and whanau to share your experience Bring - A Team of friends, a pack of cards or games and just hang out for awhile Bring - Your pet, if you are a responsible owner and promise you will pick up its mess and will not let it annoy others.
If you want something a little more private, we do hire out our property for photography and special events, contact Pauline on lavendermagic@outlook.com How to get there: Drive past the pizza place to get to Lavender Magic - Pizza at the Water Mill Bakery is open (Friday Only 5pm-9pm).

events.id: The Human League — Generations: The Greatest Hits Tour-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: The Human League — Generations: The Greatest Hits Tour
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
A fresh and influential sound dominated the charts in the 1980s — synth-pop. The Human League were one of the first bands to find success with this new sound. Now they are bringing decades of catchy hits to Wellington fans. Expect an unforgettable night with timeless classics like Don’t You Want Me, Human, Love Action (I Believe in Love), The Lebanon, Mirror Man, Being Boiled, and more. 
Long before electronic music became mainstream, the band was successfully using computers and sequencers to create rhythm and melody. In the process, they redefined modern pop. Their stylish, forward-thinking sound remains relevant today as ever. In 1982, The Sydney Morning Herald described them as “one of the first futurist bands.” Join founding members Philip Oakey, Joanne Catherall, and Susan Ann Sulley on an electrifying journey through four decades of stylish synth-pop brilliance.

events.description:
Gindulgence Wellington 2027!
Welcome to New Zealand’s most celebrated boutique gin festival.
On offer is a fantastic line-up of 20 distillers showcasing a fabulous selection of 90+ gins and other spirits from New Zealand and around the world.
If you’re looking for inspiration or education, the Gin Theatre will be in action with presentations from a selection of passionate distillers.
Get your tickets here - https://gindulgence.flicket.co.nz/events/f29a3268-c174-40b8-88e7-afdbaf1eecf0?tc=wlgjan2026-fb-event

events.id: Marlborough Lines Classic Fighters Airshow 2027-79 Aerodrome Road, Burleigh, Blenheim 7272, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Marlborough Lines Classic Fighters Airshow 2027
events.venue: 79 Aerodrome Road, Burleigh, Blenheim 7272, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Marlborough Lines Classic Fighters – ‘Putting on the Ritz’
We’re bringing the glamour back bigger and better for 2027!
Step into the golden age of aviation as the skies sparkle with the elegance of the 1920s and 1930s. Marvel at breathtaking aerobatics, feel the thrill as legendary WW2 warbirds take command overhead, and soak up the glamour of a bygone era.
Beyond the flying action, enjoy a weekend packed with classic cars, fireworks, fantastic food, live entertainment, and family fun. It’s a celebration you won’t want to miss!
🎟️ Tickets now available online – choose a single-day ticket for any day you prefer, or take advantage of our new multi-day passes. A Friday ticket includes the full day’s program plus the spectacular Twilight Extreme.
Join us in Marlborough for a show that promises to be unforgettable – we can’t wait to see you there!

events.id: Black Ferns vs British and Irish Lions-Sky Stadium, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Black Ferns vs British and Irish Lions
events.venue: Sky Stadium, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The first-ever Howden British and Irish Lions women‘s series is coming to Aotearoa in 2027. With five games across the country, Wellington is to play host to one of three Test games. The competition is sure to be fierce and the atmosphere electric. 
Sitting at the halfway point between Rugby World Cups, the tour will offer high-calibre clashes between two rugby powerhouses. Ben Calveley, CEO of The British & Irish Lions, said the tour marks “something truly special for the women’s game.” With the first-ever tour title on the table, you can expect both teams to leave it all on the field. Let‘s fill the cake tin with stomping feet and edge-of-your-seat screams. The Wellington game is Test number two of the series, so pull on your jersey, warm up your pipes and get ready for Black Ferns fever to sweep the city. 
Tickets go on sale late 2026.
